凯斯·哈林纽约楼梯间壁画下月拍卖 估价上亿元

2019年10月29日 14:22 联合报 何定照／即时报道

美国著名新普普艺术家凯斯·哈林（Keith Haring）创作于纽约曼哈顿上城区Grace House楼梯间的壁画，将于11月13日由邦瀚斯拍卖行（Bonhams）在纽约“战后及当代艺术”专场拍卖，估价300至500万美元（约合新台币9150万至1亿5250万元）。

这幅创作于1983至1984年间的《无题（Grace House壁画）》，是凯斯·哈林最鲜为人知、也是最为隐秘的作品之一。壁画高达85英尺，位于曾为修道院、后为天主教青年组织（The Catholic Youth Organization）所在地的Grace House楼梯间内，横跨这栋五层建筑的三层楼。

凯斯·哈林当年在没有草图和底稿的情况下，仅用一晚便完成了这幅作品。壁画包含了哈林标志性的元素，例如闪耀婴儿、咆哮犬和跳舞人物等共13种图案，被分割成15个部分保存，堪称一部“哈林美学辞典”。此次拍卖由升天教堂（Ascension Church）委托进行，所得款项将用于资助教区改善无障碍设施等重要建设项目。

邦瀚斯表示，凯斯·哈林（1958-1990）以其勇敢无畏、快乐主义、打破边界和风格杂糅的个性而闻名，这与上世纪80年代纽约艺术圈的氛围相契合。即便在21世纪，80年代的纽约依然被视为艺术的黄金时代，孕育了一批塑造艺术世界和市场的巨匠，凯斯·哈林正是其中关键人物之一。他以看似简单的粗轮廓线和充满动感的元素创作，迅速吸引了全世界的目光，并通过作品表达生死、性和战争等概念，赢得了国际声誉。

哈林是曼哈顿下城区夜店的常客，并在此结识了安迪·沃霍尔（Andy Warhol）、尚·米榭·巴斯基亚（Jean-Michel Basquiat）、肯尼·沙夫（Kenny Scharf）等艺术圈巨星。

Michael sat down at the table, facing his own image through the bulletproof glass. The original Michael, inmate 1134, stared back, serving a life sentence.  "So this is our last talk before I replace you," Michael began. "Anything you want to tell me? About your family? Your friends?"

"I want to tell *them* in person," 1134 spat. "They don't even call me by my name anymore. I'm just 1134."

"Technically, anything you say to me *will* be told in person," Michael replied. He chuckled nervously, but the original didn't find it funny.  "Plus, *you* were the one who opted for the Clone Home Program. At least your family will have *me*."

"I know," 1134 admitted, his voice heavy. "It…it just doesn't feel right. I was convicted for a crime that had no—"

"We've talked about this before," Michael interrupted. "Your DNA was at the crime scene. That's enough evidence. No use arguing now. It's over."

1134 winced. "I never realized how much it would hurt to hear my own face say that." He slumped back, defeated.

Michael sighed. "If there's anything more you want to tell me about your family, let me know."

"So you can convince them that *you're* me?" 1134's voice cracked.  "Sleep with my wife? Tell stories to my child? The things *I* should be doing." A tear welled in his eye.

"I'm not meant to *replace* you," Michael explained gently. "Only replicate. You chose this program because your son needed a father who isn't a murderer, and your wife needs a husband who can comfort her. You can't do anything about that now, and I was created to do that. I'm not calling it fair, just the best course of action.  Now, is there anything else I should know?"

"I… I guess," 1134 started. "Tell my son—"

"TIME IS UP. RETURN TO YOUR CELL!" a guard barked.

"What? No!" 1134 shouted.

"Wait, stop! Give us another minute!" Michael pleaded desperately.

"Orders are orders," the guard stated flatly.

"Yes, you *will*," Michael hissed.

La portavoz de la gestora de Ciudadanos, Melisa Rodríguez, ha anunciado este sábado, tras el Consejo General de Ciudadanos, que la formación pedirá junto al PP una comisión de investigación en el Congreso sobre el paso por España de la vicepresidenta de Venezuela, Delcy Rodríguez, y su encuentro con el ministro José Luis Ábalos. Rodríguez ha calificado este encuentro de "escandaloso" y ha criticado la postura del Gobierno respecto a la visita del presidente de la Asamblea Nacional de Venezuela, Juan Guaidó.

El objetivo de la comisión de investigación, según Rodríguez, es triple. En primer lugar, busca esclarecer "cómo es posible que el avión de la vicepresidenta de una 'narcodictadura' haya aterrizado en suelo español". En segundo lugar, pretende determinar "por qué el señor Ábalos se ha reunido con ese número dos (de Venezuela), desatendiendo cualquier tipo de estrategia de la UE".  Finalmente, la comisión busca dilucidar "cómo es posible que un ministro de España pueda dar cuatro versiones diferentes en 24 horas" sobre lo ocurrido.

"Nos parece del todo escandaloso que el señor Ábalos haya dado hasta cuatro versiones en 24 horas, con un tono despótico y altanero con la prensa, supongo que al sentirse incómodo porque le están pillando en contradicciones sistemáticamente", ha sostenido Rodríguez.  A esto se suma, según ha leído en prensa,  el supuesto enfrentamiento entre el ministro del Interior, Fernando Grande-Marlaska, y el propio Ábalos, una situación que considera "no seria" para un país como España.  Para Rodríguez, este comportamiento "no es reflejo de lo que debería ser un buen Gobierno".

Rodríguez ha criticado que Ábalos "no esté del lado de los demócratas, de los que defienden los derechos y libertades del pueblo venezolano", y ha acusado al Gobierno de Pedro Sánchez de estar "totalmente podemizado por el señor Iglesias", sin querer especular sobre las razones.

Finalmente, ha considerado "una vergüenza y una desfachatez" la decisión del presidente Pedro Sánchez de no reunirse con Guaidó, sobre todo, ha recalcado,  mientras "manda a un ministro a reunirse con la vicepresidenta de una narcodictadura".

Le 19 juillet dernier, l'Algérie remportait sa deuxième Coupe d'Afrique des Nations de football face au Sénégal, battu 1-0.  Le match a basculé dès les premières minutes lorsque Salif Sané, le défenseur sénégalais, a dévié involontairement la frappe de Baghdad Bounedjah. Le ballon, lobé, a surpris Alfred Gomis, le gardien sénégalais. La suite de la rencontre s'est déroulée sur un rythme plus lent, les Algériens adoptant une posture défensive.

Les Lions de la Teranga ont multiplié les assauts pour égaliser. Sadio Mané, héroïque tout au long du match, n'est cependant pas parvenu à trouver la faille.

Après le coup de sifflet final, Salif Sané, auteur de la malheureuse déviation, était effondré.  Une fois la douleur de la défaite atténuée, le robuste défenseur de Schalke 04 s'est confié à un média français, relayé par Afrique Sport : « Avec le recul, j'arrive à gérer, mais au moment où l'arbitre a sifflé la fin du match, j'ai eu l'impression que mon monde s'écroulait. Je ressens une certaine culpabilité sur le but de Bounedjah.  La veille de la finale, j'avais un très mauvais pressentiment. J'avais les jambes lourdes et je n'arrivais pas à dormir.  Lorsque j'ai finalement réussi à m'endormir, je me suis réveillé en sursaut après avoir eu un flash : je me voyais pleurer, seul, au centre du terrain.

The news showed Senator Henry grinning. "Congress has voted to make me Speaker of the House. I am now Speaker of the House. It was a unanimous decision.”  I wrinkled my brow.  His elation was understandable, but the repetition grated. *We get it,* I thought, flipping channels to a mindless cartoon.  Anything to stave off sleep and the nagging memory of the news. My three-month-old daughter, Victoria – Tory, as I often thought of her – was in my arms, crying. Screaming, really.  I hated the thought of Kate having to soothe her in the dead of night.

Kate, my wife, was perpetually exhausted. Kind, smart, loving, and exhausted. Her workdays were longer than mine, often starting before sunrise and ending after sunset. Yet, she never complained.  Sometimes I worried she resented my eight-hour days and the extra time I had with Tory. But every other Friday, for the past eight months, she’d beam, showing me her growing savings account, “Victoria’s School.” Each $100 increment brought her close to tears, and me along with her.  So, I took the night shift with Tory, letting Kate get some rest.

The next morning, after dropping Tory at daycare, the radio blared, “In other news, a Chicago lawyer secured a double-murder acquittal by arguing George Washington condoned killing your neighbor for sleeping with your wife. And the Cincinnati Zoo welcomes a baby hippo!”

I nearly slammed on the brakes. *What?* I pulled into the parking lot at work and frantically searched my phone.  There it was: the lawyer shaking hands with a client radiating anger and regret. "Not Guilty!" the headline screamed. Further down, an even more bizarre headline: "President Jacks Steps Down, Senator Henry Appointed."  Apparently, a private conversation led President Jacks to believe Henry would do a better job.  Shaking my head, I went into work.

I worked at Leo’s Used Cars, home of the “cerrrrazy” deals – more like swindles.  I wouldn't buy a single car on that lot, and selling them to people with poor credit and low incomes made me feel slimy.  Yet, in a year and a half, I'd become the top salesman. I was a good liar. I could sell ice to an Eskimo.

That day, I sold seven vehicles, a new record. Enough commission to match Kate's contribution to Tory's savings and take a day off with her. It was ridiculously easy.  I lied about gas mileage, they believed me.  I claimed the tires were new, and even I almost believed it.  A few times, I simply said, "It's a great car," and somehow, it seemed to become shinier, sleeker, better.

On the way home, with Tory in the backseat, the radio announced, "Newly appointed Chief Justice Henry accepts position.”  I shook my head again.  The same Henry?  At home, I looked up the news. Different Henry. But a photo of the new Chief Justice shaking hands with the President revealed an uncanny resemblance. Brothers.  I wondered at the lack of public outcry. Where were the riots? The confusion?  Then I realized I wasn't outraged either. It just…made sense.

Confused, I bathed Tory, made dinner, and waited for Kate.  Eager to share my good news, I almost missed her dejected look.  "I sold seven cars today!" I announced after kissing her.

"That's good," she replied dully. Taking a deep breath, she confessed, "I got fired."

My heart sank. We weren't destitute, but we relied on her income. My dismay must have shown, because she started to cry.  I held her close. "It's okay, it's okay. We'll be fine. We barely needed your job anymore. I can support us. I’ll take care of us," I whispered until her sobs subsided.  Looking up, she seemed less exhausted, more relieved.  And strangely, so did I.

That night, Tory cried as usual. Despite having work the next day, I took her so Kate could rest.  Watching the news, I saw the Henry brothers already reshaping the government, eliminating term limits, and giving themselves raises. Again, I felt a strange sense of acceptance rather than outrage.

Then, it clicked. Like a puzzle piece falling into place, I realized the rules were changing, lies were bending reality. I knew it with the same certainty I knew those seven cars were "great vehicles."

I thought of Kate, sleeping soundly, free of worry. I could lie to the bank, claim our house was paid off. Lie to the credit card company, declare us debt-free. I could see Kate's relieved smile. Then I looked at Tory.

She wasn't crying. She looked up at me with her baby blue eyes, and I knew better. Struggle was important. Tory would see us fight for her education, watch us work hard, and learn from our example.  If things were easy, she wouldn't understand the battles life throws at you. Not my Tory.

“There’s no such thing as world hunger,” I told her. “There’s plenty of food for everyone. They’ll find a cure for cancer tomorrow.  Cancer is a thing of the past. When people go to jail, they learn their lesson. They learn not to do bad things again.” I took a deep breath. “People are good, Tory. People are innately good! They make mistakes, and they learn. They help each other. They love each other. People are good.”

All night long, I told her how amazing human nature was, how we should always love each other. Long after she fell asleep, I kept talking.

**Síntomas de coronavirus y definición de caso sospechoso**

Los casos confirmados de coronavirus en Argentina están en aumento y los especialistas anunciaron cambios en la definición de caso sospechoso, que requiere monitoreo diario y la prueba correspondiente.

Inicialmente, la temperatura igual o superior a 37.5°C era un factor de alarma, especialmente si se acompañaba de tos seca, dificultad respiratoria, cansancio y opresión en el pecho.

Posteriormente, la OMS incluyó como síntomas la pérdida del olfato y el gusto, congestión nasal, dolor de cabeza, conjuntivitis, diarrea, erupciones cutáneas o cambios de color en los dedos de las manos o los pies.

"We caught him in the act and terminated him," Trump said, adding that Soleimani should have been taken out by his predecessors.

Trump cast his decision as one of deterrence, not aggression. "We took action last night to stop a war. We did not take action to start a war," he said.  While seeking to portray the strike as preventative, Trump continued to threaten Iran's leaders with further strikes should they continue destabilizing actions in the region.

"We do not seek regime change," Trump stated, adding that Iran's use of proxy fights "must end and it must end now." He declared, "The future belongs to the people of Iran."

Trump boasted of US military might and intelligence capabilities.  "We have the best intelligence in the world," he said. "If Americans anywhere are threatened, we have all of those targets already fully identified, and I am ready and prepared to take whatever action is necessary, and that in particular refers to Iran."

في إطار توجيهات القيادة السياسية بتنفيذ شبكة خطوط القطار الكهربائي السريع بإجمالي أطوال 1795 كم، والتي ستمثل نقلة حضارية جديدة في وسائل المواصلات في مصر، تابع الفريق مهندس كامل الوزير - وزير النقل أعمال تنفيذ مشروع قطار العين السخنة / الاسكندرية / العين السخنة. ويركز العمل حاليًا على المسافة من حلوان حتى العين السخنة مروراً بالعاصمة الإدارية الجديدة.

وقد تم الانتهاء من أعمال أبحاث التربة والرفع المساحي وتخطيط المسار، ويجري العمل حاليًا على تنفيذ الجسور الترابية والكباري والأعمال الصناعية للمسار والمحطات والأسوار بواسطة كبريات الشركات المصرية المتخصصة. بالتزامن مع هذه الأعمال، ستبدأ شركة سيمنز الألمانية أعمال الإشارات والاتصالات والتحكم وأنظمة الكهرباء، بالإضافة إلى تصنيع وتوريد 35 قطار ركاب (سريعة وإقليمية) و10 جرارات لنقل البضائع.

وأكد الوزير خلال جولته على أهمية تكثيف الأعمال والعمل على مدار الساعة للالتزام بالجدول الزمني المحدد لإنهاء المشروع بالكامل خلال عامين وفقاً لتوجيهات القيادة السياسية.  وأشار إلى أهمية هذا المشروع الذي يعتبر بداية لمنظومة شبكة القطارات الكهربائية السريعة التي ستخدم المناطق العمرانية والصناعية الجديدة والقائمة، وستساهم في تخفيض واختصار زمن الرحلات بين المحافظات لأكثر من نصف الوقت الذي يستغرقه المواطن حاليًا سواء عبر شبكة القطارات القديمة أو عبر الطرق الحالية.

The bathroom. Ridiculous. I could fall asleep anywhere these days. I woke with a start, trying to place myself.  Realizing I had to be back at work in a few short hours, exercise seemed like a waste of precious sleep. Especially on the third shift. Lazily, I bent to untie my shoes, resting my head against the wall. Even that felt tedious. When I finished, I was tempted to just lie down on the cool tile.  I took a sharp breath and tried to stand, but my body resisted. Then something moved by my face. I looked up, and went dead cold.

"Shit," muttered the man in the mirror.

Suddenly, an energy I hadn't felt in years surged through me. "Get to the kitchen! Cover the exits! MOVE! MOVE! MOVE!" I roared, bursting into the bedroom. My own voice echoed from the bathroom as I ran.  "Dining room window covered!" I heard myself shout as I passed my wife's china cabinet. "Front door secure!" I yelled, reaching the dining room.  "Back door!" I commanded myself as I rounded the corner into the kitchen. I sprinted to the open window, only to have it slam shut in my face.  I stopped dead, staring at the person who wasn't me.

"Bitteroldfella," he said, "we can't let you leave this house. Think of your daughter."

"What did you say?" I snarled, but didn't wait for a reply. My fist went through the window. "WHAT ARE YOU GONNA DO TO MY DAUGHTER YOU FUCKING PIECE OF GLASS?!"

The man in the mirror looked winded, hurt.

From my bedroom, I heard myself yell, "Bitter! Come here. We need to talk."

I tried the back door, but my bloody hand couldn't get a grip past my doppelganger. He just shook his head. "I can't let you do that, sir."

The adrenaline faded, and the pain in my hand throbbed. A million thoughts raced through my mind. This couldn’t be real. How could I explain this to my family? To anyone?  God, I was so tired.

"Bitter, look at me," my reflection said.  I instinctively glanced up and flinched. I saw my little girl at her desk in her classroom, eagerly raising her hand. The image vanished, replaced by my transparent face in the glass. "Think about this for a second. Come to the bathroom, fix your hand up, and just hear me out."

"Why can't we talk here?" I demanded.

He knocked on the glass. "We can't exactly have a face-to-face if we can't see each other. And we need to figure out a deal that works for everybody. Besides," he gestured to the broken window, "I'm a little worried about my safety here."

I considered his words.  Lacking a better plan, I reluctantly headed back to the bathroom.  With each reflection I passed, I saw fear, disgust, and anger staring back at me.

Inside the master bathroom, normalcy returned. My reflection mimicked my every move as I bandaged my hand. I leaned back, waiting for his proposal.

"It's not always easy, is it?" he said, "looking at yourself. Seeing what you've become.  The what-ifs and how-comes slipping through your fingers like water. When you look at yourself, Bitteroldfella, what do you see?"

He continued when I didn't answer. "I'm just being polite. I know what you see, because that's what I am. And I know you hate me. All that bitterness, frustration, and hopelessness, standing in front of you every day, reminding you of all you should have been.  So here we stand, waiting for the other one to blink. How do you see this working out for yourself?"

"Simple," I snapped. "I'm going to get my little girl, and anything that gets in my way is getting smashed."

"And how will you get her, Bitter?  You’re going to tell her there’s an army of reflections hiding in the glass? You'll be hospitalized. And what then? Keep her from ever seeing her reflection again?  You're smarter than this."

"Then get to the point!" I screamed.

With a condescending smirk, he said, "It's simple, Bitter. You get a front row seat to watch your daughter's youth pass you by, as yours did.

Despite their mathematical elegance and promising results on simple models, standard stochastic gradient (SG) methods for MCMC-based Bayesian posterior sampling (Welling & Teh, 2011; Ahn et al., 2012; Patterson & Teh, 2013; Chen et al., 2014; Ma et al., 2015) struggle with the complex loss landscapes of deep models (Draxler et al., 2018; Garipov et al., 2018), where stochastic optimization presents significant challenges (Chaudhari & Soatto, 2018; Maddox et al., 2019).  Furthermore, existing methods often require impractical, ad-hoc, and sophisticated vanishing learning rate schedules and extensive hyperparameter tuning.

SG-MCMC algorithms generally inject random noise into SG descent algorithms. The covariance of this noise and the learning rate are tightly coupled to assumptions about the loss landscape, which, along with the SG noise, determine the sampling properties (Ma et al., 2015).  However, when applied to complex models like deep networks, current SG-MCMC algorithms cannot satisfy these simplifying assumptions regarding loss landscapes and SG noise covariance behavior while also meeting practical requirements such as non-vanishing learning rates and ease of use.  While Mandt et al. (2017) advocate for fixed step sizes, their work focuses on variational approximations of simple quadratic losses.  In a general Bayesian deep learning setting, no existing SG-MCMC implementation converges to the true posterior without learning rate annealing.

Although others have highlighted these issues (Draxler et al., 2018; Garipov et al., 2018), including the lack of unified notation (Ma et al., 2015), we believe the role of noise in SG-MCMC algorithms requires further investigation.  A deeper understanding is crucial for clarifying the relationships between various methods and, more importantly, for inspiring novel, practical algorithms with fewer tunable parameters and less restrictive assumptions.

This work presents a mathematical framework (Section 2) that emphasizes the interplay between SG noise covariance and learning rate in SG-MCMC algorithms.  This framework reveals the equivalence between learning rate annealing and injecting high-variance noise, enabling us to propose a novel, practical SG-MCMC algorithm (Section 3) that produces (approximate) posterior samples with a fixed, easily derived learning rate.  Moreover, our approach readily applies to pre-trained models; after a "warm-up" phase to estimate SG noise, it can efficiently perform Bayesian posterior sampling.  This proposed SG-MCMC method offers a valid, theoretically sound, and simple alternative to popular techniques that rely on problematic assumptions (Gal & Ghahramani, 2016).

We evaluate SG-MCMC algorithms (Section 4) through extensive experiments, comparing our approach to alternatives like Monte Carlo Dropout (MCD) (Gal & Ghahramani, 2016) and Stochastic Weight Averaging Gaussians (SWAG) (Maddox et al., 2019), which have seen successful application in Bayesian deep learning.  Our results demonstrate that our approach is simpler to use than other SG-MCMC methods and offers competitive performance in accuracy and uncertainty quantification.

World Health Organization Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus announced he is self-isolating after being identified as a contact of someone who tested positive for COVID-19.  He confirmed on Twitter that he is "well and without symptoms" but will quarantine "over the coming days, in line with WHO protocols" and work remotely.

"It is critically important that we all comply with health guidance," the 55-year-old wrote. "This is how we will break chains of COVID-19 transmission, suppress the virus, and protect health systems." He added, "My WHO colleagues and I will continue to engage with partners in solidarity to save lives and protect the vulnerable. Together!"

Dr. Tedros, an Eritrean national and graduate of the University of London and the University of Nottingham, is the first non-physician and the first African to lead the WHO.

Last month, he criticized world leaders who have undermined scientific advice during the pandemic.

L'EuroMillions a fait un nouveau millionnaire britannique hier soir ! Un joueur chanceux a remporté le jackpot de 59 millions de livres sterling, marquant la deuxième grande victoire pour le Royaume-Uni en un seul mois. Avril a décidément été un mois faste pour les joueurs de loterie britanniques.  Déjà le 2 avril, un jackpot de 122 millions de livres sterling avait été remporté, propulsant son détenteur à la cinquième place des plus grands gagnants de la loterie nationale et lui assurant une place sur la prestigieuse Times Rich List.

Ce nouveau gagnant a coché les numéros 05, 17, 28, 41 et 46, ainsi que les étoiles chanceuses 10 et 11.  "Quelle nouvelle incroyable !", s'est exclamé Andy Carter de Camelot, conseiller principal des gagnants à la loterie nationale. "Un joueur britannique a remporté le fabuleux jackpot de 59 millions de livres sterling de l’EuroMillions ce soir. C'est le deuxième gagnant du jackpot EuroMillions au Royaume-Uni en avril, après le gain gigantesque de 122 millions de livres sterling du 2 avril."

Si les gagnants peuvent choisir de révéler leur identité publiquement, beaucoup optent pour l'anonymat.

El gobernador Raúl Jalil decretó el regreso a la Fase 1 del Aislamiento Social, Preventivo y Obligatorio (ASPO) para toda la provincia a partir de las 00:00 horas del sábado 4 de julio. Esta fase del ASPO se extenderá hasta el 6 de julio inclusive, y podrá ser prorrogada por disposición del COE Provincial, dependiendo del análisis de la situación epidemiológica.

En consecuencia, se suspenden en todo el territorio provincial las actividades no esenciales. Se exceptúan únicamente los servicios vinculados con:

* Salud
* Fuerzas de Seguridad
* Estaciones de servicio
* Farmacias
* Comercios y delivery de alimentos
* Recolección de residuos
* Transporte público de pasajeros

El cierre de estas actividades permitidas se establece a las 20:00 horas.

Asimismo, se suspende la actividad de la Administración Pública Provincial y Municipal, entes autárquicos y organismos descentralizados. Quedan exceptuados los empleados convocados para garantizar actividades esenciales y necesarias, a requerimiento de las autoridades superiores.

Las autoridades reiteran a la comunidad la importancia de cumplir con el aislamiento preventivo para evitar la propagación del virus.

Fuente: Unión Digital

La NBA, première ligue sportive professionnelle à avoir interrompu ses opérations en raison du coronavirus, prévoit une reprise fin juillet aux États-Unis.  Cependant, des ajustements restent nécessaires face à l'évolution de la pandémie et ses imprévus.  Vingt-deux franchises sur trente participeront à cette reprise à Disney World, Orlando, Floride, dès le 31 juillet. Les huit autres équipes ne termineront pas la saison. Le plan actuel, validé par 29 franchises sur 30, prévoit huit matchs de saison régulière par équipe, suivis de barrages potentiels pour la huitième place qualificative en play-offs.  Ces derniers se dérouleraient au meilleur des sept matchs, jusqu'au 12 octobre maximum.  L'accord définitif dépend encore de négociations entre la ligue et les joueurs, qui ont approuvé le principe d'une reprise à 22, mais souhaitent clarifier certains points.  "Divers détails restent à négocier et l'acceptation de ce scénario exige que toutes les parties parviennent à un accord sur toutes les questions relatives à la reprise du jeu", précise le syndicat des joueurs (NBPA).


Pour pallier d'éventuelles blessures ou des tests positifs au coronavirus, la NBA autorisera ses 30 franchises (y compris les 8 non-qualifiées) à recruter du 22 juin au 1er juillet, selon ESPN.  Ces recrutements permettront aux équipes reprenant la compétition d'étoffer leur effectif, actuellement limité à 15 joueurs.  Les équipes pourront recruter autant de joueurs qu'elles le souhaitent, parmi ceux ayant participé à la saison NBA, à un camp d'entraînement ou évolué en G League.  En revanche, les anciens joueurs NBA sans contrat cette saison et les joueurs évoluant à l'étranger sont exclus.


Des absences sont d'ores et déjà confirmées. LaMarcus Aldridge (San Antonio) manquera la fin de saison suite à une opération à l'épaule droite.  Son retour à l'entraînement est prévu en fin d'année, en vue de la saison 2020-2021.  Kevin Durant (Brooklyn), blessé au tendon d'Achille l'an dernier, sera également absent.  "Ma saison est terminée. Je n'avais pas l'intention de jouer en 2019-2020", a-t-il déclaré à The Undefeated, s'estimant "pas prêt". Le double champion NBA avec Golden State (2017, 2018) s'était blessé lors des finales 2019.

It’s been two years since Jon Snow trended on Twitter, but the Long Night is finally over. The countdown to season 8 has ended, and *Game of Thrones* has returned to HBO and Sky Atlantic with its eighth and final season.  With schedules already cleared and parties planned, this is arguably the year’s most anticipated cultural event. Here’s everything you need to know:

What time does *Game of Thrones* air?

American fans could tune into the first episode on HBO at 9pm Eastern time on Sunday, April 14.  For UK viewers, the episode simulcast at the rather uncivilized hour of 2am on April 15.  However, given it's a Sunday, a better strategy is to avoid Twitter (and any sleep-deprived friends fueled by energy drinks), get a good night's rest, and catch the repeat broadcast on Monday evening at 9pm.

While the temptation to be among the first to watch at 2am might be strong,  this schedule offers a silver lining: motivation to get out of bed on Monday mornings for the next few weeks. Imagine: enjoying Jon Snow on your TV screen, glass of wine in hand, every Monday night (let's hope he survives the Night King each episode!).  While the final season may bring a tear to your eye, at least your Mondays will be filled with fire-breathing, white-walker fighting excitement for the next two months.

Pedasí (Panamá), 21 abr. (EFE).- En Pedasí, Panamá, un grupo de pescadores de una comunidad costera del Pacífico dona el pescado que captura a sus vecinos para ayudarlos económicamente durante la cuarentena nacional indefinida decretada para frenar la propagación del COVID-19.

"La idea surge debido a la falta de trabajo de los vecinos.  Como los pescadores tienen permiso para laborar, decidieron donar su tiempo y salir a pescar para la comunidad", explicó este lunes a Efe el alcalde del distrito costero de Pedasí, Miguel Batista.

Bajo el lema "Pescao pal pueblo", 40 pescadores de la zona han recolectado alrededor de 1.700 libras de pescado para beneficiar a 900 vecinos del distrito en los dos últimos sábados, coincidiendo con los fines de semana en que la movilidad de la población está prohibida.

El municipio les proporcionó "las herramientas necesarias, como combustible y hielo", y "se les otorgó una autorización" para salir a pescar y así "garantizar la sostenibilidad alimentaria del pueblo", que hasta ahora no ha registrado ningún caso de coronavirus, destacó el alcalde.

Hasta este martes, Panamá registra 136 fallecimientos por COVID-19 y 4.658 contagios desde que el 9 de marzo se confirmara el primer caso en el país.

Equipados con mascarillas y guantes, los pescadores, que se han ofrecido como voluntarios a través de la campaña municipal, salen a pescar cumpliendo las normas sanitarias impuestas por el Ministerio de Salud (Minsa).

La municipalidad recoge a los voluntarios en sus domicilios y los traslada a la playa donde se encuentran sus embarcaciones. Allí, miembros del Servicio Nacional Aeronaval (Senan) los esperan para escoltarlos durante la jornada de pesca.

"Estos dos sábados salieron a las seis de la mañana y regresaron a las tres de la tarde, para comenzar la repartición a las cuatro", indicó Batista.

Un proyecto "para todos: sin religiones ni política"

"Este proyecto llega a todos. 'Pescao pal pueblo' no distingue religiones, estatus sociales ni política", añadió Batista.

Tras la jornada matinal de pesca, comienza la repartición.

A primitive race. Barely off-planet, squandering resources, incapable of governing themselves, let alone others.  Their incessant fighting…fractured into countless warring subgroups, each vying for violent dominance. And they call themselves sapient! It would almost be a mercy to end them.

---

At first, they came in small numbers. Legions of grey men armed with laser blasters, ripped straight from the pages of science fiction. Each legion attempted to capitalize on the chaos of our internecine conflicts, targeting one region at a time.  After the initial assaults, we began reinforcing war-torn areas. The grey men continued their attacks, but they were met with unexpected resistance. A few well-placed missiles, a volley of bullets—that's all it took.

---

"Warleader, complications."

"Report."

"Terran factions are reinforcing recovering regions. They've ceased infighting."

"Increase our strength."

---

We no longer offered easy targets for the grey men to exploit. Witnessing the devastation wrought by war, most of the world decided to put aside its differences.  Having observed our capabilities, their forces grew rapidly in strength. Yet they still underestimated our capacity for violence. Every attempt to strike a larger target revealed the true extent of human power.  They grew stronger, and so did we. I dreaded to think what would happen once the threat that united us was gone.


*To be continued.*

路透首尔5月13日 （记者 James Pearson） - 朝鲜人民武力部长玄永哲最后一次公开露面很可能是在4月末的一个晚上。当时，他坐在音乐厅里，欣赏“牡丹峰乐团”的演出，节目包括《光辉的祖国》和《我们国家最美好》。

然而，据韩国国家情报院（NIS）搜集并向国会议员报告的情报，就在观看演出的次日，玄永哲被指控犯有叛国罪，并当众遭高射机枪处决。若消息属实，这将是金正恩清洗行动中殒命的又一名高官。

与过去历次清洗行动一样，在身遭不测之前，66岁的玄永哲并无异样。朝鲜官方媒体报道，在他最后的日子里，他依然享有优越地位，出席了庆祝朝鲜建军节的仪式，并参加了纪念朝鲜已故领导人的活动。  4月22日，他返朝后，还与中国驻朝鲜军事武官张平会面，庆祝朝鲜建军节。4月25、26日，他又和其他军官向朝鲜已故领导人雕像献花，并鞠躬表达“最崇高的敬意”。 报道称，4月29日，他在平壤听了一场音乐会。自此以后，朝鲜再无有关玄永哲的官方消息。

玄永哲出生于1949年咸镜北道的农村地区，在平壤知名军事院校就学，整个职业生涯都在军队中度过。他自去年9月起担任国防委员会委员，去年6月起担任人民武力部长。他曾是金正日“治丧委员会”的成员，说明他与金正日关系密切。然而，金正日“治丧委员会”的许多成员随后都被剥夺了权力，这显示金正恩正在新建一个以自己为中心的权力基础。

4月13日，玄永哲率团参加莫斯科的一个国际安全会议。金正恩原本预计将参加俄罗斯5月在红场举行的纪念二战胜利的盛大阅兵式。在他返回平壤10天后，即韩国国家情报院认为玄永哲被处决的同一天，克里姆林宫发言人称，金正恩访俄因朝鲜“内部事务”取消。

据韩国媒体《韩国先驱报》的母公司Herald Corp报道，玄永哲善于交际，工作敬业。

La prostitution masculine semble prendre de plus en plus d’ampleur dans la société sénégalaise. L'ampleur du phénomène a été illustrée hier, lundi, par le procès de quatre hommes devant le Tribunal des flagrants délits.  A. Gueye, A. Pouye, E. Dieng et A. Doumbouya étaient poursuivis pour prostitution, diffusion d’images contraires aux bonnes mœurs et défaut de carnet sanitaire.

Face au juge, E. Dieng et A. Doumbouya ont reconnu sans ambages les faits de prostitution, expliquant leur acte par des difficultés financières.  « C’était pour me faire un peu d’argent. Je dois subir une intervention chirurgicale et je m’étais dit que c’était un moyen de me faire un peu d’argent. Je suis docker et je n’ai pas de qualification », a déclaré M. Doumbouya, selon Source A.

A. Gueye et A. Pouye, quant à eux, ont nié les faits de prostitution.  Ils ont cependant plaidé coupables pour la diffusion d’images obscènes, confessant s’être inscrits sur un site dédié pour le plaisir. Ils ont affirmé ignorer que leur inscription sur cette plateforme de rencontre était illégale.

Au terme des débats, le juge a condamné les quatre hommes à une peine de 2 ans avec sursis.

5:11 AM. My eyes snap open in the darkness. I throw off the comforter and stumble to my feet.

Then, I'm running.

Down the stairs, out the door, wearing nothing but a white T-shirt and nylon shorts. I sprint, vaulting over a fire hydrant.

The city is just waking up, and I've never been more grateful for my shitty second-floor studio downtown. People are always awake downtown. Always moving.  With the sun just kissing the skyline, I have just enough time.

Enough time to clothesline the passing bike messenger. Enough time to jump on his bike and pedal a full block before he can catch his breath. Before he can call the cops.

Two blocks down, one block over. 5:14 AM. Thank God it's mostly downhill.  Enough time to knock a businessman—stumbling out of his office after two all-nighters—to the ground.  I jump off the bike and grab his keys. I hear his scream as he falls; a broken leg is a bitch, but I only have enough time.

Enough time to make it to his yellow sports car, to floor the engine. Zero to sixty in under seven seconds is quite useful. Especially right now. He shouldn't be driving anyway. He'd probably crash, killing a mother and two daughters. His wife, his kids. He should thank me.

Seven blocks blur past in a roar of accelerating engine. I weave through the dreary gray concrete canyons, past taxis and early morning vendors. College kids trudge to whatever godforsaken coffee joint employs them at this ungodly hour. 5:20 AM.

A woman walking her dog steps into the crosswalk. Shit. Can't lose focus. I dodge the woman, turn right, slam the brakes, and spin out. The car flips, airbags deploy. It lands in a smoking heap in the middle of the crosswalk. 5:21 AM.

I crawl out of the wreckage as the few bleary-eyed witnesses rush over. Two blocks. Just two blocks. I run. Blood pounds in my ears, and in my leg. Someone grabs at me; I respond with a right hook. He's down, I'm running. 5:22 AM.

I see her as she enters the crosswalk. I see the tanker, brakes failing, barreling towards her. The tanker was two months overdue for inspection. The driver's license was suspended. The gas company didn't care; the guy was always quick to deliver.  She doesn't hear the horn over her noise-canceling headphones.

I bought her those headphones for our anniversary.

The truck slams into her. Her head hits the ground.  Even at 45 mph—the relatively flat city streets a small mercy—it's enough. Cracked skull, internal bleeding, hemorrhaging. Dead in under a minute.

I'm there, she's in my arms, tears streaming down my face.  Shock dulls the pain. She has just enough energy to lift a hand to my cheek, and smile. I try to shush her, tears rolling down my face, clutching her still form.

Gas leaks from the tanker, which has veered into a storefront across the street. The driver's cigarette, of all things, ignites the fumes. I hold her tightly as I'm consumed. 5:24 AM.

5:11 AM. My eyes snap open in the darkness. I throw off the comforter and stumble to my feet.

Then, I'm running.

Apple TV+ enrichit son catalogue, toujours concis mais original, avec plusieurs nouveautés.  Au programme, la sortie de la série intrigante "Home Before Dark", le retour de "The Helpsters" pour une saison 2, et de nouveaux épisodes du talk-show d'Oprah Winfrey consacrés au COVID-19.

"Home Before Dark", inspirée d'une histoire vraie à la manière de "Little America", suit les aventures de Hilde Lysiak, une fillette de 9 ans passionnée d'enquêtes policières.  Déménageant dans la ville natale de son père, elle exhume une vieille affaire de meurtre non résolue.  Cette jeune prodige deviendra d'ailleurs la plus jeune membre de la Society of Professional Journalists.

Optimal transport (OT) [33, 39] provides a mathematically rigorous framework for finding the most efficient way to transform one probability measure into another.  This framework yields a geometrically intuitive and robust metric on the set of probability measures known as the Wasserstein distance.  OT has become increasingly popular in machine learning, data analysis, and computer vision [19, 20], with applications spanning generative modeling [4, 21, 37], domain adaptation [11, 12], transfer learning [3, 27], supervised learning [14], clustering [16], image and point cloud registration [5, 15, 25], and even inverse problems [31].  Recently, there has been growing interest in OT for measures supported on manifolds [7, 36], driven by two key factors: (1) real-world data often lie on low-dimensional manifolds embedded in higher-dimensional Euclidean spaces, and (2) many applications, such as analyzing geophysical data or cortical signals, inherently involve non-Euclidean geometry.

This paper focuses on efficiently comparing probability measures supported on the unit circle—also known as circular probability measures—using the OT framework.  These measures, often represented by circular or rose histograms, are prevalent in numerous applications across computer vision, signal processing, geology, and astronomy.  For example, in computer vision, an image's color content can be captured by its hue in the HSV color space, resulting in a one-dimensional circular histogram.  Furthermore, local image/shape descriptors are often represented by circular histograms, as seen in classic computer vision techniques like SIFT [28] and Shape Context [6]. In structural geology, circular histograms represent the orientation of geological formations like bedding planes, fault lines, and joint sets [38].  Similarly, in signal processing, they represent the phase distribution of periodic signals [26], which can also be normalized and represented as circular probability density functions (PDFs).

While extensive literature exists on circular statistics [18], the seminal works of [13] and [34] are particularly relevant, providing a thorough analysis of the OT problem and transportation distances on the circle (see also [8]).  The topic's continued relevance is highlighted by recent revisits to OT on circles [7, 17].  Unlike OT on the real line, the OT problem between probability measures on the circle generally lacks a closed-form solution. This is due to the circle's intrinsic metric and the existence of two paths (clockwise and counter-clockwise) between any two points on the circle.  However, a closed-form solution for the 2-Wasserstein distance *does* exist when one of the measures is the Lebesgue measure (i.e., the uniform distribution), which we will discuss in the Background section.

We introduce Linear Circular OT (LCOT), a novel transport-based distance for circular probability measures.  LCOT leverages the closed-form solution of the circular 2-Wasserstein distance between each distribution and the uniform distribution on the circle, thereby circumventing the need for optimization.  Specifically, we determine the Monge maps that push the uniform distribution to each input measure using this closed-form solution.  The distance between the input measures is then based on the differences between their respective Monge maps.

Larson discovered the breach first. It was a fluke, a timely recollection of an image—a fusion of two distinct moments in time and place, yet sharing identical meaning.

He'd spent long hours hunched over his computer, the days blurring into a seamless stream of applications and programs.  As a security analyst for a major contractor, Larson shouldered significant responsibility for numerous processes. He was working late, as he often did, relishing the post-departure solitude of his cubicle, where he felt he could truly concentrate. He enjoyed the rhythmic, almost zen-like state of nothingness familiar to anyone who’s spent hours programming or immersed in deep, focused work.

One evening, while sifting through a subfolder, his phone rang. His boss, whose company held contracts with not only major corporations but government and military entities as well, barked into the receiver:

"God damn it, Larson! I've had it up to here with you! Are you at the office?"

"Yes, I had more work to do—" Larson stammered, bewildered. How did his boss know he was looking at the Buffalo File?

"I knew it! What the hell are you doing in the Buffalo File? You know it's off-limits! And what the hell are you doing at the office at this hour? I don't know what I pay you for, sometimes!"

"I'm sorry. I'm just doing a routine sweep—"

"I'll tell you what you're doing. You're wasting air, water, and electricity on my dime! You're fired, that's what you are! You have until tomorrow morning to get out."

The line went dead. Larson began to tremble, but the shock quickly gave way to a strange, habituated compulsion to look at the file again. He double-clicked the folder and scanned the contents.  Rationality had long since abandoned him, replaced by the unsettling familiarity of a file from a dream.

The second part of Larson's vision stemmed from years earlier, before he was a security contractor, before he was much of anything at all, really, except a deadbeat mooching off his parents and smoking copious amounts of marijuana. He’d had a dream. Whether a product of a damaged neocortex, his upbringing and education, his psychology, or a genuine vision as he maintained, it had not only stuck with him but become a part of him. Even now, sitting in the office chair that was no longer his, he recalled it vividly. He’d dreamt he was sitting there, scrolling through that very folder, and finding himself.

The image known as the "Face on Mars" has sparked speculation about alien involvement. However, a closer look at the facts reveals a more terrestrial explanation.  As the article "Unmasking the Face on Mars" explains, the image shows a large rock formation resembling a human head. This appearance is caused by shadows that create the illusion of eyes, a nose, and a mouth.  The formation is essentially the Martian equivalent of a butte or mesa, landforms common in the American West.  Garvin, quoted in the article, compares it to Middle Butte in Idaho, a lava dome forming an isolated mesa of similar height.

While some maintain the belief in an alien origin, the idea raises a fundamental question: why would aliens create a human face, especially if they had never encountered humans before?  Personally, while I remain open to the possibility of life beyond Earth, I believe the "Face on Mars" is a natural phenomenon, a coincidental arrangement of rock and shadow.  The image itself, along with the evidence presented in the article, clearly points to a natural rock formation, not an alien artifact.

About 25 years ago, on May 24, 2001, NASA's Viking spacecraft, while orbiting Mars, captured an image of what appeared to be a huge, human-like face in the Cydonia region.  This face, nearly two miles long, seemed to stare back at the camera.

Initially, the formation sparked speculation and questions about its origins.  Could such a distinct shape be merely a natural landform?  Later, the Mars Global Surveyor provided a definitive answer.  Flying over Cydonia, it took a photograph of the same area, but with ten times the resolution of the original Viking image.  Despite cloudy conditions requiring the camera to penetrate the haze, the higher resolution picture clearly revealed the “face” to be a natural geological formation.

Some skeptics argued that the clearer image was achieved *because* of the haze, suggesting it obscured evidence of artificial construction.  However, this argument is illogical.  A hazy image would obscure details, not enhance them. The clarity of the Mars Global Surveyor image, despite the clouds, provides strong evidence against artificial construction.  Therefore, the combined evidence of the original image and the significantly clearer follow-up strongly supports the conclusion that the "face on Mars" is nothing more than a fascinating, but ultimately natural, landform.

Holy Name's girls' soccer team has undergone a dramatic transformation since their 2018 season.  A telling example of their improvement is evident in their performance against Nipmuc, Nashoba, and Quabbin.  In 2018, these three teams handed Holy Name a trio of losses in quick succession. This year, the fifth-ranked Naps (7-1) have flipped the script, defeating all three in the opening month of the 2019 season.

These victories haven't been against pushovers. The Naps opened their season with a thrilling 3-2 win over fourth-ranked Nashoba, a victory secured by a late goal from sophomore sensation Hayley Houston.  Longtime coach Bill Manzello noted this as Holy Name's first win over the Chieftains in nearly two decades.  They followed this up with a decisive 2-0 shutout against seventh-ranked Nipmuc, the program's first regular-season win over the Warriors in over ten years.  A commanding 4-0 performance against a strong and experienced Quabbin squad further solidified their impressive start.

"We want to be respected as one of the better teams around, but we have to earn that respect," said Manzello, whose team has found its rhythm with three consecutive shutouts since a narrow 1-0 loss to fourth-ranked Wachusett on September 17th.

Houston’s arrival has been a key factor in this resurgence. Opting to play high school soccer over her elite club team, the eighth-grader-turned-Nap has already netted 16 goals before the halfway mark of the season. “She’s a special talent,” Manzello praised. “It was a big boost…She’s a very, very good player.”  Manzello highlighted Houston's ability to beat defenders one-on-one while also recognizing when to distribute the ball, coupled with a powerful shot with both feet.

He usually got that wish.

“Still on your arse, recruit? ’Tis dawn! We fight!” boomed the Viking warrior who owned the boot.

“Please… I haven’t eaten… in days…” Steven groaned.

“You don’t get fed for getting killed in practice, son. Up! It’s not like you’ll die of hunger. After all… you’re already dead!”

The man hauled him to his feet, roaring with laughter at his own joke.  He thrust a halberd into Steven’s trembling hands the moment he could stand.

“Please… must I fight? I’m not… I’ll never be strong enough to win. I’m not one of you… hell, I’m not even supposed to be here. Can’t you… just kill me, so I can get some rest?” Steven pleaded. The Viking adjusted his eye patch, making Steven flinch.

“Son…” the Viking began, looking at him with pity. “Are you… a coward?”

Steven frowned. “No, I’m… I don’t want to be, I just…” He trailed off, avoiding the man’s gaze.

“Let me show you something, my child, before the true battle begins.” The man said. “Do you see, on the battlefield… do you see all the skulls? The bones?”

Steven nodded. The battlefield was littered with charred skulls, mandibles, and other grisly remains untouched by the circling crows. It was gruesome. Steven hated those grounds. He couldn’t take two steps without snapping an ancient femur.

“What of them?” he asked. “Old skulls… I’m sure you see new ones every day, with all the bloodshed.”

“No, son,” the Viking said, shaking his head, his scraggly white beard swaying. “Not like this, not *these* skulls. These are the skulls of the weak. Steven’s stomach churned. “I… I can’t be like them,” he said.

Venus: Earth's Twin with a Fiery Temper

Venus, often called the "Evening Star," is one of the brightest objects in the night sky, easily spotted even by amateur stargazers.  This captivating planet, second from the sun, shares striking similarities with Earth, making it our closest planetary neighbor in terms of size and density.  This resemblance has earned Venus the title of Earth's twin, but a closer look reveals a world of stark contrasts and daunting challenges for exploration.

The similarities between Venus and Earth initially fueled speculation about the possibility of life.  Like Earth, Venus is believed to have once harbored vast oceans and potentially supported various life forms.  Its surface features familiar geological formations such as mountains, valleys, and craters, further strengthening the comparison.  This proximity and potential for past life make Venus a prime target for planetary investigation, representing the nearest option for a potential interplanetary visit.

However, the dream of a readily accessible sister planet is quickly shattered by Venus's harsh realities.  Beneath its brilliant facade lies a hostile environment. Its atmosphere, composed of 97% carbon dioxide, traps heat, resulting in a surface temperature that is the hottest in our solar system – hot enough to melt lead.  Adding to this inferno are clouds of highly corrosive sulfuric acid.  Even at thirty miles above the surface, temperatures remain a scorching 170 degrees Fahrenheit, though the air pressure at this altitude is comparable to Earth's sea level, offering a marginally survivable environment for humans.

The extreme conditions on Venus present enormous challenges for exploration.  Landing on the surface is incredibly dangerous, forcing researchers to observe the planet from afar.  This remote observation severely limits data collection, as researchers cannot directly sample rocks, gases, or other materials.

Venus, often called the "Evening Star," is the second planet from our sun and one of the brightest objects in the night sky.  Its brilliance often leads to it being mistaken for a star. While easily visible from Earth, closer examination presents significant challenges.  Though sometimes Mars is closer to Earth due to the varying speeds of planetary orbits, Venus remains a prime target for exploration.  However, this exploration comes at a cost.  Despite being similar to Earth in size and density, Venus presents a hostile environment that has thwarted numerous missions.

Venus's reputation as a challenging planet for study is well-earned.  Its thick atmosphere, composed of 97% carbon dioxide, traps heat, resulting in scorching surface temperatures averaging over 800 degrees Fahrenheit.  The atmospheric pressure is 90 times greater than Earth's.  These extreme conditions mean any spacecraft attempting a landing would be quickly liquefied and destroyed.  This explains why no spacecraft has survived on Venus's surface for more than a few hours, and why it has been over three decades since the last attempted landing. All previous missions have been unmanned.

Despite these inhospitable conditions, scientists remain fascinated by Venus.  Its similarity to Earth in size and density suggests that it may once have been much more Earth-like, possibly even harboring oceans and supporting life.  This possibility, coupled with the planet's intriguing geological features, including valleys, mountains, and craters, fuels the desire for further exploration.

While exploring Venus is undeniably dangerous and complex, the potential rewards are significant.  Understanding the evolution of a planet so similar to our own could provide valuable insights into Earth's past and future, and perhaps even reveal whether life once existed beyond our planet.  This makes Venus a worthy pursuit, despite the inherent risks.

"Pour the goat's blood and begin the sacred chant," the priest intoned, his gaze sweeping over the circle of men surrounding him. Their dark cowls were faintly illuminated by the flickering light of a hundred candles.

At the cave's center, a pentagram pulsed with crimson energy. The priest, clad in blood-red robes and adorned with gold, stood poised.  At his command, a high-ranking acolyte stepped forward, bearing a clay bowl that emanated a foul odor. One second.

Two.

Three.

**Extraños actos de los gatos**

Las mascotas suelen tener comportamientos inexplicables para sus dueños. En el caso de los gatos, esto sucede con mucha más frecuencia que con otros animales, pero todo responde a una sencilla razón.  Muchos de los dueños optan por comprar elaboradas estructuras para sus gatos, pero algunos de ellos prefieren las cajas, bolsas, maletas o mochilas. Esto se debe a que, por instinto, buscan lugares cerrados y pequeños para acechar a sus presas, evitando ser vistos.  Algunos de sus movimientos responden a la necesidad de cazar, pues contrario a otros animales, los gatos no han perdido sus instintos naturales y, por tanto, su necesidad de cazar y comer, aún estando dentro de casa.

Una de las cosas que más hacen los gatos es frotarse sobre sus dueños.  Es una forma de demostrar cariño, pues le dicen al mundo que eres de ellos. En ocasiones, este comportamiento también puede indicar una necesidad.  Asimismo, si tu gato amasa las mantas, cojines e inclusive a ti, es algo completamente normal. Cuando los gatos son pequeños, amasan para que la leche salga más fácil de su madre;  de adultos, es una forma de demostrar cariño o felicidad.

Puede que tu gato llegue con un pequeño animal muerto a tu casa. Este comportamiento tiene varias explicaciones. Una de ellas es que interpreta que eres el peor cazador de la manada y no desea que pases hambre. Otra es que quiere compartir contigo lo que ha cazado, haciéndote parte de su familia.

La mayoría de las personas optan por los perros pues suelen ser más cariñosos que los gatos. Para quienes se preguntan el porqué de este comportamiento felino menos efusivo, deberán saber que es normal y no significa que no amen a sus dueños. Es más bien una forma de llamar la atención.

Une équipe s'est rendue dans cette commune du Gers pour prendre en charge cet obus. « C'est assez rare dans la région », commente le chef de service du groupement d'intervention du déminage de Toulouse. « On en traite quatre au maximum par an en ex-région Midi-Pyrénées », poursuit-il.

L'obus était vide de toute matière active. « Nous allons le conserver dans notre collection de travail. S'il avait été plein, il aurait été détruit.  Un obus de 155 mm de ce type est rare dans notre collection.  Il faut rappeler que l'explosion d'un tel obus projette des éclats jusqu'à 1 500 mètres ! »

Lire aussi : Gers. À Chélan, la RD 929 coupée ce jeudi après-midi suite à la sortie de route d’un bus scolaire

Sa conservation a été décidée en raison de son amorçage particulier. « C'était une fabrication assez spéciale. Le principe de fonctionnement reste le même : une fusée, une gaine d’amorçage et un corps explosif », précise le chef de service.  Et cet obus n'est pas récent…

Plus d'un siècle d'histoire

Il est vieux de plus d'un siècle ! Le groupe d'intervention du déminage estime que sa conception remonte au début de la Première Guerre mondiale. Comment expliquer la présence d'un tel obus dans le Gers, plus de cent ans après ? Le chef de service propose plusieurs hypothèses :

« La plupart du temps, lorsqu'on nous appelle pour des obus, soit ils ont été découverts dans le cadre du tourisme de guerre, soit ils ont été rapportés comme souvenirs par les poilus de retour dans leur région.  Il faut également tenir compte de l'industrie de l'armement qui était présente sur les bases arrières : à la fermeture des usines, des stocks restaient parfois sur place. »

Lire aussi : Gers.

Querétaro, 9 Mar (Notimex).- Querétaro se prepara para la segunda edición del Hay Festival, que se celebrará del 7 al 10 de septiembre, con una expectativa de asistencia de 25 mil personas.  La titular de la Oficina de Turismo y Asuntos Internacionales del municipio, Esther Carboney Echave, anunció el evento en rueda de prensa, afirmando que "con el Hay Festival, Querétaro vuelve a ser punto de referencia cultural del país".

Carboney Echave recordó el éxito de la edición 2016, que contó con 80 actividades, prestigiosos invitados de 17 países, una asistencia de 22 mil personas y un 60 por ciento de ocupación hotelera en la ciudad.  "Para este año, el objetivo es superar los resultados culturales y de asistencia obtenidos en la edición anterior", puntualizó.

Durante cuatro días, Querétaro será punto de encuentro de literatos, científicos, periodistas, cineastas, filósofos y otras figuras destacadas de la cultura mundial. Los nombres de los participantes del Hay Festival Querétaro 2017 se darán a conocer en los próximos meses.

Hay es una organización cultural con sede en Gales, dedicada a la organización de festivales internacionales.  Desde 2010, México se ha convertido en una sede importante, con eventos en Zacatecas, Xalapa, la Ciudad de México y, desde el año pasado, Querétaro.

Defence Secretary Gavin Williamson, speaking at MOD St Athan in Wales on Friday, accused the Welsh Government of hindering military investment in Wales by refusing to engage in talks with Westminster.  Mr. Williamson, accompanied by Welsh Secretary Alun Cairns, met with RAF and Army representatives to discuss the base's future and proposed developing new barracks at the site.

He stated, “We want to see more service personnel based here in Wales…bringing wealth, prosperity, and opportunity.”  Mr. Williamson claimed the Welsh Government is "resisting" and "not properly engaging" with proposals to increase the number of army personnel stationed at St Athan.  He emphasized the potential economic benefits of new barracks, including job creation and increased prosperity, but expressed frustration with the Welsh Government's alleged refusal to consider the proposals necessary for this investment.  “Sadly all the options we keep putting forward…is something the Welsh Government are resisting and not properly engaging with us about," he added.  "This will have an enormous impact on the local economy, guaranteeing jobs, guaranteeing prosperity, but sadly at the moment the Welsh Government is refusing to look at the options…to make that investment happen.”

A Welsh Government spokesman countered this claim, welcoming military investment but highlighting the UK Government's cancellation of the £14bn Defence Training Academy at St Athan in 2010, a project that had promised 2,000 jobs.  The spokesman explained, “Our interests in St Athan result from the Defence Training Academy, a legacy defence project which was costly for Wales and which the MOD subsequently cancelled before completion.” Following the cancellation, the Welsh Government promoted the area as a business park, successfully attracting Aston Martin with a commitment to continued development.

While reiterating their welcome of UK Government investment in Welsh military infrastructure, the spokesman pointed to the availability of “hundreds of acres…including around 50 acres within and adjacent to West Camp,” suitable for accommodating new personnel without impacting the business park.

The stark white walls of the room amplified the contrast between the two figures within. One, in standard prison uniform, was human. The other, in a suit, was not quite.  "Did you ever steal candy when you were younger?" the suited figure began. "That first time – terrifying, wasn't it? Heart thumping, convinced the cops were coming, almost backing out, but unable to resist."

"Only degenerates steal candy," the prisoner retorted.  "You're talking about *killing* someone." His hands balled into fists within the restraints.

The suited man leaned forward, judgment heavy in his gaze.  The confession had been surprisingly easy. A slip during interrogation, a detail only the victim and her mother could have known, and the rest had followed. “It’s no different," the prisoner continued, a disturbing relish coloring his tone. "After the first time, the candy gets so much sweeter. Enjoying something you shouldn’t… it’s incredible.  Do you know the exact DNA sequence of the common house tabby? I do. I shouldn't. But the fact that I do… it's so sweet."  He arched his back, a soft moan escaping his lips, before snapping forward, hungry eyes locking onto the suited figure’s flat stare.  “And the best part? You never know what you’re going to get. Do you know what the female orgasm feels like?”

“You’re sick,” the suited man stated, his expression not one of disgust, but a strange disappointment. "How did it take me so long to find you? It'll be good to watch the world slip from your eyes.  Then I’ll know I've made this world a better place."

"I'll be the first, you know," the prisoner said.

"First what?"

"The first death row kill since the change, of course." A flicker of something like pride crossed the prisoner’s face. "I think about it at night. The poor sap pushing the button… he’s not murdering me. That would be you. Or the families pushing for my head. One or the other. We will see.” He was right. Capital punishment had been globally abolished twenty years prior. Wars had all but vanished. The world was… peaceful. Except for a few.

“I’m sure I’ll be fine,” the suited man said, rising to his feet. “It’s been twenty years. We know how things work now. Anyway, I’m done with you.”  He walked out.


The viewing room was oddly bright.  Darren, in the room for the first time, noted its disuse – a consequence of the twenty-year moratorium. The families of the victims filled the seats: parents, lovers, children, siblings. *Children.* Darren was taken aback. Who would bring a *child* to an execution?  Each person in the room, presumably, had reason to hate the man strapped to the table.

Adam, the condemned, was unsettlingly calm, even happy.  Probably reliving another stolen memory.  The unfairness of it struck Darren – the sheer volume of precious moments stolen from so many. Children, lovers, sons, daughters.  A perverse cross-section of humanity violated.

Change detection in remote sensing plays a critical role in rapid humanitarian assistance and disaster response (HADR) for natural disaster relief.  Improvements in computer vision models for change detection are crucial for accurate identification of areas requiring assistance, enabling effective planning and resource allocation by HADR organizations and communities.  The development of large-scale labeled change detection datasets has fueled this progress.

Self-supervised learning methods have recently become the dominant approach for pretraining these models due to their simplicity and ability to leverage large unlabeled datasets.  This is particularly relevant in remote sensing and Earth observation, given the abundance of multiview and multimodal data.  For instance, Manas et al. [2] demonstrated performance gains by pretraining with Sentinel-2 imagery of the same location captured in different seasons as multiple views. Similarly, Heidler et al. [3] showed effective learning and improved downstream performance by pretraining on an audiovisual dataset of aerial image and audio pairs, outperforming traditional transfer learning approaches.

Several recent studies have explored self-supervised learning for change detection, primarily using pre- and post-event imagery as multiple views. Leenstra et al. [4] used a large dataset of Sentinel-2 imagery to train a model to predict spatial overlap between patches as a pretext task.  Chen et al. [5] employed a contrastive framework with pre- and post-event imagery. However, to the best of our knowledge, no prior work has explored contrastive training using overlapping remotely sensed imagery and 3D surface maps as a pretext task.

I strongly support the development of smart/driverless cars for several compelling reasons: their potential for increased fuel efficiency, enhanced safety features, and reduced driver burden.

These vehicles promise significant fuel savings, potentially using half the fuel consumed by current taxis.  This efficiency, combined with their personalized routing, offers greater flexibility than public transportation options like buses.  Replacing traditional taxi services with driverless cars also eliminates the potential for human driver error. While the passenger becomes solely responsible for their safety, the removal of human unpredictability from other drivers significantly enhances overall road safety.

Smart cars excel at detecting and responding to road hazards. Equipped with advanced sensors and technology, they can react to dangers faster than a human driver, preemptively applying brakes and mitigating potential collisions. Features like "Traffic Jam Assistant," while still requiring driver alertness, automate much of the driving process in challenging traffic situations, increasing both safety and convenience.

Furthermore, these vehicles offer a safer driving experience even with reduced driver control.  While some might find this paradoxical, the consistent and predictable nature of automated systems minimizes risks associated with human error.  As Werner Huber, a project manager from BMW, points out, this shift requires us to "interpret driving in a fun new way."

« Une infirmière, n’ayant jamais vu de couple gay, a aspergé un patient d’eau bénite en le voyant tenir la main de son compagnon, avant de refuser de le soigner. Il est impératif d'éduquer : nos patients doivent se sentir en sécurité, dans un environnement où personne ne se moquera d’eux ni ne les insultera. » À Wilton Manors, à une cinquantaine de kilomètres au nord de Miami, Lisa Peters, directrice du centre pour seniors Noble A. McArtor, s’emploie à faire connaître son action à une communauté isolée, souvent ignorante de son existence. L’organisation à but non lucratif qui gère le centre, SunServe, est spécialisée dans les services de santé à la population LGBT+.  Les personnes âgées sont au cœur de son combat contre la précarité sanitaire et les mauvaises pratiques.

Plus au sud, à Key West, Albert, 79 ans, est ravi. Le nouveau personnel soignant qui lui a été attribué est un homme gay, comme lui. « Je n’ai plus besoin de me cacher, nous pouvons parler de nos centres d’intérêt communs, de ce qui nous rapproche », confie-t-il. Même l’éventuelle nudité n’est plus source de gêne.

Ces anecdotes contrastées, rapportées et vécues à quelques jours d'intervalle début novembre en Floride, illustrent à elles seules que si la « Silver Economy LGBT+ » n'est pas une simple niche à la mode, elle représente la partie émergée d’un iceberg précaire, où tout reste à construire, à apprendre.

"I can't believe he's dead..."  Ah crap, it's Sean's brother. Don't overdo it.

"Neither can I."  Truthfully, it *is* hard to believe, even though I was there. Even though I lay belly-down on his back, yanking the cheap paracord tighter against his neck until my arms hurt. I even checked his pulse.

Sean's brother (what's his name again?) seems satisfied with my answer. I briefly squeeze his shoulder, offering a show of support. His eyes lock on mine for a second, trying to thank me. He opens his mouth, but no sound comes out. Nodding instead, he turns and wanders back through the clusters of mourners.

I join a small group sharing stories about Sean's life. Small, almost meaningless actions he performed while alive now confirm the message we've been hearing all afternoon: Sean was a really great guy. Ordinary stories now glow. An unremarkable landscape is caught in this perfect sunset. I knew this would happen, dreaded coming today, but it's not as irritating as I expected.

"What about you?" Crap, what are they talking about?

"Sorry, what were you asking? I was lost in thought."

I'm still stuck on the unanswered question. *Why* did I kill Sean? Granted, he'd been a bit of an asshole since I've known him. But that grating feeling I got around him shouldn't have been enough to drive me to *this*.  There's no single action that stands out as unforgivable. I can't even remember all the conversations where he was self-centered, or degraded women, or spouted some cocky know-it-all philosophy. And I'm pretty sure he would have slept with that beyond-drunk girl at his housewarming party if I hadn't stayed behind to prevent it. Hearing stories of him harshly putting down his students doesn't help his case either.

The truth is, I didn't do it for the students or to defend anyone. I did it because I wanted to kill someone. The urge had been in me since at least middle school, returning every few months a bit stronger.

Manchester City’s 2-1 loss to Lyon on Wednesday, their fourth consecutive Champions League defeat, lays bare the challenge facing the Premier League champions. ## El Nuevo Sistema Horario de Luz: Preguntas y Respuestas

**¿En qué consiste el sistema horario de luz?**

Si tiene un contador inteligente de luz, su factura se calculará en función del consumo que realice cada hora y del precio que marque en ese momento el mercado mayorista de electricidad (pool).

**¿Cómo puedo saber cuál es el precio?**

El precio diario estará disponible el día anterior, a partir de las 20:15 horas, en la web de Red Eléctrica de España (REE) o en sitios web que enlacen esta información.  Esto permite al cliente anticiparse al consumo.  Existen diversas aplicaciones móviles que ofrecen esta información.

**¿El sistema funciona desde hoy mismo?**

El Ministerio de Industria, Energía y Turismo ha publicado la resolución que pone en marcha el nuevo sistema, el cual comenzará el 1 de julio. Las comercializadoras y distribuidoras tendrán un plazo de adaptación hasta el 1 de octubre para implementar el nuevo mecanismo. Los ficheros de intercambio de información entre las empresas y otros aspectos técnicos deberán aplicarse antes del 1 de enero de 2016.

**¿Qué es un contador inteligente?**

Los contadores inteligentes son digitales y están programados para la telegestión por parte de la empresa distribuidora, integrándose en el sistema. Generalmente, las compañías eléctricas los instalan siguiendo sus propios planes y un calendario gubernamental que obliga a sustituir todos los contadores antes de 2018.  Industria aún no ha fijado una fecha límite para la integración en el sistema.

**¿Con esto ya recibo la factura hora a hora?**

Existen dos opciones: que su comercializadora independiente ya ofrezca este servicio (algunas ya lo hacen) o que tenga la tarifa regulada, conocida como Precio Voluntario al Pequeño Consumidor (PVPC).  Puede acceder al PVPC independientemente de si está o no en el mercado libre, siempre que su potencia contratada sea inferior a 10 kilovatios (kW). El PVPC eliminó las subastas eléctricas trimestrales y reimplantó la facturación bimestral. Si el contador es analógico, el recibo se emite cada dos meses con un precio adaptado a perfiles de consumo.

**¿A qué hora será más barata la luz?**

Generalmente, el mercado mayorista registra precios más bajos en las horas de menor demanda (de medianoche a mediodía) y más altos en las de mayor consumo (tarde y noche hasta las 23:00 horas). La energía eólica puede reducir los precios en días ventosos, mientras que los días anticiclónicos suelen traer precios más altos.
