Chargers’ preseason opener, a 48-17 loss to the Seattle Seahawks Sunday night, was marred by a potentially serious injury to starting middle linebacker Denzel Perryman.  Perryman hurt his left ankle in the first quarter and was later seen on crutches and in a walking boot. He underwent an MRI on Monday, but the team has yet to release a medical update.  “I’m not sure how bad it is right now, we’ll have to wait and see,” coach Anthony Lynn said after the game. “It could be serious, but I have no idea right now.” This injury comes on the heels of two other significant blows to the Chargers. Projected starting right guard Forrest Lamp, a second-round pick from Western Kentucky, tore his ACL in the first week of training camp and is out for the season.  First-round pick Mike Williams, a wide receiver from Clemson, is also sidelined with a herniated disk in his lower back suffered in May.  There is no timetable for his return.

Perryman, a 24-year-old second-round pick from Miami in 2015, recorded 80 tackles, two sacks and an interception in 12 games last season, starting 11. He missed four games due to hamstring and knee injuries. As a rookie in 2015, he tallied 95 tackles and two sacks in 14 games.  If Perryman’s injury is significant, it will likely elevate reserve middle linebacker Korey Toomer into the starting lineup.  Toomer, who had four tackles Sunday night, played in 13 games with eight starts last season, recording 69 tackles and one sack.

Despite the loss and the injury, there were some bright spots for the Chargers. The first-team offense orchestrated an impressive game-opening, 13-play, 75-yard touchdown drive.  Quarterback Philip Rivers completed five of six passes for 56 yards and emerged without a speck of dirt on his uniform. “We kept Philip clean,” left guard Matt Slauson said. “He was getting the ball out fast. We ran the ball well. Everything was rolling. Communication was fast and clean. Nobody was really unsure.” The strong play of the revamped offensive line, which will feature at least three new starters, is crucial to the Chargers’ success given the talent at the skill positions with Rivers, running back Melvin Gordon, and a deep group of receivers and tight ends.

The drive included a 17-yard completion to tight end Hunter Henry, a 15-yard catch by Travis Benjamin on third-and-nine, and a 14-yard screen pass to Branden Oliver.  The drive culminated in a five-yard touchdown pass to veteran tight end Antonio Gates. “When you have a guy like Philip, a guy who understands the system, understands the game, he puts you in the best position possible,” Gates said. “That’s what he was able to do. We were so efficient. Our whole thing is trying to be balanced, and we were able to do that.”

The Chargers' first-team defense also performed well initially, preventing Seattle from scoring on its first two possessions.  Cornerback Casey Hayward provided tight coverage, and defensive end Melvin Ingram stopped quarterback Trevone Boykin for no gain.  However, the second- and third-team units struggled against Seattle’s reserves. “We’re going to be a good team, but it’s not just about the ones,” safety Tre Boston said. “Unfortunately in football, your ones will go down every so often, and we need twos and threes who are going to pick up the slack and help us.”

Backup quarterback candidate Cardale Jones, recently acquired from Buffalo, displayed flashes of potential, including a 38-yard completion to tight end Matt Weiser and a 13-yard scramble.  However, he completed only two of nine passes for 50 yards and took an 11-yard sack.  “He’s still learning our system,” Lynn said. “We threw him in the fire, and he did some good things, but he also did some bad things, things he needs to improve on — his accuracy, some reads, some protections.”

金星高空云层发现磷化氢，引发生命猜想

图像来源，JAXA/ISAS/Akatsuki Project Team
图像加注文字， 金星是一颗高温、高压的行星。

天文学家在金星的高空云层中探测到磷化氢（PH3），这一发现引发了人们对金星存在生命的惊人猜想。磷化氢在地球上与生命息息相关，它由一个磷原子和三个氢原子组成，常与企鹅等动物肠道中的微生物或沼泽等缺氧环境中的微生物活动有关。虽然磷化氢也可以通过工业生产，但金星上显然没有工厂，也没有企鹅。

图像来源，ESO/M.Kornmesser/L.Calcada/Nasa
图像加注文字， 磷化氢由一个磷原子和三个氢原子组成。

那么，磷化氢为何会存在于金星地表上方50公里的云层中？英国卡迪夫大学的简·格里夫斯教授及其团队在《自然天文学》杂志上发表了他们的研究成果，详细描述了他们在金星上发现磷化氢的过程。他们试图找出这种分子自然生成的非生物途径，但目前为止尚未找到令人满意的解释。

格里夫斯教授的团队首先使用夏威夷的詹姆斯·克拉克·麦克斯韦望远镜发现了金星上的磷化氢，然后利用智利的阿塔卡玛大型毫米波天线阵确认了这一发现。磷化氢独特的“吸收谱线”使射电望远镜能够在约1毫米的波长范围内识别它。观测显示，磷化氢存在于金星中纬度地区上空约50-60公里的高度，浓度虽然很低（每10亿个大气分子中只有10-20个），但在这种情况下已经相当可观。

图像来源，DETLEV VAN RAVENSWAAY/SPL
图像加注文字， 金星极端的环境被认为很难有生命存在。

为什么金星存在生命的可能性引人关注？金星的环境极其恶劣，表面温度高达400摄氏度以上，大气中96%是二氧化碳，失控的温室效应使其如同炼狱。以往的探测器在金星表面仅能存活几分钟。然而，距离金星表面50公里的高空，环境相对适宜，因此，如果金星上真的存在生命，这将是最有可能找到它们的地方。

然而，金星的云层主要由硫酸构成，这对地球生命来说是致命的。研究团队中的生物化学家，麻省理工学院的威廉·贝恩斯博士研究了金星上可能存在的各种化合物组合，以及火山、闪电和陨石等因素是否会产生磷化氢。但他发现，所有已知的化学反应都不足以产生观测到的磷化氢含量。

Edgar’s Story: A Revised Narrative

My name is Edgar. I was a person once.

I remember the chilling metallic touch of the cage bars against my trembling body. The dripping sink down the hall, a metronome marking the time until they came for me. The sound echoed in the stark silence, broken only by the frantic thump of my own heart.  I’d known this day was coming, always known, yet nothing could have truly prepared me.  A naive part of me had clung to the hope of being overlooked, spared.

Growing up, they fed us stories: work hard, prove your worth, and earn Pilgrim status, a valued member of society.  I wish they’d just told me it was bullshit.  All that work, all that striving, for nothing.  My father was a Breeder, a Pilgrim granted the privilege of creating new Shells.  Perhaps foolishly, I thought his position might offer me some protection, some connection.  But he was already gone, moved on before I even had a chance to know him.  I hadn't seen him since I was a child. Lying in bed at night, I used to wonder what it felt like to burn through bodies the way he did.

Footsteps in the hall. The dripping stopped. This was it.  A bone-deep dread seized me, my teeth chattering against the rising tide of fear.  The guards arrived, restrained me.  Resistance was futile; I’d always been weak, and now, a weary acceptance had settled in.

The walk seemed endless, a procession past the cells of others awaiting the same fate – their bodies repurposed.  Some wept, some raged; I pitied them. Not all could face the inevitable with the same grim resignation I had somehow mustered.

We passed through a gate, the guards nodding to a man holding a key before a large laboratory door. Its pristine white finish clashed violently with the rusted metal and crumbling concrete of the surrounding area.  Inside, all eyes turned to me.  My 25th birthday party, a macabre celebration I never wanted.  They strapped me to a chair, drew blood, confirmed I wasn't brain-dead.  The silence was the most terrifying part.

Topic models (TMs), such as Latent Dirichlet Allocation (LDA), reveal the thematic structure of document collections by identifying latent topics and their association with each document.  These models represent documents as mixtures of topics, where each topic is a distribution over words in the vocabulary.  Beyond document representation, TMs offer interpretability through the top key terms associated with each topic.  Recent neural topic models (NTMs) have demonstrated superior performance compared to LDA-based approaches, motivating our focus on NTMs in this work.

Language models (LMs) excel at predicting words within sequences, effectively capturing local linguistic structures like word order. However, traditional LMs, often limited by n-gram windows or sentence boundaries, struggle to incorporate global semantic context, particularly at the document level.  Recent research has sought to bridge this gap by integrating document-level semantics from topic models into LMs, for instance, by augmenting LSTM-based LMs with document-topic proportions.

Existing approaches, while incorporating document-topic proportions into LMs, overlook the valuable explanatory power of the individual topics themselves.  This explanatory representation, derived from the high-probability terms within each topic's word distribution, offers a finer-grained understanding of the thematic content. Consider the example in Figure 1(a): a topic model applied to a three-sentence document reveals the document-topic proportions (ĥd) and the top key terms for each corresponding topic (T1, T2, and T3).  The context of "chip" in sentence #2 is ambiguous, but the document-topic proportions combined with the explanatory topics provide both an abstract (latent) and detailed perspective, clarifying the meaning.  This combined approach of augmenting LMs with both document-topic proportions *and* explanatory topics remains unexplored, to the best of our knowledge.

Therefore, our first contribution is a novel Neural Composite Language Modeling (NCLM) framework. This framework integrates both latent document-topic proportions and explanatory topics into LMs, leveraging a NTM and a NLM.  This approach complements the latent representation with topic-specific term distributions, enriching the semantic context available to the language model.

"What's wrong?" I asked, sad to see tears on such a beautiful face.

On January 29th, TechCrunch reported that Facebook was paying teenagers $20 a month in gift cards to participate in its "Research App."  This app granted Facebook system administrator-level access to users' mobile app activity, web browsing, and even encrypted communications.

Facebook later admitted to Congress that it had paid four times as many teenagers for this unlimited surveillance access than it had initially disclosed just weeks prior.

This revelation sparked outrage, leading Apple to ban all Facebook apps from iOS for violating its Enterprise Certificate rules.  Facebook shut down the Research App and told reporters that only 5% of its users were teenagers with signed parental consent forms.

The following day, TechCrunch reported that Google's Screenwise Meter app also violated Apple's Enterprise Certificate rules, resulting in a similar suspension of Google's iOS apps.  Both Facebook and Google's apps were reinstated by Apple later that same day.

Senator Mark R. Warner (D-VA) demanded transparency from CEO Mark Zuckerberg, requesting information on the percentage of 13- to 18-year-olds incentivized with $20 monthly gift cards to install the Facebook Research App and grant root network access to their data.

In a written statement, Facebook's VP of U.S. Public Policy, Kevin Martin, claimed: "At the time we ended the Facebook Research App on Apple’s iOS platform, less than 5 percent of the people sharing data with us through this program were teens."

On February 7th, MIT Technology Review published a scathing article arguing that the Children's Online Privacy Protection Rule (COPPA), designed to prevent children from joining social media without parental permission, was a failure.  The article cited a 2017 joint poll by the National PTA and Facebook, which found that three out of five American parents knew their under-13 children used messaging apps and social media.

Independent tech analysts claimed that some teenagers had received over $1,000 in Visa gift cards for participating in the Facebook Research App. They highlighted the potential for these online gift cards to be used for illicit purposes, such as accessing pornography or purchasing illegal contraband.

As the scandal continued to unfold, Kevin Martin wrote to Senator Warner on February 20th, revising his previous statement about the Research App: "At the time we ended the Facebook Research App on Apple's iOS platform, less than 5 percent of the people sharing data with us through this program were teens. Analysis shows that number is about 18 percent when you look at the complete lifetime of the program, and also add people who had become inactive and uninstalled the app."

Maryam Nawaz, Vice President of the Pakistan Muslim League-N (PML-N), was granted post-arrest bail on Monday by the Lahore High Court (LHC) in the Chaudhry Sugar Mills (CSM) money-laundering case.  The bail was granted on merit, not on humanitarian grounds, according to her counsel, and she is now free to participate in political activities.  The LHC's two-member bench, comprising Justice Ali Baqar Najafi and Justice Sardar Ahmad Naeem, reserved its verdict on October 31st and announced it today.

As a condition of her bail, Maryam Nawaz is required to deposit Rs70 million, the purportedly withdrawn amount, and surrender her passport to the LHC to allay the National Accountability Bureau’s (NAB) concerns about her potentially fleeing the country.  She will be released from jail after furnishing two surety bonds of Rs10 million each to the trial court.

The 24-page written order details the conditions: “We allow this petition and admit the petitioner (Maryam) to get post-arrest bail subject to furnishing of surety bonds in the sum of Rs10 million with two sureties each in the like amount to the satisfaction of the learned trial court, and to establish her bona fide, she would also deposit amount of Rs7 crore with the deputy registrar (judicial) of the court besides submitting her passport(s) with him.”  The court explained this condition, stating, “Since the prosecution (NAB) has shown the bank statement…in which…Rs7 crores were withdrawn, and the prosecution has apprehension of fleeing away of the petitioner; therefore, to satisfy our judicial conscience, we would pass a conditional order.”

Central to the court's decision was the observation that while the NAB’s Suspicious Transaction Report (STR) showed a transfer of funds from the former prime minister’s account to CSM, Maryam Nawaz’s name did not appear.  The court ruled that the withdrawal of Rs7 crore could not be considered ill-gotten gains or assets beyond known sources of income, as the source of the funds was documented in CSM’s official records as foreign investment.

上百位来自中东与非洲的移民，滞留在波士尼亚边境森林的一个营地里。自从克罗埃西亚、匈牙利与斯洛维尼亚拒绝无签证移民入境以来，波士尼亚就面临移民人数激增的难题。随着巴尔干半岛寒冬来临，这些缺乏食物与衣物的移民，暴露在庞大的生存风险之中。

2019年6月，波士尼亚西北部小镇比哈奇（Bihac），将当地露宿街头的移民，安排到距离克罗埃西亚边境约八公里的维亚克（Vucjak）帐篷营区。这个营区的前身竟是一个垃圾掩埋场，不仅缺乏自来水与电力，附近树林更遍布1990年代南斯拉夫内战所留下的未爆地雷。

人道救援组织不断呼吁裁撤维亚克帐篷区，在天气变冷前帮移民找寻更好的安置地点。国际移民组织的西巴尔干专员奥维拉尔特（Peter Van der Auweraert）警告：「可想而知，这里会发生什么事。若人们在这里过冬，会在几周甚至几天内出现死亡案例，因为气温降幅会很明显。」

10月下旬，即使只是雨天，气温就已接近零度。由于红十字会提供的食物不足，移民们发生争吵，甚至需要警方出面制止。许多移民穿著拖鞋走在泥泞中，用冷水冲澡，他们大多数人穿得不够保暖，无法应付日渐下降的气温。他们聚在一起生火，用红十字会给的口粮做成简单的饭，甚至有人宰羊，希望能让大家吃得稍微丰盛一些。

来自阿富汗的尼亚兹（Mohammed Idriz Neeaziv）说：「我在斯洛维尼亚和克罗埃西亚看到的动物房舍，都比这里的要好。这营区不是给人住的。」  许多移民尝试闯越边境到克罗埃西亚，但都一再遭到遣返。有些移民指控克罗埃西亚警察拳脚相向，并砸坏他们的手机，但克罗埃西亚官方否认这些指控。来自巴基斯坦的哈姆札（Hamza）虽然被克罗埃西亚警方送回营地，但他更担心天气恶化，积雪将阻止人们继续穿越边境。

自从2018年以来，已有超过四万名移民进入波士尼亚，其中五分之一是儿童，他们还尝试著再往西欧移动。

Driverless cars, also known as autonomous vehicles, are designed to navigate and operate without human intervention.  They are programmed to perform basic driving functions like accelerating, braking, turning, and reversing. However, the question of liability in the event of an accident remains a significant concern.  Who is at fault: the owner or the manufacturer?  As one article poses, "Who is at fault, the driver or the manufacturer?" This ambiguity could lead to considerable legal disputes.  Should we embrace or reject this technology?

A fundamental limitation of current driverless cars is their reliance on programming for basic driving tasks. While they can execute maneuvers like speeding up, slowing down, stopping, going, turning, and reversing, they lack common sense and the nuanced judgment of a human driver.  For instance, a driverless car might not detect a cat crossing the road, resulting in a tragic accident. A human driver, on the other hand, would likely see the cat and react immediately.  This lack of situational awareness is highlighted in a passage stating that these vehicles "are designed to notify the driver when the road ahead requires human skills." This clearly demonstrates that driverless cars cannot handle all situations and pose a significant accident risk.  The same passage questions the practicality of a driverless car that still requires a driver.

The question of liability in the event of an accident with a driverless car is complex.  As mentioned earlier, determining fault between the manufacturer and the owner is challenging.  If a driverless car fails to respond appropriately in a complex situation, despite being designed to alert the human driver, and an accident occurs, who is responsible?  Such scenarios could lead to disputes between owners and manufacturers, with owners potentially suing manufacturers for product defects.

El Gobierno de Canarias ha decretado nuevas medidas para contener la pandemia en Gran Canaria, Tenerife y Fuerteventura, que entraron en vigor este lunes.  Las tres islas se encuentran en un “nivel 2 reforzado”, lo que implica, entre otras restricciones, un toque de queda desde las diez de la noche hasta las diez de la mañana.

En el ámbito de la restauración, el aforo máximo en espacios públicos o privados se limita a 4 personas, salvo convivientes.  Tanto en terrazas como en el interior, el aforo máximo será del 50%. En la barra se permiten un máximo de dos personas.  En cada mesa, ya sea interior o exterior,  podrán sentarse un máximo de cuatro personas, y los locales deberán cerrar antes de las diez de la noche.

Estas medidas han generado el rechazo del sector, que se queja de ser constantemente el foco de las restricciones, mientras que otras actividades con mayores concentraciones de gente no sufren las mismas limitaciones.

Carlos Bettencourt, presidente de la asociación Zona Triana,  si bien concuerda con la necesidad de combatir la pandemia y evitar la propagación del Coronavirus,  critica que la hostelería sea sistemáticamente restringida.  Bettencourt argumenta que  limitar el comercio y la hostelería frena la economía canaria.  Demanda conocer  cuándo llegarán las ayudas prometidas y qué medidas se implementarán de cara a Semana Santa,  exigiendo que el sector no sea, en sus palabras, "quien pague el pato".

Finalmente, según los últimos datos, Gran Canaria registra 17.817 casos acumulados (+73), con 1.885 casos activos, 212 fallecidos (+1) y 15.720 altas médicas.

Deep learning models excel at many challenging tasks in static environments [9, 38].  However, their performance degrades significantly in dynamically changing environments with sequentially arriving novel tasks, where humans maintain a clear advantage.  Confronted with such sequences, these models suffer from catastrophic forgetting, retaining knowledge primarily of the most recent task. Continual learning aims to address this by enabling models to continuously learn and adapt to new environments, leveraging past knowledge without succumbing to forgetting.

Two prominent continual learning settings are Task-Incremental Learning (TIL) and Class-Incremental Learning (CIL).  TIL provides task identifiers during both training and inference, while CIL offers them only during training.  Current literature explores three primary approaches to continual learning: replay-based, regularization-based, and expansion-based methods.

Replay-based methods [32, 33, 50] demonstrate promising results by storing and replaying a subset of previous task samples. However, this approach raises privacy concerns, increases storage and training costs, and can bias learning towards the current task due to limited replay samples.  Regularization-based methods [1, 4, 15] mitigate catastrophic forgetting by regularizing parameters learned from previous tasks. While they offer a solution, their effectiveness is often sub-optimal and limited to shorter task sequences.  Expansion-based methods [35, 51, 52, 58] hold potential for handling longer task sequences, but efficient expansion and task prediction remain critical bottlenecks. Consequently, most existing models operate within the simpler TIL setting, relying on task identifiers during inference.  Recent advancements [40, 44, 47] introduce efficient expansion-based models, yet they often underutilize previously learned parameters by fine-tuning expansion parameters for each new task. This limits knowledge transfer primarily to the current task, resulting in suboptimal knowledge retention.  Furthermore, these approaches often assume uniform task complexity, leading to uniform parameter growth, which fails to account for the diverse complexity of real-world tasks.  Task prediction in expansion-based approaches also presents a significant challenge, with performance degrading rapidly as the number of tasks increases.

This work introduces a simple, highly efficient filter and channel expansion-based model applicable to any convolutional network.  By fully utilizing previously learned information, our model facilitates superior knowledge transfer.

Si bien "un plátano al día mantiene la salud intestinal bajo control" no es un dicho popular, es una verdad con fundamento, como explicamos a continuación.  Los beneficios de consumir plátanos a diario radican principalmente en su impacto positivo en la salud intestinal, según la nutricionista Heather Hanks.

Hanks explica que los plátanos son uno de los pocos alimentos que contienen fibra prebiótica, "un tipo de fibra que 'alimenta' a las bacterias beneficiosas del intestino".

**Los beneficios del plátano:**

Los beneficios de la fibra prebiótica son numerosos.  Este nutriente "puede ayudar a fortalecer el sistema inmunológico, estabilizar los niveles de azúcar en la sangre y controlar el peso", afirma Hanks.  Además, cita un estudio de 2011 en el que las mujeres que consumían un plátano al día experimentaron una reducción en la hinchazón gastrointestinal. ¡Las bacterias intestinales beneficiosas hacen maravillas!

El mismo estudio indicó que el consumo de plátanos puede ayudar a mujeres sanas a controlar el aumento de peso no deseado.  Por lo tanto, comer plátanos no solo beneficia la salud en general, sino que también contribuye al control del peso.

Rachel Fine, propietaria de To the Point Nutrition, destaca la importancia de una buena salud intestinal. Explica que la fibra de los plátanos "favorece la regularidad digestiva".

Además de promover una digestión regular, los plátanos aportan una "sensación de saciedad" y son ricos en potasio, lo que ayuda a controlar la presión arterial.

Un plátano aporta aproximadamente el 10% de la ingesta diaria recomendada de potasio.  Consumir plátanos a diario contribuye significativamente a asegurar un consumo adecuado de este nutriente.

Drug discovery is a lengthy and costly process, taking an average of 12 years and $1.8 billion to bring a new drug to market (Arrowsmith, 2011; Pammolli et al., 2019).  The central challenge is designing molecules with specific biological activity on a therapeutic target, while also possessing the necessary properties to become a drug.  Scientists employ a combination of experimental and computational methods to identify such compounds (Eckert & Bajorath, 2007; Xu & Hagler, 2002).  To reduce the time and cost, machine learning is increasingly used to guide the discovery process (Chen et al., 2018; Gilmer et al., 2017).  A common application is predicting a compound's activity on a given target based on its structural or physio-chemical properties, a technique known as quantitative structure-activity relationship (QSAR) modeling (Tropsha, 2010). QSAR models can also guide generative algorithms in designing compounds with optimized properties (Bengio et al., 2021; Blaschke et al., 2020; Gao et al., 2022).

**The Low-Data Regime:** Training these models requires data from wet lab experiments, which is scarce and expensive to generate.  Datasets for novel targets are often limited to a few hundred molecules.  This scarcity has led to the exploration of few-shot learning approaches, with meta-learning emerging as a prominent solution (Altae-Tran et al., 2017; Chen et al., 2023; Schimunek et al., 2023).

**Meta-Learning:** Meta-learning methods are pre-trained to "learn to learn" from limited labeled examples (a support set), conditioning their predictions directly on this set (Vinyals et al., 2016).  This approach requires maintaining separate pre-trained models for few-shot and standard classification tasks.  Furthermore, meta-learning algorithms often require specific training procedures mirroring the test-time scenario. This control over the training process can be problematic in black-box settings, where model access is limited to predictions via an API (Ji et al., 2021; Ouali et al., 2023).  Such restrictions hinder the use of meta-learning in drug discovery, where data sensitivity often necessitates black-box models to protect confidential datasets and pre-trained models.

Distributed optimization has gained significant attention in the last decade, driven by the increasing demands of distributed signal processing and massive data processing over peer-to-peer (P2P) networks. This approach involves formulating an optimization problem from data distributed across devices and then iteratively spreading and fusing information across the network until a global solution is reached. Applications range from training machine learning models and target tracking to healthcare monitoring, power grid management, and environmental sensing.

However, distributed optimization, particularly in ad-hoc networks, faces several challenges. These include the lack of infrastructure, limited connectivity, scalability issues, data heterogeneity, data privacy requirements, and heterogeneous computational resources [3], [4].  Various methods have been proposed to address these challenges, depending on the specific application.  For example, pairwise gossip methods [5], [6] enable asynchronous message exchange, while others combine gossip with geographic routing [7].  Broadcast-based methods [8] aim to conserve communication energy.  Alternative approaches include belief propagation/message passing [9], [10] and signal processing on graphs [11], [12], [13].  Distributed optimization over directed graphs has also been explored [14]. Federated learning [15], [16], a specialized form of distributed optimization, focuses on collaborative model training over centralized server-client networks.

This work focuses on distributed signal processing through its connection with convex optimization, leveraging the fact that many classical signal processing problems can be reformulated in a convex form [17]. We model the problem as a convex optimization problem and utilize standard solvers such as dual ascent, the method of multipliers, ADMM [2], and PDMM [18], [19].  While ADMM and PDMM appear different due to their derivations, they are closely related [19].  PDMM's derivation, however, naturally leads to a distributed implementation without requiring direct collaboration between nodes during updates. Therefore, we adopt the PDMM approach to derive update rules for distributed optimization with linear equality and inequality constraints.

PDMM was initially developed for solving separable convex optimization problems: minimize  ∑_(i∈V) f_i(x_i) subject to constraints, in a synchronous setting over a P2P network represented by an undirected graph G = (V, E).  Recent research [20] demonstrates that PDMM can also be implemented asynchronously and is resilient to transmission losses.  Its application to federated learning over centralized networks [21] reveals close relationships with SCAFFOLD [16] and FedSplit [22].

Venus, our sometimes-nearest planetary neighbor, presents a compelling case study despite its undeniably hostile environment.  While the author isn't exaggerating the dangers involved in studying this planet, the potential rewards merit serious consideration.

Venus boasts a hellish landscape.  Its surface temperature scorches at a staggering 800 degrees Fahrenheit, the hottest in our solar system.  An atmosphere composed of 97% carbon dioxide crushes down with a pressure 90 times greater than Earth's.  Add to this the floating clouds of corrosive sulfuric acid, and it becomes clear why no spacecraft has survived on the surface for more than a few hours.  This unforgiving environment is further punctuated by erupting volcanoes, powerful earthquakes, and frequent lightning strikes.  It's no wonder no human has ever attempted a landing.

However, beneath this hostile exterior lies a fascinating history.  Scientists believe Venus once possessed oceans and may have even supported life.  Its surface, though ravaged, still retains diverse geological features, including valleys, mountains, and craters.  These remnants of a potentially habitable past fuel scientific curiosity and drive the desire to understand Venus's evolution.

The Annual Culling loomed, a mere nineteen days away. Clyde Castillo knew the rules: rise to the top of the Crime list or be culled, executed in the night alongside every other registered criminal who failed to make the cut.  The Culling ensured only the best criminals survived, those destined to become Hunters, tasked with eliminating their lesser counterparts to maintain their precarious position on the Most Wanted list.

Clyde wasn’t supposed to be here. His first theft, a few weeks prior, was driven by desperation, a need for food in a world where sustenance was harder to come by than the jewels and electronics that littered the malls of the Sector’s wealthy elite.  He knew that life, the life of the Zones and Wards, the life of the middle class and the poor. He’d lived it for far too long.  But now, stealing was his only path to survival.

He threw the bag of loot, his latest haul, into the stolen car. Each robbery brought him closer to his goal, closer to the top, and closer to the attention of the Hunters.  He knew the risks. He knew they were watching.  He just hoped he could climb high enough, fast enough. He was smart, a veteran of the Canton's wars. He deserved to live in their world, even if the price was becoming a Hunter, even if it meant murdering others like him.

Gun still raised, Clyde scanned the parking lot, alert for any sign of surveillance. Hunters were equipped with the Canton's finest weaponry and supplies, resources he desperately needed, resources he could only acquire through robbery.  He slid into the driver's seat and slammed the door shut.

"Castillo!"

The shout froze him.  Gun drawn, he swung around to face the voice.

"Don't shoot!"  A young woman stood before him, hands raised, a semi-automatic rifle held loosely in her left hand.  Her clothes were tattered, a C-2 burned onto her leather corset.  She smirked. "You're rising pretty quickly, you know that?"

C-2. Faye Baker. The second-best Hunter in the entire Canton.

"Aye, you know your criminals."  Faye stepped closer, her weapon lowered, unnervingly casual. "Who's number one?"

"*Maven*. Sammy Hicks." Clyde answered, his gun still trained on her.

"What are you at?"

Clyde glanced at the registry chip embedded in his arm.  The neon display listed the Top 5 Criminals, his own rank flashing below: 36th.  "Thirty-sixth."

"Nineteen days til the Cull. Think you can make it?"

"I have to try."

"Aye, I guess we all do.” Faye lowered her rifle, holding it in both hands. “You show promise.  Smart hacker, knows what stores to hit, *doesn’t kill*."

"I've killed enough for the Canton."

"Haven't we all."  Her smile didn’t reach her eyes. "I want the number one spot."

Unease coiled in Clyde's gut. Was this a trap? "And how does that help me?"

"You're going to help me get there. In return," she grinned, producing a .500 Smith & Wesson, the Hunter's sidearm of choice, "weapons. Supplies. Some semblance of safety. You'll stay as number two."

"Maven's getting old," Faye continued. "It's time his reign ended."

Clyde knew he couldn't trust her, but who could he trust in this world? He needed the help. He needed to survive.  He smirked. "Okay Faye, I'm in."

"Let the hunt begin then."  Faye's smirk mirrored his own.

Autonomous vehicles promise a significant revolution in the automotive industry, offering enhanced safety, increased convenience, and potentially greater fuel efficiency.

One of the most compelling arguments for autonomous vehicles is their potential to dramatically improve road safety.  While initial implementation will undoubtedly present challenges in sensor technology and accident prevention algorithms, continuous development and refinement should lead to highly sophisticated systems capable of minimizing, and ideally eliminating, accidents. As sensor technology advances, drawing on existing systems like anti-lock brakes and stability control, which utilize wheel speed sensors to mitigate skids and rollovers, autonomous vehicles will be able to react faster and more effectively than human drivers. The text highlights this progression, noting how sensor technology in the 1980s evolved to enable sophisticated vehicle control beyond human capability.  This continued advancement in sensors, computer hardware, and software suggests a future where autonomous vehicles achieve unparalleled safety.

Convenience is another key advantage.  Human drivers must remain attentive and are often forced to drive while fatigued or seek alternative transportation if injured or otherwise incapacitated. Autonomous vehicles offer a solution, allowing passengers to travel safely regardless of their physical or mental state.  While some argue that drivers of autonomous vehicles must still remain vigilant, widespread adoption of the technology will ultimately lead to fully autonomous systems. In a future where all vehicles are computer-controlled, complex traffic scenarios, such as merging from a parking lot, will be seamlessly managed through inter-vehicle communication and coordination.

Furthermore, autonomous vehicles have the potential for improved fuel efficiency.  Human driving habits, such as rapid acceleration, often waste fuel.  Computer-controlled vehicles can optimize acceleration and coasting for maximum fuel economy. The text supports this, citing the potential for autonomous vehicles to consume half the fuel of current taxis.  This translates into significant cost savings for owners.

In conclusion, autonomous vehicles represent a transformative technology poised to reshape the automotive landscape. Their potential to enhance safety, maximize convenience, and improve fuel efficiency makes them a compelling innovation for the future of transportation.

Ce projet, visant à mettre en valeur le talent d’un photographe amateur sur un thème lié à Douarnenez, présente le travail de Michel Babkine. Technology pervades modern life, from complex diagnostic machines to simple computers and cameras.  These tools enhance our daily activities, and one particularly promising innovation is emotion-detecting software.  This technology holds significant potential for classroom settings, benefiting students, teachers, and even parents.

One key advantage of emotion recognition software is its ability to provide real-time feedback on student engagement and comprehension.  As Nick D'Alto highlights in "Making Mona Lisa Smile," Dr. Huang suggests that "A classroom computer could recognize when a student is becoming confused or bored." This allows teachers to adjust their lessons dynamically, ensuring that the material is both understandable and engaging. By recognizing confusion or boredom, teachers can provide additional support or adapt their teaching style to better suit the students' needs. This responsiveness benefits both teachers, who can tailor their instruction, and students, who receive more effective and personalized learning experiences.

Beyond immediate lesson adjustments, emotion recognition technology can also reveal broader emotional trends.  Consistent monitoring can alert teachers to significant shifts in a student's emotional state.  A typically happy student who suddenly exhibits prolonged sadness could be experiencing difficulties at home or school, prompting a teacher to check in and offer support.  This early intervention can be crucial in addressing issues like bullying or other problems that might otherwise go unnoticed.  Furthermore, parents can gain valuable insights into their child's emotional well-being at school, allowing them to assess whether the learning environment is a good fit.

By analyzing emotional data, educators can gain a deeper understanding of student personalities and learning styles. This information can inform lesson planning, curriculum development, and even classroom management strategies. The ability to identify and address emotional needs proactively contributes to a more supportive and positive learning environment.

While privacy concerns regarding the use of emotion-scanning technology are understandable, the potential benefits for student well-being and academic success are substantial.  This technology offers a powerful tool for creating a safer and more effective learning experience, ultimately benefiting everyone involved. Therefore, integrating emotion-detecting apps into classrooms holds immense value for enhancing the educational experience.

A las 14:20 horas, el director de Protección Civil Municipal de Madero informó del hallazgo del cuerpo en una zona de difícil acceso de la Playa Dunas Doradas de Altamira, tras los rondines de vigilancia realizados por personal de la Marina.  El joven, identificado como Javier Eduardo “N” de 17 años, había desaparecido la tarde anterior en Playa Miramar, frente al Fraccionamiento Velamar, mientras se encontraba en compañía de amigos. Familiares, amigos y autoridades lo buscaron intensamente.

Según los informes, Javier Eduardo "N" fue visto por última vez alrededor de las 19:20 horas del martes.  Existían versiones contradictorias entre sus acompañantes sobre si había entrado al mar. Ante su desaparición, al caer la noche, se solicitó el apoyo de las autoridades, presentándose en el lugar personal de la Marina, la Guardia Nacional y Protección Civil.  Familiares del joven también se unieron a la búsqueda durante toda la noche.

La mañana del miércoles, las autoridades reanudaron las labores de búsqueda. El director Martínez Flores mencionó las contradicciones en las declaraciones de los amigos del fallecido, lo que dificultaba esclarecer las circunstancias de la desaparición.

Tras el hallazgo del cuerpo sin vida, se notificó a las autoridades competentes, quienes se trasladaron al lugar con vehículos todoterreno para realizar el levantamiento del cadáver y su posterior traslado al anfiteatro local.

KINGSLEY, MI – The Humane Society of the United States (HSUS) is offering a $5,000 reward, double its standard offering, for information leading to the arrest and conviction of those responsible for the shooting and neglect of a two-year-old pit bull in Northern Michigan.

The dog, named Phoenix by rescuers, was discovered by a hunter near Kingsley in Grand Traverse County on November 25.  He was suffering from a gunshot wound to the back of the neck, multiple wounds covering his face and body, and severe malnourishment.  After five days of intensive care by Grand Traverse County Animal Control and Cherryland Humane Society, Phoenix died on November 30. He had stabilized but began having seizures, likely resulting from brain injuries related to the gunshot wound, which ultimately led to his death.

“Phoenix did not deserve to suffer – likely afraid and in pain – from a gunshot wound and malnourishment,” said Molly Tamulevich, Michigan state director for HSUS. “It takes a truly callous person to leave an injured dog to die. We hope this reward will encourage anyone with information about this terrible crime to come forward.”

HSUS’ animal cruelty campaign aims to raise awareness about the link between animal cruelty and human violence. Studies show a correlation between animal cruelty and other crimes, including narcotics, firearms offenses, and sexual assault.  The campaign also provides resources and support to law enforcement, social workers, educators, legislators, and families, while working to strengthen laws against animal cruelty.  “Securing the serious attention and engagement of law enforcement officials, prosecutors and residents in cases involving allegations of cruelty to animals is an essential step in protecting the whole community,” an HSUS release stated.

En janvier 2016, Ricky Tenzer a acheté un téléphone cellulaire Nexus 6P, codéveloppé par Google et Huawei. Ce modèle était le dernier de la gamme Nexus, lancée en 2010 et conçue en collaboration avec différents constructeurs externes, avant d'être remplacée par la gamme Pixel, entièrement développée par Google.  Dès juin 2017, M. Tenzer affirme que son appareil a commencé à présenter des problèmes de déchargement prématuré de la batterie.  Contactant le service client de Huawei, il apprend qu'une batterie de remplacement lui coûterait 230 $.

Face à ce problème, et alléguant un vice de fabrication affectant la durée de vie de la batterie, M. Tenzer a déposé une demande d'action collective le 21 mars 2018.  Il souhaite représenter tous les propriétaires québécois de Nexus 6P ayant rencontré des problèmes similaires. Plus précisément, la poursuite allègue qu'après quelques mois d'utilisation, les téléphones s'éteignent malgré un niveau de batterie affiché entre 30 % et 40 %.  Le téléphone ne redémarre que branché à un chargeur, affichant alors le même pourcentage de batterie qu'avant l'extinction, puis se décharge rapidement une fois débranché.

L'action collective réclame une réduction du prix de vente, le remboursement des frais de réparation ou de remplacement de la batterie, et 100 $ de dommages punitifs par personne affectée.  Initialement, le juge Gary Morrison de la Cour supérieure avait rejeté la demande d'action collective en mai 2019.  Cependant, la Cour d'appel du Québec a infirmé cette décision lundi dernier, autorisant ainsi la poursuite à aller de l'avant.  La Cour d'appel a jugé que M. Tenzer avait démontré une cause défendable et sa capacité à représenter adéquatement le groupe.

Le juge qui présidera le procès devra déterminer si la batterie présente un « déficit d'usage sérieux » et si elle viole la garantie de qualité prévue au Code civil du Québec.  Aucune allégation n'a encore été prouvée.  Notons qu'une action collective similaire a été intentée aux États-Unis l'an dernier, aboutissant à un règlement à l'amiable. Les plaignants américains ont reçu entre 10 $ et 400 $ américains en dommages punitifs.

SEOUL, Aug 21 (Reuters) - South Korea's producer prices index (PPI) fell 0.3% in July from a year earlier, marking its first annual decline since October 2016 and the fastest drop since a 1.1% fall in September 2016, central bank data showed on Wednesday.  This drop, following a 0.1% gain in June, underlines lower inflationary pressures and supports further policy easing.

行政长官林郑月娥近日接受多家报章专访，畅谈深港融合发展及多项经济政策。她表示，期望在四个政策范畴上争取中央支持，其中包括落实“港车北上”，让香港私家车无需申请两地车牌即可进入珠海。此外，鉴于香港国际机场第三条跑道将于2022年率先启用，并于2024年全面竣工，她也希望争取中央支持，协助香港航空业复苏。林郑月娥认为，深港融合发展不会导致“两制”模糊，并批评香港近年出现一股“对着干”的风气，过分排斥内地和内地人士，但她相信可以通过宣传教育加以改善。

关于深港科技创新合作区，林郑月娥表示，国家主席习近平早前在深圳经济特区成立40周年庆祝大会上发表重要讲话，提到要促进内地与港澳融合发展、相互促进，把握粤港澳大湾区建设的重大机遇，并充分利用重大合作平台，吸引更多港澳青年来内地学习、就业、生活。她理解“一体化”是指在“一国两制”框架下，深港融合发展，并非香港融入国家发展大局或粤港澳大湾区建设就会令“两制”模糊。她强调，“正因为有港澳两个特别行政区，更应该发挥好‘一国两制’的特色，这正是习近平主席多次提到的，希望粤港澳大湾区可以丰富‘一国两制’的实践。”

以创科为例，林郑月娥认为香港的大学科研实力雄厚，而深圳则拥有先进的制造业，可以将香港的科研成果转化为产品，并推向市场。加上深圳的融资渠道畅通，科研成果可以 readily 在香港上市。

The Internet of Things (IoT) is a dynamic environment where physical objects communicate and interact, exchanging and processing information [1].  It bridges the physical and digital worlds [2].  IoT applications, such as Industrial IoT, smart healthcare, and smart cities, minimize user involvement through automated tasks.  Consequently, IoT interactions primarily occur between devices like sensors and actuators [3].

Authentication is crucial for securing electronic systems. Without reliable authentication, security services like access control and intrusion detection are compromised.  While numerous authentication solutions exist for IoT environments, they predominantly offer single-level protection.  Existing multi-level authentication solutions typically focus on user authentication [28].  To address this limitation, we previously proposed the M2I (Multi-Factor, Multi-Level, and Interaction-based Authentication) framework for IoT environments [29]. This paper extends the M2I framework to address multi-device-to-device authentication scenarios.

The remainder of this paper is structured as follows: Section II reviews related work. Section III outlines the high-level design and evaluation principles of the Many-to-One (M2O) hybrid protocols. Section IV introduces the design preliminaries and building blocks. Section V details the protocols themselves.  Sections VI and VII analyze and evaluate the protocols through experimentation, respectively. Section VIII compares the communication and computational costs of the proposed protocols with Kerberos version 5 to assess their efficiency.  Section IX provides further discussion, and Section X concludes the paper.

Winning the lottery itself never appealed to me. I never understood the millions who spent their money on such a seemingly futile pursuit.  However, I'm grateful for these unwitting masses who fuel my addiction. It wasn't the money, that useless relic of a bygone era, that intrigued me; it was the aftermath. The moment the final number confirmed what I already knew—that's when the desire would take hold.

Desire, that untamable force, always beckoning, always ensnaring me with its deceptive allure.  It was desire that drew me back into the past, the desire to continually devise new ways to slip through time and continue the game of cat and mouse I so relish.

"Today's the day they finally catch me," I murmured, patiently waiting for the numbers to ignite my addiction. "The day I'm finally outsmarted."  A habitual mantra before every game. It hasn't happened yet, but one day, when I'm truly lucky…

Two minutes. Time for the final preparations. My phone… check. My wallet, containing my oh-so-lucky ticket… check.  The ritual, repeated countless times, required nothing more. It had become second nature, a calming practice before the storm.

Five, four, three…  Each second stretched into an eternity.  I was so close to the gratification I craved, the release of all that pent-up anticipation. Perhaps this is what it feels like for those who actually yearn to win, those who so graciously fund my obsession. Thank you for that false hope.

"And tonight's lucky numbers are… 14, 29, 2, 11, 19, 31, and 17!" the television announced.  Without glancing at my ticket, I knew I'd won. I sat patiently, not daring to move, savoring these precious seconds.  These were the moments I craved.  I wondered how long it would take them to find me this time.  Hopefully, it wouldn't…

Knock, knock.  The rap at the door shattered my thoughts. The game was about to begin.

Harold sat alone at the counter of the small-town diner, staring into his coffee cup, a daily ritual.  He hated getting old. His body ached, his movements were slow, and the world seemed to be passing him by.  At an age when others boasted about fifty being the new thirty, Harold felt every one of his years. His back was shot, his knees ached, and the pain was a constant companion, managed only by pills and alcohol.  He’d lived hard, abusing his body, his relationships – two ex-wives, estranged children – even his so-called friends were just the same high school buddies stuck in this dying town.  He figured he was on borrowed time, just like his father and grandfathers before him.

Donna, the waitress, poured his coffee, long ago giving up on small talk. Harold rarely responded, often not even bothering to wear his hearing aids. He’d always felt people talked just to hear themselves anyway, so the fading of his hearing was almost a blessing. The worsening vision, however, was a different story, a constant source of frustration.  He gulped the scalding coffee, finding a perverse comfort in the burn, a tangible sensation in a world of fading senses.

He gestured for a refill.  Donna poured, but her attention was suddenly diverted.  Hot coffee sloshed over Harold's lap. He lurched up, his back seizing in agony. "Goddamit, Donna, what the f-"

He turned to follow her gaze just as the tanker truck smashed through the diner's front window.  Chaos erupted. A flying napkin holder struck his forehead, and he crumpled to the floor by Donna’s feet. He dimly registered the sickening angle of her neck before the frigid, burning liquid from the tanker washed over him. His last conscious thought was of Bo, the dog he’d had as a boy, hit by a car.  Donna's neck and Bo’s… they looked so similar. Then, blackness.

Time became a blur.  Voices drifted in and out.  He thought he heard his daughter, which was strange – she hated him. The words “coma,” “crash,” and “unlikely recovery” floated by, meaningless yet strangely comforting. He was focused on the sounds, realizing he could hear them with a clarity he hadn’t experienced in years, even without his hearing aids.  He felt thirsty.  He remembered how to talk.

After an indeterminate amount of time, he croaked, "Wa…… ter?"

Sudden commotion. Lights. Anxious voices. His bed shook.  He opened his eyes to a flurry of masked doctors.

“Mr. Burke? Can you hear me? Blink if you can understand.”

He blinked, surprised he’d obeyed. They spoke of the accident, the exposure to something… bad.  They urged him to relax.

Confusion turned to annoyance. He sat up, ignoring the hands trying to restrain him. "Let go of me, dammit!"

He swung his legs to the floor, astonished. His hip didn't hurt. He stood, shifting his weight, taller than he’d been in years.  He reached for his glasses, his finger poking his nose instead.  He saw everything with crystal clarity. He swatted at the doctors, horrified as they flew across the room.

"My god, what have you people done to me?" He strode to the locked door, pressing it. It flew open as if struck by a battering ram. In his hospital gown, he walked to a first-floor window, climbed out, and strode away.

The world was a symphony of sensations: the grass growing beneath his feet, the whisper of blood in pigeons' veins.  He was overwhelmed, barely noticing the guards encircling him. A woman in a business suit pushed through.

"Mr. Burke, I'm Carole. Please come back to the hospital. You're very sick."

"I'm not sick," Harold said, looking at her. "I haven't felt this good in my life. I can see, I can hear… and you saw that door! I don't know what happened, but I'm not wasting it on you."

A tingling sensation spread through him. He looked at his hands, smooth and firm. He was floating above the ground. He drifted towards Carole.

"You don't understand. I've been given a chance... to do something... big."

The tingling surged into blinding energy.

The widespread popularity of cars in modern society is undeniable. They are a primary mode of transportation, and for many, driving offers a sense of enjoyment. However, this popularity comes at a cost: a consistent occurrence of accidents. Whether due to driver error or collisions, the frequency of accidents raises serious concerns about the prospect of driverless cars.  With so many accidents already occurring with human drivers, entrusting control to a computer system seems premature and potentially dangerous.  It's reasonable to anticipate a rise in accident rates, not an increase in safety.

One of the major hurdles for driverless cars lies not just in developing the technology for the vehicles themselves, but also in adapting our infrastructure.  As some futurists have pointed out, the key to autonomous vehicles may lie less in smarter cars and more in smarter roads.  This would involve significant infrastructural changes, such as embedding electrical cables for signaling, magnets for alternating polarity, and binary code systems in roadways. While such technology is not beyond our capabilities, the associated costs are substantial.  Without addressing these financial implications, the development of "smarter roads," and consequently, driverless cars, remains improbable.

While driverless cars technically exist today, their reliability is far from guaranteed.  Current models may handle driving functions at low speeds (up to 25 mph), but often require driver oversight through touch sensors on the steering wheel. This places a significant burden of responsibility on the driver, demanding constant attention to the road and surroundings.  The lack of full autonomy necessitates driver vigilance, negating the purported safety benefits.  While manufacturers have incorporated warning signals to alert drivers to potential hazards, human fallibility remains a factor.  Missed signals can lead to accidents, ultimately placing the responsibility for safety back on the human occupant.

The introduction of driverless cars also presents complex legal and ethical questions regarding liability. In the event of an accident, determining fault becomes a significant challenge.  Is the manufacturer responsible for ensuring flawless operation of their technology?

The question of life on Mars, particularly regarding the "face" of Cydonia, has sparked much speculation.  While some see it as evidence of alien civilization, I believe it's a natural formation.  It's difficult to imagine an alien species sculpting such a likeness without prior exposure to humans.  However, the intrigue surrounding this formation has undoubtedly fueled public interest in Mars, appearing in films, books, magazines, and radio shows.

This fascination drives scientific inquiry. My colleagues are committed to capturing higher-resolution images of Cydonia and other Martian features, hoping to identify potential signs of artificial construction.  However, Martian conditions, such as winter dust storms and cloud cover, present significant challenges to observation. The improvement in image resolution from 1976 to 2001 is substantial.  The 2001 images, with a resolution of 1.56 meters per pixel compared to the 1976 resolution of 43 meters per pixel, should reveal objects three times larger than the pixel size.  Theoretically, structures like buildings, vehicles, or even bodies of water should be visible.  Perhaps the "face" is an attempt at extraterrestrial communication, a message waiting to be deciphered with improved imaging technology.

On Earth, many natural formations resemble familiar objects. It's plausible that the Martian "face" is a similar phenomenon, albeit unusual on a supposedly lifeless planet.  Ultimately, it's up to scientists to determine the truth. While public opinion varies, only scientific investigation can provide definitive answers, whether today, tomorrow, or years from now. I'm optimistic that with current and future technologies, we'll eventually unravel this Martian mystery.

The existence of aliens remains unproven.  It seems unlikely they would have remained undetected, particularly if they possessed advanced technology like spacecraft.  The discovery of extraterrestrial life would undoubtedly cause widespread shock and fear, a scenario many anticipate and even prepare for.

Just as we on Earth might investigate a peculiar rock formation on another planet, aliens might react similarly to Cydonia, prompting further exploration.  However, a human mission to Mars carries significant risks.  A hypothetical encounter with potentially hostile and superior alien life could be disastrous.  Robotic exploration, while having limitations in terms of adaptability and exploration of complex environments like caves, offers a safer initial approach.  Drones could survey the planet, paving the way for eventual human exploration, while mitigating the risks of a first contact scenario.

Benoît Minville, libraire à la Fnac de la Défense et auteur de polar, SF et romans pour adolescents, vient de publier *Générations*, le second tome et la conclusion de son thriller fantastique *Héros* (Sarbacane éditions). Leur tentative de créer une série dérivée dans un bâtiment abandonné les confronte à d’étranges phénomènes qui mettent à l’épreuve leur amitié.

Enrique Iglesias, con uno de sus mellizos, anima a España en un partido del Mundial contra Portugal.

El cantante, hijo de Julio Iglesias e Isabel Preysler, afirma que "la madre es la verdadera superheroína", en referencia a su pareja, Anna Kournikova.

Enrique Iglesias y Anna Kournikova mantuvieron su embarazo en la más estricta privacidad. Sin embargo, la llegada de sus mellizos, Lucy y Nicolas, de seis meses, les ha ablandado, y ahora comparten con mayor frecuencia imágenes familiares y detalles sobre su nueva vida.

Recientemente, el cantante ha hablado sobre la paternidad en unas declaraciones a la emisora KTUphoria.  Ante la pregunta recurrente de cómo se organiza con dos bebés a la vez, Iglesias cede todo el protagonismo a Anna Kournikova: “Suelo responder: ‘No me preguntes. La madre es la verdadera superheroína’.  Como mi primera experiencia ha sido con gemelos, no sé la diferencia entre tener uno o dos”, comentó el intérprete con humor.

Volcado en su nuevo rol, Enrique Iglesias tiene claro que su prioridad es ser un buen padre: "Lo primero y más importante para mí es educarles adecuadamente.  Solo quiero que sean buenos niños, que estén sanos y que disfruten de la vida". Estas declaraciones sobre su paternidad coincidieron con la celebración del Día del Padre en Estados Unidos.  El artista es consciente de las exigencias de su profesión, que implican viajes y separaciones de sus hijos, pero disfruta enormemente de esta nueva etapa que comenzó en diciembre, cuando la pareja anunció por sorpresa el nacimiento de los mellizos.

Sobre Anna Kournikova, con quien mantiene una relación desde hace 17 años, tras conocerse durante el rodaje del videoclip "Escape" en 2001, afirma que, a pesar de ser figuras públicas, tienen una relación normal. “Las relaciones son complejas, seas o no famoso”, declaró el cantante. “Hay días buenos y días malos.  Cuando son malos, tratas de superarlos, y cuando llegan los buenos, ves lo increíble que es”. Estas fluctuaciones, comunes en cualquier pareja, no empañan sus sentimientos por Kournikova: “Anna es la mejor.  Sabe que amo mi trabajo, me apoya siempre y está detrás de todo lo que hago”.

En sus últimas publicaciones en redes sociales, ambos expresan abiertamente la felicidad que les embarga.  El fútbol ha sido, durante el último mes, el pretexto perfecto para mostrar su alegría familiar. A principios de mayo, Iglesias publicó una imagen con uno de sus hijos, sin especificar cuál, junto al mensaje: “Todavía no puedo creer que seas mío”.  Anteriormente, había compartido una fotografía donde se le veía junto a sus mellizos, los tres de espaldas, viendo el partido del Real Madrid contra el Bayern de Múnich en la Liga de Campeones. Durante el Mundial, tanto él como Anna Kournikova han compartido imágenes con alguno de sus hijos –aún difíciles de distinguir– apoyando a la selección rusa, cuando acompañan a su madre, y a la española, cuando aparecen con su padre.

Gasping for breath, I absorbed his words. A drop of blood trickled from a gash on my forehead, obscuring my vision. I angrily swiped it away, uncaring about the crimson smear it left. Only the fight mattered.

"Well?"

He stood opposite me, the clangor of battle receding as a ring of space cleared around us.  The intensity of our duel drew a grudging respect, even from those locked in their own desperate struggles. Soldiers understood. They recognized skill and prowess far beyond their own, even amidst the chaos of survival.

"What?"  The single word was a struggle. The day-long battle had taken its toll. I was exhausted.

"Look at them, Solan," my opponent gestured to the surrounding soldiers. "They don't know why they're here. They think they fight for king, country, or family. Impure reasons.  Their battle is impure because of it."

He sheathed his sword with a smooth, practiced motion.

"It's different with us. There's a reason they call you 'Berserker,' General."

"Put up your sword," I gritted through clenched teeth. "Our fight isn't over."

"Yes, it is."  He spread his arms wide, a gesture of vulnerability. "I felt it from you, and you felt it from me. The purity. We are cut from the same cloth, Solan. We fight not for duty or allegiance, but because we can. Because it's in our nature.  This battlefield is unworthy of us. Unworthy of our talents."

My grip tightened on my sword. I yearned to strike, to end this war.  Everyone knew this man, their warleader, was the tactical genius orchestrating the conflict.  Killing him would cripple their efforts.

But… he was right. There had been something… transcendent… when our blades clashed. A purity I had never experienced in battle and knew I would never find again.  I craved it.

"Alright, talk," I said curtly, sheathing my own sword.

"Warriors of our caliber deserve a fitting stage to showcase our skills, our pure ideals. This war?" He swept his hand across the battlefield. "This is beneath us. Unfulfilling. Let's create something better."

I resisted the truth, but it resonated within me. A clear, fierce energy surged through my veins, something I thought long lost.  I had found my equal.  I knew I would never rest until I proved, once and for all, who was superior.

Dear Jonathan, praised be Your name.

I know you don't like it when people pray outside of Your business hours. I'd also be annoyed if thousands of voices appeared at random times in my head, demanding this and asking for that.  But now, since I'm your last follower, I have to make an exception. We need to talk.

I appreciate you, Jonathan, and all the wonders you do for me.  I really do. But it's too much. It's not you, it's me.

The neighbors are getting angry about all the burning bushes. They don't appreciate them spontaneously combusting every time I walk by. And when I was on vacation at the Mediterranean, splitting the sea was a nice thought, but I just wanted a normal swim.  Everyone on the beach got upset.  Even the mailman is suffering. I appreciate the weekly updated commandments, but his back is giving out from delivering all those stone tablets. The pile in my backyard is getting dangerously high.

I'm sorry, Jonathan. As I said, it's not you. I just don't think I'm the right follower for you anymore.  I think your wonders would be better appreciated by others. People in cold climates could really use those burning bushes. A stonemason would love an endless supply of tablets and could even recycle the old ones.  Imagine how helpful splitting the sea would be for those laying undersea cables!

I'm sure you'll find someone new who will be a better fit. I just don't see a future for us.

I need a break, Jonathan. I need some space.

But we can remain friends, if you like.

Amen.

## Le Barça retrouve le sourire grâce à un Fati étincelant et un Messi apaisé

Un doublé d'Ansu Fati et un penalty transformé par Lionel Messi ont permis au FC Barcelone de s'imposer largement 4-0 face à Villarreal au Camp Nou, le 27 septembre 2020. Cette victoire éclatante, lors de la troisième journée de Liga,  souffle un vent d'optimisme sur un club catalan en crise tout l'été.

Après un été mouvementé marqué par le feuilleton Messi, le départ de cadres importants et une motion de censure contre la direction, la pression était immense sur les épaules des Blaugrana.  C'est pourtant un jeune joueur de 17 ans, Ansu Fati, qui a libéré le Camp Nou. Auteur d'un doublé express (15e, 19e), l'international espagnol a multiplié les appels et les percées,  faisant oublier le départ de Luis Suarez, pourtant auteur d'un doublé le même jour avec l'Atlético Madrid (victoire 6-1 contre Grenade).  Fati a également provoqué le penalty transformé par Messi (35e),  un symbole fort de la transmission entre la légende et l'avenir du club. Un but contre son camp de Pau Torres juste avant la mi-temps (45e) a scellé la victoire barcelonaise.

Nearly a year ago, counties across Western North Carolina (WNC) received almost $10 million in state grant funding to improve rural broadband connectivity. This funding has become even more critical due to the COVID-19 pandemic, which forced a shift to at-home distance learning and encouraged businesses to allow employees to work remotely.

In May 2019, North Carolina launched the Growing Rural Economies with Access to Technology (GREAT) grant. According to Governor Roy Cooper and the NC Department of Information Technology, these matching grants targeted "Internet service providers and electric membership cooperatives that compete for funding to lower financial barriers that prevent high-speed internet service expansion in Tier 1 – economically distressed counties."  The program, initiated by the N.C. General Assembly in 2018, subsidizes internet providers and electric cooperatives partnering with unserved and underserved rural communities statewide.

“Access to reliable, high-speed internet service is critical for businesses to grow, students to learn, and communities to thrive,” Governor Cooper stated when announcing the funding. “These grants will help connect thousands of homes and businesses with opportunities across the state and around the world.”

The grants aided 14 companies, including Morris Broadband, which serves Macon County. These funds will improve broadband access for approximately 10,000 households and nearly 600 businesses and community institutions.

In Macon County, the Morris Broadband expansion aims to provide internet access to 226 homes in various outlying areas, including Gibson Cove Road, Granny Kate Lane, Stoudemire Drive, Schurman Cove Road, Annes Lane, Gibson Cove Estates Road, Willow Wind Heights, Willowbrook Estates, Bryson City Road, Iotla Church Road, Quail Hollow Road, Riverbend Road, Liner Drive, Iotla Hill Drive, Olsen Drive, Bennett Road, Sanderstown Road, Rain Ridge Road, Red Fox Lane, Buster Cabe Road, Tranquil Road, Holbrooks Road, Piney Grove Road, Lee Bates Road, Kangas Drive, Country Walk, Circle Trace, Dillon Drive, Main Trace, Center Trace, East Trace, Southern Trace, Dowdle Mountain Road, Wells Grove Road, Jennings Drive, Angel Cove Road, Chapel Cove Circle, Brookshire Lane, Oakridge Drive, and Hunters Trail. This project is estimated at $667,000, comprising $433,550 in state grant money and a $233,450 investment from Morris.  Currently, Morris Broadband provides internet services to just under 3,500 residences in Macon County.

“The construction process began in the last quarter of 2019,” explained Morris Broadband General Manager Tony Carter. “This involved engineering design, pole permits and replacements, and other make-ready preparations.  These have all been filed, and we are just awaiting a few more responses and replacements before we can begin construction.”

Carter stated that the company is now shifting its focus to the physical construction of the expansion project, anticipating a start date sometime in April.

Ciudad de México, 28 de marzo. – Ante la eventual llegada a México de la caravana migrante, proveniente de Honduras y con aproximadamente 20 mil centroamericanos, el gobierno mexicano implementará una serie de medidas para contener su avance hacia Estados Unidos.

Tras reunirse el martes por la noche con la entonces secretaria de Seguridad Nacional de Estados Unidos, Kirstjen Nielsen, la secretaria de Gobernación, Olga Sánchez Cordero, anunció que se prevé permitir el avance de la caravana solo hasta el Istmo de Tehuantepec.  Ahí se establecerán instalaciones migratorias, con presencia de la Policía Federal y Protección Civil, para impedir su paso hacia la frontera norte, la cual, reconoció, se encuentra al borde del colapso.

Asimismo, advirtió que se reforzarán los operativos de seguridad con elementos federales en los puntos más vulnerables de los 1,200 kilómetros de frontera con Guatemala, incluyendo los 12 cruces legales y los 370 pasos ilegales identificados.

“No vamos a militarizar nuestra frontera sur, quiero dejarlo claro, y así se lo expresé a la señora Nielsen; tampoco seguiremos otorgando visas humanitarias de forma masiva.  Otorgaremos permisos temporales de visitante y de trabajo en toda la zona sureste del país, de manera ordenada y segura”, declaró Sánchez Cordero.

Entrevistada después de su participación en la reunión de la Confraternidad Nacional de Iglesias Cristianas Evangélicas, la secretaria de Gobernación explicó que Estados Unidos colaborará con inteligencia para detectar y detener a quienes, dentro de la caravana, estén relacionados con tráfico y trata de personas, explotación infantil y tráfico de órganos.

Durante el encuentro del lunes entre Sánchez Cordero y Nielsen en Miami, Florida, Estados Unidos expresó su preocupación por el incremento exponencial de migrantes irregulares que han ingresado a su territorio en los últimos meses: alrededor de 76 mil en febrero y una proyección de 90 mil para marzo.  Por ello, Estados Unidos busca el apoyo de Guatemala, Honduras y El Salvador.

Lost in the urban sprawl of Los Angeles, I stumbled upon a disturbing scene.  A hulking man, easily three hundred pounds and radiating menace, stood on a corner.  Intrigued, and perhaps foolishly, I decided to observe him.  My approach was a clandestine crawl beneath cars and a dash through honking traffic.  Thirty minutes later, I reached the other side, unseen.

The man was delivering a crude pick-up line – "What up, bitch?" – to a woman who looked both puzzled and eager to escape, yet she hesitantly approached.  He repeated his offensive greeting.  Suddenly, he lunged, his actions suggesting a gruesome attack on her face.  Horrified, I watched from just two feet away, documenting the unfolding nightmare. He then threw her into the back of a taxi.  Driven by morbid curiosity, I jumped onto the roof of the cab.

The taxi ride was short.  At a small house, the man hauled the woman inside.  Desperate to witness the conclusion of this bizarre encounter, I spotted an open window and, despite the potential danger, hurled myself through, landing with a painful thud in what appeared to be a bathroom.

Exiting the bathroom, I followed a dim light and a discarded piece of clothing to a room.  Inside, a brutal scene unfolded.  The man, armed with a cylindrical weapon drawn from his belt, was repeatedly striking the woman.  Her screams mingled with his grunts.  To my surprise, she fought back with ferocity.  After a protracted struggle, the woman prevailed, leaving the man defeated on the floor.  "Really?! 300 lbs and only a couple of minutes?" she exclaimed, her voice laced with a mixture of exhaustion and triumph.

As she walked towards the door, I realized my precarious position. I scrambled back to the bathroom and hid behind the shower curtain. But she followed. She sat down on the toilet, sounds of pain escaping her lips.  She repeated the phrase, "Oh God." Then, as she stood, I slipped. Discovered.

The woman advanced.  Fearing the worst – especially after my regrettable McDonald's lunch – I braced myself.  To my astonishment, she ripped off my belt, pulled down my pants, and tore off my shirt.  Then, she pressed my face against hers.  She... copulated with me.  The interspecies act felt surreal and wrong.  After an eternity, she screamed, "Thank you," and then… she bit off my head.

The moral of the story? Stay away from praying mantises that resemble humans.

Semi-supervised semantic segmentation, the focus of this paper, presents a unique challenge: the need for rich and robust supervision from unlabeled data.  Two prominent strategies in semi-supervised learning, consistency and contrastive learning, offer potential solutions, but each has limitations in this context.  Consistency learning, which minimizes feature distance between pixels in different augmented views of the same location, provides reliable but limited supervision, neglecting relationships between pixels at different locations.  Contrastive learning, conversely, leverages pairwise supervision by encouraging similar features for positive pixel pairs and dissimilar features for negative pairs. However, determining these binary positive-negative assignments is problematic. Treating each pixel as a distinct class, as in image classification, forces neighboring pixels—often describing the same object—to have dissimilar features.  Alternatively, using pseudo labels to guide these assignments is susceptible to noise, where small errors can completely reverse the intended feature similarity supervision.

In semi-supervised learning generally, effectively utilizing unlabeled data is paramount.  Consistency and contrastive learning represent two popular approaches.  For image classification, given augmented views of an image (Fig. 1), consistency learning enforces similar features across different views, while contrastive learning encourages dissimilarity between an image's features and all others except those of the same image.

To address these limitations and achieve rich, robust supervision, we propose multi-view correlation consistency (MVCC) learning.  MVCC introduces a correlation consistency loss that enforces similarity between self-correlation matrices of different augmented views (Fig. 1).  This approach offers several advantages. Compared to consistency learning, MVCC analyzes similarities between a significantly larger number of pixel pairs, capturing a richer representation of the data distribution.  Crucially, compared to contrastive learning, MVCC avoids hard positive-negative assignments. Instead of directly increasing or decreasing similarity based on these assignments, pixel-pixel similarity is supervised by the similarity of the same pixel pair in another view.  This provides a weaker but more robust form of supervision, circumventing the issues of treating each pixel as a separate class and mitigating the impact of noisy pseudo labels, leading to state-of-the-art results in multiple settings.

Beyond the loss function, MVCC incorporates a view-coherent augmentation strategy, ensuring pixel-pixel correspondence between views.  For image-level augmentations like random cropping, scaling, and flipping, we utilize sampling grids of affine transformations, implementing invertible and differentiable operations efficiently.  For region-level augmentations like CutMix, we enforce view coherence to maintain correspondence across views.

Alone in the box, it was too dark, yet the noise from outside—the tall man's booming voice, the blaring music—was overwhelming. The anticipation was agonizing; he knew precisely what would happen next. The lid would open with a near-silent *schuff*, and a rough hand, reeking of some indefinable stench, would yank him by the scruff of his neck, ripping him into the blinding light.  Already too bright, the sudden transition from the darkness of the box to the stage would feel like staring into a thousand suns.  The applause, a muted roar while he was in the box, would wash over him with its full force.  The place reeked of stale beer, popcorn, and the sweat of a summer afternoon. All he could do was wait, trapped in his cramped, dark prison, dreading the inevitable. But this time was different. This time, he would have his revenge.

*Schuff*. "I'd certainly hope my hat was empty, but sometimes I have bad luck!" The rough hand grabbed him and pulled.

The rain poured down, drenching two soldiers in their leather overcoats.  They paused, gasping for breath. The taller one pulled off his gas mask, lit a cigarette, and offered one to his partner, who grunted a refusal.  He inhaled deeply, exhaled slowly, and looked up at the grey, rain-streaked sky.  Flicking the cigarette to the ground, he crushed it with his boot.

"Think we'll be pulling out of here soon?" he asked.  His partner, gas mask still on, grunted again. "You don't talk much, do you?"  Another grunt.  The tall soldier laughed, clapped the shorter man on the shoulder, and pointed at a boarded-up building across the street.

"Think we might find someone in there, mate?" he asked, hoping for disagreement. He was weary of this endless search for survivors of the gas bombing, questioning how any could have possibly lived through it.

"Maybe," the short man rasped, his voice gravelly, like a heavy smoker’s. Perhaps that was why he’d refused the cigarette.  The tall man knew *he* was growing tired of the taste of the looted cigarettes.

"You sure? That building doesn't look like it would have protected anyone," the tall man argued.

"Maybe. Maybe not." The short man picked up his gun and started toward the building. He paused, turned back, and whispered fiercely, "Let's go."  The tall man sighed, replaced his gas mask, and followed, gun drawn.  They moved through the building, ready to shoot anything that moved.

*Our cause is righteous and just. We will not falter.*

---

"I am telling you, man, there is nobody in this building!"  The tall soldier's frustration grew.  He trusted his partner's instincts, but something felt wrong about this building. A premonition of danger, a sense of futility, urged him to rejoin their company. "Come on, man, I didn't hear whatever you heard. Let's just get out of here!"

The short man stopped at a door and turned.  He removed his gas mask, revealing a face scarred by war: a milky eye, a crooked nose, and a beard that couldn't hide the damage. "In there," he growled, his voice transformed from a rasp to a menacing snarl.  The tall man felt a grim smile form beneath his mask; all doubt vanished.

*Our cause is righteous and just. We will not falter.*

---

The door exploded inward.  Huddled around a small fire, two girls cowered behind a young boy who stood bravely, though his small frame offered little protection.  Two figures filled the doorway, gas masks and red-lensed eyes concealing their faces, black overcoats swaying, massive guns held ready.  The boy knew he had to protect his sisters, despite his overwhelming fear.

Silence hung heavy as the soldiers surveyed the room.  The taller one watched his partner, who shifted restlessly, eager for action. The taller one seemed to hesitate. The boy took a deep breath, his dead father's words echoing in his mind: *Show them no fear, my son. You must not let your sisters ever doubt you.*

"Please," he whispered.

---

The taller soldier cocked his head, a gesture of curiosity, or perhaps a cruel amusement. He wasn't sure why he even acknowledged the boy.  This child, playing protector, was one of the survivors they were ordered to eliminate. Their cause was righteous and just.  They knew the consequences of faltering.

He aimed his weapon at the boy's small chest.  His partner advanced toward the girls, weapon raised, ready to unleash its devastating power. *He should know the danger of being that close,* the tall man thought, his attention divided between his partner and the boy.

*Our cause is righteous and just. We will not falter.*

A single, resounding boom echoed through the building.
