تجري السلطات الأفغانية تحقيقا في صحة تقارير تتحدث عن غرق عدد من المهاجرين الأفغان بعد أن عذبهم حرس الحدود الإيرانيون وألقوا بهم في نهر هاريرود الواقع على الحدود بين البلدين.

ويقول الإعلام الأفغاني المحلي إن الحادث وقع يوم الجمعة حينما ألقى حرس الحدود الإيرانيون القبض على المهاجرين أثناء محاولتهم دخول إيران بشكل غير قانوني قادمين من ولاية هرات الغربية.  وتفيد التقارير بأن حرس الحدود الإيرانيين ضربوهم ثم أجبروهم على القفز في النهر، مما أدى إلى غرق عدد منهم.

شهد  بعض المهاجرين الناجين على الحادثة.  حيث قال أحدهم، واسمه شير أغا، لوكالة رويترز إن الحرس الإيرانيين "حذرونا بأنهم سيفتحون علينا النار ما لم نرم بأنفسنا في النهر". وأضاف مهاجر آخر يدعى شاه ولي أن الحراس الإيرانيين "ضربونا ثم أجبرونا على القيام بأعمال شاقة. ثم نقلونا بحافلات صغيرة إلى مكان قريب من النهر، وعندما وصلنا إلى هناك، رمونا في الماء".

وقالت مفوضية حقوق الإنسان في أفغانستان إن مسؤولين محليين أخبروها بأن "قوات الأمن الإيرانية احتجزت عددا من المهاجرين الأفغان كانوا يريدون دخول إيران بحثا عن عمل. وأجبروهم على عبور نهر هاريرود، ونتيجة لذلك مات عدد منهم غرقا بينما نجا آخرون".

ولم يتأكد عدد المهاجرين الذين شملهم الحادث، ولكن مسؤولين قالوا إن العشرات من المهاجرين عبروا الحدود، وإن سبعة منهم على الأقل ماتوا وما زال آخرون في عداد المفقودين.  وأرسل فريق بحث إلى المنطقة لاستعادة جثث المهاجرين من النهر.


من جانبها، نفت إيران هذه التقارير. وقال متحدث باسم وزارة الخارجية الإيرانية إن الحادث وقع داخل الأراضي الأفغانية وليس في إيران، كما نفت قوات حرس الحدود الإيرانية ضلوعها فيه.


يذكر أن نحو 3 ملايين مواطن أفغاني يعيشون في إيران، من بينهم لاجئون وعمال، ويجتاز الحدود المئات من الأفغان يوميا بحثا عن عمل.  وعاد العديد منهم إلى بلادهم بعد تفشي وباء كورونا في إيران، حيث أصيب نحو 100 ألف شخص حتى الآن، ويعتقد أن الكثيرين من هؤلاء نقلوا الوباء إلى أفغانستان.

صرحت معالي وزيرة الشؤون الاجتماعية ووزيرة الدولة للشؤون الاقتصادية، مريم العقيل، بأن برنامج عمل الحكومة يركز على تجسيد الأمر السامي بالقضاء على الفساد، من خلال تعزيز النزاهة، والتحول الرقمي للخدمات الحكومية، وتطوير الأداء الحكومي.

جاء ذلك في كلمةٍ ألقتها العقيل بعد انتقال مجلس الأمة في جلسته التكميلية، اليوم الأربعاء، إلى مناقشة برنامج عمل الحكومة للمدة المتبقية من الفصل التشريعي الخامس عشر (2016/2017 - 2019/2020)، تطبيقا للمادة 98 من الدستور.

وأضافت أن المحور الأول من برنامج عمل الحكومة، والمتعلق بتعزيز النزاهة، يتمحور حول تنفيذ استراتيجية النزاهة ومكافحة الفساد.

وأشارت إلى مبادرات تعزيز النزاهة، والتي تشمل إنشاء وحدة متخصصة لمكافحة الفساد في الإدارة العامة للمباحث الجنائية بوزارة الداخلية، ودعم وتفعيل أدوات المحاسبة للمقصرين، ومكافأة المجدّين، وخلق منصة للتعاون والتنسيق بين الأجهزة الرقابية، والتعاون مع مؤسسات المجتمع المدني والقطاع الخاص.

وأكدت على تفعيل الحوكمة المؤسسية، واتباع الأطر التشريعية والمؤسسية والأخلاقية التي تهدف إلى تحقيق الجودة والتميز في الأداء.

The world dissolved into black.  Control-A. Delete. Control-S. The finality of it echoed in the nothingness that remained.  My scream, a desperate "NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!", was swallowed by the void.  She had pressed **THE SEQUENCE**.

I had warned her.  "Okay, you can stay up all night changing your book back from what I wrote. But eventually you'll miss something and keep writing, and your precious Jane will stay dead. I need no food, nor oxygen, nor rent money. I live only on paper and I can keep fighting you forever. Can you say the same?" A masterful retort, I thought, designed to break her.  For a second, her sneer faltered, replaced by a frown.  Then came that terrifying grin. "Goodbye, Mister Random Hitman."

I had confronted her in Rome, Texas, at the very spot where the Fourth Wall used to be.  Clad in a stolen DoD suit to protect me from the residual radiation, I stood before the architect of my failures. "So, Megan," I began, my voice smooth, controlled. "Let's have a little talk, shall we?"

"Wh- who are you?" she stammered.

"Oh, I think you know. You're the one who keeps stopping my attempts to kill…" I paused for effect, savoring the moment. What *was* her name again?  Jane. It was always best to remain detached, to sever any possible emotional connection. But sometimes, the name lingered. "Jane."

Her gasp was followed by a torrent of sobs. "AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH!" 

"What?" I asked, my voice flat, dispassionate.

Between gasps and sniffles, she choked out her confession.  "All I—" *sob* "—wanted to do was—" *sniffle* "—write a story about a girl who likes horses and—" *Christ, these sobs are getting annoying* "—birds! And then you kept changing my story and I had to change it so she doesn't get hurt!"

Slowly, the truth dawned.  "Wait, so… you're a little girl?"

Her sneer returned, sharp and cutting.  "You liked the act, huh? No, bitch, I'm not a *little girl*. I'm a novelist writing a symbolist book and you keep fucking it up with your stupid one-dimensional character! I mean, *'sever any possible emotional connection?'* Christ, your inner monologue sounds like a 12-year-old boy trying to sound cool!"

"Point taken," I conceded.  But I had to make her understand. "But you *know* you have to let me kill Jane."

My meticulous plans, each one foiled. The first, a long-range sniper shot with my modified .338 Winmag and subsonic bullets, thwarted by a fortuitously timed pet bird.  The second, a C4 car bomb, disarmed by a forgotten set of keys and a vigilant traffic cop. I had studied her for weeks.  Leave for work at 8:30, back at 6:00, walk the dog at 8:00, bed at 10:30.  A boring routine, easily exploited.  But luck, or perhaps something more, was on her side.  I had even observed her mundane purchases, scoffing at the pet bird, the condoms.  *A pet bird? Really?* I had thought. *Christ, you're not fooling anyone by flashing condoms—everyone knows you have no chance with any sort of guy.* I never missed. I never left things to chance. And I never got discovered. Until her. This target was different. Smarter.  *Or maybe,* I had mused, *just luckier.* Half a million dollars was half a million dollars, but this job was proving… problematic.

This time, I had aimed higher.  My target wasn't Jane herself, but the one protecting her: the Fourth Wall. I had infiltrated the White House, bypassed their "security,"  taken the President hostage, and launched a low-yield uranium bomb at Rome, Texas.  The launch codes?  A simple matter of persuasion, involving a few "contacts" in the government, some hypodermics, and a quick cremation. Government security *was* a joke. An MP-5, MREs, a water purification system, and the burning desire for revenge filled my pack. I never failed. Until Jane.  Until Megan.

Transformers have achieved state-of-the-art results in language modeling, significantly outperforming LSTMs. One explanation for their superior performance is attention's ability to leverage long-range dependencies, while Recurrent Neural Networks are constrained by encoding past information within a fixed-size hidden state. However, this explanation doesn't address why specific transformer architectural choices, particularly exponential dot-product attention (sometimes ambiguously called softmax attention), outperform alternatives.  Exponential dot-product attention has gained prominence in contrastive and metric learning, featuring in state-of-the-art semi-supervised contrastive learning models.  In language models, exponential dot-product probabilities model conditional probabilities in Word2Vec and certain memory networks.

Despite the empirical success of transformers, theoretical frameworks for their effectiveness remain limited.  We propose a probabilistic explanation for attention and contrastive probabilities, grounded in exponential family distributions.  Framing attention within the exponential family allows us to leverage related theory from statistics, machine learning, and statistical mechanics, providing insightful interpretations of the transformer architecture. We also provide proofs for attention updates over several continuous distributions.

We acknowledge the limitations of our theory, noting that the modern Hopfield network interpretation of attention shares many of these constraints.  For some of these limitations, we suggest connections to other research areas that may resolve the theoretical inconsistencies, motivating future research directions.

RDF2vec [7] is an approach for embedding knowledge graph entities into a continuous vector space.  It extracts sequences of entities (walks) from the graph and feeds them into a word2vec encoder [2]. These embeddings have proven valuable for downstream tasks requiring numerical representations of entities and relying on distance metrics that capture entity similarity and/or relatedness [4].

Various RDF2vec walk extraction strategies exist, including weighted random walks [1] and approaches like community hops and walklets [8].  Furthermore, recent work demonstrates that using an order-aware variant of word2vec, rather than the classic implementation, improves the resulting embeddings [6].

RDF2vec blends the notions of similarity and relatedness. This is evident in Table 1, where the closest concepts to "Mannheim" in the vector space include its timeline, a person, the local ice hockey team, and nearby cities. While all semantically related to Mannheim (e.g., Peter Kurz is the Lord Mayor), they are not necessarily similar.  A person and a city, for instance, share few common characteristics. This paper introduces two new RDF2vec variants: p-RDF2vec, which emphasizes structural properties (attributes) and thus favors similarity; and e-RDF2vec, which emphasizes neighboring entities (context) and thus favors relatedness.

Ce site nous emmène, par exemple, au musée de Vernon, non loin de Giverny, où se trouvait le dernier atelier de Claude Monet.  En maniant avec précaution le curseur – un peu trop sensible – on découvre une série de peintres, dont la plupart sont méconnus.  La promenade n'en manque pas de charme, grâce à quelques œuvres comme l'atypique "Coin d'atelier" de Monet (1861), qui joue avec les motifs décoratifs de la pièce représentée.

Le charmant musée de Rouen s'intéresse, quant à lui, à la création du jardin de Claude Monet, le maître de l'impressionnisme.  Durant les quarante-trois années passées à Giverny, Monet a composé un tableau vivant à grande échelle : son parc, source d'inspiration inépuisable.  Botaniste dans l'âme, il a été secondé par son beau-fils, Jean Pierre Hoschedé, qui a constitué un herbier témoignant de leurs recherches communes.  Aux côtés d'herbiers anciens répertoriant les plantes locales, on découvre un "portrait" de clématites blanches par Monet (1887) et, de la même année, celui de pivoines somptueuses éclatant sur un fond de feuilles vertes.

Jusqu'en octobre, le MuMa du Havre proposait "Nuits électriques", explorant l'influence de l'apparition de l'électricité sur la vision des artistes.  Le réverbère est rapidement devenu un élément central des compositions urbaines impressionnistes.

The scientific community watched, awestruck, as a pair of crudely conjoined toasters sat within a steel-reinforced glass case.  A short, sweat-drenched man in overalls rubbed his sunburnt neck.

"I'm tellin' you, Sully…it happened."

A tall man with long, dark brown hair adjusted his sweater vest and rose from behind his podium. "You keep saying that, Wilfred, but this is simply two toasters. This can't possibly be what you claim."

The short man's brow furrowed, a disturbing glint in his eyes – a look that hinted at both madness and unsettling intelligence. "It's two toasters, I know. But it's also the solution to every problem we'll face for the next thousand years."

"I assure you, two kitchen appliances cannot defy the laws of thermodynamics."

The other experts exchanged pointed glances at Wilfred, held between two armed guards.  With a collective nod, they gestured to the guards, who shoved him forward.  "Show us how it works," the sweater-vested scientist, Dr. Sullivan, demanded.

Wilfred approached the case cautiously, as if it housed a dangerous animal. He ran his fingers across the bulletproof glass, thick enough to withstand an elephant's weight. The scientists had insisted on the precaution, given Wilfred’s claims about the device's potential power.

His hand reached inside, past a small locked hatch, and pressed down on a lever on the lower toaster.  He quickly withdrew and backed away until the butt of a rifle slammed into his face, sending a spray of blood from his nose.

The guards hauled him to his feet, gripping his bloody shirt. "No need to run. There's certainly nothing that could hurt you *here*."

The toasters began to glow, the air around them shimmering with heat.  The scientists remained unimpressed. "So far, your 'great machine' is merely producing hot air. *Impressive*."

Wilfred, ignored and bloodied, wept. Tears of fear? Sadness? Pain? Madness? No one knew, no one cared. He smeared blood across his lips with a trembling hand, staring intently at the toasters.

The lever sprang up with a light *ting*.  "You've gone mad, Wilfred. This double-toaster can't even make twice the toast, with one stacked on top of the oth–"

Suddenly, the toasters rumbled. Holes erupted in their shells, emitting beams of intense, searing light. The scientists recoiled in terror.  The room plunged into darkness, illuminated only by the toasters’ now-fierce flames.

"You idiots! How much energy did you feed the device?!" Wilfred roared.

His question went unanswered as the beams melted through the reinforced glass, slashing across the room. Wood furniture ignited, flesh seared. Screams mingled with the crackling of fire and the stench of burning.

The toasters, now a single molten mass, consumed the case entirely.  Thick smoke filled the room, obscuring everything.  The screams faded, replaced by wheezing and the occasional pop of burning wood.

Hours later, Dr. Sullivan stirred, lifting his face from the scorched tile floor.  He pushed himself to his knees, his body coated in soot.  The room was devastated; no toasters, no colleagues, no guards…and no Wilfred.

He stumbled out into the pristine lobby, the central hub of the labs. "Anybody? Anyone there?"

He'd always acknowledged Wilfred's brilliance, even as the old man's inventions grew increasingly outlandish. These toasters had seemed the epitome of that descent—simple in appearance, but with unknown capabilities.

He searched frantically, calling out, but the labs were eerily deserted, stripped of both personnel and equipment. Panic set in.  Reaching for his phone, he found his pocket empty.  He ran, fearing he was trapped.

He burst through the doors at the top of the winding staircase, only to be met by a hellish landscape.  Winds howled as liquid fire and lightning rained down from two colossal, winged toasters.

A new study by sex toy provider EdenFantasys reveals that honesty about sexual history isn't always a given in relationships.  While most people (76 percent) are curious about their partner's past, nearly one in three Americans (29 percent) admit to lying about their own.  Men are more likely to deceive, with 37 percent admitting to lies compared to 25 percent of women.

This curiosity isn't always welcome.  While over half of respondents (53 percent) crave every intimate detail, a third admit feeling jealous about their partner’s past, and one in five (18 percent) prefer to remain ignorant.  Learning the truth even led to breakups for 19 percent of those surveyed.

Despite the potential for discomfort, the topic is bound to arise. Only 16 percent of couples have never discussed their sexual histories, with 28 percent talking about it frequently. While the average couple broaches the subject around five months into the relationship, a curious 31 percent delve into the past within the first month.

The primary curiosity?  The number of previous partners (56 percent), followed by the number of people dated (40 percent) and specific sex acts (30 percent).  Men ideally envision their partner having nine previous partners, while women prefer closer to six.  Interestingly, men consider six too few, while women draw the line at three.  Men are also almost twice as likely to inflate their own number.

"Your partner’s past is a taboo and often divisive topic,” says Fred Petrenko of EdenFantasys. “Our study showed a range of reactions, from celebratory high-fives to upset and even jealousy.  This extends even to partners' experiences with robots, as revealed in a previous study. At EdenFantasys, we are dedicated to understanding the complexities of human sexuality.”

The survey found men report an average of 13 partners compared to women's nine.  Despite potential anxieties, most (84 percent) are open to discussing their past.  Ultimately, the majority agree that a partner’s history doesn't impact their current relationship, emphasizing the importance of good communication in bed (76 percent) for a satisfying experience.

Petrenko concludes, “The key takeaway is that a partner’s sexual history is less important than the present.  Good communication, perhaps enhanced with a sex toy, contributes significantly to a happy, healthy, and lasting relationship.”


**Top Curiosities About Partner’s Sexual History:**

* How many people they’ve had sex with (56 percent)
* How many people they’ve dated (40 percent)
* Sex acts they’ve done (30 percent)
* Funny/embarrassing sex stories (23 percent)
* Participated in threesomes/orgies (22 percent)
* Nothing (18 percent)

**The Debate: Should You Know Your Partner’s History?**

* Yes, I want to know everything (53 percent)
* No, I don’t want to know anything (18 percent)
* Don’t care (29 percent)

浴室虽小，却是重要的私密空间，兼具洗漱、放松和保养等功能。然而，瓶瓶罐罐堆积其中，加上潮湿环境，容易滋生水垢霉菌，显得脏乱不堪。以下提供三种收纳方法，让浴室保持清爽洁净。

**一、盥洗用品**

▲（图／Pinterest）

牙刷、漱口杯、牙膏、洗面奶等盥洗用品，以及各种保养品，是不是都摆放在洗手台上？虽然方便取用，却显得凌乱，甚至不小心就会碰倒。维持浴室整洁的关键在于净空台面和地面，将物品收纳于洗手台下方、镜柜，或利用无痕贴收纳于墙面，打造利落的空间。

**二、清洁用具**

▲（图／Pinterest）

马桶刷、刮水器、抹布、清洁剂等清洁用具，通常放置于马桶旁或角落，方便随时取用。然而，潮湿环境容易使清洁用具滋生细菌霉菌。建议使用挂钩将清洁后的用具挂于墙面，保持通风干燥，确保卫生。

**三、卫生用品及毛巾**

▲（图／Pinterest）

卫生纸、卫生棉等备品，以及日常使用的毛巾，不建议放置于潮湿的浴室中，以免变质或滋生细菌。如果必须存放，请使用密封防水的收纳盒。毛巾则应晾晒于通风处。

总而言之，保持浴室通风，避免物品直接接触地面，是维持浴室清洁的关键。此外，避免囤积过多的物品，谨慎评估每一件物品的必要性，才能拥有清爽简约的卫浴空间。

Control Barrier Functions (CBFs) have emerged as a powerful tool for guaranteeing safety in nonlinear control systems deployed in real-world environments [1], [2].  While initially applied to systems where the input directly affected the CBF's time derivative, recent efforts have extended their use to higher-order systems where the input's influence appears through multiple derivatives [3]-[6].  However, these extensions require verifying feasibility using complex system dynamics and can lead to complicated alterations of the safe set.  An alternative approach [7] involves designing CBFs for a simplified top-level model and employing a tracking controller to address the full system dynamics.

As system complexity grows, utilizing a simplified top-level model for initial control design becomes increasingly desirable, with subsystems subsequently addressing the full dynamics. Backstepping, a well-established technique for robust stabilization of higher-order nonlinear systems [8], [9], aligns perfectly with this approach.  It recursively designs a controller using the full system dynamics based on a top-level design, effectively handling mixed-relative degree systems where inputs influence dynamics at different levels.  Existing work has explored backstepping with state constraints through non-overshooting control [10], recently connected to CBFs [11], [12]. These methods achieve safety using structured controllers that create linear dynamic relationships between cascaded states, preventing setpoint overshoot during stabilization.  Other studies have employed backstepping with Lyapunov-Barrier functions [13]-[15] to enforce state constraints. However, these approaches couple safety and stability, potentially imposing restrictive requirements on safety constraints.  To our knowledge, decoupling stability and safety within a backstepping framework using CBFs has not been explored.

A key challenge in combining CBFs with backstepping lies in finding smooth controllers that guarantee safety, as backstepping necessitates differentiating controllers higher in the integrator chain.

When developing machine learning solutions for classification tasks, practitioners frequently grapple with selecting the optimal performance metric.  Consider, for example, cancer diagnosis, where a cost-sensitive predictive model categorizes patients [12].  While the chosen costs clearly influence model decisions, translating expert intuition into precise quantitative cost trade-offs—that is, the performance metric itself—remains a challenge [1, 13].  Hiranandani et al. [3, 4] addressed this challenge by formalizing the Metric Elicitation (ME) framework, which estimates a performance metric using user feedback on confusion matrices.  The underlying principle is that leveraging metrics reflecting a user's inherent trade-offs within a specific task, context, and population leads to models that better capture user preferences [3].  Since humans often struggle to provide accurate absolute quality feedback [10], Hiranandani et al. [3] proposed using pairwise comparisons, where a user (oracle) indicates a preference between two confusion matrices.  Figure 1 (reproduced from [3]) illustrates the ME framework.

Existing ME literature proposes elicitation strategies for binary [3], multiclass [4], and multiclass-multigroup [6, 5] classification settings, all assuming an oracle providing relative preference feedback on confusion matrices. However, to the best of our knowledge, no implementations have tested the ME framework or the assumption that users can effectively compare confusion matrices. This paper bridges the gap between theory and practice by presenting the first practical implementation and evaluation of the ME framework.  Our contributions are:

* We propose a visualization for pairwise comparison of confusion matrices, adapting the visualization of individual confusion matrices from Shen et al. [11].
* We integrate this visualization into a web user interface (UI) that solicits relative preference feedback on confusion matrices.  The UI implements Algorithm 1 from Hiranandani et al.

Dormir más tiempo durante la noche no necesariamente se traduce en un efecto beneficioso para la salud y el bienestar, sugiere un reciente estudio publicado en *The Quarterly Journal of Economics*. La investigación, centrada en la calidad versus la cantidad de sueño, se enfocó en personas de bajos recursos que residen en zonas urbanas de países en vías de desarrollo, donde el ambiente de vida, con múltiples interrupciones, dificulta un sueño reparador.

Para el estudio, los autores monitorearon los patrones de sueño de 452 voluntarios de Chennai, India, durante un mes.  Utilizaron dispositivos de actigrafía, sensores de muñeca que registran los ciclos de sueño en entornos cotidianos.  Los resultados revelaron que, a pesar de permanecer en cama alrededor de ocho horas, los voluntarios dormían un promedio de 5,5 horas, con aproximadamente 31 despertares nocturnos.  Esta eficiencia de sueño es comparable a la de personas con trastornos como apnea del sueño o insomnio.

Frank Schilbach, economista del Instituto Tecnológico de Massachusetts y coautor del estudio, describe el ambiente de sueño en Chennai:  “Puedes ver gente durmiendo en sus ‘rickshaw’.  Con frecuencia, cuatro o cinco personas duermen en la misma habitación con mucho ruido; ves gente durmiendo en la calle cerca de autopistas. Es increíblemente caluroso por la noche y hay muchos mosquitos.  Esencialmente, en Chennai puedes encontrar cualquier fuente potencial de irritación o factor adverso para el sueño”.

Los científicos implementaron estrategias para que los participantes aumentaran su tiempo de descanso nocturno.  Proporcionándoles información,  alentándolos a dormir más y mejorando su entorno, lograron un incremento promedio de 38 minutos en el tiempo en cama, que se tradujo en solo 27 minutos adicionales de sueño efectivo.

A lo largo del experimento, se evaluó la atención, productividad, toma de decisiones y bienestar psicológico de los participantes mediante una tarea de ingreso de datos por computadora.  Sin embargo, el tiempo extra de sueño nocturno no produjo mejoras en ninguno de estos parámetros.

La Red de Salud de Alto Amazonas bajo la lupa: Millonarias adquisiciones cuestionadas.

La Red de Salud de Alto Amazonas se encuentra en el ojo de la tormenta debido a presuntas sobrevaloraciones en diversos procesos de licitación.  Se cuestiona, entre otras cosas, la adquisición de sal y pollos parrilleros a precios exorbitantes.  A esto se suma la modificación, sin justificación aparente, de las fechas de adjudicación (Buena Pro) de cuatro proyectos. Inicialmente prevista para el 31 de julio, la fecha fue postergada sucesivamente al 1 y luego al 2 de agosto, generando sospechas sobre la transparencia del proceso.

Seis procesos, financiados por el Decreto de Urgencia 004-2017 y que suman un total de S/ 1,619,000,  requieren una exhaustiva revisión.  Si bien dos ya cuentan con la Buena Pro, uno incluso con contrato firmado, la legitimidad de las adjudicaciones es cuestionable.  La directora de la Red de Salud, Lic. Enf. Telma Bárbara Ríos Cachique, debe responder por estas irregularidades.

Los proyectos en cuestión incluyen el mantenimiento de la infraestructura de diversos puestos de salud:

* Seis de Julio, Nuevo Arica y Barrio Central (distrito de Lagunas): S/ 386,310.24
* Cotoyacu y Achual Limón (distrito de Yurimaguas): S/ 206,843.53
* San Francisco de Pampayacu y Nuevo Pijuayal (Micro Red Pampa Hermosa): S/ 355,088.91
* Nuevo Arica, San Juan y Santa Lucía (Balsapuerto): S/ 390,228
* Cuiparillo, Nuevo Papaplaya y Parinari (distrito de Teniente César López Rojas): S/ 282,665
* Alquiler de inmueble para oficinas administrativas: S/ 50,000

**Gastos inexplicables: ¿Gallinas de oro y sal a precio de caviar?**

Este año, la Red de Salud adquirió, para supuestas "sesiones demostrativas", 308 kilos de gallina entera fresca sin cabeza ni patas y 206 gallinas de postura, por un total de S/ 9,792. I strongly support the development of autonomous vehicles.  Human error contributes significantly to the frequency and severity of accidents on our roads. Autonomous vehicles offer the potential to nearly eliminate this human factor.  Furthermore, they promise increased efficiency.

Unlike human drivers who can be prone to anger, distraction, or disorientation, autonomous vehicles utilize the logic of a computer.  A computer program is impervious to emotional outbursts or passenger distractions, offering a potentially safer alternative to a human driver.  Its logical decision-making process enhances safety on the road.  Google's seven-year track record of testing semi-autonomous vehicles under specific conditions, with no reported crashes to date, further supports this potential.

Beyond safety, autonomous vehicles offer a more fuel-efficient and environmentally friendly mode of transportation.  Google co-founder Sergey Brin suggests they could be twice as fuel-efficient as current taxis and buses. This increased efficiency translates to a significant reduction in carbon dioxide emissions, contributing to a cleaner environment.  Moreover, greater fuel efficiency benefits the economy by reducing our dependence on imported oil.

In conclusion, autonomous vehicles offer a compelling future for transportation. By placing a computer at the wheel, we can enhance safety, optimize routes, and significantly reduce greenhouse gas emissions, creating a cleaner, more efficient, and safer world.

Un humoriste YouTube, Luke Erwin, 26 ans, est intervenu courageusement pour empêcher un homme d'être étranglé à mort lors d'une violente altercation routière à Coomera, sur la Gold Coast, lundi après-midi.  L'incident, filmé par Erwin et partagé sur Instagram, montre une bagarre sanglante entre trois hommes au milieu d'une route mouillée.

Au début de la vidéo, on entend Erwin et ses deux amis rire de la situation. Cependant, le ton change rapidement lorsqu'ils réalisent la gravité de la situation.  "Devrait être rompu, ou non?" demande une voix derrière la caméra.  Quelques secondes plus tard, Erwin se précipite hors de la voiture pour secourir un homme, identifié comme Filiti, qui est en train d'être étranglé.

"Reste en arrière, merde!" crie Erwin au premier agresseur, torse nu, tandis que son ami tente de dégager le coude du deuxième agresseur du cou de Filiti, 32 ans.  Des enfants crient en arrière-plan, des klaxons retentissent et des spectateurs implorent la fin de la bagarre.  Le caméraman, la voix tremblante, s'approche de l'agresseur et le supplie d'arrêter. "Arrêtez, arrêtez. Aidez-le, aidez-le s'il vous plaît."

"Regarde, putain de mère, lâche-toi de la merde," hurle Erwin en tirant la jambe de l'agresseur pour tenter de le faire lâcher prise.  Erwin et ses amis réussissent finalement à séparer les deux hommes, mais l'agresseur se jette à nouveau sur Filiti et commence à l'étrangler avec ses mains.  La mêlée ne s'arrête que lorsqu'une voiture s'approche, permettant aux deux agresseurs ensanglantés de se relever et de remonter dans leur véhicule.

Filiti a remercié Erwin sur Instagram : "Je vous dois une bière, frère." Il a expliqué au Daily Mail Australia que l'altercation avait débuté après qu'il ait klaxonné les deux hommes qui avaient failli percuter sa voiture sur l'autoroute. "Ils m'ont insulté et voulaient que je m'arrête. J'aurais dû continuer à conduire, mais je ne l'ai pas fait," a-t-il déclaré.  Interrogé sur la crainte pour sa vie, l'électricien a répondu : "Oui, il ne s'arrêtait pas.

STOCKHOLM –  Struggling chip joint venture ST-Ericsson, owned by Ericsson and STMicroelectronics, faces an uncertain future.  The two parent companies have enlisted an external advisor to explore strategic options for the loss-making unit.  This follows media reports that JP Morgan has been engaged to review possibilities, including finding a new partner, selling assets, or even a complete sale.  French newspaper Les Echos suggested a scenario where ST-Ericsson could be sold piecemeal, with technologies like connectivity, power management, and software architecture attracting different buyers.  Remaining parts of the business might be reabsorbed by the parent companies. While no decision has been announced, one is expected by the end of the year.

ST-Ericsson continues to struggle financially.  In the second quarter, it reported an operating loss of $235 million, attributed to the collapsing demand for feature phones from clients like Nokia and Sony Ericsson, and the challenging transition to supplying chips for the smartphone market.  The company’s full-year 2011 loss totaled $841 million on sales of $1.65 billion, and it has accumulated losses of around $2 billion over its three years of operation.

While Ericsson and STMicroelectronics have publicly stated their support for ST-Ericsson's ongoing cost-cutting initiatives aimed at lowering the break-even point, analysts are skeptical about the prospects of a sale.  "The possibilities for Ericsson are limited except to hold on to its share and try and do the turnaround themselves," said Mirko Maier, analyst at LBBW. Finding a buyer for the entire business, or even substantial parts of it, appears challenging given its financial performance.

Although a sale or break-up wasn't explicitly mentioned in the official statement from the parent companies, Ericsson's head of media relations confirmed that all options are under consideration.

Dona Mobeti, anciennement connu sous le nom de Donatien Sabuela, signe un retour remarqué avec son nouvel album « Dis-moi la vérité », une œuvre témoignant de la persistance de son talent.  Alors que certains le croyaient disparu de la scène musicale,  ce come-back sensationnel, notamment relayé par les médias africains en Europe,  prouve que le « Commandant », comme le surnomment affectueusement ses fans, reste un pilier de la musique congolaise moderne. Il continue de lutter pour affirmer sa place d'artiste incontournable et incontesté de ce genre musical.

Depuis le lancement de son groupe « Cavacha » en 1973, Dona Mobeti s'est illustré comme un chanteur et auteur-compositeur de talent.  Des titres comme « Luciana », « Chérie Kadetti », « Pitchouna », « Ekila », « Mayi Mongala », « Nene Malakasi » ont marqué la jeunesse congolaise des années 70-80 et témoignent de la qualité de son œuvre. Sa célébrité, malgré quelques fluctuations, perdure depuis plus de quarante ans grâce à son talent, son courage, sa créativité et son inventivité, des qualités qui suscitent parfois l'envie et la jalousie de ses pairs.

Fidèle à son habitude de se renouveler sans cesse,  Dona Mobeti, confiant en son inspiration, sa voix et son instinct,  entend  avec « Dis-moi la vérité »  rappeler sa présence et affirmer son style. L'engouement des médias africains en Europe et des réseaux sociaux,  manifesté par des articles de presse, des diffusions radio et des commentaires en ligne, confirme le succès de cet opus.

Enregistré avec la participation de figures emblématiques comme Papa Wemba, Danos Canta Nyboma, Luciana Demingongo, Diblo Dibala et Simolo Katondi, « Dis-moi la vérité » est un album abouti tant sur le plan musical que sur celui des arrangements.  Ses 7 titres (plus 2 bonus instrumentaux) invitent les mélomanes à un voyage musical explorant les thèmes de l'amour, du désir et de l'attirance. Des morceaux comme « Dis-moi la vérité », « Ekila taxi », « Mayi mongala » et « Chérie Cadette »  expriment le désir d’être avec l’être aimé, perçu comme source de bonheur.

Zoé, sept ans, n’a pas envie de bouger.  La voix de son père la tire du sommeil, annonçant leur arrivée.  À travers la vitre de la voiture, elle aperçoit pour la première fois leur nouvelle maison, encore plus sinistre en vrai que sur les photos. La pierre grise est rongée par la mousse, le toit perd ses tuiles, la peinture s’écaille sur les volets qui menacent de céder au moindre souffle de vent. Deep neural networks are powerful, but their size and computational demands hinder deployment on resource-constrained devices like dash cams or in real-time applications such as autonomous driving.  Network compression addresses this challenge by reducing memory and computational costs. Popular techniques include quantization, knowledge distillation, and network pruning. Unlike other compression methods, pruning directly removes network components, typically involving a pre-train, prune, and fine-tune cycle. Pruning methods primarily differ in their granularity and importance measures.

Unstructured pruning removes individual parameters or connections, resulting in unstructured sparsity that necessitates specialized software and hardware for acceleration.  Conversely, structured pruning removes entire channels, filters, or neurons, creating structured sparsity readily exploitable by standard hardware. This leads to both reduced storage and faster inference. This paper focuses on structured channel pruning.

Existing filter/channel pruning approaches often employ different importance measures. While effective, these measures are frequently ad-hoc, locally computed, and not directly tied to the final task's utility.  Furthermore, few studies address visual detection specifically.  This paper proposes a gradient-based saliency measure for visual detection to guide the pruning process. Channels with higher gradient-based detection saliency contribute more significantly to the visual detector's predictions.

Our key contributions are:

* We leverage the gradients of the detection utility with respect to channel features as our saliency measure for pruning deep visual detectors in autonomous driving scenarios, a departure from most existing methods.
* By incorporating ground truth bounding box information and surrounding context, we reweight the detection task gradients, further enhancing pruning performance and demonstrating significant potential for handling small-scale objects.

The world used to be simple.  I remember leaving my parents' home, venturing out to build my own quiet dwelling by the water. Land was plentiful then. Finding a companion, raising children – life followed a familiar, comforting cycle.

Disruptions were occasional, not constant. A flood might wash away homes, fire might force a move, a neighbor might disappear without a trace. Sometimes the communal alarm would sound, warning of an approaching danger, a bolt from the blue in an otherwise tranquil sky. But mostly, life was easy, touched by fortune.

Then came the fear, the uncertainty.  They came.

I remember vividly the first time terror gripped me.  Gathering food for my family, I stumbled upon the body of a neighbor.  We’d recently quarreled, a fierce argument fueled by his unwanted advances toward my wife. I would have killed him myself had he touched her, but this… this was something else. His skin was flayed from his body. I stood there, struggling to comprehend the horrific sight, when my daughter’s scream ripped through the air.  She was caught in a trap, pleading for help.  And then I saw them. Two giants, their movements alien and unsettling, casually approaching my terrified child.  One pointed at me, uttering something in a language I didn’t understand. The other raised a strange object. A crack, sharp as the communal alarm, followed by an eruption of pain in my leg.  I glanced at the wound, unbelieving.  I ran. I abandoned my daughter. I ran until I reached the safety of my home, where my remaining family tended my wounds.

Weeks have passed since that day.  Their presence has spread.  No longer confined to the water's edge, their massive structures now dominate the landscape, stretching as far as the eye can see. They continue their inexplicable campaign of slaughter, and I rarely venture out anymore.  All I can do is hope, desperately, that their departure will be as sudden as their arrival.

La Policía Nacional del Perú capacitó a periodistas en terminología y procedimientos de investigación policial

Esta mañana, en la sede del Ministerio del Interior (Mininter), se llevó a cabo el I Seminario “Terminología y Procedimientos en la Investigación Policial”, organizado por la Dirección de Comunicación e Imagen Institucional de la Policía Nacional del Perú (PNP), a través de su División de Prensa.  El evento, dirigido a periodistas de diversos medios de comunicación de la capital, se desarrolló en el auditorio Mariano Santos Mateos, ubicado en el tercer piso del Mininter, de 8:00 a 15:00 horas.

El seminario, que culminó con éxito, tuvo como objetivo actualizar los conocimientos de los periodistas sobre la terminología y los procesos de investigación policial.  Esta capacitación permitirá un uso óptimo de la información en la redacción de notas y trabajos periodísticos, contribuyendo a mejorar la información sobre el quehacer policial que se brinda a la ciudadanía.

Entre los temas abordados se encuentran: “La terminología policial, casuística y su incorporación en el nuevo Código Procesal Penal”, a cargo del General PNP Carlos Gómez Cahuas, Jefe del Comité de Asesoramiento de la PNP; “Procedimiento en la investigación policial”, presentado por el Comandante PNP Víctor Revoredo Farfán, de la División de Investigación de Homicidios (DIRINCRI PNP); “Proceso de investigación en casos de indebida conducta funcional policial”, a cargo del General PNP Marlon Savitsky Mendoza; y “Defensa legal del policía y tiempos de detención en intervenciones policiales”, expuesto por un Oficial Superior PNP de Asesoría Jurídica de la Institución Policial.

**Presentan el "Observatorio Policial de Criminalidad y Delitos"**

En el marco del seminario, el Mayor PNP Gabriel Calderón Chuquitaype presentó el “Observatorio Policial de Criminalidad y Delitos”, dependiente de la Dirección de Criminalística de la PNP (DIRCRI PNP). Este observatorio constituye un importante centro de recopilación de información para su estudio, evaluación y tratamiento con un enfoque sociopolicial y científico.  La información obtenida servirá como herramienta para la toma de decisiones del Comando Institucional, con el objetivo de reducir los índices de inseguridad en el país.

Asimismo, personal especializado de la DIRCRI PNP realizó una representación en forma de sociodrama de una “escena del crimen” simulada en el hall del Mininter.  Un oficial superior de dicha unidad explicó de manera didáctica los detalles del proceso que se sigue en estos casos.

Jesús Palomino Núñez, Presidente del Círculo de Periodistas Policiales del Perú, agradeció al Comando PNP por la realización del seminario y comprometió los esfuerzos de los periodistas para ofrecer una mejor información sobre el quehacer policial.

Finalmente, el Director General de la PNP, General de Policía Richard Zubiate Talledo, clausuró el evento.  Tras destacar la importancia de la capacitación para los periodistas y felicitar a los organizadores, solicitó el apoyo de la prensa para generar esfuerzos conjuntos que permitan el desarrollo y progreso del país.

The increasing prevalence of fraudulent operations, intrusions, and attacks on computer networks has become a significant concern.  With over 90% of real-world activities now accessible online, including financial transactions, online shopping, examinations, and information exchange, the need for robust cybersecurity measures is paramount. While traditional technologies like firewalls offer a first line of defense, they are often insufficient.  Consequently, Intrusion Detection Systems (IDSs) are commonly deployed to enhance network security for businesses and organizations [1]. Firewalls provide passive, manual protection, while IDSs offer active, automated protection.

An IDS detects, tracks, and reports intrusive activities and security breaches within an IT infrastructure or network.  It analyzes potential events, including unpredictable behavior and imminent threats to network security designs, established policies, and outdated safety provisions.  The two primary types of IDSs are signature-based and anomaly-based. Signature-based IDSs utilize a database of known malicious activity signatures, triggering alerts when network communication matches a specific signature. Anomaly-based IDSs establish a baseline of normal system operations and raise alarms for deviations from this baseline.  While IDSs effectively identify various network attacks, a significant challenge is the high volume of false positives, which reduces their overall effectiveness [3]. A false positive occurs when an IDS incorrectly flags benign activity as malicious.

In recent years, the false positive rate has become a key metric for evaluating IDS effectiveness, playing a crucial role in the overall performance of these systems. IDSs, encompassing signature-based, anomaly-based, and hybrid approaches (Figure 1), are the most common method for detecting intrusions.


Signature-based intrusion detection systems (SIDS) employ pattern-matching algorithms to detect intrusions, storing signatures of malicious activities in a knowledge base. Anomaly-based intrusion detection systems (AIDS) analyze normal behavior patterns and flag deviations as suspicious.  AIDS do not require a signature database and can potentially identify previously unknown, zero-day attacks. Hybrid systems combine SIDS and AIDS to leverage the strengths of both approaches, improving the detection of known malicious activities while reducing false positives for zero-day attacks [2].

Although SIDS generally produce fewer false positives than AIDS, they are not entirely avoidable. This has driven research into strategies for minimizing false positives, including machine learning algorithms, visual content analysis, and intelligent false alarm filtering.

Numerous intrusion detection strategies exist, but their accuracy, which depends on detection rates and false positive rates, remains a concern.  Reducing false positives and improving detection rates are crucial for enhancing accuracy.  This challenge has motivated the research presented in this paper.

Modeling long-range sequences is fundamental to solving many real-world challenges. Applications range from processing biosignals like electroencephalograms spanning tens of thousands of time steps [Tang et al., 2023] to comprehending and generating large documents (e.g., novels, scientific papers) using large language models [Zhou et al., 2023; Liu et al., 2023].

Deep learning methods are state-of-the-art for numerous challenging tasks, including learning functions over variable-length input sequences. Recurrent neural networks (RNNs) emerged early as strong contenders. They compress sequences by incorporating input elements sequentially, using only O(1) operations per input token and sharing parameters across time steps (Figure 1a). Notably, RNNs are partially inspired by cognitive and neurological computational principles [Lipton et al., 2015].  Perhaps unsurprisingly, they also underpin another class of biologically grounded architectures: spiking neural networks (SNNs) (Figure 1b). SNNs process sequences using simplified mathematical models of biological neurons that relay computations using sparse binary spikes [Maass, 1997]. The goal is to emulate the brain's efficient neural coding, enabling computation with a fraction of the energy required by modern von Neumann machines [Hasler, 2017].

RNNs are affected by vanishing and exploding gradients [Pascanu et al., 2013], stemming from unstable recurrent weight initialization and backpropagation through time (BPTT) (Figure 1a). These phenomena hinder learning long-range dependencies, and while gating mechanisms like long short-term memory (LSTM) [Hochreiter and Schmidhuber, 1997] can mitigate them, they are difficult to eliminate entirely.  Furthermore, traditional RNNs apply nonlinearities at each time step (σ in Figure 1a), requiring iterative computations. This is acceptable during inference, where input sequence elements arrive sequentially. However, RNN forward passes become prohibitively slow during training with long sequences because they cannot leverage GPU parallelization due to the nonlinear state propagation [Yarga and Wood, 2023; Orvieto et al., 2023; Kalchbrenner et al., 2016].

Additional challenges arise in SNN learning because binary spiking is non-differentiable, precluding direct training with backpropagation. One solution is training an artificial neural network (ANN) and converting its continuous activations to spikes [Diehl et al., 2015]. However, this introduces inference latency and often leads to excessive firing, impacting energy efficiency [Davidson and Furber, 2021]. Another solution is training SNNs directly using surrogate gradients [Neftci et al., 2019]. Nevertheless, even with surrogate-based training, SNNs are generally outperformed by ANNs like LSTMs [Malcom and Casco-Rodriguez, 2023].

The Transformer [Vaswani et al., 2017] overcomes these RNN limitations by directly compressing the context for each token, measuring its relationship to all other elements (Figure 1c).  Besides improving performance, its core component, self-attention, is easily parallelized through GPU-friendly matrix multiplication, accelerating training [Zeyer et al., 2019]. Consequently, Transformer blocks have been crucial to the current era of large pre-trained models [Min et al., 2023].

However, the parallel, dense matrix multiplications that have established the Transformer as the de facto standard also accentuate structural differences between SNNs and ANNs. SNNs are designed for neuromorphic platforms like Intel Loihi [Davies et al., 2021], potentially enabling orders of magnitude lower energy consumption. These efficiencies are partly achieved by representing information as sparse, address-identified events. Spike events then "excite" targeted synapses asynchronously, with accumulation occurring within postsynaptic neurons. This enables addition-based feature mixing, reducing costly Multiply-and-Accumulate (MAC) operations [Li et al., 2023].  Massive parallel matrix multiplications, as required by self-attention, contrast with this event-driven, brain-inspired computing philosophy. Therefore, lessons from Transformer research have seen limited adoption in SNNs [Zhou et al., 2022; Zhu et al., 2023; Yao et al., 2023].

Cybersickness: How to Manage the Side Effects of Screen Time

Do you ever feel your computer screen’s light boring into your eyes, making your head throb?  Or experience dizziness or nausea after using your phone? These sensations, while easily mistaken for eye strain or fatigue, are often symptoms of cybersickness.

With the rise of remote work, online learning, and constant digital engagement, these issues might seem unavoidable.  However, as a human-computer interaction researcher specializing in cybersickness, I can assure you there are ways to anticipate and mitigate these effects.

What exactly is cybersickness?  It encompasses a cluster of symptoms similar to motion sickness, but occurring without physical movement. These symptoms fall into three categories: nausea, oculomotor problems (like eye strain, fatigue, and headaches from overworking the eye movement nerve), and general disorientation (including dizziness and vertigo). Some symptoms, such as blurred vision and difficulty concentrating, overlap categories.  These issues can linger for hours and even disrupt sleep.

Cybersickness can be triggered by everyday devices like computers, phones, and TVs.  Recall the 2013 parallax effect on iPhone lock screens, which made the background image appear to shift with phone movement.  Many users found this extremely uncomfortable, as it triggered cybersickness. Similarly, parallax scrolling on websites, where background images remain static while foreground content moves during scrolling, can also elicit these symptoms.

While the exact cause of cybersickness isn't fully understood, a leading theory, sensory conflict theory, suggests it arises from a mismatch between visual and balance information. Your eyes perceive motion, while your body registers stillness.  Everyday technology design can exacerbate this conflict.


Cybersickness in Virtual and Augmented Reality

Cybersickness is often more intense with virtual reality (VR) and augmented reality (AR). VR, which replaces the real world with an immersive artificial environment (think Oculus and PlayStation VR), can cause severe, escalating nausea, rendering some applications unusable. AR, which overlays simulated environments onto the real world (like Pokémon Go or head-mounted displays), tends to cause more severe eye strain.

Even if you haven't used VR or AR, you likely will within the next decade.  The projected growth of these technologies for work, education, and entertainment—potentially exceeding $900 billion by 2027—suggests a corresponding rise in cybersickness.

The Potential Dangers of Cybersickness

While seemingly benign, cybersickness symptoms can persist for up to 24 hours, potentially impacting daily functioning in dangerous ways.  Lingering headaches, eye strain, or dizziness can impair coordination and attention, posing risks, for example, while driving.  Liability for injuries related to device-induced cybersickness remains unclear.

Long-term effects of chronic cybersickness are still largely unknown.  Similar to motion sickness, susceptibility varies widely; some individuals are significantly more prone.  Evidence suggests women, infrequent video game players, and those with poor balance may experience more severe symptoms.

Managing Cybersickness

If prolonged computer or phone use triggers cybersickness, there are ways to alleviate discomfort.  Blue light glasses can reduce eye strain and sleep disruption.  Zooming in or increasing font size can also minimize eye strain.

For those interested in VR/AR but prone to motion sickness, warning indicators like Oculus Comfort Ratings can help manage expectations.  Calibrate devices for visual comfort, use them in open spaces to minimize fall risks, and take breaks at the first sign of discomfort.

Navigating New Technology Safely

The rise of remote work, spurred by the COVID-19 pandemic, has increased awareness of the challenges of prolonged screen time.  While the convenience is undeniable, the physical effects are real.

However, don’t let cybersickness deter you.  Ongoing research promises to mitigate and prevent these symptoms across devices, allowing us to enjoy technological advancements without discomfort.

Un equipo de investigadores del Idibaps, el instituto de investigación asociado al Clínic de Barcelona y dirigido por Elias Campo, ha elaborado un mapa del genoma de pacientes con leucemia linfática crónica, el tipo de leucemia más frecuente.  Este arduo y detallado trabajo, publicado en La Vanguardia por Ana Macpherson, se basa en una enorme cantidad de datos moleculares de individuos enfermos y sanos, los cuales fueron catalogados, ordenados y comparados.

Iñaki Martín-Subero, jefe de la investigación epigenética del Idibaps, explicó que "Hemos encontrado 500 alteraciones que se repiten en la práctica totalidad de los pacientes estudiados. Estas 500 alteraciones tienen un denominador común: tres familias de proteínas que desencadenan todos esos cambios. Son las superdianas a las que podremos dirigir los posibles nuevos tratamientos".

Quizá el aspecto más llamativo de este exhaustivo análisis es que, a pesar de haber identificado estas tres familias de proteínas como el denominador común y las superdianas terapéuticas, aún se desconoce por qué se adhieren al ADN de los futuros enfermos.

في ندوة عبر تقنية الفيديو كونفرانس بعنوان "الأثر الاقتصادي، العلمي، الاجتماعي، الثقافي لفيروس كورونا على العالم وانعكاسه على مصر"، نظمتها جمعية رجال الأعمال، بمشاركة رئيسها المهندس علي عيسى ونائبه المهندس فتح الله فوزي، رئيس لجنة التشييد، تحدث الدكتور إسماعيل سراج الدين، المدير المؤسس والفخري لمكتبة الإسكندرية الجديدة، ونائب رئيس البنك الدولي سابقاً، عن رؤيته لمرحلة ما بعد كورونا.


وأكد الدكتور سراج الدين أن الأزمة، رغم صعوبتها، تحمل في طياتها أثراً إيجابياً لمصر على مدى السنوات العشر القادمة.  فالدول ستعيد اكتشاف مواردها وتوظيفها بشكل أمثل، وستظهر تكنولوجيات جديدة، وسيعيد قطاع الأعمال النظر في مفهوم الأمن القومي بأبعاده التجارية والاقتصادية.  ويرى أن العالم يمر بمرحلة تحول كامل في نظامه، ما سيغير خريطة الدول الاقتصادية.  ومصر، بثقلها السياسي والتجاري والاقتصادي، ستكون من المستفيدين من هذا التحول خلال العقد القادم.


وشبّه الدكتور سراج الدين الوضع الاقتصادي العالمي الحالي بمرحلة الكساد العظيم عام 1929، متوقعاً ظهور نظام اقتصادي عالمي جديد تقوده الصين ودول شرق آسيا، مع دور إيجابي للعالم العربي وأفريقيا وجنوب آسيا.  وأكد أن مصر تمتلك فرصاً واعدة للخروج من الأزمة بمكاسب اقتصادية، من خلال تعزيز علاقاتها الدبلوماسية القوية، خاصة مع الصين، وتحويلها إلى اتفاقيات تجارية وصناعية واستثمارية.  وأشاد بحرص الرئيس عبد الفتاح السيسي على تدعيم العلاقات الدولية وفتح قنوات تواصل مع مختلف دول العالم، قائلاً: "الرئيس السيسي حافظ على علاقاته مع جميع البلاد ولم ينخرط في موقف عدائي ضد دولة بعينها".


وأشار إلى النمو الاقتصادي الذي حققته مصر على المديين المتوسط والبعيد، لاسيما في قطاع البترول والغاز، مؤكداً أن التحدي الحقيقي يكمن في إعادة توظيف العمالة المتضررة من توقف قطاعات مثل السياحة.


وتناول الدكتور سراج الدين الوضع الاقتصادي في الولايات المتحدة والصين، متوقعاً انكماشاً للاقتصاد الأمريكي بنسبة 20% إلى 30% في الربع الثاني من العام الحالي، مع ارتفاع معدلات البطالة.  في المقابل، رأى أن الصين أكثر استعداداً لتحقيق قفزات في النمو بفضل طفرتها العلمية والتكنولوجية.


وعلى الصعيد الصحي، أشار إلى أن أزمة كورونا كشفت نقاط ضعف في الدول الكبرى، كالولايات المتحدة وأوروبا،  معرباً عن تفاؤله ببداية استخدام عقار "ريمديسفير" والتعاون الدولي لإيجاد لقاح.  وشدد على أهمية إجراء الاختبارات اللازمة لتوفير بيانات دقيقة لإدارة الأزمة وإعادة فتح الاقتصاد.


أما عن الأثر الاجتماعي والثقافي، فأكد الدكتور سراج الدين أهمية دعم المواطنين وتأمين الأمن الغذائي، خاصة في الدول الفقيرة، ودور الثقافة في التوعية بالتباعد الاجتماعي والإجراءات الوقائية.

كابول: فجر انتحاري نفسه الاثنين بالقرب من مكتب لجهاز الاستخبارات الأفغاني في كابول، مما أدى إلى مقتل ستة مدنيين في هجوم تبناه تنظيم داعش.  وتبنى تنظيم داعش عبر وكالته الدعائية "أعماق" الهجوم الانتحاري، معلناً عن "عملية استشهادية تستهدف مقراً للاستخبارات الأفغانية بمنطقة شش درك" في مدينة كابول.

ويأتي هذا الهجوم، الذي وقع أثناء وصول الموظفين إلى عملهم، بعد أسبوع على اعتداء استهدف مركزاً للتدريب تابعاً للإدارة الوطنية للأمن (الاستخبارات) في العاصمة الأفغانية. تبنى تنظيم داعش أيضاً الهجوم الذي استمر أكثر من أربع ساعات، وأصيب خلاله عدد من رجال الشرطة بجروح طفيفة.

وصرح نجيب دانيش لوكالة فرانس برس أن ستة مدنيين كانوا في سيارة قُتلوا في الهجوم، وأن ثلاثة آخرين جُرحوا. وأضاف أنهم سقطوا "عند مرورهم في المنطقة بسيارة تويوتا".  وتابع دانيش "لا نعرف حتى الآن هدف الهجوم، لكنه وقع على الطريق الرئيسي". وكان نصرت رحيمي، الناطق باسم نائب وزير الداخلية الأفغاني، قد صرح لفرانس برس قبل ذلك أن "المعلومات الأولية تشير إلى حدوث انفجار بالقرب من مقر للاستخبارات في حي شاش داراك في كابول".

وذكر صحافي من فرانس برس في المكان أن الهجوم وقع بالقرب من المدخل الرئيسي لمجمع الاستخبارات، مشيراً إلى أن قوات الأمن أغلقت الطريق الرئيسي المؤدي إلى المبنى. وشوهدت سيارات الإسعاف تغادر الموقع وهي تنقل، على الأرجح، جرحى إلى المستشفيات.  وأكدت وزارة الصحة الأفغانية عدد القتلى.


وأصبحت العاصمة الأفغانية في الأشهر القليلة الماضية أحد أخطر الأماكن على المدنيين في الدولة التي تمزقها الحرب. وتكثف حركة طالبان وتنظيم داعش هجماتهما على المقار الأمنية والمساجد.

Cars Driving Themselves? A Dangerous and Unnecessary Pursuit

Many automobile companies, such as General Motors and Berkeley, are contemplating the creation of driverless cars.  These vehicles, envisioned to handle acceleration, steering, and braking without human intervention, are being touted as the future of transportation. Google co-founder Sergey Brin, for example, has developed a prototype with the aim of reducing reliance on taxis and buses.  However, the pursuit of driverless cars is fraught with problems and promises more disaster than progress.

The financial implications alone are staggering.  As highlighted in the "Driverless Cars Are Coming" reading, these vehicles require a multitude of sensors, adding significant cost to the manufacturing process. While sensors themselves are not new, the sheer quantity needed for a driverless car makes the overall expense exorbitant.  Companies risk jeopardizing their budgets and potentially their entire business on this uncertain technology.  Pouring vast sums of money into such an unproven venture is fiscally irresponsible.

Beyond the financial risks lie serious safety concerns.  Entrusting a computer with one's life is a dangerous proposition. As noted in paragraph 9 of the same reading, the potential dangers of driverless cars are so significant that testing them is illegal in most states. Accidents are inevitable, raising complex questions of liability.  Who is responsible in the event of a driverless car accident – the owner or the manufacturer?  The inherent risks associated with autonomous vehicles far outweigh any perceived benefits.  The safest approach remains a human driver in control of the vehicle.

Some argue that driverless cars eliminate the need for personal vehicles and associated costs like insurance and gas. However, the projected cost of utilizing these autonomous taxis is likely to negate any such savings.  Ultimately, driverless cars represent an overpriced, driverless taxi service.

أجرى حاكم نيويورك، أندرو كومو، يوم الأحد، فحصًا مباشرًا لفيروس كورونا خلال مؤتمره الصحفي اليومي، وحثّ سكان المدينة الذين تظهر عليهم أعراض الإصابة أو الذين خالطوا مصابًا بالفيروس على أن يحذوا حذوه.

بعد أن أخذت منه ممرضةٌ بقفازاتٍ وكمامةٍ مسحةً أنفيةً لإجراء الاختبار، قال كومو: "عليكم التحلّي بالذكاء والوحدة والانضباط. عليكم أن تحبّوا أنفسكم وعائلاتكم وسكان نيويورك".  وأضاف مازحًا: "إذا لم أكن هنا غدًا، فهذا يعني أنني مصاب بالفيروس"، مشيرًا إلى أنه خضع للاختبار عدة مراتٍ سابقًا، ولكن هذه هي المرة الأولى التي يقوم بها أمام الجمهور.

وأوضح كومو أن معايير الخضوع للاختبار لا تقتصر على من تظهر عليهم أعراضٌ تشبه أعراض الإنفلونزا فحسب، بل تشمل أيضًا العائدين إلى العمل، والعاملين في المجال الطبي والتمريض، ومَن خالطوا مصابًا.

وتابع الحاكم: "لا يخضع عددٌ كافٍ من سكان نيويورك للاختبار، وهو أمرٌ بالغ الأهمية، خاصةً مع إعادة فتح بعض الأعمال غير الأساسية في أجزاءٍ من الولاية".

In 1976, scientists made a startling discovery in Cydonia, a region on Mars. NASA's Viking 1 orbiter, while photographing potential landing sites for its sister ship, Viking 2, captured an image resembling a human face. This sparked immediate debate, with some believing it to be an alien monument and others attributing it to a natural landform.

Subsequent analysis has definitively proven the "Face on Mars" to be a natural formation, analogous to a butte or mesa, common landforms in the American West.  Despite this scientific consensus, some remain unconvinced.  Conspiracy theories, lacking credibility, allege a NASA cover-up, suggesting the agency is hiding evidence of extraterrestrial life. Ironically, proponents of continued NASA funding might have welcomed evidence of an ancient Martian civilization.  The "Face" captivated public interest, and NASA prioritized capturing higher-resolution images.

On April 5, 1998, the Mars Global Surveyor finally provided a definitive answer.  Its Mars Orbiter Camera, operated by Michael Malin, captured an image ten times sharper than the original Viking photos. The image revealed no alien monument, only a natural landform.

After eighteen years of investigation, most researchers concluded the matter.  The perceived "face" likely appeared due to a combination of low resolution, shadows, and pareidolia – the tendency to see familiar patterns in random data.

The Facial Action Coding System (FACS), a technology designed to detect the emotional state of individuals by analyzing facial features and muscle movements, presents both potential benefits and drawbacks. While proponents suggest its value in diverse settings, from classrooms to workplaces, a critical examination reveals a more nuanced perspective.

One of the most compelling arguments for FACS implementation lies in its potential to improve the educational environment.  By recognizing subtle emotional cues in students, educators could identify those struggling with hidden anxieties, sadness, or fear. This early detection could enable timely interventions, potentially reducing disruptive behaviors, bullying incidents, and academic underperformance.  Understanding a student's emotional state could provide invaluable insights, allowing teachers to tailor their approach and offer personalized support, ultimately fostering a more positive and productive learning atmosphere. As the article mentions, FACS could even help understand historical figures' emotions by analyzing their portraits. Imagine uncovering the emotions Da Vinci imbued in the Mona Lisa! This potential to analyze historical depictions of emotion offers exciting avenues for research and understanding.

However, the introduction of FACS also raises significant concerns.  The claim that it could replace trained professionals in fields like psychology or social work overlooks the complexity of human emotion and the crucial role of human interaction in therapeutic settings. The time, money, and effort invested in these professions shouldn't be readily dismissed, and the potential displacement of human expertise by a technological system warrants careful consideration.  While FACS might offer a broad overview of emotional states in a group setting, it cannot replace the nuanced understanding and individualized support provided by human professionals. Relying solely on technology for emotional assessment risks oversimplification and could lead to misinterpretations with potentially harmful consequences.

Furthermore, the very premise of relying on technology to interpret emotions raises ethical questions.  Do we want to live in a world where machines constantly scrutinize our faces and judge our emotional states? While proponents argue for the benefits of emotional transparency, the potential for misuse and the erosion of privacy cannot be ignored.  The notion that a computer can definitively understand our emotional state better than ourselves or trained professionals is a bold claim that requires further scrutiny.

In conclusion, while FACS offers intriguing possibilities, particularly in educational settings, its widespread implementation should be approached with caution. The potential benefits of early emotional detection and personalized support in schools must be weighed against the ethical implications, the potential for job displacement, and the risk of oversimplifying the complexities of human emotion.  While FACS may prove to be a valuable tool in specific contexts, it is crucial to avoid overreliance and to prioritize the irreplaceable value of human connection and expertise.  Further research and careful consideration are necessary to determine the appropriate role for FACS in our society.

国产动画电影《哪吒之魔童降世》自7月26日上映以来，票房口碑双丰收，至今已突破30亿元人民币，雄踞中国动画电影票房榜首。电影的火爆也引发了一场“哪吒故里”之争，至少有四地自称是哪吒的“家乡”，并在政府网站上列举证据，试图借此分一杯羹。然而，专家学者指出，哪吒本是神话传说人物，并非真实存在，探讨其故里意义不大。

四川宜宾市是其中一个积极争夺“哪吒故里”的地方。宜宾市政府新闻办公室先后发表文章，明确表示哪吒是“宜宾娃”。文章提到，上世纪90年代，曾任台湾嘉义市南天门太子宫主持的黄樟在宜宾发现了“哪吒洞”，并在当地重建了“哪吒行宫”。此外，宜宾市政府还指出，距离市区7公里的南广镇古名为陈塘关，是哪吒出生和李靖镇守之地。当地的一些民俗也可能与哪吒的服饰武器“乾坤圈”、“红肚兜”有关。宜宾还能找到传说中太乙真人居住的“金光洞”、哪吒打死龙王三太子留下的“龙脊石”等景观。早在2018年6月，中国民间文艺家协会就正式命名宜宾市翠屏区为“中国哪吒文化之乡”。宜宾市政府希望以此打造哪吒文化品牌，促进文创产业发展。

此外，四川江油市也自称是哪吒的家乡，称当地自古流传着哪吒太子的传奇故事，并保留着陈塘关、九湾河、翠屏山祖庙、乾元山金光洞等与《封神演义》中哪吒相关的地理名称。甚至，当地的非物质文化遗产名录中，也有“哪吒故事及民俗”一项。

天津市河西区陈塘庄也加入了这场争夺。当地文化和旅游局工作人员表示，陈塘庄据传就是李靖镇守的陈塘关，“全国很少有叫‘陈塘’的地方”。

المصدر: هونغ كونغ (د.ب.أ)

أعلن منظمو معرض "آرت بازل هونغ كونغ" السنوي، أحد أهم المعارض الفنية العالمية، إلغاء دورته للعام 2020، بسبب تفشي فيروس كورونا المستجد.

وقال برند شتادلفيزر، الرئيس التنفيذي لمجموعة "إم سي إتش جروب" المنظمة للمعرض: "اضطررنا لإلغاء المعرض، مع بالغ الأسف. لقد درسنا جميع البدائل الممكنة، بما فيها التأجيل، واستمعنا إلى توصيات وآراء العديد من العارضين والشركاء والخبراء".

وكان من المقرر إقامة المعرض، الذي يُنظَّم أيضًا في بازل (سويسرا) وميامي (فلوريدا، الولايات المتحدة)، في هونغ كونغ في الفترة من 17 إلى 21 مارس المقبل. ويجذب هذا المعرض، الذي يُعَدّ من أبرز الفعاليات الفنية في آسيا، حوالي 80 ألف زائر.

وأعلنت "إم سي إتش جروب" أن الدورة المقبلة من "آرت بازل هونغ كونغ" ستُقام في الفترة من 25 إلى 27 مارس 2021.

من جانبها، رأت كاتي دو تيلي، صاحبة معرض "تن تشانسري لين" الذي تُنظّمه في هونغ كونغ منذ 19 عامًا، أن إلغاء "آرت بازل" كان قرارًا لا مفر منه.

وقالت دو تيلي: "قبل أسبوع، كان لديّ أملٌ في إقامته، لكن بات الإلغاء ضرورة.  القلق يسود الجميع، وستعاني الكثير من الأعمال التجارية، لكنْ ثمة أملٌ في نهاية المطاف.

Self-driving cars present a compelling idea, but I firmly believe they are not ready for widespread adoption.  Several critical safety concerns remain unaddressed.  One primary issue is the handover problem:  while these cars can handle many driving situations, they still require human intervention in others.  This creates a dangerous scenario where a driver, potentially disengaged after periods of automated driving, must suddenly react to a critical situation.  For example, if the car's sensors fail to detect a pedestrian crossing the street, the driver may not have enough time to react and prevent an accident. This raises a crucial legal and ethical question: who is responsible in such a case – the driver or the manufacturer?

As mentioned earlier, this ambiguity surrounding liability creates a legal minefield. If an accident occurs, determining fault becomes complex. Is the driver responsible for not paying sufficient attention, even if they were relying on the car's automation?  Or is the manufacturer liable for flaws in the technology? This potential for legal battles between drivers and manufacturers further complicates the issue.  Additionally, the criminal implications are disturbing. Could a driver face charges for a fatality caused by the car's malfunction, even if they were technically following the rules of automated driving?

Furthermore, the article I read about this technology did not mention any driver override system. This raises the alarming possibility that a driver, even if they see a hazard, might be unable to take control of the car in time to prevent an accident.  This lack of control in critical situations makes the prospect of self-driving cars even more risky.

While some self-driving cars alert drivers to roadwork or other potential hazards through vibrating seats and flashing lights, the effectiveness of these alerts is questionable.

Driverless cars, a concept long envisioned by innovators like Sergey Brin, are a source of both excitement and debate. While acknowledging potential drawbacks, I believe driverless cars offer significant advantages and could revolutionize transportation, making it safer, more environmentally friendly, and ultimately, more convenient.  This potential stems from existing technological advancements, the promise of environmental benefits, and the potential for increased safety.

The foundation for driverless technology is already in place.  While the concept may seem futuristic, we are closer than many realize. Features like antilock brakes and sensors are commonplace, and companies like Google have been developing autonomous vehicles for years. As reported, Google has had cars capable of independent driving under specific conditions since 2009. These vehicles utilize a sophisticated array of technology, including position-estimating sensors, a roof-mounted rotating sensor, a video camera, radar sensors, GPS, and an inertial motion sensor. This rotating sensor constantly scans the car's surroundings, building a dynamic 3-D map.  Even this scanning technology isn't entirely new; automakers have been using speed sensors at the wheels for antilock brakes since the 1980s.  With these building blocks already available, accelerating the development of fully autonomous vehicles seems a logical next step.

Beyond the existing technology, driverless cars offer compelling environmental and safety benefits.  These vehicles are projected to consume significantly less fuel than traditional taxis and offer greater flexibility than public transportation.  Reduced fuel consumption translates to a cleaner environment and a reduction in harmful emissions. Google co-founder Sergey Brin recognizes this transformative potential, believing that driverless cars could fundamentally reshape our world.

Moreover, driverless cars promise to enhance safety significantly.  While no system is entirely without risk, autonomous vehicles have the potential to eliminate human error, a major factor in accidents.  Google's driverless cars, for example, have logged over half a million miles without a crash.  The multitude of sensors, including the 3-D scanning roof sensor, provides a comprehensive awareness of the surrounding environment.  Furthermore, features like vibrating driver seats and flashing windshield lights can alert drivers when intervention is required.

Haley sat down, a satisfied smile on her face, inhaling the calming scent of valerian tea.  The routine was familiar now: lights off, curtains drawn tight, sealing out the world.  The only goal was sleep before midnight.

And she did.

07:00 AM, Friday 25th of March, 2017. Haley awoke and marked another line on her calendar – thirty-seven in total.  The familiar sounds of a street argument drifted in through the window: the honking, the shouting.  It was a scene she could picture perfectly.

The city bustled, even at this early hour.  Haley navigated the crowded streets with practiced ease, sidestepping an errant elbow, hopping over a dirty puddle, and finding her usual spot in line at the coffee shop.  She noticed so much more now, small details, fleeting moments that most people missed.  How much life went by unobserved, unappreciated.

The aroma of coffee and fresh buns filled the air.  She ordered a single cup, the name written on it not her own.  The barista's weary smile and rote greeting couldn't mask the genuine affection behind it, the care that ensured the name on the cup was always spelled correctly.

Across the street, through an ornate gate, beneath blooming pink trees, Haley walked past uniformed workers exchanging tired pleasantries as they changed shifts. Some heading home to sleep, others just beginning their day.  Haley, too, had come from her bed, but her destination, her true home, was just ahead.

Inside the hospital room, pale, thin fingers dug into crisp white sheets.  A pained expression twisted Peter’s face, instantly smoothing into a smile as Haley entered.  "Good morning, sunshine." He shifted on the bed, making space for her beside him, a silent invitation she never refused, even if it meant forgoing the uncomfortable chair.

"The barista sends her regards," Haley murmured, offering him the coffee and a bun, taking a bite of her own to mask the familiar pang of grief.  No matter how many times she visited, no matter how she braced herself, the sight of him wasting away stole her breath and pricked at her eyes.

"No coffee for you today?" Peter asked, his blue eyes brightening as he inhaled the scent of the bun.

Berlin: French striker Antony Modeste has been cleared to play for German second division side Cologne, despite an ongoing legal dispute with his former club, Chinese Super League team Tianjin Tianhai FC.  Modeste walked out on Tianjin in 2018 after two seasons, citing unpaid salary. He subsequently signed a contract with Cologne, his former club where he enjoyed a prolific 2016/17 season, scoring 25 goals in 34 league games.  This new contract, signed late last year and running until 2023, was initially deemed invalid by FIFA's Dispute Resolution Chamber in January after Tianjin protested the move.

However, Cologne’s managing director Alexander Wehrle announced on Thursday that FIFA has now granted Modeste permission to play for the German club. "The Chinese FA, with the approval from his former club Tianjin Tianhai, has granted Tony the right to play," Wehrle confirmed.  He expressed his delight, adding, "Tony is finally able to play football again. That’s the most important thing. Obviously we're happy about the fact that we won't just be able to see his qualities in training in the future, but that he is available to play for us."

While Modeste can now play for Cologne, the club clarified in a statement that the legal dispute between the player and Tianjin remains unresolved and that Cologne "is not part of" this ongoing issue.

Web application attacks are a primary target for attackers. Symantec Internet Security [9] reported that a staggering 1 in 10 URLs are malicious.  Web applications, typically using HTTP/HTTPS protocols supported by backend and frontend interfaces, are vulnerable to various exploits.  According to the Imperva Web Application Vulnerability Report [9], high-severity attacks predominantly involve injection techniques, exploiting HTTP/HTTPS web queries via GET, POST, and PUT methods.  Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF), SQL injection, Cross-Site Scripting (XSS), and vulnerabilities in widely used JavaScript libraries account for 51%, 27%, 33%, and 36% of these attacks, respectively. This paper focuses on the most frequent web-based injection attacks: SQL injection, XSS, Remote File Inclusion (RFI), XML External Entity (XXE), CSRF, and Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF).

Network Intrusion Detection Systems (NIDS) monitor network traffic within web applications.  Acting as an intermediary between the application and users, a Web IDS analyzes web traffic to detect anomalies or malicious activity [2].  Two primary detection approaches exist: anomaly-based and signature-based. Signature-based IDS functions similarly to antivirus software, relying on a database of known attack signatures.  However, it is ineffective against new attacks with unknown signatures. Anomaly-based detection identifies unusual behavior patterns deviating from established baselines. While anomaly-based detection excels at uncovering unknown attacks, it suffers from higher false positive rates.  Detected anomalies are often subsequently added to signature databases.  Furthermore, anomaly-based detection encompasses adaptive and constant detection methods [3]. Adaptive detection analyzes HTTP traffic on port 80, continuously processing incoming data, while constant detection analyzes stored traffic logs or current incoming traffic.

Conventional patching, effective for mitigating network-layer vulnerabilities, often fails against web application vulnerabilities like SQL injection, Remote Code Execution (RCE), or XSS.  This is largely due to insecure coding practices in modern web applications. Adhering to OWASP's secure coding guidelines can prevent many of these attacks.  Adaptive detection models effectively identify and classify anomalies, enabling developers to implement appropriate patches (e.g., Django's use of CSRF tokens).  Ideally, these models should learn and adapt to emerging attack vectors over time.  Anomaly-based detection approaches [2] typically employ adaptive models but struggle with high false positive rates.  This paper proposes a solution to manage false positives by employing an IDS that monitors system behavior patterns.

Several challenges hinder the effectiveness of conventional IDSs and web application firewalls:

* **Limited Datasets:**  Collecting substantial anomalous data requires sophisticated systems capable of capturing and automatically classifying attack requests, akin to an advanced attack-defense simulation.
* **High False Positives:** Conventional systems using unsupervised learning algorithms like Principal Component Analysis (PCA) [5] and Support Vector Machines (SVM) [7] require manual feature selection [6] and often produce high false positive rates.
* **Labeled Datasets:** Conventional IDSs relying on rule-based strategies or supervised algorithms (e.g., SVMs, decision trees) require extensive labeled datasets for accurate classification [6].

This paper introduces SWAD, a deep learning-based web application attack detection model capable of autonomous real-time detection.  SWAD utilizes an autoencoder to analyze word sequences, assigning weights based on their significance.  The classification engine is trained on the ECML-KDD dataset to classify anomalous queries by attack type.  Implemented using a sequence-to-sequence model (encoder-decoder architecture), SWAD initially trains on 40,000 benign and anomalous web requests, followed by 20,000 anomalous requests and responses.
