Ben felt the large man's fist connect with his jaw.  Five hours. Five hours these men had been working him over.  Blood filled his mouth, his right eye was useless, and at least two ribs were likely cracked or broken. He spat out a mixture of blood and saliva, then straightened his head, locking eyes with his interrogator.

"The last guy hit harder," he rasped. "And he hit like a bitch. Who taught you how to punch?"

Another blow sent his head snapping back.  His vision swam with bursts of light, and a high-pitched ringing filled his ears.  It hurt, sure, but he’d endured worse back home. He shook his head slightly, working his tongue around the inside of his mouth.

"No, see, you gotta turn your hip into it.  You can't just flail like that."

This was the fourth interrogator.  The first had tried to be “civil,” offering food, a better cell, an end to the beatings.  Ben had laughed—and bitten the man's ear off when he got too close.  After that, the real fun had started. Clubs, electric shocks, attempted suffocation—nothing worked.  Now, he was facing a gorilla of a man, all muscle and seemingly no brains.  The man was winded, knuckles red and swollen, and Ben, instead of breaking, was goading him further into a rage. The brute planted his hands on his knees, sucking in deep breaths. Ben could see the sweat beading on his forehead and arms.

"Taking a break?" Ben taunted. "Time for tea and a little nap? Don't worry about me. I'm tied up. I can wait."

The big man's head snapped up, eyes blazing with fury. He cocked back his right fist, aiming for Ben's face.  Ben leaned into the punch, meeting the fist with the top of his head.  A sickening crack echoed through the room. The giant staggered back, clutching his hand.

"Oops. Did I break your hand? Sorry, pal.  Sounds painful."

"That's it! I don't care anymore!" The interrogator snarled, reaching behind his back with his left hand and producing a gun. "You're not gonna talk, so I'm just going to put a bullet in your fucking skull!"

He pressed the cold steel against Ben's forehead, thumbing back the hammer. Ben stared up at him, his gaze icy. He didn’t fear death.

Six candidats briguent la présidence de la Gambie lors de l'élection de ce samedi 4 décembre. Ce scrutin, le premier depuis la chute historique de Yahya Jammeh fin 2016 après 22 ans de règne, est considéré comme un test pour la transition démocratique du pays. Le président sortant Adama Barrow se représente face à son principal concurrent, Ousainou Darboe, figure de l’opposition à l’ancien régime.

De notre envoyée spéciale à Banjul,

À la veille du scrutin, l'atmosphère est apaisée.  Pour la première fois avant une élection présidentielle, des citoyens comme Aliou Ba, commerçant, osent s'exprimer librement : « Le pays est en paix maintenant, nous sommes libres d’aller où on veut, de parler à qui on veut, de faire nos affaires, tout cela c’est nouveau. »  Ce climat de liberté est un changement majeur depuis l’ère Jammeh.

Arrivé au pouvoir à la surprise générale en 2017, suite à l’intervention des forces de la Cédéao, Adama Barrow sollicite un second mandat.  Certains, comme Mamadou Samba Ba, se disent satisfaits de son bilan : « Nous profitons de la démocratie depuis le départ de Yahya Jammeh. Le président sortant Adama Barrow est indépendant et très humble. Tout va bien maintenant, même si nous avons des problèmes avec la hausse des prix, l’électricité, l’eau. Je pense que le président travaille. »

D’autres, comme Aïda Diane, qui avait pourtant soutenu Adama Barrow en 2016, expriment leur désenchantement : « Nous avons besoin de changement, nous avons besoin d’Ousainou Darboe comme président pour donner de l’emploi à nos jeunes, pour contrôler les prix, pour nos écoles et nos hôpitaux. On s’est battus pour Adama Barrow la dernière fois, mais il nous a trahi. »  Le non-respect de sa promesse initiale de ne rester que trois ans au pouvoir et l'abandon du projet de nouvelle constitution limitant les mandats présidentiels sont pointés du doigt. L'alliance controversée entre Adama Barrow et l’ancien parti de Yahya Jammeh, l’APRC,  ajoute à la désillusion, même si Yahya Jammeh lui-même soutient un autre candidat, Mammah Kandeh.

Malgré son exil en Guinée équatoriale, l’ombre de Yahya Jammeh plane sur le scrutin.  Abdoulaye Saine, professeur en sciences politiques, s’inquiète de son influence persistante : « Je suis très gêné de voir Yahya Jammeh tenter d’influencer l’élection. C’est politique. Malgré tout, certains continuent à l’apprécier et ont apprécié la manière dont il a géré le pays. Il y a des gens, y compris au sein de l’administration, qui restent de fervents soutiens. Personnellement, je souhaite qu’il reste là où il est, jusqu’à ce qu’on puisse le juger pour toutes les atrocités commises. »

La publication du rapport de la Commission vérité et réconciliation la semaine dernière pose la question de la mise en œuvre de ses recommandations.  Pour Essa Njie, maître de conférences en sciences politiques à l’université de Gambie, le système perdure malgré l’alternance : « Toutes les personnes au gouvernement, les plus proches du pouvoir et du président, ont travaillé pour Yahya Jammeh. La Nouvelle Gambie a été un rêve et cela a été une illusion pour de nombreux Gambiens.

The body of a man found wrapped in cloth on the roadside near Lohiya Garden in Magarpatta, Hadapsar on Friday has been identified as Santosh (34), a resident of Malwadi, Hadapsar.  Police have confirmed the death to be a murder.

Santosh, who lived with unidentified roommates, was employed by caterer Narayan Vyas (30) in Loni Kalbhor.  He had previously worked for another caterer, Jayesh Kadam (32), also a Hadapsar resident.  Santosh had taken a temporary assignment with Vyas on December 31st.

According to Senior Police Inspector Balkrushna Kadam of Hadapsar police station, Jayesh Kadam discovered Santosh's body at Vyas's establishment on the morning of January 1st after receiving a call that Santosh was unresponsive.  Fearing the implications of having a dead body, Kadam placed Santosh in a tempo.  He attempted to locate Santosh's residence in Malwadi but was unsuccessful, ultimately disposing of the body near Lohiya Garden.

A post-mortem conducted at Sassoon General Hospital revealed that Santosh had been strangled. Consequently, a murder case (Section 302 of the Indian Penal Code) was registered at Hadapsar police station and subsequently transferred to Loni Kalbhor police station.

A woman revealed her impressive carpet transformation, taking it from cream to a stylish grey in just over an hour using £1 worth of dye.  She shared her savvy technique in the Facebook group Mrs Hinch Cleaning Tips, explaining how she achieved the chic update with minimal effort.

"So, just want to say the Dylon in a spray bottle really does work," she wrote.  "Brought my carpet up like new as well with all the rubbing in.... this took 1.5 hours to do and cost me a total of £1 for the dye I used."

Her method involved mixing four tablespoons of Smoke Grey Dylon fabric dye with 700ml of warm water.  She used three bottles of this mixture on her carpet.  Applying the dye with a spray bottle while wearing gloves, she left it to dry overnight and reported no color transfer the next day.

Her post generated significant interest, racking up over 2,200 comments and impressing many.  "I had no idea you can dye a carpet," one person admitted. Another added, "Would never have thought of doing that, looks fab."

The Dylon Dye Pod fabric dye in Smoke Grey, which she used for the project, is currently available for around £5.  This clever hack echoes a previous story where a woman similarly transformed her brown stairs to grey using a £5 Wilko product.  This budget-friendly approach to home improvement contrasts sharply with other recent stories, such as a new mum's emotional £500,000 Grand Designs renovation and a single mum's surprise return from holiday to a £50 living room makeover courtesy of her parents.

«Je pense que communiquer via des images est l’un de ces médiums que vous allez voir décoller dans les années qui arrivent, grâce à une évolution fondamentale de la technologie concernée.»  Ces mots prophétiques, prononcés par Kevyn Systrom à un journaliste de TechCrunch le 6 octobre 2010, annonçaient l'essor fulgurant d'Instagram. Dix ans après sa création, le plus grand exploit d'Instagram n’est pas d’avoir révolutionné la photographie: c’est d’avoir su en utiliser l’essence pour redéfinir toute la grammaire visuelle d’une époque.  Le réseau social né autour de la photographie s’est totalement émancipé du huitième art pour devenir la plate-forme incontournable des stars et des grandes marques.

Les dix comptes les plus suivis d’Instagram illustrent parfaitement cette transformation.  Cristiano Ronaldo, Kim Kardashian, Justin Bieber, Lionel Messi, Beyoncé…  À eux dix, ces célébrités, dont l'activité n'a aucun lien direct avec la photographie, totalisent plus d’un milliard et 700 millions de «followers». National Geographic, symbole d'une approche plus traditionnelle de l'image, arrive seulement à la 11e place.  Et jusqu’à la cinquantième place du classement, le règne des musiciens, des acteurs et des sportifs se confirme.

Pour l'anecdote, la photo d’un simple œuf, mise en ligne dans le cadre d’un défi, a récolté 54,9 millions de likes, devenant la photo la plus likée d’Instagram.  Une preuve supplémentaire du pouvoir viral de la plateforme et de son éloignement progressif du monde de la photographie artistique.

While the world has been comprehensively mapped in 2D for decades, the vertical dimension remains underexplored despite its vast potential. This gap is particularly critical in the Global South due to inherent mapping inequalities and diverse data availability.  Accurately representing human settlements in 3D requires describing the vertical dimension in addition to 2D footprints and shapes [19, 11, 14, 7, 23]. Such 3D representations are crucial for various applications, including quiet and shadow routing [35], environmental exposure modeling [2, 40, 34], architecture and city planning [32, 36], and population capacity estimation [37, 21].  However, deriving low-cost, open-source 3D building representations at scale remains a challenge.  Here, "low-cost" primarily refers to the cost of data acquisition for 3D building modeling.

Traditional methods like photogrammetry and remote sensing make 3D city reconstruction expensive and time-consuming, often requiring extensive expertise and substantial geospatial data (e.g., cadastral data, airborne photogrammetry data). This poses a significant barrier for stakeholders and city governments with limited funding seeking to establish 3D city modeling systems.  Fortunately, the growing availability of Volunteer Geographic Information (VGI) and crowdsourcing technology [16] offers a scalable, low-cost solution for 3D world mapping.  OpenStreetMap (OSM), the most successful VGI project, has emerged as a valuable global data source for creating large-scale 3D city models [14, 12].  For example, a method for generating large-scale 3D urban reconstructions by jointly processing OSM and multi-sensor remote sensing data (e.g., TanDEM-X and Sentinel-2) was developed in [10].  Milojevic-Dupont et al. [27] demonstrated the potential of accurately predicting building heights using only morphometric features (urban forms) extracted from OSM data (e.g., building and street geometry).

(NOTICIAS YA).- Los residentes de Colorado están enfrentando un aumento considerable en sus facturas de gas, con incrementos de dos dígitos debido a que los proveedores transfieren el costo de la inflación del gas natural a sus clientes.  Este aumento, que se suma a otros cargos adicionales, amenaza con impactar fuertemente los bolsillos de los habitantes del estado, según advierten la Comisión de Servicios Públicos y los defensores de los consumidores.

Concretamente, las tarifas de gas de Xcel aumentarán más del 14% en promedio para el consumidor durante el último trimestre del año.  En algunas áreas atendidas por Black Hills Energy, las facturas se dispararán hasta un 50%.  Atmos Energy y Colorado Natural Gas también han anunciado aumentos en los costos del gas, que oscilan entre el 11% y el 24% para el consumidor residencial promedio durante los meses de invierno.

Además del gas, la electricidad también está subiendo.  Empresas como Xcel, que utilizan gas natural para generar electricidad,  incrementarán sus tarifas eléctricas en un 3% con respecto al trimestre anterior para compensar el aumento del precio de esta materia prima.  A modo de ejemplo, Xcel genera actualmente alrededor del 37% de su electricidad en Colorado con plantas de gas natural.

Ante esta situación, la Comisión de Servicios Públicos de Colorado (PUC) ha tomado cartas en el asunto.  Esta semana, la PUC solicitó a las empresas de servicios públicos que presenten un informe dentro de tres semanas detallando el costo total previsto para los consumidores en marzo de 2022, en comparación con el año anterior.  Según James Cullen, portavoz de la PUC, “La PUC está solicitando que las empresas de servicios públicos nos brinden una visión general holística de cómo se verán las facturas de los consumidores más adelante este invierno”.  La PUC tomará en cuenta estos informes al considerar nuevos cargos potenciales.

Wi-Fi, ubiquitous in public and private spaces due to its simplicity, reliability, and flexibility, presents a unique opportunity for environmental sensing.  By analyzing signal features like phase differences and Doppler shifts, we can detect and track targets.  This has spurred research into Wi-Fi-based target sensing, particularly at lower frequencies, using methods like fingerprint-based and geometry-based approaches.  These methods, while effective due to rich multipath signals and low attenuation, rely heavily on channel state information (CSI), and their accuracy is limited by antenna numbers and bandwidth.  Moreover, these systems, primarily designed for communication, haven't prioritized sensing.  Recognizing this, the IEEE 802.11bf task group (TGbf) is adapting the Wi-Fi standard to incorporate sensing capabilities, including utilizing 802.11ad and 802.11ay protocols operating in the millimeter wave (mmWave) band, promising enhanced sensing performance.

MmWave sensing, while attractive, faces challenges due to high path loss and susceptibility to blockage.  Phased-array antennas and beamforming techniques mitigate attenuation by enabling estimation of the angle of departure (AoD) and angle of arrival (AoA).  The large bandwidth of mmWave further provides high distance resolution, facilitating accurate geometric target sensing.

Prior work demonstrates mmWave's potential for sub-decimeter accuracy in short-range sensing, such as gesture tracking, by leveraging two Wi-Fi links to detect CSI phase changes. However, these approaches often require specific transceiver placement and assume a line-of-sight (LoS) path.  POLAR, a passive target sensing algorithm for IEEE 802.11ad devices, uses AoD and time of flight (ToF) from the channel impulse response (CIR) to sense targets, but only in 2D space and assuming LoS conditions.  Non-line-of-sight (NLoS) conditions, with increased ToF and altered AoA, introduce significant sensing errors if treated as LoS measurements.  While monostatic radar offers direct range and radial speed estimation, multi-device mmWave sensing, with its multi-angle detection, holds greater potential for improved accuracy.

This paper explores a novel sensing method between two devices in 3D space, a significantly more challenging problem.  The absence of a LoS path makes baseline information unknown, rendering bistatic triangle calculations infeasible.  Furthermore, diverse target locations on different planes and the complex geometry between targets, transmitter, and receiver add to the complexity.  To address these challenges, we propose mm3NLoS, an enhanced mmWave sensing algorithm for 3D NLoS environments, which exploits the geometric relationship of multiple NLoS paths.  Our key contributions are:  (1) an enhanced sensing approach for 3D NLoS environments, mitigating performance degradation in weak or blocked LoS scenarios; (2) the introduction of projection to simplify the problem and derive an analytical expression for the direction and distance between target and receiver using AoD, AoA, and ToF of two propagation paths; and (3) a performance comparison with the POLAR algorithm using simulated data, demonstrating the superior performance of our method regardless of LoS path availability.

ZARAGOZA, 29 Jun. (EUROPA PRESS) - Los delegados del Gobierno en Aragón, Cataluña, La Rioja, País Vasco y Navarra han visitado este lunes las instalaciones del IV Batallón de la Unidad Militar de Emergencias (UME) en la Base Aérea de Zaragoza.  Esta unidad, que cumplirá su 15 aniversario el 7 de octubre, ha realizado 390 intervenciones en su zona de actuación durante los 100 días del estado de alarma por la pandemia de la COVID-19.

La visita ha estado encabezada por los delegados del Gobierno Denis Itxaso (País Vasco), Teresa Cunillera (Cataluña), María Marrodán (La Rioja), Pilar Alegría (Aragón) y José Luis Arasti (Navarra), acompañados de sus subdelegados.  El general jefe de la Base Aérea, José Luis Ortiz-Cañavate, y el teniente coronel Alejandro Morón, jefe del IV Batallón de la UME, les han guiado por las instalaciones.

La jornada comenzó con una presentación del jefe de la Unidad sobre las capacidades de la UME y sus posibilidades de intervención ante diferentes riesgos, tanto naturales como medioambientales. Se hizo especial hincapié en los medios y el personal destinados a la lucha contra incendios forestales,  destacando su disposición para apoyar a los dispositivos autonómicos en la extinción de grandes incendios.

Los delegados visionaron un vídeo sobre las actuaciones de la UME en toda España desde su creación, visitaron el Centro de Operaciones del Batallón y recorrieron una exposición estática sobre las capacidades desarrolladas en las distintas campañas. Finalmente, firmaron en el Libro de Honor.

En declaraciones a los medios, la delegada del Gobierno en Aragón, Pilar Alegría, agradeció "el magnífico e impagable trabajo" de los 450 hombres y mujeres del Batallón durante casi 15 años, destacando "la labor encomiable" realizada durante la pandemia en las cinco comunidades autónomas de su zona de actuación.  Mencionó la desinfección de residencias de mayores, estaciones de transporte, centros de salud y hospitales, así como su papel en la extinción de incendios forestales, especialmente durante el verano, y en otros fenómenos naturales.  Alegría resaltó la humildad y la vocación de servicio público de los miembros de la UME, cualidades que "les han hecho estar al frente de esta situación" de pandemia y que ahora les permiten continuar con la campaña de prevención y extinción de incendios.

El teniente coronel Alejandro Morón explicó que el IV Batallón se puso a disposición de las autoridades desde el inicio del estado de alarma, cumpliendo con los cometidos ordenados por las comunidades autónomas.  Describió la situación vivida como de "cierta normalidad", en ocasiones "muy intensa", pero sin  problemas "muy desagradables" como en otras regiones.  Detalló la labor de apoyo en residencias con un "número muy elevado" de contagios, coordinándose con los servicios sanitarios autonómicos.  Recordó también la participación del Batallón en el operativo ante la Dana Gloria a principios de año, que dejó incomunicadas por nieve a numerosas poblaciones de Zaragoza y Teruel.

The planet practically reverberated with the announcement, broadcast simultaneously from every speaker on Earth. Scientists later confirmed the absolute simultaneity, detecting no light-speed delays.  Even unplugged speakers inexplicably emitted the proclamation.

The first question on everyone's mind: "Who sent the message?" The second: "What's Galactic Deathball?"

Over the next few months, wars ceased, long-standing conflicts resolved, and even the most isolationist governments engaged in global diplomacy. The overarching question became: How do we prepare for the unknown—an event of unpredictable nature and arrival?

While the public remained unaware of the closed-door discussions, the abrupt shift in the Olympic Games hinted at the underlying changes. Events took on a distinctly martial focus. Governments sponsored training facilities emphasizing multi-disciplinary competitions like triathlons, biathlons, and even newly invented hybrids like the MMArathon. It became clear that the world was cultivating peak-human athletes, handsomely rewarded, to compete in Galactic Deathball.

Years passed uneventfully. The initial global unity eroded with time, and the fervor for the new sports waned, losing sponsorship in many countries.  However, dedicated communities of practitioners kept them alive.

Then came the second message. A copy of “The Rulebook” materialized beside every sleeping person, staggered in delivery.  Written in two languages—one unsettlingly alien, the other the recipient's native tongue—it provided the ultimate Rosetta Stone.  The alien language was deciphered almost as quickly as it was uploaded online.

“The Rulebook” proved a partial misnomer.  Much of the text detailed the game's history, past events, and background information—more scholarly treatise than technical manual.  Perhaps this was because the game itself was deceptively simple.

The playing field: an equilateral polygon, minimum four sides, ranging from a quarter-mile to just under a half-mile across.  The number of sides equaled twice the number of competing teams.

Teams were assigned starting positions along the polygon's faces, the order determined by a draw. The Deathball—a one-quarter kilogram iron sphere with universally graspable handholds—was placed at the field's center.

Upon the starting signal, players had five seconds to enter the field. Leaving without the Deathball meant death. Leaving with it granted the power to choose who died, followed by a field reset. The game ended when only one team remained.

The only restrictions: players had to be unmodified members of their species, and equipment was limited to worn items extending no more than four millimeters from the skin in any given pose.

The game clearly prioritized strength, speed, and above all, endurance. MMArathon’s popularity surged.

Two more years passed before The Ship arrived. Earth was ready. Strategies were honed, a non-lethal version of Deathball had spawned eight world championships, and the team—the Heroes of Earth—boarded the ship amidst a roar of global support.

The team comprised the planet's finest physical specimens: long-distance sprinters built for speed, brutal martial artists, all possessing the endurance to run marathons and fight multiple consecutive matches.

As the match began, every screen on Earth switched on, broadcasting the event.  The planet watched, waited, and worried.

Worry proved unnecessary.

Dean looked at me like I was a psychopath. "You did *what?!*"

Craig added, "Seriously, Brian, that's really messed up. I think you may need help."

"Guys, guys, come on," I pleaded. "Can you please just let me explain *why* I did it? I’m not a bad guy, not some sociopathic sadist trying to make life miserable. It was the only way I could guarantee human longevity."

"You guys may preach at me for making these things happen," I shouted, "but if I didn't, I'd end up in worlds like yours!"

"What do you mean, 'worlds like ours'?" Dean questioned.

"Dean, your world is so overpopulated they're starting sea colonies and looking for space on other planets just for shelter. You've had to artificially manufacture food, and there *still* isn't enough. Every time you went back to Roman times to give them the latest medical knowledge, you kept giving more and more. They weren't wise enough to realize that if everyone lived for 200 years and disease was eradicated, they'd run out of room on Earth by the next millennium. People *need* to die for new life to prosper!"

"Hey," Dean yelled back, "they may be starving, but at least they're not dying!"

"I'd rather be dead than spend my entire life feeling like I was *going* to die!" I bellowed.

Craig, with a smug grin, said, "You two should both take inspiration from *my* world."

"Don't get me started on you, Craig," I retorted. "You may think removing religion was a great idea, but what about the art, the cities, the architecture inspired by it? You've created a race of logical, scientific beings who have evolved out of even feeling love! Your world is so boring and efficient, I don't even know how you spend time there anymore. You created nothing to rebel against, nothing to give people hope, and most importantly, you removed anything that made them remotely human… So yes, I may have created bad people, evil religions, corporations, and organizations.  Yes, I may have to occasionally cause a global war to help reduce the population or send a tornado down to let them improve their knowledge of weather systems and forecasting. But goddammit, I also gave them love, and hope, and free will! If that makes me crazy, then go ahead and call me crazy, but I can bet you my people are a hell of a lot happier than either of yours! All I'm doing is keeping their intelligence from overtaking their wisdom, allowing them to make mistakes and be human. The fact that *you* won't let them fail is the reason why your worlds are doomed."

The design of distributed controllers presents a significant challenge due to the scarcity of dedicated numerical tools compared to the well-equipped centralized design context.  Existing computational methods, such as those in [1]-[4], employ specialized techniques to address the inherent numerical complexities of distributed control.

One notable approach, presented in [5], attempts to enforce sparsity constraints directly on a Finite Impulse Response (FIR) approximation of the Youla parameter.  However, this method relies on restrictive assumptions like Quadratic Invariance (QI) and strong stabilizability [6], and, crucially, cannot handle sparsity patterns in non-sparse affine expressions of the Youla parameter, as highlighted in Section 5 of that work.

The System-Level Synthesis (SLS) framework, introduced in [7], addressed some of these limitations.  However, its focus on discrete-time systems has led to other promising architectures being overlooked.  For example, Network Realization Function (NRF) representations, discussed in [8] and [9], offer an alternative approach but have been overshadowed by the FIR approximation methods prevalent within the SLS framework.

Jamais l’organisme Statistique Canada n’a enregistré un second trimestre aussi catastrophique pour l’économie depuis 1961. Comme la grande majorité des pays, le Canada subit de plein fouet les répercussions de la pandémie de coronavirus et du confinement.  Selon Statistiques Canada, le produit intérieur brut (PIB) a chuté de 11,9% en avril, mai et juin, essuyant un recul historique au deuxième trimestre.  Les entreprises ont moins exporté et moins vendu au début du printemps.

Cependant, l'économie canadienne peut aussi être observée avec un certain optimisme.  Paradoxalement, les revenus disponibles des Canadiens ont progressé de 10% pendant cette même période, et l’épargne de 28%.  Cette situation s'explique par le solide filet de sécurité mis en place par le gouvernement pour compenser les pertes de revenus des entreprises et des particuliers. Prestation d’urgence, subventions salariales, allocations familiales : l’État n’a pas lésiné sur les moyens pour soutenir les citoyens.  Faute d'occasions de dépenser, les Canadiens ont ainsi pu épargner davantage.

Ce choix a un coût : le déficit s’élève désormais à plus de 280 milliards d’euros, soit 20% du PIB. Malgré cela, les stratèges canadiens restent confiants et estiment que l’économie devrait reprendre rapidement. Les statistiques de juin sont déjà encourageantes. De plus, les règles de confinement strictes ayant permis de contenir l’épidémie, le climat est propice à la reprise des investissements.

Par contre, la situation semble s’améliorer plus vite que prévu.

Avec notre correspondante à Québec, Pascale Guéricolas

A strange compulsion drew me to the mirror as I prepared for bed.  A sudden insecurity gripped me. *Did my hair look alright? Was there something amiss with my clothes?*  I peered into the glass. Everything seemed normal. The same brown hair, the same green eyes—perfectly ordinary.  I exhaled, relieved. Then, bending down to untie my shoes, I saw it.  Movement in the mirror.  

My reflection, or so I thought, stood upright, even as I remained bent over.  I straightened up, rubbing my eyes.  *Was I tired? Imagining things?*  It seemed impossibly real.  I tentatively waved my arm. My reflection mirrored the gesture. Everything appeared normal.  *Huh. Weird.* I dismissed it and went to bed.

The next morning, I awoke refreshed, but the memory of the mirror lingered.  I rose and went to investigate.  Approaching the mirror, I saw… nothing. A flicker of panic—*was I a vampire? Had I vanished?*—then my reflection materialized, walking towards the mirror as I had. It was lagging again.  This was definitely happening. I waved, and again, my reflection followed, albeit delayed.  I stared, bewildered. Why was my reflection lagging? And why did it return to normal after a few seconds? I experimented, wiggling, making random movements, all duplicated by my tardy reflection.

After work, I returned to the mirror. This time, my reflection appeared simultaneously.  Everything was normal. I jumped, flailed my arms, and my reflection kept pace, mirroring my every move.  Relief washed over me, tinged with confusion. *Why? What had happened?*

To this day, the mystery remains.

Driveless cars, while promising a technological breakthrough, present significant safety and logistical concerns that warrant careful consideration before widespread adoption.  The central issue lies in the untested nature of these vehicles in real-world scenarios.  While the idea of autonomous driving is appealing, relying entirely on technology for safety raises serious questions.

One primary concern is the unpredictable nature of other drivers. Human drivers can react instinctively to erratic maneuvers by other vehicles, such as swerving or sudden braking.  A driveless car, relying on algorithms, might not possess the same flexibility and adaptability. For example, a sudden swerve by another driver into your lane might cause a human to instinctively steer into the next lane. A computer, however, might react by abruptly stopping, potentially causing a chain reaction accident. This lack of human-like judgment in complex situations poses a significant safety risk.

Beyond the interactions with other drivers, the car's own functionality presents challenges.  What happens if the car malfunctions?  Every machine is prone to glitches, and in a driveless car, a glitch could have disastrous consequences.  Can we guarantee that the computer will always make the correct decision in a split second?

Furthermore, practical considerations like fuel and battery life add another layer of complexity. A self-driving car cannot simply pull over to a gas station when it's running low on fuel, nor can it easily be jump-started if the battery dies.  A distracted or sleeping passenger might not notice these issues until it's too late, leaving them stranded. While alerts could be implemented, there's no guarantee they will always be effective. This reliance on technology without a reliable backup system creates potential for hazardous situations.

Road conditions also pose a significant challenge. Potholes, debris, and other road hazards require drivers to make quick decisions and adjustments.  While humans can easily navigate around these obstacles, a driveless car's ability to perceive and react appropriately is still under development.

For over three decades, the Alleghany Education Foundation has funded the college educations of thousands of students in Alleghany County. Established in 1985 by former Alleghany County Schools Superintendent John Woodruff, the foundation has awarded millions of dollars in scholarships, enabling students in this sparsely populated North Carolina mountain county to attend institutions ranging from community colleges to Yale.

This year, however, the foundation saw a decline in scholarship applications from Alleghany High School students—90 compared to 104 in 2020 and 111 in 2019.  While seemingly small, this reduction is significant for a school with approximately 400 students.

This decline mirrors a statewide and national trend following the COVID-19 pandemic.  A June report from the National Student Clearinghouse Research Center revealed that overall spring higher education enrollment fell by 3.5% (603,000 students) to 16.9 million from 17.5 million. This drop is seven times greater than the previous year's decline.  Undergraduate enrollment accounted for the entire loss, decreasing by 4.9% (727,000 students).  While all postsecondary sectors experienced undergraduate enrollment declines, community colleges were hardest hit with a 9.5% drop (476,000 students), representing over 65% of the total undergraduate enrollment loss.  North Carolina community colleges experienced an 11% enrollment decline in fall 2020.

Wilkes Community College (WCC) in Wilkesboro, which partners with the Alleghany Education Foundation to offer last-dollar scholarships providing Alleghany County students with two years of tuition-free education, has experienced an even steeper enrollment decline.

“Unfortunately, we saw a staggering 16% enrollment drop during COVID last year,” said WCC President Jeff Cox. “Despite our efforts with the WCC Education Promise program—launching this fall to provide a tuition-free guarantee to all eligible students in Wilkes, Ashe, and Alleghany counties—enrollment remains low this fall.”

In rural Alleghany County, the reasons for declining college enrollment are complex, but the combined impact of COVID-19 and poverty is undeniable. According to Alleghany High School Assistant Principal Melissa Vestal, the blend of synchronous and asynchronous instruction last year allowed some students to work and complete coursework outside traditional school hours.  “After entering the workforce, some students became reliant on their income and chose to continue working rather than pursue education, stating they would ‘go to school once they had some money saved,’” Vestal said. “Students who weren’t planning to attend college didn’t bother applying for scholarships.”

This decline in college enrollment, and consequently scholarship applications, comes as the Alleghany Education Foundation’s available funds have surpassed $7 million—a substantial amount for a county with only about 11,000 residents and a median household income of $37,830, according to 2019 U.S. census data.  The foundation relies solely on private donations, often testamentary gifts, some exceeding $1 million, and many connected to Woodruff or his wife, Rita, a longtime hospice nurse.

“We feel like John’s still working in this county,” said Warren Taylor, the foundation’s current president.  “We received a million-dollar testamentary gift designated for the John Woodruff fund. These gifts come from people he knew, a testament to his relationships.”

Before the pandemic, the Alleghany Education Foundation and WCC formed a partnership to leverage these funds and expand educational opportunities. Cox, a former Alleghany County Schools superintendent and Alleghany Education Foundation board member, noticed the declining WCC enrollment from Alleghany County and believed the foundation could help.

“Our Alleghany County enrollment had dwindled to single digits,” he said. “Few students were taking advantage of community college; many were going to universities, but often returned due to financial issues or the overwhelming environment of larger institutions.”

The resulting partnership created a last-dollar scholarship fund, guaranteeing two tuition-free years at WCC for eligible Alleghany County graduating seniors.  Students must meet criteria including financial need, GPA, and extracurricular involvement.  As a last-dollar scholarship, the fund covers any remaining tuition after federal aid like Pell Grants.

“Alleghany County enrollment was as low as seven students in 2014, but now we have 20 to 30 students annually, about 25% of graduating seniors,” Cox said. “Before the pandemic, we saw a significant increase.”

Similar promise programs exist at other North Carolina community colleges. Several schools offer free tuition this fall through combined federal, state, local, and philanthropic funding.  Institutions like Forsyth Technical Community College and Southwestern Community College have seen application increases due to these programs.  North Carolina’s 2021 high school graduates from low- and middle-income families may also qualify for the new Longleaf Commitment grants, providing at least $2,800 for tuition and fees at any state community college.

WCC expanded its free tuition program to two neighboring counties this fall. “Inspired by the Alleghany program, we’re extending the same concept to Wilkes and Ashe counties,” Cox explained.  “We’re currently fundraising $8.5 million to endow this comprehensive program.”

While enrollment hasn’t yet risen to Cox’s expectations, he hopes the initiative will reach more students as the pandemic’s impact recedes.  For students in these rural counties, many of whom cannot afford college without such assistance, this funding represents a crucial opportunity to break the cycle of poverty.

“For many students, starting with two years at WCC is a better solution,” Cox said. “Even for those aspiring to a four-year degree, it’s a good starting point. While a four-year degree isn’t for everyone, postsecondary credentials are essential for living-wage jobs.”

I clicked yes, and the goggles began to load heaven for me. It was empty. Acres and acres of sunny grassland stretched out before me. A soft breeze licked the grass and slightly cooled the warm sunlight. Trees of all sorts dotted the fields, but there was nobody there. Not a single soul.

I tore off the goggles. If nobody was in heaven—none of the great holy people; popes, saints, bishops—then what chance did I have?  And there was only one other alternative. Hell was bad enough, with trillions of souls screaming out at once. Lakes of fire, gusts of wind that blew you hither and thither, horrible torture devices manned by even more horrible demons. There wasn't a single happy face; all were suffering equally. And from the grotesquely twisted faces, I could tell it was an inhuman level of suffering.

La Federación Departamental de Choferes 1° de Mayo planteó la posibilidad de instalar un cobrador sindical en el peaje de la Autopista La Paz-El Alto, luego de que el Gobierno anunciara la suspensión del convenio entre el sector y Vías Bolivia.  Este convenio permitía la retención de Bs 0,20 de la tasa de rodaje para su posterior transferencia a las cuentas de los dirigentes.

El secretario ejecutivo de la federación, Rubén Sánchez, indicó que solicitaron una reunión con Vías Bolivia para aclarar las condiciones de la suspensión y proponer la instalación de un cobrador sindical en el peaje.

“Necesitamos aclarar si se trata de una anulación definitiva del convenio o solo un congelamiento.  En su defecto, proponemos tener un cobrador sindical en ambas casetas del peaje para recaudar los Bs 0,20”, explicó Sánchez.

Según Sánchez, si el acuerdo se anula, la tarifa del peaje debería reducirse a Bs 1,60 en lugar de los Bs 1,80 actuales, de los cuales se descuentan Bs 0,20 para el inexistente fondo ProSalud.

La Resolución Ministerial 7729 del 7 de abril de 1992 estableció una tarifa de Bs 1,80 para vehículos livianos de transporte público que circulan por la autopista La Paz-El Alto.  Esta tarifa se mantuvo vigente hasta 2003.

En 2003, durante el gobierno de Gonzalo Sánchez de Lozada, se firmó un acuerdo con la concesionaria Toll S.A. para reducir Bs 0,20 de la tarifa de Bs 1,80 y destinarlos al mencionado fondo.  Este convenio fue ratificado en 2004 mediante la Resolución Ministerial 082 del gobierno de Carlos Mesa.  En la práctica, los choferes continuaron pagando Bs 1,80, con la diferencia de que Bs 0,20 teóricamente se destinarían a su seguro de salud, beneficio que nunca se materializó.

El diputado opositor Wilson Santamaría (UD) calificó el acuerdo entre Vías Bolivia y los choferes como ilegal, argumentando que implicaba la transferencia de fondos públicos a cuentas privadas.

Mike interrupted the court proceedings. “Your Honor,” he said quickly, “I plead guilty.”  He realized, with a chilling sense of self-awareness, that he was just as insane as his daughter.  He couldn't bear to listen to any more testimony; the courtroom drama faded as his mind returned to the true events of that night.

It was early summer evening, the sky just beginning to darken. Spaghetti noodles were boiling on the stove, and Mike was sorting through bills at the kitchen table. His daughter, Cathy, was playing outside. He called her through the window, and after a second unanswered call, panic propelled him out of the house.

He found Cathy curled into a ball on the side of the road. Dark red spots pooled on the asphalt, drawing his eye to the skid marks and a '79 Cutlass in the ditch. The driver was nowhere in sight.  His mind raced as he ran to Cathy's side. “Cat, Little Cat,” he cried, turning her over. “Cathy? Can you hear me?”

Slowly, one green eye opened. She looked at him and smiled. Relief washed over him; she was alive. But the blood!  His stomach lurched.  Clutched tightly to Cathy's body was their cat, Pancakes.  Limp and broken.  The blood was the cat’s. Cathy, he realized, must have witnessed the accident and run to Pancakes, trying to protect him even in death.

He gently took the blood-soaked cat from Cathy and told her to go back to the house and turn off the stove.  He retrieved a shovel from the garage and walked towards the public trail entrance near the abandoned Cutlass. The once futuristic dream of driverless cars is rapidly becoming a reality.  Engineers and scientists are no longer confined to science fiction; they are actively developing self-driving technology.  Major car manufacturers are investing heavily in this innovation, bringing us closer to a world where we can summon a vehicle with a simple text or call. This technology promises not only convenience—eliminating the need for car maintenance and repairs—but also a potential transformation of transportation as we know it.

But what practical applications will these vehicles have?  One key benefit lies in providing transportation for those without driver's licenses. Teenagers and young adults could easily summon a driverless car for rides to and from school, extracurricular activities, or sporting events, relieving parents of the burden of chauffeuring.  This technology could also revolutionize the taxi industry, addressing safety concerns associated with traditional taxis.  Unlike human drivers, a driverless system eliminates the risk of price manipulation or unnecessarily long routes.  Passengers can expect efficient, fairly priced rides to their destinations.  Furthermore, the potential fuel efficiency of these vehicles could significantly reduce our dependence on fossil fuels.

Beyond convenience and cost, driverless technology has the potential to drastically improve road safety.  While fully autonomous vehicles are still under development, existing driver-assistance systems are already demonstrating life-saving capabilities.  Subaru, for example, has pioneered safety features that allow vehicles to brake automatically in emergencies.  Sensors detect potential collisions and activate the brakes before a human driver can react.  Consider a scenario where a distracted driver backing out of a driveway fails to notice oncoming traffic.  The car's sensors detect the danger and automatically stop, preventing a potentially disastrous accident.  Such technology can mitigate human error and prevent countless accidents caused by inattention or delayed reaction times.

In conclusion, while driverless technology is still evolving, its potential is undeniable.  We are on the cusp of a transportation revolution, with safer, more efficient travel within reach.  Beyond individual benefits, the widespread adoption of driverless cars could transform our economy and reduce our reliance on traditional transportation systems. Even if fully autonomous vehicles remain a work in progress, the advances in driver-assistance systems are already making our roads significantly safer.  The future of transportation is not just driverless; it's safer, smarter, and more efficient.

ERC acepta a Sánchez para levantar el 155, pero la CUP se abstendrá sin un programa republicano

La CUP presiona con sus cuatro diputados en el Parlament. JxCat pide tiempo a Torrent para convencerlos.  PSC y CatECP rechazan investir a Sánchez.

La secretaria general de ERC y líder parlamentaria, Marta Rovira, comunicó formalmente este lunes al presidente del Parlament, Roger Torrent, el apoyo de su partido a la candidatura de Jordi Sánchez (JxCat) a la presidencia de la Generalitat. El objetivo es levantar la aplicación del artículo 155.  Sin embargo, la CUP asegura que se abstendrá si Sánchez, o cualquier otro candidato, no presenta un programa republicano. Tras el anuncio de Torrent, Puigdemont y Comín podrían verse obligados a renunciar a su escaño (no pueden delegar su voto) para que las cuentas independentistas cuadren y Sánchez pueda ser investido.

En rueda de prensa posterior a su reunión con Torrent, Rovira explicó que el apoyo a Sánchez busca la formación de un Govern que permita a Cataluña "recuperar las instituciones y levantar el 155".  Este apoyo, fruto de un preacuerdo con JxCat (cuyos detalles no reveló),  depende del respaldo de la CUP, que por el momento no se ha concretado.

El otro pilar independentista necesario para la mayoría parlamentaria, la CUP, advirtió a JxCat y ERC que sus cuatro diputados se abstendrán en la investidura de cualquier candidato que no presente un programa republicano catalán,  considerando autonomista la propuesta actual de Govern.

Carlos Riera, tras reunirse con Torrent,  afirmó: "Un candidato autonomista contará con nuestra abstención. Con un programa republicano sobre la mesa, aceptaremos cualquier nombre". La premisa es clara: solo un programa de desarrollo de una república obtendrá su apoyo. De lo contrario, se abstendrán.  "Si se precipita una investidura, contarán con nuestra abstención",  reiteró,  insistiendo en el  desacuerdo  con ERC y JxCat sobre el programa de Govern expresado en el Consell Polític de la CUP.

La CUP busca poner a prueba la "verdadera voluntad de soberanía republicana institucional" de JxCat y ERC, considerando que sus cuatro abstenciones son decisivas para cualquier candidato.

JxCat, a través de sus portavoces Elsa Artadi y Eduard Pujol, solicitó a Torrent tiempo para convencer a la CUP, pidiendo que el pleno no se convoque antes de 48 horas.  Artadi explicó que JxCat ultima un acuerdo con ERC que se presentará próximamente, y que confían en que satisfaga a la CUP al profundizar en la "construcción de la república" y el proceso constituyente.

Sin la CUP, los independentistas pierden la mayoría absoluta de 70 diputados, imposibilitando la investidura en primera vuelta. En segunda vuelta, basta una mayoría simple (más síes que noes).  JxCat y ERC suman 66 diputados frente a los 65 del resto de grupos, pero el voto de cuatro de ellos (Puigdemont, Comín, Junqueras y Sánchez) no está garantizado.

Junqueras (ERC) y Sánchez (JxCat) previsiblemente podrán delegar su voto desde prisión. Sin embargo, Puigdemont (JxCat) y Comín (ERC) lo tienen difícil, ya que los letrados del Parlament y el Tribunal Supremo advierten que delegar el voto desde Bélgica contraviene el reglamento.

Despair etched Sean's pale face in the near darkness. He sighed and turned to Jordan. "Face it. We're lost."

"No, we're not," Jordan huffed, struggling to catch up.  He poked his head out from behind a nearby oak. "Look, we only left camp half an hour ago. We can't be *that* far. Besides, we can just wait until morning to go back."

Sean shook his head in frustration, then flinched as something hit him. "Damn it, Jordan, now it's starting to rain.  Got any bright ideas?"

Jordan grinned, pointing to their left.  A rocky outcropping with a crevice at its base looked just big enough to shelter them. He jogged over to investigate.

"Watch it, moron," Sean called after him, reluctantly following. "Hundred bucks says there are snakes in there." But Jordan had already disappeared into the ground, his voice echoing from what was clearly more than just a crevice.

"Get down here! This is insane!"

Sean lay down and slid under the rock.  His initial claustrophobia vanished as he found himself in a spacious cavern.

"Déjà vu, am I right?" Jordan chirped.

"Not really," Sean replied. "I can't even see anything. It's pitch black."

Jordan chuckled. "Okay, yeah, I know. We *were* just outside where there was a little light, and it's really dark in here. But this cave…if you close your eyes, does it almost feel like nothing changed at all?"

"Uh…"

"And if you close your eyes, does it almost feel like you've been here before? *Serious* déjà vu, dude."

Sean's eyes, adjusting to the dark, could now make out Jordan's grin.

"Maybe, I guess. But we're still lost, idiot," Sean snapped, his patience wearing thin.  "We're alone, no food or water, and nobody even knows we left camp. How am I supposed to be optimistic about this?"

2019年2月10日，中国时报社论指出，陆委会主委陈明通年前拜会高雄市长韩国瑜及台南市长黄伟哲，并宣称将陆续拜访六都市长，旨在建立两岸互动战略协同共识。然而，其真正目标显然是韩国瑜，意图与其就九二共识展开攻防。

韩国瑜胜选的关键在于明确支持九二共识，当选后自然力求落实“货出去，人进来，高雄发大财”的政见。  虽然经济繁荣人人期盼，但九二共识触及了民进党的底线。陈明通捍卫反九二共识立场，显示蔡政府依然坚持政治优先，韩国瑜“政治0分、经济100分”的路线势必困难重重。

九二共识的核心在于两岸对“一个中国”的默契：双方都承认世界上只有一个中国，但台湾理解为中华民国，大陆则理解为中华人民共和国。  此论述获得多数主要国家不同程度的认可，美国在《中美联合公报》中即声明：“美国认识到，台湾海峡两边所有中国人都认为只有一个中国。” 这不仅是美国台湾政策的核心，也是中美建交40年来未曾改变的基石。《台湾关系法》建立在此基础之上，承认台湾当局的治理权，并维持美台民间关系。

然而，民进党不接受这样的定位，坚持台湾与中国互为独立实体，无论名称是中华民国或台湾共和国，也无论主张两国论或一中一台。陈水扁曾试图挑战美国的定位，结果铩羽而归；蔡英文则提出“中华民国宪政体制”论述，试图与大陆建立更模糊的共识，同样未能成功。

蔡英文执政后，刻意避免提及中华民国，甚至创造“这个国家”一词，文化部和教育部也积极修改教科书、去中华文化。大陆对此心知肚明。两岸关系因此陷入螺旋式下降的困境。九合一选举惨败后，蔡英文略微调整立场，开始提及国号、唱国歌，元旦谈话中出现“坚持自由民主”与“守护主权”的新论述，春节谈话更进一步诉求“海内外华人朋友”，祝福“所有拥有农历春节传统的华人都能像台湾人一样，享有自由、民主的好生活”。

蔡英文的多层次论述有其战略和战术的考量，也有一定的号召力，但所有政治论述都无法回避“初心”的问题。民进党党纲明文主张台独，但在选举和执政现实面前却不敢公开承认，只能以修饰性的决议文应付外部压力。蔡英文甚至不愿面对决议文，仅以个人演说提出各种论述以争取支持。

Powerful conversational models like ChatGPT (OpenAI, 2022) and Claude (Anthropic, 2023) are transforming products and daily life.  A key factor in their success is the underlying language model. State-of-the-art foundation models are typically pre-trained on massive, diverse, high-quality corpora encompassing sources like Wikipedia, scientific papers, community forums, GitHub code, web pages, and more (Gao et al., 2021; Together, 2023a).  A powerful foundational language model should possess comprehensive and balanced capabilities, including language understanding, commonsense reasoning, mathematical reasoning, and language generation (Bubeck et al., 2023). This work focuses on the mathematical reasoning capabilities of foundational language models (Chern et al., 2023; Azerbayev et al., 2023b, among others), which can potentially enhance applications like educational tools, automated problem-solving, data analysis, and code programming, thereby improving user experience.  Rather than building a new model, we focus on a more fundamental aspect: creating a high-quality, diverse pre-training corpus tailored for mathematics, called MATH-PILE.  Our work differs significantly from previous efforts in the following ways (see Table 1 for a comparison):

**Math-Centric:** Existing open-source pre-training corpora typically focus on general domains, like Pile (Gao et al., 2021), Red-Pajama (Together, 2023a), and Dolma (AllenAI, 2023). Others concentrate on multilingual aspects or programming languages, such as ROOTS (Laurençon et al., 2022) and The Stack (Kocetkov et al., 2022), respectively.  A notable gap is a corpus specifically tailored for mathematics. While some corpora exist for training or improving math-specific language models, such as Minerva's mathematical training dataset (Lewkowycz et al., 2022) and OpenAI's MathMix (Lightman et al., 2023), these are not open-source.  A recent concurrent work, OpenWebMath (Paster et al., 2023), is math-centric but solely sourced from web pages. We will discuss this comparison later.  Our work aims to bridge this gap by developing an open-source mathematical corpus, democratizing access to high-quality mathematical data, and enabling researchers and developers to advance mathematical reasoning in language models more effectively and inclusively.

**Diversity:**  Hendrycks et al. (2021b) introduced AMPS, a problem set ranging from elementary mathematics to multivariable calculus (K-12 level) for pre-training. However, it lacks college-level and more challenging competition-level mathematics, focusing on a supervised dataset rather than an extensive corpus. ProofPile (Azerbayev et al., 2023a) aims to improve autoformalization and formal proving capabilities, but its scope is limited to formal proving.  OpenWebMath (Paster et al., 2023) comprises mathematical web pages. Our corpus goes further, integrating high-quality mathematics textbooks, lecture notes, arXiv papers in mathematics, and carefully selected content from StackExchange, ProofWiki, and Wikipedia, making it a richer and more diverse resource.

**High-Quality:** Recent studies (Allamanis, 2019; Luccioni and Viviano, 2021; Lee et al., 2022; Hernandez et al., 2022; Longpre et al., 2023) highlight the detrimental effects of low-quality and repeated content in pre-training corpora.  Properly filtered and deduplicated web data can yield models as powerful as those trained on curated corpora (Penedo et al., 2023), a practice adopted in several notable studies (Cerebras, 2023; AllenAI, 2023; Together, 2023b). One example is the 1.3 billion-parameter code-focused model trained on synthetically generated textbooks and filtered web pages (Gunasekar et al., 2023), which broke existing scaling laws but did not open-source its data.  Corpus quality is more important than quantity. OpenAI's MathMix, for instance, comprises only 1.5 billion tokens. We adhere to the "less is more" principle (Zhou et al., 2023), undertaking extensive preprocessing, filtering, cleaning, and deduplication to achieve high quality. We are committed to continually refining and optimizing this corpus.

**Data Documentation:** Auditing large-scale pre-training corpora, including documenting data characteristics, intended uses, information content, and potential biases, is crucial (Bender and Friedman, 2018; Gebru et al., 2021; McMillan-Major et al., 2023).  Despite this, many corpora are released without detailed documentation (Mitchell et al., 2022).  Recent audits of publicly available pre-training datasets have revealed potential issues like useless content (Luccioni and Viviano, 2021; Kreutzer et al., 2022; Elazar et al., 2023), copyright violations (Bandy and Vincent, 2021), and inclusion of downstream task test sets (Allamanis, 2019; Dodge et al., 2021).  Following best practices for transparency, we provide a datasheet for MATH-PILE (see Table 5).  Throughout our data processing workflow, numerous documents were annotated for quality, including language identification scores and symbol-to-word ratios (see Figure 4). These annotations allow users to apply custom filters.

Pregroups and special Frobenius algebras, often called "spiders" due to their distinctive normal form (38), are algebraic structures with surprisingly broad applications.  Pregroups underpin modern categorial grammars [15, 35, 38, 61], while spiders appear in diverse fields from topological quantum field theories and group representations to linear algebra, computability, and complexity [23, 34, 56, 57, 59, 65].  The two structures have been combined in computational linguistics, using pregroups for syntactic representation and spiders for vector space semantics [49, 62, 63]. String diagram notation has facilitated this integration at different levels of language modeling, offering a promising path towards unifying the distributional and compositional paradigms of natural language processing [8, 18, 24, 28].

Central to the theory of pregroups is Lambek's Switching Lemma [38, Prop. 2], a form of cut elimination for free pregroup sequents [40, Ch. 27].  This lemma states that any sequent in a free pregroup can be normalized so that all contraction steps precede all expansion steps.

Depuis une dizaine d'années, les producteurs du Modef du Lot-et-Garonne perpétuent une tradition : vendre leurs produits à Paris.  Et comme chaque année, le succès est au rendez-vous.  Raymond Girardi et une cinquantaine d'agriculteurs ont ainsi sacrifié une nuit de sommeil pour acheminer deux semi-remorques remplis de tomates, melons, salades et autres fruits et légumes vers la capitale.  Alors que Paris vibre encore des derniers feux de l'été, ils prennent la route pour une opération de vente directe sur une trentaine de points de vente, dont l'incontournable place de la Bastille, haut lieu symbolique de cette initiative.

Accueillis par l'association des élus communistes qui leur fournissent la logistique (tables, chaises, bancs, parasols…), les producteurs installent leur marchandise, issue du Lot-et-Garonne et de la Dordogne. « Cette année, nous avons acheminé 50 tonnes de fruits et légumes, dont 17 pour la place de la Bastille. Des melons, tomates, nectarines, prunes, poires, pommes de terre, haricots verts, salades… », explique Raymond Girardi, le chef de file,  toujours à l'aise face aux journalistes et aux caméras.

Dès 8 heures du matin, les consommateurs parisiens se pressent autour des étals.  À 10 heures, tout est vendu. « Le succès est toujours grandissant », constate M. Girardi.  « Même après la vente, des gens arrivent encore, déçus de ne plus rien trouver. Il faudra y réfléchir pour l'année prochaine. »  L'objectif de cette opération est clair : vendre au juste prix, un prix rémunérateur pour l'agriculteur, sans marge abusive, contrairement aux pratiques de la grande distribution, ouvertement pointée du doigt.

Ces échanges directs avec les producteurs du Sud-Ouest sont appréciés des Parisiens. « Depuis des années, ces opérations ont un impact important sur les habitudes de consommation », analyse M. Girardi.  « De nombreux Parisiens souhaitent désormais acheter directement aux producteurs, par solidarité avec le monde agricole, pour des prix raisonnables, et bien sûr, pour la qualité gustative et sanitaire. »  Il rappelle que les fruits et légumes importés, qui représentent 40 % des ventes en France, peuvent contenir des pesticides interdits dans le pays.

阿姆斯特丹梵高博物馆（Van Gogh Museum）珍藏着世界上数量最多的梵高作品。策展人巴克（Nienke Bakker）正在为该馆最新的重磅展览进行最后的布置。展览汇集了一系列令人目眩神迷的风景画和肖像画，营造出令人叹为观止的艺术盛宴。与其他艺术家相比，梵高的热情更为炽烈，足以让你驻足凝视，沉浸其中。

乍看之下，这些作品似乎风格各异，但它们却有着共同的灵感源泉：日本艺术。这场展览曾在东京、札幌和京都引起轰动，如今荣归故里。其中最引人注目的展品当属收藏于伦敦考陶尔德画廊（Courtauld Gallery）的《包扎着耳朵的自画像》（Portrait with Bandaged Ear）。这幅名作自1930年以来首次回归梵高的故乡荷兰。

尽管梵高从未踏足日本，却对日本艺术深深着迷，其后期作品更是受其深刻影响。他作品中标志性的浓墨重彩的轮廓和鲜明的色块，与他对浮世绘的喜爱息息相关，赋予作品一种卡通式的质感，使其在众多欧洲艺术家中独树一帜。

1886年，居住在巴黎的梵高发现了日本艺术。彼时，在经历了几个世纪的闭关锁国后，日本终于向欧洲商人敞开了大门。“日本风”席卷巴黎乃至整个欧洲。人们用日本饰品装点家居，身着和服参加化装舞会。巴黎的大街小巷随处可见浮世绘。梵高购入了数百张浮世绘，原本打算转售盈利，但却一直未能出手。他对这些画作爱不释手，实在不忍割爱（显然，他并非一个精明的商人）。

由于囊中羞涩，梵高无力购买像葛饰北斋（Hokusai）这样的名家精品。他收藏的大多是些物美价廉的作品，这对于一个学习日本艺术的“穷学生”来说已足够。“他偏爱浓烈的色彩，而浮世绘恰好拥有这样的色彩，”巴克说道。这些鲜艳的色彩很快便融入到梵高的创作之中。

梵高最初通过临摹米勒（Millet）等欧洲大师的作品学习绘画，后来开始临摹浮世绘。这为他的作品带来了不同的视角，仿佛是用左手创作。“与我们西欧的传统相比，日本人观察世界、描绘世界的方式截然不同，”梵高博物馆馆长鲁格（Axel Ruger）说道。“他欣赏日本人对细节的关注，在他们所做的每一件事情中，他都看到了极致的完美。”

《梵高与日本》展出的作品包括梵高的临摹作品以及他收藏的许多浮世绘（梵高一生收藏了600多幅浮世绘，梵高博物馆拥有其中的500多幅）。比较日本原作与梵高的临摹作品是一件非常有趣的事情，从中可以看出他是如何走出自己的舒适区，学习用一种全新的方式进行创作。

“这有助于他强化色彩，简化构图，”巴克说。“他希望作品中拥有更多的光线和色彩，提升自己的绘画风格。”梵高看到了日本艺术家信手拈来却精准无比的技艺，他们能够用寥寥几笔捕捉事物的精髓。

Correlation analysis is often the first step in understanding complex systems data [1], employed across diverse fields from financial economics and psychology to bioinformatics, neuroscience, and climate science.  Correlation matrices, which capture pairwise similarity of often temporally evolving signals, describe system interactions within these fields.  Existing methods for analyzing this data are abundant.

Established techniques like principal component analysis (PCA) [2] and factor analysis (FA) [3, 4] extract a small number of interpretable components. For example, PCA might reveal a global market trend in stock market data or spatio-temporal patterns of air pressure in atmospheric data.  Markowitz's portfolio theory in mathematical finance [5, 6], another key method, minimizes the variance of financial returns for a given expected return. Relatedly, random matrix theory has been a crucial tool for analyzing economic and other correlation matrix data for decades [6].

Numerous newer methods have also emerged.  These include detrended cross-correlation analysis [7][8][9], correlation dependency (defined as the difference between partial and Pearson correlation coefficients) [10, 11], identifying optimal paths within correlation matrix data [12], and early warning signals for anticipating abrupt changes in dynamical systems, including networked systems [13][14][15]. Energy landscape analysis, particularly used in neuroscience [16, 17], also offers another approach.

Over the past two decades, network science and graph theory have provided powerful tools for analyzing correlational data.  A correlation matrix can be mapped onto a correlation network, where nodes represent elements and edge weights reflect correlation strength.  Correlation network analysis aims to extract information like interaction patterns or node rankings. Ideally, this approach leverages network science concepts in a way that generates insights beyond those provided by standard correlation matrix methods like PCA.  While correlation doesn't necessarily imply a direct physical connection or interaction, correlation matrices often serve as a readily available proxy when direct connection data is scarce.

بعد نشر صحيفة "يديعوت أحرونوت" تقريراً يفيد بأن واشنطن تعتزم بيع طائرات "إف-35" للإمارات في إطار اتفاق التطبيع الإسرائيلي الإماراتي،  أصدر مكتب رئيس الوزراء الإسرائيلي بنيامين نتنياهو بياناً مفصلاً لنفي ذلك. وجاء في البيان، حسب صحيفة "جيروزاليم بوست"، أن "اتفاقية السلام التاريخية الموقعة بين إسرائيل والإمارات لا تتضمن أي موافقة من جانب إسرائيل على أي صفقة أسلحة بين الولايات المتحدة والإمارات"، مؤكداً  أن الاتفاق لا يشمل بيع مقاتلات F-35 أمريكية، ولا يتضمن أي صفقات عسكرية معها. وأضاف البيان أن "الولايات المتحدة أكدت لإسرائيل التزامها بالحفاظ على التفوق النوعي (العسكري) لإسرائيل". من جهته، أكد السفير الأمريكي في إسرائيل، ديفيد فريدمان، أن أي صفقة بيع مستقبلية للأسلحة المتقدمة للإمارات، بما في ذلك مقاتلات "إف 35"، ستكون مشروطة بضمان التفوق العسكري لإسرائيل. ونقلت "جيروزاليم بوست" عن مصادر في البيت الأبيض قولها إن كل شيء في الصفقة علني، ولا توجد ملحقات سرية لها حول مبيعات الأسلحة.

Valencia. La ruina, como punto de partida para la reflexión sobre el pasado y su conexión con un presente complejo, es el leitmotiv de la nueva exposición 'Fragmentos para la eternidad. Poéticas en torno a la ruina' en la Fundación Chirivella Soriano.  La muestra, que se podrá visitar hasta el 14 de enero, reúne los trabajos de un conjunto de artistas, entre los que destacan dos Premios Nacionales: Carmen Calvo (Artes Plásticas 2013) y Bleda y Rosa (Fotografía 2008).

Estos creadores reflexionan sobre la ruina y su función histórica, social y crítica.  El proyecto utiliza diversos medios de expresión, como el videoarte, la escultura, la fotografía y otros recursos plásticos, pervirtiendo los materiales para alcanzar nuevas realidades sensibles al cambio. Recrean espacios que «ya no serán como fueron, pero permiten una perspectiva sobre el paso del tiempo, sobre la memoria».

La exposición ofrece una mirada amplia, personal y en constante evolución sobre este tema.  Lida Abdul, David Bestué, Bleda y Rosa, Carmen Calvo, Óscar Carrasco, Antonio Fernández Alvira, Patricia Gómez y Mª Jesús González, Mª José Planells y Anna Talens comparten con el espectador su ideal de ruina como recurso artístico.  A través de múltiples expresiones, tejen un imaginario pleno de matices, estableciendo un diálogo sobre sus inquietudes, preocupaciones y experiencias vitales.

El mercado europeo de motocicletas y ciclomotores experimentó resultados mixtos en el primer trimestre de 2021.  Las matriculaciones de motocicletas en los cinco mayores mercados (Francia, Alemania, Italia, España y Reino Unido) aumentaron un 10,3% (197.856 unidades) en comparación con el mismo período de 2020, según datos de la Asociación de Fabricantes de Motocicletas Europea (ACEM).  Este crecimiento global se debe al fuerte repunte de marzo (+67,6%), que compensó las caídas de enero (-29,8%) y febrero (-12,8%). Sin embargo, la situación varía considerablemente entre países. Italia (+47,3%) y Francia (+15,1%) registraron aumentos significativos, mientras que Reino Unido (-21,3%), Alemania (-4,1%) y España (-0,4%) se mantuvieron por debajo de las cifras de 2020.

José María Riaño, secretario general de Anesdory representante de las asociaciones nacionales europeas en el Comité Ejecutivo de ACEM, comentó: "El sector de la moto en España se mantiene como el cuarto mercado europeo. Las diferencias entre países en este periodo se explican tanto por las distintas restricciones aplicadas en 2021 como por las del año pasado. Los indicadores generales del trimestre nos invitan al optimismo tanto a nivel nacional como europeo".

El segmento de los ciclomotores mostró un comportamiento más positivo. En los seis mayores mercados europeos (Alemania, Bélgica, España, Francia, Italia y Países Bajos), las ventas alcanzaron las 56.535 unidades, un aumento del 21,6% respecto a 2020.

Antonio Perlot, secretario general de ACEM, añade una perspectiva a largo plazo: "Si tomamos como referencia 2019, un año posiblemente más normal, las matriculaciones de motocicletas de 2021 aún se encuentran un 4,14% por debajo, mientras que las de ciclomotores muestran un claro crecimiento del 19%".

Venus, the second planet from the sun and closest to Earth in size and density, presents a hostile environment. Its thick atmosphere, composed of nearly 97% carbon dioxide, traps heat, resulting in scorching average temperatures of 800 degrees Fahrenheit.  Adding to the danger are clouds of highly corrosive sulfuric acid.

Despite these perilous conditions, studying Venus offers invaluable scientific opportunities.  The planet's extreme environment fosters the formation of rare geological features and atmospheric phenomena.  Discovering and analyzing these unique rock formations, gases, and other elements could significantly advance our understanding of planetary science and space history.

To overcome the challenges posed by Venus's surface conditions, NASA has proposed a potential solution: a floating observation platform.

Dernier chef du Parti progressiste-conservateur du Canada, M. MacKay a orchestré la fusion de ce parti avec l'Alliance canadienne de Stephen Harper en 2003, donnant naissance à l'actuel Parti conservateur du Canada.

البرهان إلى أمريكا: رحلة الأمل والتحديات

بات في حكم المؤكد أن تتم الزيارة المرتقبة لرئيس مجلس السيادة الفريق أول ركن عبدالفتاح البرهان إلى الولايات المتحدة الأمريكية خلال هذا الشهر، بعد تأكيد مصادر دبلوماسية إرسال الدعوة الرسمية الأمريكية  إليه عبر سفارتها بالخرطوم.

وتشير هذه الزيارة رفيعة المستوى بوضوح إلى انتقال العلاقات السودانية الأمريكية إلى مربع جديد، وتمثل بارقة أمل للدفع بمسار حوار المصالح المشتركة.  يسعى السودان من خلال هذا الحوار إلى تحقيق هدف محوري يتمثل في رفع اسمه من قائمة الدول الراعية للإرهاب،  والذي يُعد أولوية جوهرية  نظراً للمعاناة المركبة التي يعيشها شعب السودان منذ إدراجه في هذه القائمة في تسعينيات القرن الماضي، وما ترتب عليها من عقوبات خانقة،  أبرزها وقف التعاملات البنكية مع المصارف السودانية، وحرمان السودان من الاستفادة من برنامج إزالة الديون على المؤسسات المالية الدولية –تحت النفوذ الأمريكي–  الذي يمكنه من تجديد الاقتراض لتمويل مشاريعه التنموية والخدمية.


كشف البرهان، عقب لقائه برئيس وزراء إسرائيل في عنتبي في الثالث من فبراير الماضي –والذي سبقته اتصالات من وزير الخارجية الأمريكي مايك بومبيو– عن رؤية جديدة في التعامل مع الملفات الخارجية المؤثرة على الداخل الاقتصادي والأمني. تقوم هذه الرؤية على إدراكه لتغير أدوات الصراع في العالم –دون تغير أهدافه بالضرورة–  وانحسارها في لغة المصالح الشاملة والمكاسب الاقتصادية.  وأكد  البرهان في تصريحاته  على ضرورة دخول الدول التي تبحث عن مصالحها إلى الملعب الدولي واستخدام أدواته وفق استراتيجياتها وخططها وتكتيكاتها. وجاءت دعوة البرهان لزيارة أمريكا كخطوة مكتسبة في إطار هذه الرؤية الجديدة والجريئة بعد تفاهمات عنتبي.


ويمثل التعامل مع دولة مؤسسات كأمريكا، حيث تتقاطع المصالح السياسية لأحزابها الرئيسية مع قطاع الأعمال،  وتنشط فيها مجموعات الضغط وشركات اللوبي، تحديًا أساسيًا لتنزيل أي اتفاقيات أو تفاهمات سودانية أمريكية على أرض الواقع.  وهو بالتأكيد ما نتوقع أن يضعه الفريق أول البرهان في حساباته.


بلا شك، يُعد ملف التعامل مع السودان داخل الأروقة الأمريكية موضوعًا للصراع الحامي بين الديمقراطيين والجمهوريين في المؤسسات التشريعية،  كما يُثير قلق من كانوا يقتاتون من ورائه نفوذًا أو مالًا، خاصة من معاوني المؤسسات الأمريكية من السودانيين الذين  يجلسون على طاولات التصحيح أو ما يعرف بكشف الثغرات لواضعي مشاريع التعامل مع السودان.  وأشير هنا إلى تحدي مشروع قانون "التحول الديمقراطي والمساءلة والشفافية المالية في السودان للعام 2020" المعروض حاليًا على الكونغرس الأمريكي من قِبل الحزب الديمقراطي.

Integrating Facial Action Coding System (FACS) technology into schools offers valuable classroom insights. By detecting often subtle student cues, FACS can provide teachers with feedback on lesson effectiveness and student emotional well-being.  However, it's crucial to ensure this technology respects students' privacy and doesn't intrude on their personal feelings.  FACS can enhance teaching by providing in-depth analysis of student comprehension, reactions, and areas where teachers can adapt their approach for optimal learning outcomes.

Student expressions of fatigue or anticipation, particularly at the beginning or end of the school day, can sometimes be misinterpreted by teachers as disengagement with the lesson.  Integrating FACS into school computers allows for the tracking of students' emotional responses during online activities and assignments, providing insights into their attentiveness. By comparing facial expressions against a neutral baseline, teachers gain a clearer understanding of student reactions.  While tiredness or excitement can sometimes mask true engagement, FACS, using video imagery and analysis of characteristic facial muscle movements associated with six basic emotions, offers a more objective assessment of student responses to lessons.

Another valuable application of FACS lies in identifying student confusion or boredom, both indicators of a mismatch between task difficulty and student ability. While teachers strive to support struggling students and challenge those who are bored, these emotions are not always readily apparent.  Students, especially when confused, may hide their struggles to avoid embarrassment. FACS technology can detect subtle muscle movements indicative of these emotions, even when students attempt to conceal them.  This allows teachers to identify students requiring additional support or lesson modifications, tailoring instruction to individual needs and ensuring appropriate levels of challenge.

Furthermore, FACS can play a role in addressing bullying and depression within schools. By recognizing signs of fear or sadness, the technology can provide early warning signs of potential problems.  Even attempts to mask these emotions, such as forced smiles, can be detected by the system.  This offers a valuable tool in a time when student mental health is a critical concern.  Consistent monitoring and reporting of these emotional cues can provide a crucial lifeline for students who might not otherwise seek help.

While the benefits of FACS are significant, it's essential to implement safeguards to protect student privacy. With the increasing prevalence of take-home devices, clear boundaries must be established to ensure FACS data is used solely for educational purposes and does not infringe on students' personal lives.

Gerald Bäck, founder of the personal search engine Archify, announced an investment from Balderton Capital at the re:publica conference in Berlin. The venture capital firm acquired a 20 percent stake in the young company, joining a portfolio that includes game supplier Wooga, location service SCVNGR, online game Habbo, and Airbnb competitor Housetrip.  This investment followed Archify's decision to relocate its operations from Vienna to the German capital.

Bäck explained to futurezone that the move was driven by several factors.  "In Vienna there are few people with the necessary skills, in Berlin there are more people who potentially fit the job," he stated.  Additionally, he cited Berlin's growing influence in the internet sector, particularly its focus on the US market, which is Archify's target audience.  The exorbitant real estate prices in London, another potential relocation option, further solidified the decision in favor of Berlin.  Bäck also revealed that attending a start-up boot camp in Copenhagen cemented the realization that remaining in Vienna was not a viable option for the company's growth. While the five-person team plans to transition to Berlin, Bäck intends to initially commute between the Austrian and German capitals.

Archify is developing a personal search engine designed to complement Google.  Bäck explained, "Google is great for searching for information you don't yet know." Archify, however, focuses on searching an individual's own digital history, including social networks and browsing activity.  The platform currently boasts 5,000 registered users, with 3,000 active users, 80 percent of whom engage with Archify daily.

The platform offers a browser plug-in that saves all visited websites to a separate account.  It also integrates with Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn, archiving posted content for future searches.  Gmail integration is planned for the next development phase. Unlike tools like Evernote and Delicious, Archify automates the recording of internet usage, eliminating the need for manual saving. Bäck identifies CloudMagic and Greplin as direct competitors but believes Archify's automated browsing history feature gives it a competitive edge.

Deep neural networks, with their characteristically deep, multi-layered structure, have demonstrated remarkable success in computer vision and natural language processing.  A key challenge in leveraging these architectures lies in efficiently transforming and fusing information across these numerous layers.  Neural Machine Translation (NMT) exemplifies this challenge, with self-attention-based systems (Vaswani et al., 2017) now achieving state-of-the-art performance and training speed, surpassing previous recurrent neural network architectures (Wu et al., 2016) like those used in earlier successful NMT systems (Bahdanau et al., 2014; Luong et al., 2015).

However, standard Transformer models typically utilize only the top encoder and decoder layers, neglecting potentially valuable information embedded in other layers.  Previous work (Shi et al., 2016) has shown that different layers of the encoder capture different types of syntactic information, both local and global.  Fusing information from these various layers has proven beneficial in both computer vision (Yu et al., 2018) and natural language processing tasks (Shen et al., 2018; Dou et al., 2018).  This work builds upon these findings, introducing a more efficient approach to cross-layer information fusion.

Specifically, we propose residual tree aggregation of layers (RTAL), a method inspired by techniques from numerical analysis (Peters et al., 2018; He et al., 2016; Huang et al., 2017).  RTAL utilizes a post-order binary tree structure with residual connections to combine layer outputs, effectively addressing the limitations of standard NMT models by incorporating information from all layers. The residual connections further enrich the information flow within the tree. We also explore various aggregation formulas to optimize performance.

Our contributions are threefold:

* We introduce RTAL, a novel approach for fusing information across layers, addressing the limitations of standard NMT models that rely solely on the top encoder and decoder layers. The residual connections within RTAL enhance information flow and representation learning.
* RTAL is efficient, easy to implement, and generalizable to arbitrary multi-layer deep neural networks.
* This work further strengthens the growing body of research (Dou et al., 2019; Shen et al., 2018; Wang et al., 2018) demonstrating the potential of cross-layer information fusion in natural language processing.
