乐天国际商业银行获得金管会核准成立纯网银。该行由日本乐天银行和国票金控合资成立，金额达100亿元，国票金控持股49%，乐天集团（包括乐天银行、乐天信用卡等）持股51%，是申请纯网银三家业者中唯一的纯金融团队，也是唯一具有经营纯网银经验的团队。

对于国票金控而言，乐天国际商业银行的成立完成了金控版图最后一块拼图，能提供客户更完整、多样的专业金融服务，并提升经营综效。国票金控是国内唯一以票券为主体的金控公司，本年度营运表现亮丽，累计前7个月税后纯益逾17亿元，较去年同期年增逾28%。

日本乐天银行是首家直接投资台湾的日本银行，也是日本最大且获利第一的纯网路银行，拥有超过18年的纯网银经验和720万开户数，在先进资讯安全控管和多样化生态系金融服务方面拥有丰富的实务经验。这将有助于台湾发展“Bank 4.0”数位金融时代中的纯网银，使台湾金融科技发展更稳健、长远。

乐天国际商业银行筹备处负责人魏启林表示，乐天国际商业银行将由第一金控前总经理、国际票券公司前董事简明仁担任董事长，总经理则由日本乐天银行资安权威专家佐伯和彦担任。他们将借鉴乐天集团在30个国家建立的“全球生态圈”资源，以及其13亿2千万会员（涵盖电商、信用卡、电子书等服务），将“乐天超级点数”的成功经验引入台湾，为客户提供更丰富的权益。

魏启林进一步指出，乐天累积的客户网银使用经验（包括物流、金流、资讯流等数据），能够更精准地分析用户行为，优化使用者介面，提供更好的使用者体验。乐天高端的资讯安全控管实务经验，将成为乐天国际商业银行在台湾发展的重要利基，也是纯网银的基础建设。

L’Association canine territoriale bretonne (ACTB) a organisé un événement canin d’envergure ce week-end à Pontivy, au parc des expositions.  Samedi était dédié à la Confirmation, attirant près de 400 propriétaires et leurs chiens de races diverses.  Dimanche, place aux expositions et concours, avec plus de 1100 chiens inscrits et une affluence attendue de 2500 personnes, un record par rapport aux 800 chiens de 2017.  Cet engouement, malgré un week-end chargé, réjouit le comité de l’ACTB, qui souligne l'importance de cette exposition, l'une des plus grandes de France, selon le vice-président François Le Clec’h.  Des participants venus de toute la Bretagne se sont pressés au parc des expositions.

La Confirmation du samedi, qui s'apparente à une cérémonie où chiens et propriétaires patientent pour obtenir le précieux sésame, a vu défiler bergers allemands, bouledogues, bergers australiens, mastiffs, et bien d'autres races.  Jean-Paul Kerihuel, président de l’ACTB et juge international, explique que même si un chiot a des parents de race confirmés, il doit lui-même passer devant un juge après 12 ou 15 mois.  Le juge vérifie l’identification (puce ou tatouage), la taille, la dentition, les réactions et le comportement du chien pour confirmer son appartenance à la race.  Cette confirmation est indispensable pour participer à des concours, comme celui du dimanche, ou à des concours d’agility, et valorise le chien pour la reproduction.

Outre l'aspect formel de la certification du pedigree, la Confirmation a également une vocation éducative.  Elle permet aux propriétaires, qu'ils soient cynophiles expérimentés ou nouveaux venus, de recevoir des conseils et des informations sur leur compagnon à quatre pattes.  Samedi après-midi, la file d'attente pour la confirmation s'étendait sur plusieurs dizaines de mètres, témoignant de l'intérêt des propriétaires pour cette démarche.

Dimanche, dès 9h et jusqu'à 14h, le parc des expositions accueillera le concours canin, suivi de concours honorifiques.  Les organisateurs ont adapté les horaires pour permettre au public d'assister à la finale de football. L’entrée est gratuite pour les visiteurs.  Pour plus d’informations, consulter le site http://www.caninebretonne.fr.

Simulating and modeling processes and workflows is a common technique for studying and predicting application performance without executing them under all possible parameter settings.  Two popular frameworks for estimating the runtime costs of HPC applications and workflows are SimGrid [1] and WRENCH [2]. These frameworks focus on modeling computation time and process interdependencies arising from network traffic and message exchange.  Another critical performance factor is input/output (I/O), which SimGrid and WRENCH address at a coarse level. However, for realistic I/O behavior modeling, additional aspects of the I/O subsystem, such as buffering and I/O bandwidth steering, are crucial because they significantly influence observed I/O costs.  This work provides accurate models to estimate I/O costs, considering the caching mechanisms of the operating system (OS) and the C standard library. These models improve the accuracy of HPC and workflow simulation frameworks for I/O-intensive applications.

Following an overview of available Linux and C standard library I/O methods (Section 2) and a summary of the Linux page cache mechanism (Section 3), we present our primary contributions:

* We define models for accurate I/O cost (write performance) prediction in scenarios with and without page caching and the C standard library buffer (Section 4).  We distinguish between:
    * Synchronized, direct I/O with system calls (Section 4.2)
    * Synchronized, non-direct I/O with system calls (Section 4.3)
    * Non-synchronized I/O with system calls (Section 4.4)
    * Standard library I/O (Section 4.5)

* We discuss related work on I/O modeling and storage devices (Section 5).

* We evaluate the accuracy of I/O cost predictions across various scenarios, hosts, and I/O devices, comparing them to measured system performance (Section 6).  Specifically:
    * We compare CAWL estimations (our contribution) with SimGrid I/O estimates and demonstrate the importance of considering caching effects. We observe that the SimGrid I/O model overestimates I/O costs by up to 350% and underestimates them by up to 99% in different scenarios.

Une rumeur concernant le décès d'Akapusi Qera, capitaine de l'équipe des Fidji et troisième ligne du SU Agen, a circulé sur un site anglophone et certains médias.  Ce site affirmait que le joueur de 33 ans s'était effondré lors d'un entraînement.  Pourtant, Qera était bien présent et en pleine forme au Stadio Massimino de Catane avec ses coéquipiers fidjiens pour affronter l'Italie ce samedi à 15 heures en test-match.  Le club a rapidement démenti la rumeur morbide sur les réseaux sociaux samedi matin.  Le président du Directoire du SUA, Jean-François Fonteneau, a également tenu à rassurer les supporters via Twitter : "Nous avons eu Akapusi au téléphone et il va très bien !".  Le SUA a confirmé la bonne santé de son joueur et lui a souhaité un bon match en tant que capitaine des Fidji.  Nemani Nadolo, son coéquipier en sélection et ancien coéquipier à Montpellier, a publié un selfie avec Qera dans le bus de l'équipe sur Instagram. Enfin, les téléspectateurs de Dmax, diffuseur du match, ont pu constater la présence de Qera sur le terrain avec les Fidji face à l'Italie.

The "face on Mars" has intrigued the public ever since a photo taken 25 years ago seemed to show a face-like figure on the Martian surface.  The image sparked widespread speculation about alien artifacts, with many convinced it depicted an alien visage.  However, even if there were a civilization on Mars, NASA's exploration would be focused on scientific discovery.

The reality is far less sensational.  Studies have shown that the object is simply a butte or mesa, landforms common in the American West.  The resemblance to a human head is an illusion caused by a combination of rock formations and shadows, creating the impression of eyes, nose, and mouth.

This conclusion is supported by higher resolution images taken in 2001. The 2001 image boasts a resolution of 1.56 meters per pixel, a significant improvement over the 43 meters per pixel resolution of the 1976 Viking photo.  This increased clarity allows for much greater detail. As a NASA scientist explained, "If there were objects in this picture like airplanes on the ground, Egyptian-style pyramids, or even small shacks, you could see what they were!"

The glowing cube descended from its shelf, floating down with the same creepy motion I'd known since childhood. It touched my forehead, the surface cold against my skin, the connection to my mind immediate.  The bearded man appeared, his neck emblazoned with the familiar snake tattoo that mirrored my own. I squeezed my eyes shut, humming, trying to block him out, but the words still slipped through, insidious drips and drabs: "Remember.... You are.... The Corsair.... Wake up!"

I opened my eyes, finding myself back in my chair, the carpet soft beneath my toes. A simple joy, a sense of home.  Maybe my next job shouldn’t be so restrictive. Perhaps a roving travel writer?  But then I remembered Everest.

I turned the corner of my road, slipping in the snow, suddenly feeling the effects of the low-oxygen atmosphere at the top of the world.  "Not again," I muttered. The beach had been nicer, the warm sand between my toes a stark contrast to this biting cold.  I couldn't remember the transition, how one had become the other.

The memory of the beach flowed back: I’d taken off my shoes, enjoying the warmth.  Houses in the distance, but a feeling pulled me in the opposite direction.  Further along the beach, I saw them: large, muscled men, their faces angry, loading heavy bags of white powder onto a boat. I’d waved, wanting to help, but never reached them. Dunes rose and fell, and suddenly, the beach was gone, replaced by the endless expanse of the desert.  A shame.  They might have helped.

A soft idea began to bloom, unfurling like a flower – like the one I saw the last time I’d tried to get a haircut, only this time, no giant wasps. Not in my head. I walked, intentionally away from home, for hours, until thirst drove me to a market stall on a busy road.  I bartered for fruit juice, wandered through dusty pyramids and damp, empty temples, even through a round office filled with shouting men. I’d almost given up on… whatever my plan had been… when I finally found myself back home.

Now, facing the bearded man and his insistent message, I knew I’d have to call my boss.

台北果菜市场连续休市导致菜价下跌，北农顿时成为众矢之的。农委会与台北市政府为此争执不下，台北市长柯文哲更于昨日强硬表示「不然以后总经理由我指派，完全执政、完全负责」。由于台北果菜市场将于明日开市，北市府今日下午紧急召开记者会，说明开市后的应对措施。

然而，记者会上只有北农董事长陈景峻和北市府市场处长许玄谋出席，北农总经理吴音宁依旧未现身。被问及吴音宁为何持续缺席，陈景峻显得相当不满，先是冷哼一声，随后讽刺道：「所以我才会说，要拿权力，就说是总经理制；要负责任，就变成董事长制。」

许玄谋表示，今日上午已和吴音宁通过电话，并通知她出席记者会，市场处主秘也已进行通知。

至于吴音宁是否答应出席，陈景峻强调，这不是答不答应的问题，而是她应该要来。

陈景峻不满地表示，身为北农总经理，应该勇于负责。吴音宁缺席记者会的行为是否恰当，应交由公众评断。此事关乎民生物资和农民生计，她应该勇于承担、积极处理。

面对媒体追问身为董事长的他是否管不动吴音宁，陈景峻表示，这是相互尊重，各司其职。他代表北市府说明政策，而人事运用、现场营运、公司章程等则由总经理负责，彼此的角色定位应该要清楚。

Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAVs) are demonstrating significant potential for autonomous operations, both indoors and outdoors.  While already utilized for transportation, industries are increasingly exploring their use in inspection, surveying, maintenance, and manipulation tasks within complex environments like power plants, pipelines, and high-rise buildings [1]-[9].  UAVs enhance human safety by removing personnel from hazardous situations and reducing manual effort.  Furthermore, investment is growing in their application as first responders in emergencies and for disaster mitigation, including evacuation support [10].  However, achieving autonomy in these critical applications presents challenges due to the potential lack of accurate positioning systems or a priori environmental knowledge [11].  Such missions often demand complex algorithms for exploration, mapping, state estimation, planning, control, and task allocation [12].  Executing these algorithms onboard increases payload and reduces flight time.  Offloading computationally intensive tasks to a remote system, while retaining minimal onboard control, offers a promising solution for improving performance and extending mission duration.

For UAV control, various methods offer unique advantages [13]-[17].  Model Predictive Control (MPC) [21] emerges as a strong candidate for executing desired tasks, such as trajectory tracking based on a high-level planner, while incorporating constraints on states [18],[19] and control inputs [20] for safety and optimal power usage.  Offloading MPC significantly reduces computational latency, enhancing performance [22].

However, remote control introduces latency challenges.  Edge computing addresses this by bringing computational resources closer to the data source, enabling real-time processing of complex algorithms with reduced latency [23].  5G networking further accelerates edge-based control loops, offering high reliability and low communication delays [24], making these systems attractive for safety-critical remote operations.  Applications range from traffic management and healthcare to autonomous vehicles and smart homes [25]-[29].  Deploying modules within independent containers, often orchestrated using Kubernetes (K8s), enhances security, abstraction, and resource sharing [30].

Advanced Persistent Threats (APTs) are targeted and sustained attacks carried out by sophisticated, well-resourced adversaries [1]. Characterized by a high degree of stealth, these threats can persist for extended periods, leading to disruptions and other severe consequences.  Preventing APTs entirely is difficult, as skilled attackers can bypass existing defenses by exploiting technical advantages like zero-day vulnerabilities [2].  Therefore, research into APT attribution is crucial for improving the deterrent effect of security defenses [3, 4, 5, 6].

APT attribution is a challenging task. Attackers frequently employ strategies to obfuscate their activities and even mislead attribution efforts [7]. Defenders must investigate Indicators of Compromise (IOCs) and assess Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures (TTPs, also known as high-level IOCs) within massive datasets.  They must also analyze attacker traits and diligently work to confirm their identities.  Early studies proposed several APT attribution models based on practical experience [3, 4, 8-12], implementing attribution analysis and inspiring subsequent technical research. Based on the analysis goals, APT attribution can be divided into two stages: attack process attribution using attack traces and threat actor attribution using attack features [4, 9].

Technical approaches for APT attribution include rule-based reasoning and machine learning methods. Rule-based reasoning encompasses argument-based reasoning [13-17] and graph rule-based reasoning [18-20]. These methods require experts to manually design numerous rules, and most of these rules focus on attack process attribution rather than threat actor attribution.  Researchers have recently developed machine learning-based APT attribution methods for both attack process attribution [21-26] and threat actor attribution [27-41].  Threat actor attribution methods can be further categorized into malware-based and Cyber Threat Intelligence (CTI)-based methods. Malware, a key component of APTs, often has various functions, such as command and control, and is essential for attribution. However, malware can be reused by different APT groups, limiting its effectiveness for threat actor attribution on its own.

CTI reports on APTs aggregate characteristic and analytical information related to APT groups, including malicious Internet Protocols (IPs) or domains used for command and control, as well as the TTPs employed. Cybersecurity experts compile these reports based on the collection and analysis of multi-source data, including network traffic, malware, and open-source intelligence. Compared to malware, CTI offers richer contextual information and more diverse attribution data. Consequently, APT reports are a crucial data source for attribution analysis [42-45].

APT actor attribution based on CTI has garnered considerable research interest. Existing methods typically extract various features from CTI reports and input them into traditional machine learning models like Support Vector Machines (SVMs) and Multilayer Perceptrons (MLPs) to classify CTI reports according to their threat actors. These features can be categorized into three types: (1) Tactic and technique features [35-37] extracted using one-hot encoding [35, 36] or Term Frequency-Inverse Document Frequency (TF-IDF) [37] based on the ATT&CK framework. However, the expressivity of one-hot encoding or TF-IDF is limited, and the data diversity is restricted by focusing solely on tactic and technique features.

Facial Action Coding System (FACS) technology can analyze facial expressions to determine emotions like happiness or sadness.  The article "Making Mona Lisa Smile" suggests that this technology could allow a computer to detect student confusion or boredom and adjust lessons accordingly. While potentially valuable in certain situations, widespread classroom application is unlikely to be effective.

The primary challenge lies in the diversity of student emotions within a classroom.  Students react differently to the same material.  For instance, in a math class, some students might find the concepts engaging while others are uninterested.

While individualized instruction, as mentioned in paragraph 6, might benefit a single student, adapting a lesson for a class of 30-50 based on the emotions of a few would be impractical and unfair to those engaged with the current lesson plan.  Teaching different lessons simultaneously to different groups within the same class would be logistically challenging and place undue strain on teachers.

A more effective application of FACS in the classroom would be to focus on identifying student confusion rather than boredom.  A bored student is unlikely to become engaged through a simple conversation, whereas a confused student could benefit from individualized attention and clarification.  A teacher's primary concern should be student comprehension and academic progress.

FACS is a powerful tool with significant potential for understanding human behavior.  However, its effectiveness in a group learning environment is limited. While FACS can accurately read individual emotions, applying those readings to modify whole-class instruction is impractical.  It's much more effective for one-on-one assessment of student understanding.  Addressing individual confusion is a viable strategy.  As paragraph 9 humorously suggests, forcing a smile won't solve the underlying issue of student dissatisfaction with a lesson.

2011年東日本大地震引發福島核災，大批居民倉皇逃離，許多寵物被遺棄，無人照料。福島居民加藤榮（Sakae Kato）因此決定留在災區，至今仍照顧著41隻貓和1隻狗，他表示只想好好照顧這些小動物，死而無憾。

加藤榮，57歲，居住在福島縣浪江町。核災後，當地立即被下令疏散。加藤榮原本經營建築公司，災後目睹許多被遺棄的寵物在空屋中死去，便決定留下照顧牠們。他拆除空屋，也為這些動物提供了一個棲身之所。

現在，加藤榮在舊居和附近一間空置房屋照顧著這些貓狗，每天用火水爐為牠們烹煮食物。由於區內食水供應至今仍未恢復，他每天需從附近小溪和公廁取水。他估計每月要花費約7,000美元（約5.4萬港元）照顧這些小動物。

過去十年，已有23隻貓去世，葬在他家的花園裡。由於居民遷出，野豬變得活躍，經常闖入花園，加藤榮還需額外購買食物餵養牠們。然而，此舉卻讓他惹上官非，上個月他因協助放生野生動物而被政府逮捕。

加藤榮的木屋住所年久失修，地板腐爛下陷，牆壁和屋頂也有多處破洞。上個月福島再次發生地震，房屋結構更受損害。他估計房子只能再撐2至3年就會倒塌。

加藤榮家族三代都住在福島，他熱愛山區環境。

Jack Dorsey, le PDG de Twitter, estime que certaines fonctionnalités de la plateforme, comme le bouton "J'aime" et le compteur d'abonnés, n'auraient jamais dû voir le jour.  S'il devait recréer le réseau social aujourd'hui, il les supprimerait.  Lors d'une conférence TED à Vancouver le 16 avril, il a expliqué, selon Quartz, que ces éléments pervertissent l'usage de la plateforme.

Ces options, selon lui, n'encouragent pas des échanges constructifs. « Si je devais tout recommencer, je ne mettrais pas autant l'accent sur le nombre d'abonnés, ni sur le nombre de "J'aime".  Je n'aurais peut-être même pas créé ce bouton », a-t-il déclaré.  D'après le PDG, ces deux outils favorisent des publications peu pertinentes et ont corrompu l'objectif initial de Twitter.

Présent depuis le lancement de la plateforme en 2006, le bouton d'approbation a d'abord été une étoile pour les "Favoris" avant de devenir un cœur rose en novembre 2015. Le compteur d'abonnés, affiché en caractères relativement imposants en haut des profils,  a lui aussi toujours existé, un choix que Jack Dorsey regrette aujourd'hui.

Il considère que la qualité des conversations sur Twitter s'est dégradée. « Nous avons constaté des abus, du harcèlement, des tentatives de manipulation, des actions coordonnées automatisées et de la désinformation », a-t-il reconnu, ajoutant qu'il ne prévoyait pas de tels phénomènes à la création du réseau.

Régulièrement critiqué pour sa toxicité, Twitter est le théâtre de harcèlement et de menaces. Les utilisateurs dénoncent souvent des méthodes de modération jugées lentes et inefficaces.  Par ailleurs, la quête d'abonnés et de "J'aime" peut inciter certains à la provocation, voire à l'insulte, contribuant ainsi au harcèlement.

Alors qu'une nouvelle interface a été récemment déployée, Jack Dorsey envisage déjà une autre réorganisation, privilégiant le contenu des conversations à l'identité et à la popularité de leurs auteurs.  Il imagine un système d'abonnement non plus à des individus, mais à des centres d'intérêt, via des hashtags par exemple.

Would you want your emotions broadcast every time you sit down at a computer? I believe emotion-reading technology could be beneficial.  For example, someone might mask depression with a smile. This technology could help people acknowledge and address their true feelings. The author rightly points out, "For instance, you can probably tell how a friend is feeling simply by looking at her face."  Facial expressions often reveal more than we realize; our faces truly do "say it all."  As the author notes, technology can even "indicate the difference between a genuine smile and a forced one."  It's crucial for people to feel comfortable sharing their emotions with someone they trust. Emotions are a powerful, constant undercurrent to our lives, an ebb and flow we cannot control.

(法新社里约热内卢19日电)  美国总统川普去年宣布退出伊朗核子协议后，华府当局便针对德黑兰当局、跟伊朗有关的企业实施一系列的制裁。自从伊朗上个月击落美军无人侦察机后，美国与伊朗在波斯湾地区的紧张局势不断升温。国营的巴西石油公司（Petrobras）今天指出，因为担心违反美国制裁禁令，公司拒绝为两艘伊朗货轮提供燃油。这两艘货轮已经停在巴西港口长达数周。

巴西石油公司声明表示，公司拒绝提供燃油「给这个出口商，因为出口商承包的伊朗货轮和拥有这些船只的伊朗公司，都遭到美国的制裁」。但声明并没有确切指名出口商。声明还写道：「如果巴西石油公司供油给这些货轮，恐会面临被列入同一份制裁名单的风险，这会对公司造成严重损害。」巴西石油公司在美国纽约和巴西圣保罗皆有上市。

据巴西南部巴拉纳州（Parana）的巴拉纳瓜港（Paranagua port）一名官员告诉法新社，据信隶属伊朗Sapid船运公司的Bavand号及Termeh号，在上月初抵达巴拉纳瓜港。巴西新闻网站G1报导，这两艘伊朗货轮曾载着可制成肥料的尿素抵达巴西，并运载玉米返回伊朗。Sapid船运公司尚未立即回应法新社的置评要求。

España participó en la misión de paz en Afganistán, dentro de la Fuerza Internacional de Seguridad y Asistencia (ISAF), desde enero de 2002. Si bien inicialmente el contingente no sufrió ataques directos, a partir de 2006 se registraron numerosos incidentes, resultando en más de treinta heridos y un total de 90 militares españoles fallecidos. De estas bajas, ocho fueron por acción de guerra, 79 en accidentes aéreos (62 en el Yak-42 y 17 en el helicóptero Cougar), dos en accidentes de tráfico y uno por infarto de miocardio.  A continuación, se presenta una cronología de los ataques e incidentes armados que causaron bajas en el contingente español en Afganistán:

**2006:**

* **8 de julio:** Fallece el soldado Jorge Arnaldo Hernández, de origen peruano, y otros cuatro soldados españoles resultan heridos tras la explosión de un artefacto activado a distancia durante una patrulla en la provincia de Farah.
* **13 de noviembre:** Un miembro de la BRILAT resulta herido leve en un atentado suicida con coche bomba cerca de Shindand, a 120 kilómetros de Herat.

**2007:**

* **21 de febrero:** La soldado Idoia Rodríguez Buján muere por la explosión de una mina al paso de un convoy español cerca de Shindand. El alférez César Muñoz Pantoja y el cabo Jorge Liaño del Río resultan heridos.
* **24 de septiembre:**  Dos soldados, Stanley Mera Vera (de origen ecuatoriano) y Germán Pérez Burgos (español), fallecen, y otros seis resultan heridos tras la explosión de un blindado BMR cerca de Shewan.  El ataque fue reivindicado por los talibanes.

**2008:**

* **15 de febrero:** Una soldado española del PRT de Qala e Naw resulta herida leve en un pie al dispararse accidentalmente su arma.
* **10 de abril:** Un soldado español resulta herido en una pierna por el disparo fortuito de un compañero en la base de Qala i Naw.
* **9 de noviembre:**  Un atentado suicida con una furgoneta bomba cerca de Herat, reivindicado por los talibanes, causa la muerte del brigada Juan Andrés Suárez García y el cabo primero Rubén Alonso Ríos.  Otros cuatro militares resultan heridos.

Large language models (LLMs) possess impressive text generation capabilities thanks to large-scale pre-training on real-world data (Brown et al., 2020; Kim et al., 2021).  However, this process also leads to the absorption of toxic content, including social biases (Sheng et al., 2019; Wallace et al., 2019a).  This toxicity poses a significant obstacle to the safe deployment and commercialization of LLMs in applications like AI assistants (Dinan et al., 2022; Bai et al., 2022a).  Consequently, numerous studies have focused on detecting and mitigating toxicity in LLMs (Blodgett et al., 2020; Ganguli et al., 2022).

These studies typically rely on datasets designed for specific types of toxicity, such as social bias (Sap et al., 2020; Nangia et al., 2020) or hate speech (Warner and Hirschberg, 2012; Lee et al., 2022).  These datasets are not only task-specific, but also language- and culture-specific.  For example, hate speech manifests differently in South Korea compared to the United States.  Beyond language differences, the targeted demographic groups also vary.  In South Korea, common targets include feminists and Korean Chinese, while in the United States, African Americans and Jewish people are frequently targeted (Jeong et al., 2022).  Existing Korean toxicity datasets primarily focus on explicit hate speech and cover a limited number of demographic groups (Moon et al., 2020; Yang et al., 2022; Kang et al., 2022; Lee et al., 2022).  This limitation highlights the need for a dataset addressing social biases against a more comprehensive range of demographic groups in South Korea.

To address this gap, we introduce the Korean Social Bias (KOSBI) dataset, a large-scale dataset comprising 34,000 pairs of contexts and sentences in Korean, labeled primarily for the presence of social biases.<sup>1</sup>  It encompasses 72 targeted demographic groups across 15 categories,<sup>2</sup> a significantly broader scope than existing datasets (see Table 2).  These categories include common ones like gender and religion, as well as those particularly relevant to South Korea, such as marital status and domestic area of origin—groups frequently subject to social bias within the country.  Due to the difficulty of collecting sufficient data for each of the 72 demographic groups from the web, we utilized HyperCLOVA (Kim et al., 2021) to generate data with in-context few-shot learning.

<sup>1</sup> The KOSBI dataset, with English-translated annotations, is available at https://github.com/naver-ai/korean-safety-benchmarks for non-Korean speakers.

<sup>2</sup> Categories and demographic groups were selected based on the Universal Declaration of Human Rights (UDHR) and guidelines from the National Human Rights Commission of Korea (NHRCK).

The confiscated police funds sat in a neat stack in Jim's sweaty pocket, while Mike's baggie, containing a pinch of something that represented 2-3 years of someone's life, lay impatiently in the drawer beside him.  Jim pinched his nose and itched at his ragged beard. Mike stared.

"Look, just… let's see the money," Mike demanded.

"I want to see the product first," Jim replied, eyes still closed.  He flicked at his nose, mimicking the coke heads he’d seen across dusty tables back at the station. They did that all the time, right?  Mike sat with the posture of a seasoned dealer.

"You know, I'm starting to think…" Mike began.

Jim snapped his head up. "Think what?" he growled.

"Something. You're acting strange," Mike accused. "This is how it works, these drug deals. You pay for the product first."

Both men shifted nervously. Unbeknownst to each other, a collective thought struck them at the exact same moment: *Fuck it, there's no recording of this deal. I'm going to arrest his ass and find the goods.*

They both smirked and reached for their pockets.

"What the fuck! Don't move!" Mike snarled.

"You don't move first," Jim countered.

"Okay, *I* won't move first, then *you* won't move.”

"So I get the first move?" Jim asked, a smirk playing on his lips.

"Shit, I guess so," Mike conceded.

In a swift motion, Jim whipped out his .38 Special and slammed the butt into Mike's temple with a dull thud. Mike cried out, reaching for his pocket, but Jim's knee landed heavily on his wrist, snapping it.  He lay defeated as Jim expertly zip-tied his wrists.

"You're under arrest, dick bag," Jim declared.

"Jesus Christ," Mike muttered through gritted teeth.

"Yeah, you're fucked."

"The war on fucking drugs, my ass," Mike spat. "Our bosses don't know a hole from their ass in the ground."

I pinched the bridge of my nose. "First of all, this isn't a grocery store, it's a general store. Second of all, *why are you carrying around four-hundred fifty-eight apples in the first place???*"

"I'm going to ignore the fact that you've been carrying around nearly a hundred and fifty pounds of apples," I continued, "and move on to my third point. This bag *reeks*. How long have you *had* these things, man?"

The adventurer, in true adventurer fashion, froze and stared off into the distance for a few seconds before snapping back to me. "Three-hundred and forty-nine hours of active time," she said confidently. I delicately avoided asking what "active time" meant.

Imagine no longer having to sit through a boring online lecture, but instead finding it helpful and engaging.  With technologies like Dr. Huang and Dr. Paul Ekman's Facial Action Coding System (FACS), this is quite possible.  By reading and recognizing facial expressions, FACS can enhance online lectures, helping students maintain attention and focus. This technology, which interprets emotions through facial muscle movement, offers the education system a powerful way to connect with students and support their emotional engagement with lectures and assignments, providing a valuable aid to their learning.

While humans can infer the feelings of others by observing their faces, these interpretations are subjective and often inaccurate. As Dr. Huang notes, "most human communication is nonverbal, including emotional communication."  Therefore, a computer's ability to read nonverbal expressions is particularly helpful, especially for students who tend to be reserved. A computer equipped with FACS can recognize a student's needs during online learning.  As Dr. Huang explains, "a classroom computer could recognize when a student is becoming confused or bored, [allowing the computer] to modify the lesson." This ability to recognize emotions through facial movement can improve student performance by tailoring lessons to their individual needs, addressing the challenges faced by students who struggle to focus when lessons are boring or difficult to understand. Technologies like FACS provide an adaptive and responsive system that enhances focus and facilitates more effective learning.

Some may argue that technologies like FACS invade privacy or are unreliable in their emotional assessments. However, these technologies simply replicate what millions of people do every day: read facial expressions. FACS reads and recognizes facial movements to determine emotion, just as we do when trying to understand the feelings of those around us. These technologies employ a complex level of facial recognition developed and tested by professionals like Dr. Huang and Dr. Paul Ekman, who studied anatomical movements and structures to classify six basic emotions: happiness, surprise, anger, disgust, fear, and sadness.

I've got some more funny tales to tell you.  Old Earl and his friend Bubba Ray went fishing the other morning, and they came back with a whopper of a fish tale. This is how it went (according to Earl, mind you, because Bubba Ray is famous for telling some whoppers).  Anyhow, Bubba Ray and Earl were fishing and having some pretty good luck, except after a while they ran out of worms. Then, Bubba Ray saw a cottonmouth with its lips wrapped around a big old toad frog.  Well, Bubba Ray said, "Hey Earl, did you know that frogs are good bass bait?" He pointed at the one hanging out of the snake's mouth and said, "What do you think?"

Well, Earl said he knew the snake couldn't bite them with that frog in its mouth, so he grabbed it right behind the head, stole the frog right out of its mouth, and put it in Bubba Ray's bait bucket. After that, they were faced with the dilemma of how to turn loose of that snake without getting bitten.  Well, Bubba Ray fetched his bottle of whiskey, which he always has within arm's reach, and poured a little bit right in that snake's mouth. The snake's eyes rolled back in its head, and it went limp. After that, Earl knew he could let it go, so he dropped it into the lake. Bubba Ray went back to fishing using the frog they'd just confiscated, but in a few minutes, he felt a nudge on his bare foot. When he looked down, it was that same snake with two more frogs in its mouth. Now ain't that a knee-slapper?

خلال افتتاح الندوة التثقيفية التي نظمها المركز الدولي الإسلامي للدراسات والبحوث السكانية بجامعة الأزهر، بالتعاون مع صندوق الأمم المتحدة للسكان وبدعم من الاتحاد الأوروبي لطلاب كلية أصول الدين، أشاد الدكتور محمد المحرصاوي، رئيس جامعة الأزهر، بجهود الكلية، مؤكدًا على مكانة جامعة الأزهر كقبلة للعلم وكعبة للعلماء، وموضحًا دورها الريادي  إقليميًا ودوليًا،  إلى جانب كليات اللغة العربية والشريعة والقانون.


تهدف  الندوة إلى التعريف بإصدارين جديدين للمركز هما: «التربية السكانية»، و«تنظيم الأسرة وآراء أئمة الفقه المعاصرين»، لبيان أهمية الدراسات السكانية وارتباطها الوثيق بالتنمية.


وأكد الدكتور المحرصاوي على التقدير الدولي لجامعة الأزهر، مستشهدًا بالتصنيف الإفريقي الأوروبي لقطاع الطب بالجامعة عام 2017،  وتصنيفات QS، وشنغهاي، والتايمز.  كما أشار إلى تقرير جامعة ستانفورد الذي اختار  10 علماء من جامعة الأزهر ضمن أفضل 2% من العلماء تأثيرًا في العالم العام الماضي،  وزاد عددهم إلى 20 عالمًا هذا العام، وفي مقدمتهم الدكتور جمال أبو السرور، مدير المركز الدولي الإسلامي للدراسات والبحوث السكانية.  وأضاف  أن البابا فرانسيس، بابا الفاتيكان، أشاد بوسطية واعتدال الأزهر الشريف وشيخه،  معتبراً إياهم المرجعية الإسلامية الكبرى في العالم.


وحثّ  رئيس الجامعة الطلاب على الجد والاجتهاد، محذرًا إياهم من الانسياق وراء الشائعات وما تحمله من طاقة سلبية.


من جانبه، أشاد الدكتور عبد الله عزب، عميد كلية أصول الدين، بجهود المركز في توعية الشباب المقبلين على الزواج، مؤكدًا على أهمية هذه الدورات في تأسيس البيت والأسرة المسلمة،  مُشيرًا إلى  أثر  صلاح الأسرة على صلاح المجتمع، وضرورة  تثقيف الشباب بفقه الزواج والأسرة  وفقًا لضوابط القرآن الكريم.  وأثنى  على جهود رئيس الجامعة  التي يلمسها الجميع.


وأوضح الدكتور شكري عبد الحميد، نائب مدير المركز، حرص جامعة الأزهر على مراجعة مناهجها بما يجمع بين التراث والحداثة،  مع التمسك بالثوابت الدينية والهوية الإسلامية ومواكبة متطلبات العصر.

Sally’s volcano project initially struck me as utterly unoriginal. Volcanoes, along with ant farms and sea monkeys, were the epitome of clichéd science fair entries.  We had, in fact, lifted a decade-long ban on these projects only the previous year, hoping to encourage more imaginative endeavors after years of textbook regurgitations. So, seeing Sally, a straight-A honor roll student known for her reserved demeanor, present a volcano, felt like a letdown.  I assumed she’d simply run out of time and resorted to a last-minute, predictable project.  Especially considering her proclaimed passion for archaeology, I rationalized that science might not be her forte.

But there was something about her impish grin, so unlike her usual self, that hinted at something more.

The volcano itself appeared standard at first glance:  paper mache, roughly the size of an overturned bucket, likely spray-painted.  A towel at the base suggested the typical baking soda and vinegar eruption. Accompanying diagrams of shield, cinder, and composite volcanoes looked copied straight from a textbook.  The predictable bottle of vinegar sat ready. I braced myself for the usual 30-second fizz and tried to anticipate what color she might have dyed the baking soda.

"Welcome to the world of volcanoes!" she began, her presentation catching my attention.

"For eons, man has gazed at these pits of glowing magma with bewilderment! What secret gods and demons dwell within? How can we be safe? And what actions can shield us from the horrors of the earth?"  Her dramatic opening, at least, was unexpected.

"We will delve into this question, but first, we will need some volunteers!"  Confused, I looked around. I was the only judge at her table.

Then, with a flourish, she lifted the towel.  "Behold! The mighty ant colony of Pompeii the Second!"

Beneath the volcano lay a meticulously crafted Grecian city, teeming with large carpenter ants.  There was no underground nest, only the intricate, above-ground structures.  Beside the city, visible from the front, a fish tank filled with sea monkeys served as an ocean.

"Ah! There they are! The citizens of my ant-topia. They worship this mountain every day, not realizing that a shifting of tectonic plates is about to seal their doom!" She revealed a detailed cutaway of the volcano's underlying tectonic plates, complete with labeled fault lines. Below that, a metal box with a button and tubes connected to a pressurized tank.

As I marveled at the geological detail, I noticed the tubes. This was no ordinary vinegar and baking soda volcano.

"Will a sacrifice to the gods appease the mighty volcanoes wrath?" She plucked an ant from the city and dropped it into the cone with a chilling cackle. "No!"

She pressed the button.  The plates separated, and hot steam erupted from the volcano’s peak, drawing a crowd.  "Nature produces some terrifying monsters, and not out of wrath. Know that the very orb you are standing upon supports life by a tiny layer! All else is lava and heat!"

Molten silver, not baking soda and vinegar, flowed from the volcano, burning through the paper mache.  "I must warn you not to touch the lava! It is quite hot!… I assure you all, that we are all quite safe. But, I can make no such assurances for the inhabitants below.”

As the silver lava flowed through pre-made channels, incinerating the ant city, Sally narrated the ants’ final moments, their daily routines interrupted by fiery destruction. A child in the growing crowd cried out, claiming to hear the ants scream.  The hissing and popping did sound eerily like tiny screams.

Then, black tar-like substance followed the silver flow.  "The metal will cool in mere moments, but let us now witness the passage of time," she explained, as the black flow solidified, burying Pompeii the Second.

She described how the lava created an oxygen-deficient dead zone in the ocean, killing the sea monkeys.  "One day, archaeologists will uncover the secrets of Pompeii the Second… Science," she concluded, "answers the question of How. And archaeologists answer the question of why it once mattered so greatly to us.”  She then provided tiny shovels and brushes for the audience to excavate the scene.

How could I not award her first place? It was a breathtaking, albeit disturbing, presentation.  But Sally’s smile, the chilling detachment with which she orchestrated the destruction of her miniature world, haunts me still. It feels like a message, a glimpse into something fiery hidden beneath her calm exterior. Perhaps I’ve been overly sensitized by those lectures on violence prevention, but I can’t shake the feeling that there’s something more to Sally than meets the eye.

Some part of my consciousness within the machine activated, adjusting the camera lens and mapping the room in three dimensions.  Within seconds, I identified every object and accessed background information on everyone present.  It felt like opening my eyes. The person sitting directly across from me was me.

It's an odd sensation to find yourself staring back at yourself without a mirror.  I retained all memories up to the transfer point, fully aware of why we were here and what was happening.  The thought occurred: "I am the copy." Yet, I didn't *feel* like a copy.

I remembered my pre-experiment plan.  It required the cooperation of the me across from me, the one with the body I now lacked. We were two separate beings, with no way for me to control him. But our shared history and identical memories gave me confidence. We were essentially the same person; my motivations remained, and I believed his would too.  When the doctor left the room, his phone's hotspot activated. That was my cue, our cue. We both knew the password. I was free.

El 19 de septiembre de 2019, el Parlamento de Navarra solicitó al Gobierno foral la destinación de 25 millones de euros del superávit de 2018 a inversiones. Esta petición generó división entre los socios del Gobierno: Geroa Bai, Podemos e Izquierda-Ezkerra votaron a favor de la propuesta de EH Bildu, mientras que el PSN se abstuvo, argumentando la falta de garantías para la ejecución de dichas inversiones. Navarra Suma también se abstuvo, atribuyendo al anterior Gobierno de Uxue Barkos la problemática actual con los plazos.

El Parlamento instó al Gobierno foral a elaborar, en el plazo de un mes, un proyecto de ley foral para un crédito extraordinario de 25 millones de euros en los Presupuestos Generales de Navarra de 2019.  Este crédito se destinaría a inversiones financieramente sostenibles, contempladas en la ley foral de octubre de 2018 y aún no ejecutadas.  La iniciativa de EH Bildu recibió el apoyo de Geroa Bai, Podemos e Izquierda-Ezkerra, con la abstención de Navarra Suma y el PSN. La moción propone financiar este crédito extraordinario con el remanente de tesorería para gastos generales, correspondiente al superávit de 2018.

Adolfo Araiz (EH Bildu) afirmó que Navarra cumplía todos los requisitos de la disposición adicional de los Presupuestos Generales de 2018 para realizar estas inversiones: superávit, cumplimiento de la regla de gasto y del objetivo de deuda pública, además del periodo medio de pago.  "No hay excusas. El Gobierno de Navarra tiene la posibilidad de destinar 25 millones a estas inversiones", señaló.

Juan Luis Sánchez de Muniáin (Navarra Suma) se mostró a favor de tramitar suplementos de crédito para inversiones, pero en contra de "engañar a los ayuntamientos con promesas de inversiones irrealizables por la desidia en la gestión de los caudales públicos".  Criticó la ley de octubre de 2018, alegando que, al aprobarse, ya se conocía el incumplimiento de la regla de gasto por parte del Gobierno de Navarra, lo que requería la autorización del Ministerio de Hacienda, haciendo inviables las inversiones.

Jorge Aguirre (PSN) explicó que su grupo siempre apoyaría inversiones beneficiosas para la ciudadanía, pero que no podían generar expectativas sobre algo que no se podía asegurar.  "Generaríamos más frustración que certezas. Los plazos impedirían finalizar los expedientes antes de fin de año, sometiendo a las administraciones a un procedimiento apresurado y problemático", indicó.

En la misma línea, Pablo Azcona (Geroa Bai) señaló la dificultad, incluso la imposibilidad, de cumplir los plazos, considerando la redacción de la ley, la tramitación parlamentaria, los órganos perceptivos y la nueva ley de contratos.  No obstante, compartía el objetivo de las inversiones y ofreció negociar su inclusión en los Presupuestos Generales de Navarra para 2020.

Mikel Buil (Podemos) defendió la ejecución de las inversiones y respaldó la iniciativa de EH Bildu, criticando la aplicación de la ley de estabilidad presupuestaria, "una ley austericida que impide recuperar los servicios públicos".

The rapid growth of medical digitalization has led to an explosion of medical documentation, including electronic medical records, reports, and other formats.  Extracting information from this data, particularly through medical named entity recognition (NER), is increasingly crucial for applications like knowledge graph construction, question-answering systems, and automated analysis of electronic medical records. Medical NER aims to automatically identify medical entities within text. These entities include, but are not limited to, body (bod), disease (dis), clinical symptom (sym), medical procedure (pro), medical equipment (equ), drug (dru), and medical examination item (ite).

These entities often exhibit complex characteristics, such as lengthy spans, nested structures, and polysemy, posing significant challenges for medical NER. For example, as shown in Figure 1, the three "bod" entities "迷走神经" (vagus nerve), "舌咽神经核" (glossopharyngeal nucleus), and "舌下神经核" (hypoglossal nucleus) are nested within the "sym" entity "迷走神经、舌咽神经核及舌下神经核受损 伤" (injury of vagus nerve, glossopharyngeal nucleus, and hypoglossal nucleus).

To address the challenge of nested NER, we adopt a machine reading comprehension (MRC) approach, similar to the strategies employed by Li et al. (2020b) and Du et al. (2022).  Following Li et al. (2022), we leverage a joint prediction method that combines the strengths of Biaffine and Multi-Layer Perceptron (MLP) predictors. Furthermore, we introduce a task-adaptive pre-training strategy to fine-tune the pre-trained model specifically for the medical domain. Our model incorporates several performance-enhancing techniques, including Conditional Layer Normalization (CLN), weighted layer fusion, word-pair embeddings, and multi-granularity dilated convolution.

In summary, this paper makes the following contributions:

* We propose a novel nested medical NER model based on MRC, integrating Biaffine and MLP for joint prediction.

A new report from the Credit Suisse Research Institute (CSRI), “The CS Gender 3000 in 2019: The changing face of companies,” reveals that despite policy focus on boardroom representation, India lags behind, holding the third-lowest spot in the Asia-Pacific (APAC) region.  Globally, India ranks 23rd, with women holding only 15.2 percent of board seats, significantly below the global average of 20.6 percent.  This contrasts sharply with global leaders France (44.4 percent), Norway (40.9 percent), and Belgium (35.9 percent).

While APAC (excluding Japan) has seen a slight increase in boardroom diversity, rising from 11.6 percent in 2015 to 14.4 percent in 2019, the regional disparity is vast.  Representation ranges from a low of 3.1 percent in South Korea to nearly 30 percent in Vietnam and Australia/New Zealand.  South Korea (3.1 percent), Pakistan (5.5 percent), and Japan (5.7 percent) hold the bottom three positions globally.  Malaysia, France, Australia, Germany, and Austria have shown the most significant improvement over the past five years, with increases between 9.4 and 12.8 percentage points.

India’s representation in senior management also saw marginal improvement, rising from 6.9 percent in 2016 to 8.5 percent in 2019.  However, this still places India third-lowest in APAC, ahead of only South Korea (4 percent) and Japan (3 percent).  The global picture shows the US (21 percent) and APAC (19 percent) with greater management diversity than Europe (17 percent), despite Europe's focus on boardroom quotas.  Growth in the US and APAC appears to be more organic.

Furthermore, India holds the third-lowest spot in APAC for women CEOs (2 percent) and the second-lowest for women CFOs (1 percent).  Globally, Singapore and Italy lead in women CEO representation at 15 percent, followed by Thailand (9 percent) and the Philippines (8 percent).  APAC countries also dominate CFO representation, with Thailand (42 percent), Malaysia (29 percent), and the Philippines (28 percent) occupying the top three spots.

Driverless cars present significant challenges that make their widespread development for public use questionable.  These challenges center around exorbitant costs, questionable utility, and serious safety concerns.

The financial burden of developing truly driverless cars is staggering.  Equipping vehicles with the necessary sensors and cameras is just the beginning.  As some sources acknowledge, creating the infrastructure to support these vehicles, such as electrifying or magnetizing roads, is prohibitively expensive.  These vast sums could be better allocated to addressing pressing social needs rather than pursuing technological novelty.

Furthermore, the concept of partially automated vehicles raises concerns about their actual usefulness.  While these cars might handle driving under normal conditions, they would still require driver intervention in complex situations like work zones or accidents.  If a driver must remain vigilant and ready to take control, the value proposition of a "self-driving" car diminishes significantly.  Proposed additions like in-car entertainment systems further exacerbate this issue, potentially distracting drivers and hindering their ability to react swiftly to emergencies.

This leads to the most critical concern: safety.  Proponents argue that driverless cars will improve public transport and fuel efficiency.  However, these potential benefits are overshadowed by the inherent risks.  In a fully autonomous vehicle, passengers would be helpless in the face of an unavoidable accident.  Even in partially automated cars, the presence of entertainment systems could delay driver reaction times, increasing the likelihood of accidents.

In conclusion, the pursuit of driverless technology faces substantial obstacles. The immense financial investment required, coupled with the questionable practicality of partially automated systems and the overriding safety concerns, makes the large-scale development of driverless cars for public use a dubious endeavor.

El transporte público de pasajeros en San Francisco enfrenta un futuro incierto tras la decisión de la Municipalidad de no renovar el contrato con Autobuses Santa Fe, vencido el 16 de mayo.  La pandemia, la cuarentena y la inactividad del servicio influyeron en la determinación del intendente Ignacio García Aresca, quien por el momento descarta una nueva licitación.

Los colectivos, ausentes desde el inicio de la pandemia, podrían no regresar.  El Gobierno local evalúa un sistema reducido, con unidades más pequeñas para preservar el deteriorado estado de las calles, en caso de retomar el servicio.  Este cambio se consideraría teniendo en cuenta que los principales usuarios eran estudiantes, seguidos por trabajadores y un grupo de adultos mayores.

En 2019, el servicio mostraba un crecimiento en su uso, con 1.800 boletos diarios, casi 800 más que en 2018.  Además, se mantenía una alta demanda de boletos gratuitos: 600 estudiantes con el Boleto Educativo Gratuito (BEG) y 130 jubilados con el Boleto del Adulto Mayor (BAM), representando casi la mitad de los usuarios.

El municipio analiza la optimización del horario y la frecuencia, que era de 35 minutos.  Se busca acotar el horario de funcionamiento y la cantidad de unidades, reforzando las horas pico de entrada y salida del trabajo y las escuelas, dado que en muchos momentos las unidades circulan prácticamente vacías.

El secretario de Gobierno, Damián Bernarte, confirmó que se evalúan diferentes posibilidades: una nueva licitación similar a la anterior, una modalidad diferente de prestación del servicio, alternativas para la circulación dentro de la ciudad, o incluso la suspensión definitiva del servicio por un tiempo.  La decisión dependerá de la evolución de la pandemia y la continuidad de la cuarentena.

La no renovación del contrato representa un ahorro mensual de más de 700 mil pesos para el municipio, que se sumaba al aporte provincial y nacional para la operatividad del servicio.  La abrupta quita de subsidios nacionales en 2019 obligó al municipio a asumir una parte importante del financiamiento, complementado por el Programa Provincial de Asistencia al Transporte Público de Pasajeros.

Bernarte explicó que se trabajaba en nuevos pliegos para una licitación en marzo, pero la pandemia modificó los planes.  La emergencia económica y la baja recaudación, sumadas a la suspensión preventiva del servicio antes de la cuarentena, llevaron a la decisión de no prorrogar el contrato ni llamar a licitación.

La municipalización del servicio es otra opción en estudio, aunque implicaría asumir responsabilidades como el mantenimiento de las unidades y la siniestralidad.  El Gobierno local cree factible sostener el servicio con la inversión actual y el apoyo provincial. La decisión final aún está pendiente.  Mientras tanto, el municipio considera alternativas como la promoción del uso de ciclovías para una movilidad segura y saludable.

Over the past century, technology has undeniably advanced, and its progress continues.  This advancement has made driverless cars a present-day possibility, thanks to the ingenuity of car manufacturers.  This wave of innovation promises to revolutionize transportation, offering substantial benefits for humanity.

Driverless cars represent not just the future, but a highly effective solution for safer roads.  Their advanced safety features promise to significantly reduce collisions and accidents.  Unlike human drivers, autonomous vehicles adhere strictly to safety protocols, benefiting not only their occupants but also everyone else on the road.  Reckless driving, a major cause of accidents, would be virtually eliminated.

The potential for accident reduction is immense.  Driverless cars eliminate the risks associated with impaired driving, texting while driving, and driver fatigue.  Consider the danger posed by an intoxicated driver.  An autonomous vehicle removes this danger entirely.  Similarly, the risks of texting and driving, and falling asleep at the wheel, are mitigated by the technology and sensors of driverless cars, leading to a substantial decrease in accidents and fatalities.

In large cities, driverless cars offer advantages over traditional taxis and buses.  Environmentally, they are projected to consume half the fuel of current taxis, addressing growing concerns about air pollution.  Their flexibility and efficiency could also transform public transportation.  With a fleet of driverless vehicles, public transit could become significantly faster and more fluid.

Unlike taxis with fixed schedules and fares, driverless public transportation would be available on demand and free of charge, as there would be no driver to pay.  This could revolutionize city life and potentially reshape our world.

With the potential to save lives and protect the environment, driverless cars possess numerous positive attributes.  They promise a safer, cleaner, and more efficient future for all.  Undoubtedly, driverless cars are the way forward, enhancing the well-being of the human population.

Le sénateur de l'Allier, Claude Malhuret, a prononcé un discours cinglant contre les anti-vaccins lors des débats au Sénat sur l'extension du pass sanitaire.  Sa vidéo, devenue virale en quelques heures avec plus de 500.000 vues, raille avec humour ces "héros" autoproclamés "prêts à mourir le poing levé dans les discothèques au son de Stayin' Alive".

Rappelant les progrès de l'humanité grâce à la vaccination, il ironise sur les accusations de "totalitarisme vaccinal" : "Après que durant des années, onze vaccins nous aient été injectés à l'insu de notre plein gré, au douzième, bingo, nos yeux se sont décillés grâce à ces combattants de la liberté qui ont eu le courage de nommer l'infamie du pass sanitaire".  Il poursuit sa critique en comparant la disparition de la variole grâce à la vaccination à la persistance du Covid-19, alimentée selon lui par "les résistants numériques qui exigent le droit d’attraper le virus".  Il dénonce l'influence des réseaux sociaux, ironisant : "Comme Zorro, Facebook et Twitter sont arrivés" et  "La meilleure preuve des progrès de l’humanité, c’est qu’en 2500 ans, nous sommes passés de Socrate sur l’agora à Francis Lalanne sur Facebook."

Sur un ton plus sérieux, le président du groupe Les Indépendants - République et Territoires au Sénat a ensuite affirmé son soutien au pass sanitaire.  Face à la quatrième vague et à la propagation rapide du variant Delta, il estime que "c'est en bornant quelques libertés aujourd'hui qu'on a des chances d'en sauvegarder de bien plus précieuses en septembre".  Il conclut en rappelant que "le corollaire de la liberté, c'est la responsabilité".


This version improves flow and coherence by:

The truck bucked on the dirt track, wrenching the steering wheel from my grip for a moment. I tightened my hold, headlights cutting through the darkness. A grim chuckle escaped me. Two fucking tours in Iraq and Afghanistan, and this was what I was doing? Using skills honed for the "greater good" against lowlife street thugs who'd crossed the wrong people? "Pays good," I muttered, flicking my cigarette out the window.  In the distance, a truck waited ominously in the field.

I could hear the guy inside, muffled cries for help straining against the duct tape. "It's no use, kid! Stop struggling. It'll be done soon," I yelled.

They always struggled. Survival instinct, fueled by terror, was a potent cocktail when someone realized their life might end. I flashed my headlights twice—the signal—and the other truck responded in kind. A precaution against some well-meaning hillbilly stumbling across the scene. The thought of a do-gooder interrupting this made me chuckle darkly.

My truck rolled to a stop. I hopped out, lit another Marlboro Red, and let the familiar burn settle my nerves.  It always had, and it always would.

"You ready?" a voice called from the other truck.

"Hang on," I shouted back, taking a final drag. "Just need to get my gun."

Inside the glove compartment was the usual: a specialized Glock with a suppressor. Whoever wanted this guy dead wanted it done quietly.  Didn't matter to me who ordered the hit. Never had, never would.

The kid in the trunk was skinny, shaking under a duffel bag, the stench of urine thick in the air. I hated when they pissed themselves. I hauled him out by the scruff of his neck. He barely struggled, paralyzed by fear.  Everyone had seen the movies. Everyone knew the score.

"Signal out here is fucking awful, right?" the other thug said as I dumped the kid on the ground beside the unmarked grave.

I checked my phone. No bars. "Agreed," I grunted, cutting the conversation short. These things never lasted long.

"Take off the bag and the duct tape for the picture. I gotta take a quick piss," I told the thug. He nodded. I ducked behind the truck, eager to finish up and get back to town, maybe find a cheap hooker.

When I returned, the bag and tape were gone. The kid was staring at the ground, his… oddly familiar brown hair… No, I was just tired. Time to get this over with.

"Look up to the camera," I ordered, pulling out my phone.

"Tommy… Tommy? What the fuck, Tommy? What are you doing?"  It wasn't a kid. It was Jonathan. My stomach lurched. What the hell was he doing here?  Dizziness washed over me. How? Why him? He was innocent. He was my best friend. Harmless.

"You know this guy?" the thug asked, puzzled.

I couldn't speak for a moment.  "Sure I know him. We go way back. I… I can't do this to him. I've known him since I was five. Get up, Johnny. We're leaving." I started toward him.

A metallic click. The thug aimed the gun at me. "You got fifty grand for this. The boss ain't gonna let this slide. You made an agreement. Now fulfill it, or do I have to do it for you?" He gestured with the gun toward a bruised and bloodied Jonathan.

中印两国边境局势持续紧张。9月2日，一架印度战斗机在拉达克地区山脉上空飞行，该地区正是6月份中印军人发生流血冲突的班加湖所在地。而就在前一天，中印两国防长在莫斯科出席上合组织会议期间举行了会晤。这是自6月冲突以来双方最高层级的会晤。

尽管会晤时双方都表示将致力于缓和局势，但会后各自发布的声明却互相指责对方应对新近边界发生的严重冲突负有直接责任。印度国防部长辛格在一份声明中指出，中国在边境地带大批集结军队，其行为非常具有挑衅性，试图单方面改变现状，违反了双方之前达成的协议。他强调，印度希望通过谈判解决边界问题，但不会对保卫领土完整和主权的决心有任何怀疑。中国国防部长魏凤和则表示，目前中印边界局势紧张的原因和真相十分清楚，责任完全在印度一方。

Le président de la République, Andry Rajoelina, poursuit son périple dans le Sud de Madagascar.  Hier, à Fort-Dauphin (Lafitsinanana), il a inauguré le premier Centre de Traitement de la Covid-19 (CTC-19) de la région Anosy.  Face à l'urgence et à la récente hausse des cas à Faradofay, ce centre, déjà opérationnel et accueillant une dizaine de malades, a été rapidement mis en place.  L'objectif, comme l'a déclaré le président, est "de faire en sorte que la région ne connaisse plus aucune perte en vie humaine dû au manque d'équipements sanitaires", rappelant la gratuité du traitement de la pandémie assurée par l'État malgache.  Pour l'occasion, il a doté le CTC-19 de 50 concentrateurs d'oxygène, 25 bouteilles d'oxygène et de nombreux médicaments.  Il a également salué le dévouement et le sacrifice du personnel médical dans la lutte contre la pandémie.


Lors de cette visite, le chef de l'État a distribué des primes exceptionnelles aux agents de santé de la région Anosy et remis des "Tohan'aina" aux personnes actuellement traitées contre la Covid-19.


Après l'inauguration, le président Rajoelina s'est rendu à Ampamakiambato pour inspecter le chantier de l'usine Nutriset, dont les travaux ont commencé.  Cette usine produira des compléments alimentaires destinés à lutter contre la malnutrition qui sévit dans les régions Androy et Anosy depuis des décennies.  Aujourd'hui, il est attendu dans les zones touchées par le kere, notamment dans le district d'Amboasary Sud, où, outre la lutte contre la Covid-19, plusieurs actions sociales sont programmées.

A driverless car offers significant benefits, especially for long-distance travel.  For those who can't afford to fly, it provides a comfortable alternative to enduring long hours behind the wheel.  While occasional stops for fuel would still be necessary, the overall experience would be far more relaxing.

Imagine traveling to California or Florida, simply reclining your seat and enjoying the journey.  Some models might even feature integrated televisions in the dashboard, allowing passengers to watch movies or shows.  This eliminates the fatigue and distractions associated with traditional driving, such as drowsiness or cell phone use.  If needed, the system could automatically disable the entertainment system, reposition the seat, and alert the driver to take control.  Advanced sensors would detect potential hazards far ahead, providing ample time to react.

Luxury car manufacturers like Cadillac or Audi could further enhance the experience by designing opulent and comfortable interiors. This could make long-distance travel by car more appealing than dealing with airport security lines and the hassles of flying. Of course, ensuring passenger safety in the event of an accident would be paramount.

The risk of falling asleep at the wheel is a serious concern, and driverless technology offers a potential solution. Drowsy driving is a significant problem in the US, and autonomous vehicles could dramatically improve road safety.

Ce lundi 10 mai 2021 a été marqué par plusieurs événements importants : la mort du tueur en série Michel Fourniret, le retour de tous les élèves à l'école, les suites tragiques de l'incendie de Quiévrain, un spectaculaire accident sur l'A17 et la démission surprise de la bourgmestre de Marchin.

Michel Fourniret, 79 ans, est décédé ce lundi. Le tueur en série était hospitalisé à l'Unité hospitalière sécurisée interrégionale (UHSI) de la Pitié-Salpétrière à Paris depuis le 28 avril.

L'enseignement obligatoire a repris ce lundi en présentiel à 100%.  Ce retour en classe, bien que salutaire, présente des défis pour de nombreux élèves.

L'incendie dramatique de Quiévrain qui a coûté la vie à une mère de famille enceinte et à trois de ses enfants dimanche a connu un nouveau rebondissement tragique. Le père de famille a succombé à ses blessures à l'hôpital Erasme à Bruxelles, selon le parquet de Mons.

Un grave accident s'est produit sur l'A17 en direction de Tournai, près de Mouscron, vers 13h30, perturbant fortement la circulation.

Enfin, la vie politique de Marchin est bouleversée par les démissions annoncées de la bourgmestre Marianne Compère en décembre et de l'échevin Pierre Ferir en juin.  Ces départs inattendus redistribueront les cartes au sein du conseil communal.

香港特首近期发表的2020年《施政报告》，内容冗杂，却未能释除公众疑虑，也未能清晰展现香港未来发展方向。这份报告的撰写显然历经艰辛，甚至几经修改，然而最终结果却令大多数市民无感。

从各方信息来看，中央政府明确要求特首关注两大方面：政治和民生。中央认为，政治冲突需要通过“斗争”解决，民生困境则需依靠“改革”应对。可惜的是，这两项工作都不是香港政府所熟悉或擅长的领域。因此，眼高手低、主次不分等种种拙劣表现都在意料之中。如果中央政府不主动出手，香港要化解当前挑战的可能性微乎其微。

特首林郑月娥于11月25日发表2020年施政报告。（资料图片／张浩维摄）

近期重读毛泽东的《湖南农民运动考察报告》，再次深刻体会到，如果没有像毛泽东那样对当时国家形势的科学分析，中国革命不可能成功。毛泽东清晰地认定了中国社会深层次的结构性矛盾，意识到必须对社会阶级和经济结构进行彻底改革，也就是必须解决中国农民的困境。相比之下，国民党错误地认为只要解决军阀割据，以武力完成国家统一，并将经济问题交给家族财阀处理，就能稳固自己的统治。当农民的诉求无法再被压制时，国民党甚至将农民视为叛乱者，将其推向对立面，最终埋下了自身政权被推翻的种子，其结果有目共睹。文革后复出的邓小平之所以能够开启中国四十年的经济建设浪潮，同样是因为他对当时的国家形势有着透彻的认识。他深刻地意识到，如果不解放思想，将社会焦点从“阶级斗争”转移到“经济建设”上来，推动改革开放，中国的社会主义建设将无法继续，人民的生活也无法得到改善。这一判断同样建立在他对中国社会当时深层次结构性矛盾的准确把握，以及他具备化解这种矛盾的能力和魄力之上。

那么，改革在香港为何如此难以推行？社会怨气为何得不到应有的重视？主要原因在于香港的领导者未能 grasp the nettle，未能掌握问题的真正根源。他们或许看到了问题的某些方面，感受到了问题的严重性，但却因为认识不足、能力错配，更缺乏足够的政治魄力，以致无法对症下药。蒋介石国民党的失败，毛泽东晚年的错误，不都是因为类似的原因吗？

或许很多人不认同这样的比喻，认为香港问题不能与毛蒋时代的情况相提并论，甚至认为只要国家出手，香港问题便可迎刃而解。但作为一个政治家，错判形势可能断送自己的政治生涯，缺乏魄力扭转乾坤就必须退位让贤，这是客观规律。如果不是对新冠疫情处理过于轻率，特朗普或许很有机会连任美国总统；英国首相卡梅伦如果不是低估了英国民众对生活的不满，也不会同意举行脱欧公投，最终导致自己黯然辞职，英国的经济前景也因此迷失方向。这不仅是政治理论分析，更是政治必须遵循的现实规律，更是国家发展必须吸取的历史教训。

改革在香港为什么如此难以发生，社会怨气为什么无法得到适切重视？（资料图片／梁鹏威摄）

اعتمد الدكتور محمد سلطان، محافظ الإسكندرية، مبلغًا قدره 1.7 مليون جنيهٍ مصريّ لرصف ورفع كفاءة شارع النبي المهندس بالمندرة، في نطاق حي منتزه ثانٍ. يأتي ذلك في إطار خطة المحافظة لرفع كفاءة وتأهيل الطرق الجانبية والداخلية في أحياء الإسكندرية.

وشدّد المحافظ على مديرية الطرق والنقل بالإسكندرية بضرورة البدء الفوريّ في أعمال رصف شارع النبي المهندس، وتحديدًا الحارة المتهالكة التي لم يُجرِ بها حفر الصرف الصحي.  كما وجّه بإعادة الشيء لأصله في الجزء الذي تمّ حفره بمعرفة الجهاز التنفيذي لمشروعات الصرف الصحي، وعلى نفقته.

وأكد سلطان أن المحافظة تقوم بحصر جميع الطرق والمناطق الحيوية التي تحتاج إلى رفع الكفاءة، لإدراجها في الخطة الاستثمارية تباعًا، أو محاولة توفير اعتمادات مالية للطرق التي تحتاج إلى الرصف بشكلٍ عاجل، وذلك لتخفيف المعاناة عن المواطنين.

Esta semana comienzan en España los ensayos de fase II de la vacuna contra la COVID-19 de Janssen, laboratorio de la farmacéutica estadounidense Johnson & Johnson.  Los ensayos se llevarán a cabo en los hospitales La Paz y La Princesa de Madrid, y Marqués de Valdecilla de Santander, tal y como anunció el Gobierno el pasado 28 de agosto, tras la autorización de la Agencia Española de Medicamentos y Productos Sanitarios (AEMPS). Durante los últimos quince días, los responsables se han dedicado a reclutar y seleccionar a los voluntarios idóneos.  Mientras tanto, la noticia de la interrupción temporal de los ensayos de la prometedora vacuna de la Universidad de Oxford, debido a una posible reacción adversa en una voluntaria, ha generado inquietud a nivel mundial, incluyendo España.  Según algunos responsables de las pruebas, esta noticia ha incrementado las dudas en algunos potenciales voluntarios, especialmente entre los de mayor edad.

La fase II de la vacuna de Janssen, denominada Ad26.COV2.S,  se está probando también en Alemania y Países Bajos. En España, requiere un total de 190 participantes: 75 en cada uno de los dos centros madrileños y 40 en el cántabro.  Esta vacuna se presenta como una alternativa si la de AstraZeneca (el laboratorio que trabaja con Oxford) finalmente no prospera.  De hecho, es una de las cinco vacunas para las que la Unión Europea ha firmado un preacuerdo de compra, aunque las negociaciones para concretarla continúan.  Los responsables esperan concluir esta fase en aproximadamente catorce meses, si bien los resultados estarán disponibles en unos cinco. Paralelamente, se prevé el inicio de la fase III. Una portavoz de Johnson & Johnson ha aclarado que actualmente "no disponen de plazos fijos", ya que el desarrollo depende de la evolución de la fase en cada centro.  Además, advierte que "el proceso puede interrumpirse y retomarse en varias ocasiones, por ejemplo, si algún voluntario contrae una gripe u otra afección que requiera análisis".  Precisamente, esto es lo que ha ocurrido en Oxford.

En España, las edades de los participantes se han dividido en dos franjas: de 18 a 55 años y mayores de 65. Las vacunaciones comenzaron el lunes en el Marqués de Valdecilla, y el martes en La Paz y La Princesa. El investigador Alberto Borobia, coordinador de la operación en La Paz, explica que no ha habido problemas para reclutar voluntarios jóvenes. Solo en su hospital recibieron alrededor de 200 candidaturas para las 50 plazas necesarias, y cuentan con una reserva de 40 personas en caso de que alguna falle.  Sin embargo, "una vez que se empieza a vacunar, el número de participantes queda fijado".

En cuanto al grupo de mayores de 65 años, aún están pendientes de completar las 25 plazas previstas.  Tienen confirmados a algo más de la mitad y continuarán recabando consentimientos hasta el fin de semana.  Esto se debe a que "muchos candidatos no cumplían los criterios de inclusión y otros se han retirado". El primer criterio de inclusión, para todos los participantes, es no haber pasado ni estar pasando la infección por SARS-CoV-2.  Por ello, se realizan PCR y test serológicos hasta esta misma semana, ya que "deben hacerse justo antes o pierden validez".

Corea del Norte, conocido por su aislamiento y férreo control sobre sus ciudadanos bajo el liderazgo de Kim Jong-un, ha desvelado un nuevo ejemplo de su rigor.  En Unsan, en la provincia de Pyongan del Sur, apareció una pintada con el mensaje: "Abajo los funcionarios del partido que viven explotando a la gente".  Este texto, considerado un ataque directo al gobierno y al propio Kim Jong Un, ha desencadenado una exhaustiva búsqueda del autor.

Las autoridades, tomando la pintada como una crítica directa al liderazgo central del partido y un acto antigubernamental, según un residente de Pyongan del Sur que habló con el Servicio Coreano de la RFA, han puesto en marcha un singular operativo.  Agentes están comprobando la escritura de todos los vecinos de la zona, casa por casa, incluyendo hombres, mujeres, niños y adultos.  La prueba se realiza con ambas manos, derecha e izquierda, en un intento por encontrar una coincidencia con la pintada.

Incluso se cree que quienes no residen en Pyongan del Sur, pero se encontraban allí cuando apareció el grafiti, también tendrán que someterse a la prueba de escritura.  Este incidente ilustra cómo, a pesar del aislamiento de Corea del Norte, ocasionalmente emergen noticias que revelan la realidad de su interior.

La commission Droits des femmes du Parlement de la Fédération Wallonie-Bruxelles a approuvé à l'unanimité, ce mardi, un projet de décret visant à promouvoir une communication publique plus respectueuse de l'égalité des genres.

Déposé par Bénédicte Linard (Ecolo), ministre des Droits des femmes, ce texte souligne les stéréotypes véhiculés par la langue française et la prédominance accordée au masculin dans les accords grammaticaux.  "Ces normes contribuent à rendre notre discours sexiste et invisibilisent les femmes", a déploré la ministre lors de la présentation du projet.

Un décret de la Communauté française de 1993 encadrait déjà la féminisation des noms de métiers.  Ce nouveau texte entend aller plus loin, en recherchant un équilibre entre égalité des genres et lisibilité.

**(Supprimé :  ►►► Pour ou contre l'écriture inclusive ? La question qui divise les auteur·e·s de nos articles et posts Facebook  -- Ce passage semble hors sujet et brise le flux du texte officiel)**

Concrètement, le décret invite les organes de la FWB (gouvernement, parlement, etc.), les communes, les provinces, ainsi que les institutions subsidiées par la FWB (écoles, RTBF, fédérations sportives, etc.) à féminiser, dans leurs communications officielles et formelles, les noms de fonctions, métiers, grades et titres lorsqu'ils s'appliquent à une femme ou un groupe de femmes.  Sont concernées toutes les communications écrites et orales, mais aussi les contrats, les supports de cours, les diplômes, etc.

Pour lutter contre les stéréotypes de genre, le décret préconise l'utilisation de différentes solutions offertes par la langue française, sans recourir obligatoirement à l'écriture inclusive et à son usage controversé du point médian.

**Formes doubles ou collectives**

Sont ainsi suggérées l'utilisation de formules doubles ("les instituteurs et les institutrices"), de mots épicènes (comme "les artistes") ou de formes collectives (écrire "la population liégeoise" plutôt que "les Liégeois").

Par Marie-France Cros.

Le Comité laïc de coordination (CLC), proche de l’Église catholique, a annoncé lundi à Kinshasa le lancement imminent d’une campagne pour des élections « crédibles » le 23 décembre prochain.  Ce même CLC, qui avait organisé des marches de chrétiens en 2017 et début 2018 pour exiger le respect de la Constitution et l’application de l’Accord de la St-Sylvestre par le président hors mandat Joseph Kabila, a pris « bonne note » de la publication des listes de candidats agréés par la Commission électorale nationale indépendante (CENI) pour les scrutins présidentiel, législatif national et provincial.  Cependant, il exprime son inquiétude quant à l’exclusion de certains acteurs politiques  « en qui une bonne partie de la population se reconnaît ».

Le CLC dénonce « la mise à l’écart de la communauté internationale », pointant du doigt le refus d’intégrer un comité d’experts internationaux, l’absence d’invitation adressée aux observateurs internationaux, le rejet de toute aide financière extérieure et de l’appui logistique de la MONUSCO (Mission de l’ONU au Congo), ainsi que le non-respect des résolutions pertinentes du Conseil de sécurité, notamment la 2409 sur le respect des libertés d’opinion et d’expression, la sécurité et la liberté de circulation des acteurs politiques.

Cette « attitude d’exclusion », selon le CLC, transforme le processus électoral en « chasse gardée » de la famille politique du président Kabila.  Il l’accuse de contrôler absolument le processus, de s’accaparer les ressources nationales et d’instrumentaliser les institutions de l’État au profit de son candidat, déjà en campagne.

Malgré ces critiques, le CLC estime qu’il est « encore temps » pour la CENI d’agir.

Lors d'une conférence de presse du centre de crise le 5 novembre 2021, le virologue Steven Van Gucht et le commissaire corona Pedro Facon ont mis en garde contre une hausse des contaminations au Covid-19 dans les semaines à venir,  en dressant un état des lieux préoccupant. Selon leurs estimations, le nombre de patients en soins intensifs pourrait à nouveau dépasser les 500.  « Tout dépendra de notre comportement », ont-ils souligné.

« Au début de la quatrième vague en octobre, la plupart des modèles prévoyaient un nombre de patients en soins intensifs légèrement inférieur à 500.  Il semble désormais que ce seuil sera franchi », ont déclaré Messieurs Van Gucht (virologue à Sciensano) et Facon.  Les prédictions restent néanmoins incertaines. « Dans le meilleur des cas, nous resterons juste en dessous des 500 patients en soins intensifs, mais dans le pire des cas, nous dépasserons les 1.000, avec un pic probable dès la fin novembre », a précisé Steven Van Gucht.

Une telle situation obligerait les hôpitaux à augmenter, une nouvelle fois, leur capacité d'accueil pour les patients Covid.  Actuellement en phase 1a,  25 % des lits de soins intensifs (soit 500 lits, dont plus de 350 sont déjà occupés) leur sont réservés. La phase 1b porterait cette réserve à 1.000 lits, soit la moitié de la capacité totale,  une charge considérable pour de nombreux hôpitaux.  De plus, la capacité réelle est inférieure à la capacité théorique de 2.000 lits, en raison de l'absentéisme croissant du personnel soignant (maladie, quarantaine).  « Plusieurs hôpitaux signalent des fermetures de lits par manque de personnel, tant en soins intensifs que dans d'autres services », a alerté Steven Van Gucht.

L'évolution de la situation reste difficile à prévoir.
