The idea of driverless cars is appealing, especially the convenience of simply inputting a destination and letting the car handle everything. Imagine being able to sleep during a long road trip!  However, several significant concerns temper my enthusiasm.

While many people enjoy the control of driving, a fully automated system, guided by GPS, sounds much safer.  But this raises questions about the power source for such a vast fleet of vehicles.  If they run on electricity, the strain on the power grid could lead to widespread outages.  Think about the electrical infrastructure we pass daily – poles, transformers, etc.  A sudden surge in demand could overload the system, potentially causing failures and widespread disruption.

Even more concerning is the reliability of the technology itself.  A few million test vehicles are insufficient to guarantee safety for a global population of billions. What if a software glitch causes a car to malfunction, failing to stop or turn correctly?  The risk of accidents, potentially fatal ones, is undeniable.  This begs the question: while the concept of driverless cars is attractive, do the potential benefits outweigh the significant risks to personal and public safety?

The Internet of Things (IoT) is a paradigm connecting everyday objects, or "things," to the internet.  These objects are typically equipped with sensors and actuators.  A recent study estimates that up to 75 billion connected IoT devices will be in use by 2025 [1].  Examples of IoT devices include smartphones, medical sensors, and wearables.  These devices often possess augmented capabilities such as sensing, networking, and processing [2]. The ubiquity of the IoT presents opportunities to crowdsource the capabilities of these devices [3].

Crowdsourcing IoT devices involves integrating these "things" by leveraging their data and functionality to create novel applications [3].  Crowdsourced applications include environmental monitoring, smart grids, and healthcare applications [3].  Abstracting crowdsourced IoT devices can further provide novel services [4]. These IoT services are defined by the functional and non-functional properties of the devices [4]. Examples of such services include Wi-Fi hotspot sharing and energy sharing [5, 6].

Energy sharing, also known as Energy-as-a-Service (EaaS), is defined as the transfer of wireless energy among IoT devices using a service paradigm [5]. An energy provider is a device that can share energy, while an energy consumer is a device that requires energy.  Both consumers and providers are user-owned.  Energy can be harvested through wearables like smart textiles or smart shoes [7], capturing energy from resources such as body heat or kinetic movement [8].  For instance, the PowerWalk kinetic energy harvester provides 10-12 watts of on-the-move power [8]. Users wearing a PowerWalk harvester on each leg can generate enough power to charge up to four smartphones during an hour's walk at a comfortable pace [9]. This harvested energy could be shared with nearby IoT devices as EaaS using newly developed "over-the-air wireless charging" technology [10].  Wattup technology, developed by Energous, is one example, enabling wireless charging up to distances of 15 feet.<sup>2</sup> This work focuses on the use of wearables and IoT devices as energy providers.

Providing EaaS offers several advantages.  It is a crowdsourced, green solution, utilizing spare and renewable energy.  EaaS provides an alternative to using the power grid, offering a more convenient solution than carrying power banks or searching for a power outlet.  Recently, interest in wireless crowdcharging has increased [11]. EaaS is particularly valuable in situations where a power outlet is unavailable, such as disaster management, entertainment venues, and emergency response scenarios [9]. The envisioned environment typically consists of microcells – confined areas where people congregate, such as coffee shops, restaurants, and movie theaters. Within these microcells, devices can share energy using the EaaS model.  We assume a trust framework is implemented, securing the IoT environment for crowdsourcing EaaS [12].

As previously mentioned, the EaaS model is defined by its functional and non-functional (QoS) properties [5]. The function of the energy service is the transfer of energy among IoT devices. The non-functional properties describe the quality of service, including energy capacity, location, and duration. To the best of our knowledge, existing research primarily focuses on EaaS composition from the consumer's perspective [5]. Our research focuses on the selection and composition of energy service requests from the *provider's* perspective.

One of the main challenges in composing EaaS is provider resistance. This resistance often stems from the limited resources of IoT devices and a lack of trust [13]. While providers may altruistically share energy to benefit the environment, they can also be egoistic, as energy is a critical resource for their own devices. Incentives can encourage providers to share energy, compensating them for their resource consumption.  To the best of our knowledge, there is no prior research on incentivizing users to provide wireless energy sharing. Existing incentive models for crowdsourced environments are not applicable to EaaS, as the context of wireless energy sharing requires a customized model [13].  We focus on designing a novel incentive model for selecting and composing energy service requests.

Our proposed incentive model considers the factors influencing a provider's willingness to participate. Incentive models rely on intrinsic or extrinsic rewards to motivate participation. Intrinsic rewards involve internal satisfaction motivated by altruistic purposes. In contrast, extrinsic rewards are driven by material compensation [14]. This work focuses on computing extrinsic rewards using our incentive model, as intrinsic rewards are self-motivated. Our model considers provider and consumer contexts that may affect provider willingness, such as the amount of requested energy and the time required to complete the energy service. Our aim is to compose the optimal set of energy requests using this incentive model.

*Motivation.* We consider an incentive-based composition for energy service requests as a motivating scenario (see Figure 1).  Assume a geographic area, such as a building or a mall, is divided into microcells, each representing a confined area like a coffee shop or restaurant (see Figure 1a).  Assume several IoT devices (providers and consumers) are distributed within a microcell (see Figure 1b).  These devices are equipped with wireless energy transmitters and receivers, such as those developed by Energous.<sup>3</sup> The distance between devices exchanging energy may reach the maximum transmission distance (15 feet using Energous technology) to ensure successful wireless transmission.

For 137 days, Mark had been living a monotonous existence, a prisoner of routine.  Recruited – or perhaps kidnapped – by the government for his unique talents, he worked tirelessly towards a single, desperate goal: a weapon against the ever-growing army of the dead.  Every morning began in Lab A, tweaking and 3D-printing prototypes of his tiny bio-organic explosives, each containing a small explosive charge, fiber optics, microelectronics, and encased in synthetic skin. He'd implant these into lab rats, only to find them dead in Lab B the following morning.  But this morning was different.  He heard noises from Lab B.  The rats lived.

A surge of elation coursed through him.  Not just relief from the grim task of cleaning rat carcasses, but the profound realization that humanity might finally have a fighting chance. After confirming the rats were healthy and the devices functional, he immediately called Colonel Telt, his captor, now seen as a comrade in this desperate war.  He then rushed back to Lab A and, using just one of the hundreds of 3D printers at his disposal, began constructing three larger prototypes, increasing the explosive charge and the length of the fiber optics while retaining the same miniature CPU.

Within ten minutes, the Colonel arrived.  "You sounded excited, Mark," he said. "What you got for me?"

"It's done, sir," Mark replied, his voice brimming with conviction. "We can start human trials. I volunteer."

Mark's eagerness stemmed from a primal fear. He had witnessed the reanimation firsthand, a fate worse than death. He dreaded the prospect of joining their ranks, of becoming a threat to the living.

"Well, Mark," the Colonel responded, "lucky for you, we're not bound by previous government regulations. I was tasked to defeat the dead army, and by God, we're about to turn the tide!"

"Sir," Mark explained, "once Dr. Linkens gets here, I'll have her install the implant. If I wake up tomorrow morning, I'll start full production on all printers."

"Sounds like a plan," the Colonel agreed.

That night, Mark went to bed with the implant nestled within him, his mind racing with the grim arithmetic of the war. Until now, it had been a war of attrition, a losing battle against an exponentially growing enemy.  He wasn’t afraid of the device now residing in his own body, a shaped charge designed to obliterate his brain upon cessation of his heartbeat for two minutes, leaving the skull intact. The two-minute delay was a calculated compromise, accounting for the varying reanimation times influenced by the proximity of the undead overlords.


He awoke the next morning filled with a renewed sense of purpose. Tomorrow, the monumental task of implanting the device into every surviving human would begin.  All remaining survivors were gathered in Eastern Russia, making their last stand.  This time, Mark thought, humanity would not go extinct.

**McEwen Copper Inc. Secures $40 Million in First Tranche of Private Placement with Rob McEwen**

**TORONTO, ONTARIO – August 23, 2021** – McEwen Mining Inc. (NYSE and TSX: MUX) announced today that its subsidiary, McEwen Copper Inc., has closed the first tranche of its Series B private placement, initially announced on July 6, 2021.  This tranche yielded gross proceeds of $40 million through the issuance of 4,000,000 common shares at a price of $10.00 per share.

The second tranche, expected to close on or before September 30, 2021, offers an additional 4,000,000 common shares to qualified accredited investors, subject to a minimum investment of $1 million and other conditions. These securities are private and subject to transfer restrictions until McEwen Copper shares are listed on a public exchange.

Rob McEwen's investment corporation, Evanachan Limited, purchased all shares in the first tranche.  Mr. McEwen now beneficially owns 18.6% of McEwen Copper, which holds a 100% interest in both the Los Azules copper project in San Juan, Argentina, and the Elder Creek exploration property in Nevada.  Both assets are subject to a 1.25% net smelter return (NSR) royalty payable to McEwen Mining.

McEwen Copper intends to pursue an initial public listing within 12 months of the final closing.  Proceeds will be used exclusively to advance the Los Azules project, including a pre-feasibility study, construction of a new year-round access road, infill and exploration drilling at both Los Azules and Elder Creek, environmental permitting, community relations, and general corporate purposes. Construction of the new 72-mile (115 km) access road is underway, with 10 miles (16 km) already completed.

McEwen Mining is relying on the exemption outlined in Section 602.1 of the TSX Company Manual, which allows issuers listed on recognized stock exchanges like the NYSE to forgo certain TSX requirements.

This news release does not constitute an offer to buy or sell securities.  No securities will be sold in any jurisdiction where such an offer or sale would be unlawful prior to registration or qualification under applicable securities laws.  All amounts are in US dollars.

Francisco Medina Guerrero.- Cd. Victoria, Tam.-  Maestros del programa Escuelas de Tiempo Completo solicitaron la intervención del gobernador Francisco García Cabeza de Vaca y advirtieron un paro laboral si no reciben el pago correspondiente a la siguiente quincena.

En entrevista este viernes, Gilberto Ruiz Hernández, director de la escuela primaria Matías S. Canales, explicó que en el estado existen 864 escuelas con este programa, con aproximadamente 20 maestros por cada una.

“El secretario federal de Educación, Esteban Moctezuma, informó que los pagos del 2020, incluyendo los servicios de alimentación y otros rubros de las Escuelas de Tiempo Completo, ya fueron realizados. Lo pendiente corresponde al 2021, debido a la presunta desaparición del programa”, declaró.

Cuestionado sobre la declaración del secretario de Educación de Tamaulipas, Mario Gómez Monroy, quien el lunes pasado indicó que el Estado solo pagaría la primera quincena de octubre, Ruiz Hernández manifestó: “Desconozco el motivo del error del Secretario de Educación. Si el dinero ya está disponible, exigimos el pago”.

“Calculamos que son 864 escuelas, con un promedio de 20 maestros por escuela, que reciben dos mil pesos por quincena, cuatro mil mensuales. Multiplícalo y verás la cantidad que representa”, enfatizó.

Advirtió que, de no recibir el pago de la segunda quincena de octubre, iniciarán un paro laboral en noviembre.

“El Secretario de Educación declaró que solo se pagaría hasta la primera quincena de octubre a los maestros de tiempo completo.  Sin embargo, el jefe del Departamento de Escuelas de Tiempo Completo, Pablo Rincón, nos asegura que el pago está garantizado desde la primera de septiembre hasta la primera de diciembre, es decir, siete quincenas.  Nos están reduciendo a tres, dejando cuatro quincenas sin cubrir”, comentó.

Finalmente, señaló que el adeudo global asciende a 69 millones 120 mil pesos mensuales.  Considerando los cuatro meses que, según afirman, están pendientes de pago, el monto total adeudado alcanzaría los 276 millones 480 mil pesos.

Labour MP Clare Curran’s resignation, announced yesterday, brings relief to both herself and the Government, although it reflects poorly on her party.  Curran’s demise, following her stumbling, bumbling non-answer to a question in the House on Wednesday, raises a critical question: how many other MPs are not ministerial material?  Labour ministers are chosen by caucus vote, and Curran's inadequacy was clear to the entire country after her exchange with National's Melissa Lee.  This resignation will undoubtedly encourage further scrutiny from the Opposition, who, like sharks circling prey, are constitutionally tasked with probing the government for weaknesses.

Curran was already a lowly ranked minister before being demoted to a seat outside Cabinet, a consequence of a second failure to properly document meetings with individuals relevant to her portfolios.  While these failings are of public concern, the handling of the situation by those in higher positions of power raises more significant questions.  When Prime Minister Ardern initially demoted Curran, many questioned why she remained a minister at all.  Last week’s events, where Curran failed to coherently respond to Lee's question about her use of personal email for official business, vindicated those concerns.

The Prime Minister’s judgment is now under scrutiny.  While dismissing someone is difficult, it is a necessary aspect of Ardern’s responsibilities.  Furthermore, Ardern’s commitment to transparency appears to have faltered.  Hours before Curran’s resignation was public, Ardern told Newstalk ZB's Chris Lynch that she had not considered firing Curran, stating that Curran had “paid her price” and that everyone has “bad days.”  This statement, while technically true – Curran offered her resignation – created a false impression, as Ardern knew she had accepted the resignation the previous night.  While Prime Ministers are entitled to avoid pre-empting announcements, transparent evasion is preferable to misleading answers.  Conjecture would have been appropriate, and arguably should be expected, if dismissal were a genuine possibility.

Parliament can resemble a sharks' tank, with the Opposition mercilessly targeting any perceived weakness.  Curran's ineptitude provided ample fodder.

Yilaena awoke with a start, finding herself face-to-face with a girl crouched over her. The girl's face was a mask of anguish – eyes screwed shut, mouth twisted in a snarl, tears welling up.  Their foreheads touched, and Yilaena distantly registered the warmth of the girl's skin.  The girl's fist, clenched tight around the hilt of a blade, rested on Yilaena.  Gently, Yilaena reached out and wrapped her fingers around the girl’s hand.  She slid her hand down to the knife, and then over the blade itself.  The metal was cold, but it didn't cut her, even when she gripped it.

Looking back up, Yilaena realized the girl was fighting back tears.  Her teeth dug so hard into her bottom lip that blood beaded on the surface.  In the faint moonlight, her eyes shimmered. A tear escaped, tracing a path down her cheek and landing on Yilaena’s right cheekbone. A drop of blood followed, staining Yilaena’s jaw.  Tears and blood. Yilaena had only ever known tears. She wondered what it felt like to bleed.

“No,” the girl choked out, the word forced between ragged breaths. “No. No. No.”

Yilaena sat up slowly, causing the girl to shift back and rest on Yilaena’s thighs, her knuckles bone-white. Gently, Yilaena pried the girl's fingers loose, took the knife, and placed it between them.

“What is your name?” she asked.

“Cae,” the girl breathed, the tears and blood now making glistening tracks down her face to stain her fingers.

Yilaena paused, gently freeing Cae’s teeth from her lip.  Her thumb brushed over the wound, and Cae stifled a sob.  Yilaena recalled whispers from the spirit world – a human arriving in their home meant a sacrifice.  Many of her peers had longed for this, and Yilaena wondered if they had imagined it like this.

“I’m sorry,” Yilaena whispered. Cae’s sobs then broke the silence.

When solving partial differential equations (PDEs) numerically using volume discretization, the computational grid must be truncated.  The key challenge lies in achieving this truncation without introducing significant artifacts. Some problems offer natural truncation, such as periodic structures amenable to periodic boundary conditions.  In other cases, rapidly decaying solutions render truncation irrelevant provided the grid is sufficiently large.  For problems with solutions that vary increasingly slowly at larger distances, like Poisson's equation, a coordinate transformation (e.g., x = tanh x) can remap the infinite domain x ∈ (-∞, ∞) to a finite one x ∈ (-1, 1) before solving the resulting finite system.  However, wave equations present a more difficult truncation challenge. Their oscillating solutions typically decay with distance *r* only as 1/ *r* <sup>(d-1)/2</sup> in *d* dimensions. This slow decay makes simple truncation with hard-wall (Dirichlet or Neumann) or periodic boundary conditions unacceptable due to reflections.  Furthermore, any real coordinate remapping to a finite domain results in solutions oscillating infinitely rapidly as the boundary is approached.  These rapid oscillations are unresolvable on a finite grid, effectively creating a reflecting hard wall. Consequently, wave equations require absorbing boundaries that absorb incident waves without reflection and without demanding infeasible resolution.

Early attempts at absorbing boundaries for wave equations employed absorbing boundary conditions (ABCs).  ABCs are rules for setting the values at the grid edge based on the solution on the interior grid points, unlike simple Dirichlet conditions (which set the solution to zero at the edge and cause reflections).  ABCs attempt to extrapolate from interior grid points to the edge, creating the illusion of an unbounded domain. While perfect absorption is achievable in one dimension, where waves propagate only along ±x, the primary interest in numerical simulation lies in two and three dimensions. The multitude of propagation directions in higher dimensions significantly complicates ABC design, making efficient, exact absorption of waves incident at arbitrary angles unlikely. Existing ABCs typically achieve perfect absorption only at a few angles, particularly normal incidence, relying on the increasing dominance of normal-incident waves on the boundaries as the grid grows.  Another challenge arises when the wave medium is inhomogeneous at the grid boundaries (e.g., simulating transmission around a dielectric waveguide bend). Many standard ABCs, formulated for homogeneous boundary materials, can become numerically unstable in inhomogeneous environments.

In 1994, Berenger transformed the approach to absorbing boundaries with his seminal work on perfectly matched layers (PMLs).  Instead of focusing on boundary conditions, Berenger proposed an absorbing boundary layer—a layer of artificial absorbing material adjacent to the grid edges (Figure 1). Waves entering this layer are attenuated, minimizing reflections from the grid boundary.  While material transitions generally cause reflections, Berenger demonstrated the possibility of constructing a special absorbing medium that eliminates reflections at the interface. While initially developed for electromagnetism (Maxwell's equations), the PML concept readily extends to other wave equations.

Several equivalent PML formulations exist.  Berenger's original split-field PML artificially splits wave solutions into two new field components. A more common contemporary formulation, the uniaxial PML (UPML), represents the PML region using the ordinary wave equation with a combination of artificial anisotropic absorbing materials. Both formulations were initially derived by analyzing the solution for waves incident at arbitrary angles and polarizations, then determining the conditions for zero reflection.  This approach, however, is cumbersome for extending to other wave equations and coordinate systems.  It also overlooks the fact that PMLs remain effective (theoretically reflectionless) in inhomogeneous media, like waveguides, as long as the medium is homogeneous perpendicular to the boundary, even without analytical wave solutions.  Both split-field and UPML formulations can be derived more elegantly through complex coordinate stretching, which analytically continues the wave equations into complex spatial coordinates where fields decay exponentially.  This complex-coordinate approach is the focus of this review.

We begin by reviewing wave equations, emphasizing the scalar wave equation while providing a general definition.  We then derive PMLs as a two-step process: analytic continuation into complex coordinates followed by transformation back to real coordinates. Finally, we discuss PML limitations, particularly the loss of reflectionless behavior upon discretization, and common mitigation strategies.

أعلن وزير الخزانة البريطاني، ريشي سوناك، وهو أول هندوسي يتبوأ هذا المنصب، الخميس، في مناسبة عيد ديوالي، عيد الأنوار الهندوسي، إطلاق سلسلة قطع نقدية خاصة تكريماً لمهاتما غاندي، رمز نضال الهنود من أجل الاستقلال.  ويتزامن إطلاق هذه القطعة التذكارية مع الذكرى السنوية الخامسة والسبعين لاستقلال الهند عن الاستعمار البريطاني عام 1947.

وأوضحت وزارة الخزانة البريطانية في بيان أن هذه القطع، التي تراوح قيمتها الاسمية بين جنيهين ومئة جنيه إسترليني،  تُعدّ الأولى من نوعها التي تستذكر غاندي عبر قطعة نقدية رسمية في المملكة المتحدة،  مُترجمةً بذلك رغبة الحكومة في "البناء على أسس العلاقة المستدامة والروابط الثقافية" بين لندن ونيودلهي. وستكون القطع متوافرة بالفضة والذهب، حيث تباع القطعة الذهبية منها في مقابل 2440 جنيهاً استرلينياً (3291 دولاراً).

تمثل القطعة زهرة لوتس (نيلم هندي)، رمز الهند، مع القول المأثور لغاندي "حياتي رسالة".  وتندرج هذه القطعة ضمن مجموعة أوسع تضم أيضاً أول سبيكة بريطانية تمثل لاكشمي، إلهة الثروة لدى الهندوس، الذين يحتفلون بها تقليدياً خلال عيد ديوالي.

وقال سوناك، الذي يصف نفسه بأنه "هندوسي ملتزم"، في بيان: "أنا فخور بالكشف عن هذه القطعة خلال ديوالي"، العيد الهندوسي الأهم.

## 上海古董大亨张仲英先生诞辰120周年纪念

张宗宪先生深切缅怀先父恩泽。在其苏州寓所“张园”的祠堂内，供奉着张仲英先生、孙惠珍女士以及祖父张楫如先生的肖像。

张宗宪先生的父亲张仲英先生生于光绪二十五年（1899年），是他古董生涯的启蒙恩师。在苏州“张园”的厅堂里，一直供奉着父母的遗像，而张宗宪先生也将其父母的照片随身携带，寸步不离。他感言：“我的古董生涯全赖父亲的教诲，‘少年不努力，老大徒伤悲’这句话，我十二三岁就铭记于心。”

“初到香港时，我身无分文，仅有24美元。尝试多种生意都未能如愿后，幸得父亲的鼎力相助，才踏上古董之路。我眼力的真正提升，是在父亲从上海发货到香港的那两年。每次百余件货物，父亲都会详细注明每件的来龙去脉、价值行情。我从中获益匪浅，汲取了父亲毕生积累的古董经验。这些珍贵的书信，我一直妥善保存，或许日后可以整理出版，与大家分享。”字里行间，流露出张宗宪先生对父亲的无限感恩与追思。

值此己亥猪年，恰逢张仲英先生诞辰120周年。为纪念父亲的教诲，张宗宪先生特以徐悲鸿的《墨猪》作为本期封面，并恭祝各位读者诸(猪)事吉祥，圆满如意，猪年大吉！

**二十世纪上海古董大亨——张仲英先生**

张仲英先生在家中排行老四，业内尊称“张四官”。他幼年在苏州读过几年私塾，并未继承父亲张楫如先生的雕刻手艺，而是投身古玩行业。十六岁时，他到上海集粹阁古玩店学徒，两年后练就了鉴定古瓷的本领，被味古斋老板沈觉仁挖走。

二十多岁的张仲英先生接手味古斋，更名为“聚珍斋”，开设于上海英租界交通路（今昭通路）55号，正式自立门户。1930年代中期，生意兴隆的张仲英先生以3000大洋购置了苏州护龙街（今人民路）蒲林巷7号的一幢三进宅院。1956年初，公私合营后，许多古董店老板进入文物商店工作，张仲英先生被分配到上海文物商店。

当时张宗宪先生已在香港。据家人回忆，文革期间，张仲英先生屡遭批斗，身体每况愈下。1968年冬，他突发心脏病，医生看到病历上的“资本家”身份后，转身离去。万幸的是，张仲英先生慢慢缓了过来，直至1969年5月逝世，享年七十岁。

成员包括：仇焱之、张仲英、戴福葆、张雪庚、洪玉琳和管复初。

La humanidad se comunicó oralmente durante siglos antes de desarrollar un alfabeto escrito que nos uniera de manera más efectiva. La invención de la imprenta por Gutenberg marcó el surgimiento de la comunicación impresa y el libro, multiplicando y compartiendo el conocimiento con miles y, eventualmente, millones de personas. El libro pervive hasta nuestros días y predigo que seguirá siendo parte integral de la civilización por mucho tiempo, iluminándonos, mejorando nuestra calidad de vida y prometiendo un futuro mejor.

Sin embargo, a pesar de su supervivencia, a veces heroica, frente a la aparición de nuevos medios de comunicación electrónicos y digitales, el libro se ha visto seriamente afectado por la terrible pandemia que hemos padecido durante casi dos años en México y el mundo.

La industria editorial mexicana sufrió un duro golpe en 2020, primer año de la pandemia.  Según el informe más reciente de la asociación de editores, la facturación disminuyó en 2 mil 764 millones de pesos, un 24.6 por ciento menos que en 2019.  José Calafell, Vicepresidente del Sector de Libros de la Caniem (Cámara Nacional de la Industria Editorial Mexicana), señaló que esta caída fue la más severa de todos los mercados en América Latina y, en cuanto al mercado de libros de interés general, probablemente la mayor entre los grandes mercados de la región, comparable solo a la de Perú.  Juan Luis Arzos, presidente de la Caniem, confirmó las pérdidas millonarias, con una disminución en la producción de casi 14 millones de ejemplares, pasando de 118.9 a 105.1 millones.

Preocupan, sobre todo, los factores estructurales más que los coyunturales.  México ya enfrentaba un crecimiento económico prácticamente nulo antes de la pandemia, a diferencia de otros países de Latinoamérica que incluso registraban crecimiento negativo, como Argentina.  Sin embargo, un factor coyuntural crucial fue la falta de apoyo del gobierno mexicano a libreros y librerías, una omisión negligente hacia la educación y la cultura.

Las editoriales también sufrieron graves consecuencias. De las 189 editoriales privadas que se mantuvieron activas durante el año pasado a pesar de la pandemia, 30 suspendieron actividades y 11 desaparecieron.

For years, car development has primarily focused on design and fuel efficiency, rather than driver assistance.  Given the significant role cars play in most people's daily lives, improving this frequently used machine is a logical step.  A key advancement is the development of autonomous vehicles. While the safety of this technology may initially concern some, car companies are committed to ensuring consumer safety. Though this innovation may face initial resistance, experts predict its eventual widespread adoption.

Autonomous vehicles offer significant safety benefits.  Equipped with LIDAR technology, they react faster than humans, preventing accidents.  Furthermore, they adhere to speed limits, enhancing road safety.  Beyond safety, built-in GPS navigation optimizes routes for maximum efficiency.

Despite these advantages, public apprehension is understandable.  This technology is relatively new, and unfamiliarity breeds concern.  Resistance to change is a common human trait, and the idea of a self-driving car represents a significant shift.  However, history demonstrates that initial resistance often gives way to acceptance.

A primary concern revolves around accident liability. However, technological malfunction is statistically improbable.  Google's autonomous car testing program, for example, resulted in only one accident, which was attributed to human error, not the technology itself. Human error is far more frequent, and regulations will mandate comprehensive safety features in these vehicles.

While the concept of autonomous vehicles may be initially daunting, experts foresee their normalization.  Public adoption will likely be gradual, and personal preference will dictate individual choices.  Availability doesn't necessitate universal adoption; the goal is to provide an option for those who desire it. Once the proficiency of safety measures is demonstrably established, there will be little reason to prevent this technology's presence on public roads.

The ritual was almost always the same. A man accused of a crime was brought before the statue.  The statue always decided. Judgment came swiftly. One of her hands, the right bearing a sword for a guilty verdict, or the left holding scales for innocence, would move.  There were no courts. The statue was never wrong. Or so people believed. Justice herself, a goddess, delivered these verdicts. Who were they to question her?

One day, a man was brought to this trial, found amidst the bloody entrails of his wife and child. His head was swiftly severed.

Weeks later, another man confessed. He detailed how he had staged the murder, framing the man now rotting in the criminal’s pit – a dishonorable grave for the undeserving.

But how? How could Justice be wrong? What would she do now?

The confessor was brought before the goddess, kneeling where the innocent man had knelt, gazing up at the blindfolded statue.  Nothing happened. Hours passed. Murmurs grew into shouts. A riot threatened to erupt. Then, the statue moved.  She dropped her sword and scales.

She stepped down from her pedestal, stone grinding against stone. Approaching the murderer, one hand gripped his skull, the other tore at her blindfold.  Fused to the statue, it wouldn’t come off, but what lay beneath was revealed: pulsing, bleeding flesh. Crimson oozed from jagged wounds in the stone, revealing the terrible truth.  No words were spoken, but the truth was undeniable. Justice wasn't just. She judged as the people desired.

And now, the people craved blood. The statue’s mouth tore open, revealing teeth more animal than human. Bloodlust turned to revulsion and shock as Justice tore the man apart.  But he deserved it, didn't he? He had murdered, and let another die in his place.

When only blood-soaked earth and scattered remains were left, Justice, dyed vermillion, turned to the crowd.  Gashes across her face revealed an abyss of blackness, from which a dozen or more eyes stared.

The statue, dripping blood – his and her own – seemed to speak, a chorus of remorse and joy, righteous dedication and terrified whimpering.  "Look at what you have done."

From that day forward, mankind took justice into its own hands.

بدأ النص بالإعلان عن دخول الشيخ علي الحذيفي، إمام المسجد النبوي، المستشفى نتيجة أزمة صحية، ثم انتقل إلى الحديث عن سبب دخوله وهو الجلطة، ثم إلى مشاعر محبيه، ثم إلى سيرته الذاتية، ثم عاد إلى الحديث عن مرضه.  لذا، يُفضل إعادة ترتيب النص كالتالي:

**الشيخ علي الحذيفي، إمام المسجد النبوي، وسيرته الذاتية:**

الشيخ علي بن عبد الرحمن بن علي بن أحمد الحذيفي، المولود عام 1947 في قرية القرن المستقيم ببلد العوامر جنوبي مكة المكرمة، هو إمام المسجد النبوي. حاصل على الدكتوراة من جامعة الأزهر الشريف، وقد أمّ المصلين وخطب في مسجد قباء بالمدينة المنورة لفترات طويلة.  عُيّن إماماً وخطيباً للمسجد النبوي عام 1979، ثم للمسجد الحرام عام 1981، ليعود بعدها بعام لإمامة المسجد النبوي الشريف، وهو المنصب الذي يشغله حتى الآن.  يُعتبر الشيخ الحذيفي أحد أبرز قراء القرآن الكريم في المملكة العربية السعودية والعالم الإسلامي، وله حضور واسع في البث الفضائي والإذاعي.

**دخول الشيخ الحذيفي المستشفى:**

دخل الشيخ علي الحذيفي (72 عاماً) المستشفى نتيجة تعرضه لأزمة صحية، أبعدته عن إمامة المصلين.

From the beginning, I ask forgiveness of the dead and the living. Silence, please. I have no desire to hear your contempt. Remember, I did not ask for this gift.

It began in childhood, a summer day. My memory holds only that, and the softness of my mother’s hand. We were walking, strolling, enjoying the sun.

A man approached. His face is lost to me, replaced by a feeling, a number flashing before my eyes: 6.  A sensation unlike any I'd known. The number 6 vibrated through me like violin strings.

I cried, a torrent of tears. The man turned away; my mother remained oblivious. But I no longer truly saw her. I saw her as one sees a distant tree, her face obscured, replaced by a number: 1. It brought a sense of safety mingled with sadness. To be so detached from my mother's face was heartbreaking.

I digress.

Something was wrong. I saw numbers, instinctively understanding my own strangeness. Where others saw beauty, I saw danger, or safety. But I did not see *him* yet.

High school found me a loner, unsurprisingly. Knowing someone is dangerous and avoiding them are two different things. I was bullied by a 6, punched by a 4, locked in the locker room by a 5.

Understand, then, my yearning for connection, for a friendship transcending numbers.

His voice was soft when we met. No, that's not quite right. I ran. He was a 10, a blazing, fire-engine red 10.  I fled, not symbolically, but physically, screaming in terror.

He persisted. He sat beside me at lunch while I shivered. At first, his presence twisted my soul. He was a *10*.

Then, he saved me. Cornered against the lockers again, he appeared from behind. Three heads were beaten that day. His hands, covered in blood, framed a skewed grin. Their faces, smashed like sponges.

The logical extension is clear. His first victim fell on a Tuesday. I remember because I’d broken up with my girlfriend the day before. We'd found an 8. His eyes were dark, his gait military.

El astronauta madrileño Pedro Duque, nacido el 14 de marzo de 1963, hijo de padres extremeños, ha sido nombrado ministro de Ciencia, Innovación y Universidades en el nuevo Gobierno de Pedro Sánchez, según confirmaron a Efe y otros medios fuentes cercanas al presidente.  Duque, licenciado en 1986 por la E.T.S.I. Aeronáuticos de la Universidad Politécnica de Madrid (UPM), cuenta con una destacada trayectoria profesional, marcada por su experiencia en el espacio y su dedicación a la ciencia y la tecnología.

Tras su licenciatura, comenzó a trabajar en la compañía GMV, siendo destinado al centro ESOC de la Agencia Espacial Europea (ESA) en Darmstadt, Alemania.  En 1992, se postuló como candidato a astronauta de la ESA, superando la selección y entrenándose en la Ciudad de las Estrellas de Moscú (Rusia) y en centros aeroespaciales de Estados Unidos.

Su primera misión espacial fue la STS-95 del transbordador espacial Discovery, entre octubre y noviembre de 1998, supervisando un módulo experimental de la ESA durante nueve días. En octubre de 2003, viajó al espacio en una nave rusa Soyuz, ejerciendo como ingeniero de vuelo y visitando la Estación Espacial Internacional (ISS) durante ocho días en la misión Cervantes.  Durante esta misión, realizó experimentos científicos relacionados con las ciencias de la vida, la física, la observación de la Tierra, la educación y las nuevas tecnologías.

Después de su segunda misión espacial, en noviembre de 2003, regresó a la E.T.S.I. Aeronáuticos de la UPM como director de operaciones en el Spanish User Support and Operations Centre (E-USOC).  Posteriormente, en 2006, fue nombrado director general de Deimos Imaging, empresa situada en el Parque Tecnológico de Boecillo (Valladolid), de la que llegó a ser presidente ejecutivo en 2010. Esta compañía puso en órbita en 2009 a Deimos 1, el primer satélite español de observación de la Tierra.

## إعادة هيكلة النص عن إقامة الملكة في قلعة وندسور

**مقدمة:**

تستعد ملكة بريطانيا، إليزابيث الثانية، لجعل قلعة وندسور مقرها الرئيس هذا العام، ولن تستأنف إقامتها في قصر باكنغهام، وفقًا لمصدر ملكي.  يُعدّ هذا الغياب عن قصر باكنغهام الأطول خلال فترة حكمها الممتدة لـ 68 عامًا. تبعد قلعة وندسور التاريخية 32 كيلومترًا عن لندن.

**أسباب البقاء في وندسور:**

أكد مصدر ملكي أن الملكة، البالغة من العمر 94 عامًا، لا تنوي "السفر" إلى لندن  ما لم يكن الوضع آمنًا تمامًا. وعادةً ما تعود الملكة إلى قصر باكنغهام في أكتوبر بعد إجازتها الصيفية في بالمورال باسكوتلندا.  لكن هذا العام، ستعود إلى قلعة وندسور، حيث عزلت نفسها مع زوجها دوق إدنبرة منذ 19 مارس، قبل إجازتهم في اسكتلندا.

ونقلت صحيفة "صنداي تلغراف" عن مصدر ملكي قوله: "هناك رغبة في إعادة قصر باكنغهام إلى العمل، ولكن فقط إذا كانت كل النصائح ذات الصلة تشير إلى أنه من المناسب القيام بذلك".  ويُعتقد أن المقترحات حول كيفية حضور الملكة بأمان لاحتفالات النصب التذكاري السنوية لإحياء ذكرى النصر، التي تُقام عادةً في نوفمبر، قيد المراجعة. من الواضح أن جلالة الملكة لن تعود إلى قصر باكنغهام حتى يتم القضاء على تهديد فيروس كورونا.  ومع ذلك، يُعتقد أنها ستقضي عطلة عيد الميلاد المعتادة في ساندرينغهام بنورفولك.


**إغلاق قصر باكنغهام:**

يُذكر أن قصر باكنغهام لا يزال مغلقًا أمام الزوار منذ مارس 2020 بسبب جائحة كورونا.

United Bank for Africa (UBA), institution financière leader en Afrique, a publié ses résultats financiers audités pour le premier semestre 2018, affichant une solide croissance de ses principaux indicateurs de performance et une contribution significative de ses filiales africaines.

Malgré un contexte de faibles rendements sur deux marchés clés, le Nigéria et le Ghana, l'institution financière panafricaine a enregistré une croissance à deux chiffres de son produit net bancaire, en hausse de 16 % en glissement annuel pour atteindre 749 millions USD, contre 646 millions USD au premier semestre 2017.  Cette performance, selon les analystes, témoigne de la capacité d'UBA à générer de solides résultats à travers différents cycles et environnements économiques.

Marcus hadn't anticipated the smugglers finding Amanda. She *had* to be safe. He couldn't fathom how they'd located his Shanghai apartment. The night was clear, and 2 a.m. was fast approaching—Rob's scheduled call time.

The smugglers searched the apartment, closing in on the kitchen where Amanda hid. Knowing discovery was imminent, Marcus began barking like a dog. "Quiet!" one of the smugglers hissed, leveling an AK-47 at Marcus's head.

Then, Marcus realized his hands weren't bound. As the smuggler prepared to fire, Marcus grabbed the AK-47 and yanked it forward, sending the man tumbling.  Marcus scrambled to his feet and delivered a swift kick to the smuggler's face, knocking him unconscious.

The other smugglers opened fire, shattering the glass behind Marcus. He lunged toward the youngest-looking smuggler, using him as a human shield. The gunfire ceased. Marcus snatched the QSW-92 pistol from the young man's grip. "Not as trusty as a 1911," he muttered, "but it'll do the job."

Drawing on his Swedish army training, he fired a controlled burst, taking down three smugglers. The others returned fire, killing his human shield and wounding Marcus. Luckily, the 9mm rounds from their JS-2s did minimal damage.

Taking cover, Marcus peeked out and fired again, eliminating two more. Panicked, the remaining smuggler ripped open the wardrobe where Amanda was hidden and used her as a shield. Marcus knew this shot had to be precise.

Click. Boom.

The smuggler crumpled, a bullet through his head.

Amanda smiled, then began to cry. Marcus, too, was overwhelmed with emotion. Suddenly, Amanda grabbed the dead smuggler's gun. "Sorry, Marcus," she whispered, pulling the trigger.

##  默默奋战的合作医院：新冠疫情下的困境与呼救

新冠疫情期间，为了响应国家号召，一些医疗机构秘密收治新冠肺炎患者，它们被称为“传染病诊疗合作医院”。这些医院的名称并未对外公布，在“防止流言中伤”这个冠冕堂皇的理由下，它们暗中日夜救治患者，却面临着资金匮乏，甚至濒临破产的严峻现实。本文邀请千叶县船桥市医师会新型传染病对策理事浅野新吾，揭示这些默默奋战的合作医院所面临的困境。

**合作医院：志愿服务般的存在**

日本全国收治新冠肺炎患者的医疗机构主要分为“传染病指定医院”（以下简称“指定医院”）和作为补充的“传染病诊疗合作医院”（以下简称“合作医院”）。国家对指定医院提供充分的公共资金和财政补贴，但对合作医院的支持却少之又少。正如浅野新吾所说，合作医院“几乎相当于志愿服务”。

为了防止院内感染，几乎所有合作医院都关闭了普通病房，腾出专用病床收治新冠肺炎患者。然而，国家提供的援助仅仅是每天每张专用病床约1.6万日元的补贴。

“有些合作医院为了预防感染，专门腾出了近50个床位，但政府对未投入使用的床位不提供任何补偿，即使使用了重症监护病房（ICU），也只额外补助约8万日元。” 浅野新吾指出。

此外，合作医院还要承担额外的负担，例如向医护人员支付“新冠肺炎感染风险津贴”，增补夜班护士等等。这些额外的支出，使得许多医院的运营已达到极限，甚至面临破产危机。

“如果每天保持40张左右的空床位，每月就会出现数千万日元的赤字。国家完全没有考虑对此给予补偿。很多合作医院向医师会痛声疾呼：‘如果继续下去，5月底就是极限了’、‘无法应对第二波疫情’。”

**隐秘的救治与巨大的风险**

随着疫情蔓延，指定医院成为关注焦点。这些医院的医护人员经验丰富，定期接受培训，精通各种新型传染病的诊治。

大英博物馆收藏了一块约3500年前的古巴比伦泥板，上面描绘了被认为是“世界上最古老的鬼故事”的图案：一个胡须浓密、双手被情人绑住的鬼魂，正被牵引着向前走。专家分析，这幅图画很可能展现的是一种驱魔仪式，当时的人们相信，为鬼魂提供伴侣可以使其安息。

这块泥板自19世纪就被大英博物馆收藏，但一直未对外展出，而是被妥善保存在库房中。泥板上描绘的鬼魂形象只有在特定光线角度下才能清晰显现。大英博物馆中东部馆长称其为“一件绝对令人惊叹的古代文物”。

英国语言学家和亚述学家欧文·芬克尔（Irving Finkel）博士，现任大英博物馆中东部古代美索不达米亚文字、语言和文化助理保管人。他指出，泥板上的图案是驱魔指南中“驱除不受欢迎的鬼魂”章节的一部分。画面中，一个大胡子鬼魂双手被情人绑住，被引导至来世，获得永恒的幸福。泥板上的文字则描述了相关的仪式，以确保他们可以一同快乐地进入冥界。

芬克尔博士进一步解释说，图案中的鬼魂显然是男性，身材瘦高，胡须浓密。“你可以想象这样一个鬼魂在房间里游荡，确实会让人感到不安。当时的人们认为，这个鬼魂需要的只是一个伴侣。他们竟然觉得可以通过提供伴侣来摆脱鬼魂，这个想法真的很有意思。”

ارتفع عدد ضحايا الهجمات التي ينفذها نظام بشار الأسد وداعميه على منطقة خفض التصعيد بإدلب شمال غربي سوريا، إلى 19 مدنياً، منذ الليلة الماضية.

فقد واصل جيش النظام والمجموعات الإرهابية المدعومة من إيران، بمساندة الطيران الروسي، هجماتهم البرية والجوية، ظهر اليوم، على تجمعات سكنية ضمن منطقة خفض التصعيد، وفقاً لما أوردته وكالة أنباء "الأناضول" نقلاً عن مصادر محلية، السبت.

وأفادت مصادر في الدفاع المدني (الخوذ البيضاء) بمقتل 5 مدنيين  اليوم، اثنان في مدينة خان شيخون، واثنان في بلدة محمبل، وواحد في محيط "معمل القرميد"، ليرتفع بذلك عدد الضحايا منذ الليلة الماضية إلى 19 مدنياً، فضلاً عن عشرات الجرحى.

وكانت المصادر ذاتها قد أعلنت في وقت سابق من اليوم، مقتل 14 مدنياً منذ ساعات الليل، أحدهم في خان شيخون، و13 في محمبل، معظمهم أطفال ونساء، إضافة إلى إصابة ما لا يقل عن 20 آخرين.

وتواصل فرق الدفاع المدني عمليات البحث والإنقاذ تحت الأنقاض، وسط مخاوف من ارتفاع عدد القتلى والجرحى.

وأشار مرصد الطيران، التابع للمعارضة المسلحة، عبر مواقع التواصل الاجتماعي، إلى إقلاع "مقاتلة روسية من قاعدة حميميم"،  مؤكداً قيام روسيا بهجمات على خان شيخون وقريتي سرمين وكفرسجنة.


يذكر أن النظام السوري وحلفاءه يشنون، منذ 25 أبريل الماضي، حملة قصف عنيفة على منطقة "خفض التصعيد"، التي تم تحديدها بموجب مباحثات أستانة، بالتزامن مع عملية برية.

وتم التوصل إلى اتفاق لإنشاء منطقة خفض تصعيد بمحافظة إدلب ومحيطها في منتصف سبتمبر 2017، بين الدول الضامنة لمسار أستانة (تركيا وروسيا وإيران).

ويقطن المنطقة حالياً نحو 4 ملايين مدني، بينهم مئات الآلاف من المهجرين من مدنهم وبلداتهم على مدار السنوات الماضية، في عموم البلاد.

وكانت الشبكة السورية لحقوق الإنسان قد أعلنت في تقرير حديث، مقتل 487 مدنياً في قصف النظام وحلفائه على منطقة "خفض التصعيد" خلال الفترة بين 26 أبريل، و23 يونيو الماضيين.

Un agent du CROUS de Reims a écopé d'une sanction financière, une exclusion temporaire d'une semaine entraînant une perte de salaire de plus de 300 euros, pour avoir volé deux cuisses de lapin dans les cuisines centrales le 3 mars dernier.  L'employé, chargé de livrer les repas aux cafétérias, avait demandé au cuisinier de lui mettre les morceaux de lapin dans un récipient pour son repas du soir.  Lors d'un contrôle inopiné, son chef de service l'a surpris. Convoqué par la direction, il a reconnu les faits. Le cuisinier, lui, a reçu un blâme.

La directrice du CROUS, Magdalena Miatello, précise que "les plats volés devaient être servis aux étudiants" et non jetés.  Elle souligne que la sanction a été prise à l'unanimité du conseil de discipline et regrette de n'avoir jamais été alertée des difficultés financières de l'agent.  "Des leviers et des mesures d'aides existent au sein du CROUS : dons d'urgence, bons alimentaires, etc.  Le CROUS dispose d'un budget d'aide sociale de plus de 100.000 euros par an, et a d'ailleurs aidé huit agents le mois dernier pour un montant total de quatre mille euros", explique-t-elle.

Laurent La Colla, du syndicat CGT, déplore le manque d'indulgence de la direction : "Une bonne mise au point, pour ne pas dire une bonne engueulade, aurait suffi".  Il souligne l'ancienneté de plus de quarante ans de l'employé, qui n'avait jamais eu de problème auparavant, et sa situation financière difficile, aggravée par cette perte de 300 euros sur un salaire net de 1400 euros.  "Il n'y a pas d'immunité ouvrière ! Quelle injustice !", s'exclame-t-il, ayant refusé de siéger au conseil de discipline.

L'agent peut désormais faire un recours gracieux auprès de la direction du CROUS ou un appel devant le tribunal administratif de Châlons-en-Champagne.

MIAMI, Florida.-  El domingo pasado, mientras la estudiante de secundaria Thalia Rodríguez conducía por la Interestatal 75 hacia su voluntariado en el departamento de bomberos de Hialeah, Florida, nunca imaginó que se convertiría en una heroína.  Antes de llegar a su destino, la joven de 17 años se topó con un grave accidente. The depth of understanding the evolution of scientific topics arguably determines humanity's ability to advance scientific development and achieve groundbreaking results [20, 21].  This understanding is crucial for effective resource allocation [2, 13], researcher hiring [14, 19], and strategic direction selection [5, 12]. Governments need to identify promising scientific topics to efficiently allocate trillions in research funding [1]. Research institutions must evaluate the potential of a candidate's research area to maximize recruitment benefits.  Individual researchers need to prioritize promising topics to publish impactful work.  However, due to a lack of intuitive and in-depth understanding of scientific topics, their evolutionary laws remain largely unknown.  We propose a "Scientific X-ray" framework to address this gap and provide insights into the evolution of scientific topics.

The explosion of scientific data [1, 2, 3, 4] has fueled interest in data-driven methods to understand scientific evolution [5].  This growth, however, prompts questions about the long-term trajectory of scientific progress.  Futurist Raymond Kurzweil predicts a "technological singularity" by 2045, a point where machine intelligence surpasses human intelligence, potentially hindering further human-driven advancement [6].  Similarly, Moore's Law, which has driven exponential growth in computing power, is slowing as chip miniaturization approaches its physical limits [7, 8, 9, 10, 11].  This slowdown, coupled with the concept of the singularity, raises a critical question: does scientific evolution follow a similar life cycle of prosperity and decline [12, 13, 14]?

Our research, analyzing citation trends of 68,675 high-impact publications (citation ≥ 1000, covering 16 disciplines, published from 1800 to 2019), suggests a potential answer.  We observed two dominant processes influencing publication impact: "birth" and "aging" (Fig. 1).  The "aging" phenomenon indicates that even highly influential topics eventually lose momentum and cease to develop further, despite their initial impact.

Figure 1: Statistics on the "birth" and "aging" of 68,675 high-impact papers. The bar height represents the cumulative number of high-impact articles "born" up to a specific time. The dark blue portion represents the cumulative number "aged" by that time. "Aging" is defined as having no more than 10 new citations annually after a certain year. The light blue portion represents currently active articles.  This figure demonstrates that while high-impact articles continually emerge, some inevitably lose attention over time.

While current citation-based metrics [15, 16, 17, 18] offer some insight into the impact evolution of individual publications, they are insufficient for understanding the complex evolution of scientific topics.

Two men held her against the brick wall behind a dumpster, trying to silence her by forcing a grimy hand over her mouth and growling threats in her ear. "Do something, please!" she begged the onlooker.  Another dirty hand clamped over her mouth, followed by a blow to her head, silencing her once more.

Thomas winced at the sickening thud of fist against skull. From the alley entrance, he sized up the men assaulting the woman. Conflict raged in his blue eyes as he weighed his options.

"Get outta here, ya runt!" one of the men yelled, struggling to restrain the girl.

*Were they actually going to kill her?* Thomas wondered, ignoring their continued threats. *And was her life even worth it?*  He shoved his hands into his corduroy pockets, about to continue his midnight stroll, when his gaze met the bloodied woman's green eyes through the shadows.

He'd never seen such a hopeless gaze. She'd given up, submitted to her attackers' will.  Looking into those soulless eyes was like looking into empty sockets. Something within Thomas boiled to the surface: sympathy. He'd seen such despair only once before, and in an instant, his mind was made up.  He pushed back his green hood, revealing a mess of blond hair.

"Leave her alone," Thomas yelled, forcing menace into his voice, "and you may walk away with your lives!"  The threat lacked conviction; the men chuckled. The smaller of the two stepped back from the woman, the knife he’d been holding to her throat now lowered.

He wore a black ski mask, but his heavy jacket and rubber boots suggested he was a dockworker.

"You just made a huge mistake, boy!" the other man growled, his voice raspy from years of cigarettes. He charged at Thomas, knife brandished.

Thomas's pupils dilated, consuming the whites of his eyes as he summoned his curse. The alley's long shadows writhed and squirmed. The charging man ignored the shifting darkness until tentacles of ink streaked from their hiding places and ripped his head from his shoulders.

Two years ago, Systems Engineer David Strauss rebuilt the decaying infrastructure of the German Air Force.  He likened it to reconstructing a building as it crumbled.  This success made him an obvious choice for a highly classified mission.

Six months prior, a new high-resolution telescope orbiting the moon captured something unusual: what appeared to be an opening in a crater wall on the dark side.  Initially dismissed as a smudge on the lens, the anomaly was quickly confirmed. The news was suppressed, those involved were paid off, and doctored images were released to the public.  Behind closed doors, NASA led an urgent meeting with China, the European Union, and Russia. Amidst accusations and even fistfights, the assembled powers agreed: the structure wasn't theirs.  At best, a geological anomaly; at worst, a clandestine military installation built by an unknown entity.

Now, thanks to Russian diversionary tactics and satellite coverage, a Chinese rocket, modified for international use and equipped with cutting-edge technology, carried the mission to the moon.  Onboard were NASA's top scientist, Jackie Hornwell, and the EU's systems and communications expert, David Strauss.  Orbiting above the crater in a command vessel was Phillip Roué, the EU's military communications expert.

"How's it going guys? Puke bags are under your seats if you need them. You're about 30 seconds from landing." Phillip’s voice crackled over the comms.

"Fuck off, Phillip," Jackie retorted.

"Phillip, let's maintain radio silence until Dr. Hornwell gets her bearings," David interjected.

"Got it, over and out," Phillip replied.

The lander touched down as gently as could be expected.  David ran system checks, confirming everything was operational. "Ship looks good. Site looks good too. Zero pressure and cold enough for it to burn. Ready to go?"

Jackie, still awestruck by being on the moon, could only think, *They’re finally on the Moon. I am on the Moon!*  "Ya. Let's go," she finally managed.

They donned their suits, gathered equipment – extra O2 tanks for David, a gear bag for Jackie – and entered the airlock.  David initiated the depressurization sequence. The hissing of escaping air faded, a green light blinked, and the hatch swung open, revealing the lunar landscape. They stepped onto the surface, testing their balance in the low gravity.

"Alright, Phillip. Where are we supposed to go? Over."

"Northwest of your position. Turn 40 degrees to your left and it's dead ahead. Over."

"Got it. Over and out."

"This way then," David murmured, taking small leaps toward the designated location, Jackie following, her gaze fixed on the otherworldly scene.  Fifteen minutes later, the entrance came into view.  Thirty minutes more and they stood before it.

"Woah… look at that," David breathed.

يشار إلى أن الحكومة الفلسطينية، برئاسة د. محمد اشتية، أصدرت قراراً قبل عدة أشهر، بوقف استيراد العجول من إسرائيل، وذلك ضمن استراتيجتها بالانفكاك التدريجي مع الاحتلال.  قال عضو حزب (أزرق أبيض) وزير الجيش الأسبق، موشيه يعلون: إن رد الحكومة الإسرائيلية المتراخي مع إجراءات السلطة الفلسطينية، يخلق سابقة سلبية، قد تقودنا إلى "منحدر خطير".  وأشار في تغريدة له عبر موقع التواصل الاجتماعي (تويتر)، إلى موضوع استيراد السلطة الفلسطينية للعجول من إسرائيل، قائلاً: "بعد سيطرة السلطة الفلسطينية على السوق، خلافًا لاتفاقيات باريس، بدأ مربو العجول في إسرائيل بفقد أرزاقهم".

El pasado martes 14 de diciembre, 'Sálvame' emitió un homenaje a Rocío Jurado que generó polémica entre varios familiares y fue objeto de comentario por diversos periodistas de Telecinco.  Joaquín Prat, en 'El programa de Ana Rosa', lo calificó de "excluyente".

El periodista aprovechó la ocasión para dirigirse a Gloria Camila y Rosa Benito, disculpándose por haber insinuado que estarían interesadas en cobrar por participar en el evento. "Es un homenaje de su hija a Rocío Jurado, con artistas interpretando sus temas. En ese sentido, efectivamente, es un homenaje", aclaró el presentador.

"Sin embargo, es un homenaje que excluye a una parte importante de la familia", continuó Prat, quien no pudo ver el programa en directo por estar presentando 'Cuatro al día'.  Rocío Carrasco ya había mencionado en ese mismo programa que desconocía la lista de invitados, salvo la participación de algunos artistas.  Posteriormente, Alessandro Lecquio intervino, a lo que Prat respondió: "Homenajes a Rocío Jurado hay, como mínimo, tres al año. En ellos vemos a toda la familia menos a Rocío Carrasco, y todos asisten sin cobrar". Ante la sospecha de que la hija de la cantante hubiera cobrado por el homenaje, esta aclaró: "Eso es impensable. Nunca haría nada que no beneficiara a mi madre".

Finalmente, Joaquín Prat concluyó: "Hay tantísimas cosas en esos 18 contenedores, cosas que tu madre te dio… Me refiero a que hay tantas cosas guardadas desde hace trece años, ¿no se podrían repartir para que todos tengan algo?".

The early morning mist dissipated over the plains as the dragon soared across the mountains, each flap of her leathery, burnished-red wings causing the air to tremble. Sunlight glinted off her scales in scintillating patterns.  She reveled in her dominion, content in her vast domain dotted with the crude buildings of her two-legged cattle.  As her shadow fell, one of the cattle cried out a warning, scattering the others.  She dived, breathing a lick of flame, a perfunctory gesture.  Having eaten a wild goat earlier, she wasn't truly hungry. Though fattened on their tributes of oxen and sheep, she still occasionally snatched a few, just for variety.

Her only real concern was her meager hoard back in her den, a deep crevasse carved into the mountainside.  Despite scouring the plains and settlements, even fighting off lesser drakes for their treasure, her trove remained a miserably small heap of silver and copper coins, a golden chalice, and a suit of gilded armor.  Nowhere near acceptable.

As she surveyed her territory, a gleam beneath the cloudbanks caught her eye.  A golden shine at the riverside.  Diving down, anticipating another prize, she instead let out a surprised puff of air as the object revealed itself to be alive.

The sinuous, serpentine creature, barely half her size, drank at the river, seemingly unaware of her presence. It had a lustrous mane, a pair of fine whiskers it fastidiously cleaned in the clear water, and small, curled horns.  And it was covered in golden scales.

Finally, it turned its head towards her.  She blinked, momentarily uncertain. None of her prey had ever been so calm.  But her desire for gold overcame her hesitation, and she lunged, claws extended, holding back her fire so as not to damage her potential prize.

To her astonishment, the wingless beast took to the air, effortlessly riding the thermals.  She snapped at its tufted tail as it coiled and twisted, facing her head-on.  As she closed in, it shot forward, and she instinctively exhaled a breath of fire. The flames washed harmlessly around the creature as it raked its claws across her snout.  She hissed in pain, droplets of acrid blood flying.

Realizing fire wouldn't harm the creature, she scorched the air with heavy gouts of flame, using the thermals to gain altitude. The creature twisted in the inferno, disoriented.  She dove into the hazy blaze, ripping into it—

—only to have it vanish into motes of light.  Puzzled, she rose from the smoke, circling.  The wind from her wings dispersed the smog, revealing nothing.

She bellowed in frustration, spewing plumes of smoke.  A shimmering in the air, a gray-lined distortion.  Too late, the creature sensed her approach and turned to flee.  She caught it easily, seizing its throat, shaking it violently.

Moments later, she landed at her cave, the creature limp and lifeless in her jaws. Exhausted from the fight, she dropped the golden carcass atop her hoard and curled up, finally content.

Amelia abrió la leche en polvo y se dispuso a preparar el biberón de su pequeño bebé, Hugo, que la observaba con admiración desde el fondo de la cocina. Primero el agua tibia, no muy caliente, y, a continuación, la leche. Después de agitarlo bien para conseguir un líquido homogéneo, Amelia cogió a Hugo en sus brazos. En ese momento, recibió un mensaje en su teléfono móvil: “El lote de leche en polvo para lactantes que usted ha comprado en nuestro establecimiento debe ser retirado debido a un brote de salmonelosis. La trazabilidad fiable y transparente de este producto en las etapas de producción, transformación y distribución, indica que su lote está afectado y no puede ser consumido”. Amelia no sabe nada de blockchain, pero hoy esta tecnología ha protegido la salud de su ser más querido.  Como hemos visto en esta historia, la trazabilidad y transparencia de los alimentos es una de las aplicaciones de esta tecnología. Mediante el uso de un simple código QR y un smartphone, los consumidores pueden escanear un producto en el punto de venta y recibir un historial completo del viaje del alimento desde el productor hasta nuestra cocina. IBM está impulsando esta innovación con su aplicación Food Trust. Las ventajas de esta trazabilidad digital son enormes para cualquier producto del mercado que esté sujeto a requisitos de seguridad o medioambientales.

Puede parecer una tecnología complicada, pero la idea principal del blockchain es bastante simple. Se trata de un registro de datos, un gran libro de cuentas o ledger compartido entre varios usuarios o nodos, donde se almacena información de una manera segura y confiable. En este libro se registran bloques de datos que se conectan entre sí cronológicamente, creando una cadena. Los bloques tienen una capacidad limitada de almacenamiento y, cuando se llenan, se encadenan al anterior formando la blockchain.

Cada bloque está conectado a su predecesor por un código único llamado hash, creado mediante una función matemática que convierte la información digital en una cadena de números y letras. Este código es fundamental para prevenir ciberataques. Si el bloque se edita, el hash cambia, impidiendo que un usuario elimine o altere registros. La cadena solo puede crecer. Además, cada bloque recibe una marca de tiempo exacta al agregarse a la cadena.

La seguridad de blockchain reside en la descentralización: cada nodo contiene una copia del libro de cuentas y todos deben verificar y validar por consenso cada transacción.  Si un hacker intenta alterar la cadena, modificar su copia no serviría, ya que no coincidiría con las demás y sería descartada.  Es como una partida de dominó donde un jugador intenta cambiar una ficha: no encajaría y los demás no la validarían.

En el marco de un Día del Trabajo conmemorado en casa o en los centros laborales, debido a la cancelación de eventos públicos por la pandemia de COVID-19, Carlos Muñoz Mosqueda, secretario general de la FROC-CTM de Salamanca-Valle, aseguró que no se registran casos de obreros afectados por la enfermedad.  Destacó que, si bien este aniversario es diferente, las exigencias de seguridad para los trabajadores y sus familias se mantienen,  y se suma la necesidad de una nueva clínica del IMSS.

A pesar de la ausencia de un acto público, en cumplimiento de las recomendaciones sanitarias,  el sector obrero reitera su histórica demanda de mejores condiciones para las familias. Muñoz Mosqueda resaltó que, en medio de la pandemia, los obreros han respondido positivamente a las medidas de seguridad implementadas en sus centros de trabajo.

“En las empresas esenciales que continúan operando, se toman medidas para proteger la salud de los trabajadores, incluyendo revisiones médicas.  Los casos sospechosos son remitidos para su evaluación y, afortunadamente, todos han resultado negativos para COVID-19”, afirmó.

Además, confirmó que las fuentes de empleo de los sindicalizados se han mantenido,  y las empresas han actuado responsablemente,  cubriendo los salarios completos e incluso otorgando bonos o gratificaciones como reconocimiento a su compromiso.

With the increasing penetration of distributed generations (DG), particularly inverter-based energy resources (IB-ER), in active distribution networks (ADNs), voltage violations and high network losses are becoming more severe, especially with reversed active power flow.  While IB-ERs can provide Volt/VAR control (VVC) support, effectively leveraging this capability presents challenges.  Traditional model-based VVC optimization methods, which generate optimal strategies for voltage regulation devices and reactive power resources, struggle due to inaccuracies in network parameters. These theoretical parameters often deviate significantly from real-world operational states, creating a model mismatch that hinders practical application.

This paper proposes a novel two-stage deep reinforcement learning (DRL) method for optimizing reactive power distribution in ADNs, addressing the limitations of model-based approaches.  The method combines offline learning with online learning and application, leveraging the benefits of both model-based and model-free control.

In the offline stage, an approximate ADN model is constructed using theoretical parameters.  Recognizing the inherent inaccuracies, a novel joint adversarial soft actor-critic (JASAC) algorithm is employed within an adversarial Markov decision process (AMDP) framework.  An adversary agent, representing modeling errors and risks, is trained alongside the offline agent (OFF-A). This adversarial training enhances the OFF-A's robustness to model mismatch, minimizing the "transfer gap" when applied to the real system.  JASAC leverages shared information between the adversary and OFF-A, ensuring efficient convergence.

The online stage utilizes the knowledge gained offline. The OFF-A is transferred to an online agent (ON-A), which continues learning and application using the state-of-the-art soft actor-critic (SAC) algorithm.  This offline pre-training significantly accelerates online training and improves safety, mitigating the risks associated with deploying untrained DRL agents directly in real-world systems.

This two-stage approach offers several key advantages: 1) It combines the practicality of model-free online operation with the efficiency of incorporating approximate model knowledge offline. 2) The novel JASAC algorithm, applicable to other DRL applications, efficiently trains a robust OFF-A through adversarial learning. 3) Transferring the robust OFF-A to the online stage significantly improves performance and safety compared to existing DRL-based VVC methods.

The remainder of this paper is structured as follows: Section II formulates the VVC problem as an MDP for the online stage and an AMDP for the offline stage.  Section III details the proposed VVC algorithm and JASAC.  Section IV presents and analyzes the numerical results.  Finally, Section V concludes the paper.  VVC has been successfully integrated into distribution management systems to optimize reactive power flow, eliminating voltage violations and reducing network losses. Conventionally, VVC employs model-based optimization to generate optimal strategies for voltage regulation devices and reactive power resources.  Numerous centralized and decentralized algorithms exist, including conic relaxation, interior point methods, mixed integer linear programming, evolutionary algorithms, local control, alternating direction method of multipliers (ADMM), and robust/scenario-based optimization techniques.  However, these methods rely on accurate system models.  Model-free methods, such as those based on game theory or gradient-based optimization applied to wind farm control, offer an alternative.  Recently, DRL algorithms have shown promise in various control tasks, leading to the development of DRL-based VVC methods.  However, online training of DRL agents can be costly and risky. Offline training using simulated ADN models is preferable, but model inaccuracies necessitate specialized algorithms to bridge the transfer gap. Wu (Corresponding Author) are with the State Key Laboratory of Power Systems, Department of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing 100084, China (email:lht18@mails.tsinghua.edu.cn, wuwench@tsinghua.edu.cn).

苹果公司于2021年秋季新品发布会上推出了iPhone 13系列、新款iPad 和 Apple Watch 7。此次发布正值苹果最大代工厂富士康郑州厂的生产旺季。由于iPhone 13系列订单量巨大，富士康郑州厂区在8月至9月面临用工缺口，急需在9月底前招募约20万名新员工，为此一度开出超过万元人民币的入职激励奖金。

富士康郑州厂的微信公众号8月20日发文证实了这一消息，称园区已进入新机种量产高峰期，9月底前新增用工需求达20万人。然而，暴雨和疫情对招工造成较大影响。为解决求职者出行难题，当地政府协调100辆大巴，实行“点对点”闭环接送。截至8月20日，已输送超过2万名求职者到富士康。

一位来自嵩县的求职者李歌飞在接受《河南日报》采访时表示，政府安排的专车让他感到安心。他还透露，富士康的入职激励奖金高达1.2万元，吸引了他的表弟也即将前来应聘。富士康国贸招募中心负责人朱峰则表示，新员工抵达后会立即进行核酸检测，入住中转宿舍，待结果出来后再办理入职手续。目前，富士康每天新入职员工超过1万人。

根据富士康的招募通知，入职奖金随着时间的推移而递减。8月15日起面试的求职者最高可获得11500元奖金，而9月15日起则降至6000元。推荐人也享有相应奖励。 想要拿到这笔“返费”（入职奖金），求职者必须在职满90天且有效出勤满55天。奖金名单公布后约7个工作日发放，且必须在职。据有经验的工人透露，实际到手时间大约需要四个月。

然而，高额奖金的背后是高强度的劳动。《每日经济新闻》报道指出，一些新工人抱怨工作压力巨大。一位工人表示，他每小时需要完成65个零件的组装，每个零件需要打三颗螺丝，高强度的重复劳动让他下班后手指颤抖。另一位工人透露，新人的工作量会快速递增，从最初的40%满量迅速提升至100%，适应难度很大。 报道还提到，夜班工作强度极大，许多人难以承受，甚至有人形容上夜班如同“脱层皮”，不少人的“万元奖金梦”在第一个夜班就被击碎。流水线的高速运转和以分钟计算的工作节奏，让许多人难以适应。

The idea of a monument built by aliens on Mars is highly controversial.  While some believe the so-called "Face on Mars" is evidence of extraterrestrial construction, others maintain it's a natural formation.  Recent high-resolution photographs of this Martian feature provide compelling evidence to support the latter view.

NASA's exploration of Mars, beginning with the Viking 1 orbiter in 1976, has yielded increasingly detailed images of the "Face."  Initial photographs, revealing a mesa that resembled a face, fueled speculation about an ancient civilization.  Subsequent missions, including further observations in 1998 and 2001, captured the feature with significantly improved resolution.

Despite claims that the "Face" exhibits artificial characteristics, the enhanced photographic detail strongly suggests a natural origin.  Multiple high-resolution images clearly indicate that the feature is a rock formation, likely a lava dome shaped into an isolated mesa, similar in height to the "Face." The article also mentions this geological explanation.

Therefore, the prevailing evidence supports the conclusion that the "Face on Mars" is a natural phenomenon. The improved clarity of recent photographs significantly strengthens the case against artificial construction, confirming its identity as a geological formation.

Intelligent reflecting surface (IRS)-assisted communication has emerged as a promising technology to meet the increasing demand for high spectral and energy efficiency in future wireless systems.  Comprising cost-effective, passive, and programmable elements, IRSs can intelligently manipulate wireless propagation environments, tailoring signal paths between communication nodes [1]–[6]. This allows for directing transmitted signal energy via beamforming, leading to significant power savings.  Furthermore, IRSs, typically fabricated as thin rectangular planes, can be easily integrated into existing infrastructure by attaching them to building facades, indoor ceilings, and vehicles [6], [7].  Driven by these advantages, research has explored IRS applications for enhancing multiple-input multiple-output (MIMO) transmission [8], physical layer security [9], and simultaneous wireless information and power transfer (SWIPT) [10].

To fully realize the potential of IRSs, careful design of both the IRS phase shift configuration and the base station (BS) transmit beamforming is crucial [4], [6], [10], [11].  Several studies have investigated joint BS beamforming and IRS reflection coefficient design to minimize total transmit power while guaranteeing user quality-of-service (QoS).  Assuming perfect channel state information (CSI), transmit power minimization problems have been explored for various IRS-assisted wireless systems, including multiuser MIMO systems [2], secure wireless systems [11], and SWIPT systems [10]. However, the significant power savings reported in [2], [10], and [11] rely on the assumption of continuous IRS phase shifts, which is impractical.  Due to challenges such as high energy consumption, integration complexity, and component coupling, practical IRS elements typically employ discrete, low-resolution phase shifters, often 1-bit (on-off) or 2-bit (quadruple-level) [4], [6], [12].

Consequently, research has begun investigating resource allocation with discrete IRS phase shifts.  For example, [12] proposed a suboptimal alternating optimization (AO)-based algorithm to promote user fairness in multiuser systems.  However, as shown in [8] and [11], AO-based algorithms for these non-convex optimization problems compromise optimality, often converging to local optima and exhibiting performance dependence on initial points [8], [11], [13].  To explore optimal performance, [4] considered a single-user scenario, determining the optimal BS beamformer and discrete IRS phase shifts using enumeration. This approach, however, is difficult to extend to multiuser systems due to the complexity of finding closed-form optimal beamforming vectors.  Furthermore, assuming perfect CSI, the conference version of this paper [1] presented a generalized Benders decomposition (GBD)-based algorithm for a simplified multiuser system without a direct BS-user link.  However, optimal design for IRS-assisted multiuser multiple-input single-output (MISO) systems with a direct link and imperfect CSI remains an open problem.

While [1] and [4] assume perfect CSI, acquiring accurate CSI in passive IRS systems is challenging.  Conventional channel estimation methods struggle with IRS-assisted links, leading to inevitable channel estimation errors and imperfect CSI [7], [9].  Furthermore, BS-IRS and IRS-user channels are typically cascaded for end-to-end estimation, requiring joint consideration of their CSI and estimation errors [7], [14]. Consequently, robust designs for imperfect CSI have been studied.  For instance, [7] and [14] employed worst-case robust optimization methods based on linear approximation and successive convex approximation (SCA), respectively, assuming continuous phase shifts.  However, even with this optimistic assumption, global optimality is not guaranteed.  A globally optimal robust resource allocation framework for practical IRS systems with imperfect CSI and discrete phase shifters is still lacking.

Motivated by this, we investigate, for the first time, globally optimal joint BS beamforming and IRS phase shift design for multiuser IRS-assisted systems with discrete phase shifters. Our contributions are:

* We study resource allocation in IRS-assisted systems with discrete phase shifters, minimizing BS transmit power while guaranteeing minimum signal-to-interference-plus-noise ratio (SINR) for each user. We develop optimal and suboptimal strategies for both perfect and imperfect CSI.
* For perfect CSI, we formulate the joint design problem as a mixed integer nonlinear programming (MINLP) problem and propose transformations enabling a GBD-based iterative algorithm that guarantees convergence to the globally optimal solution. This algorithm provides a performance benchmark for suboptimal designs [4], [12].  We also develop a computationally efficient suboptimal SCA-based scheme.
* We extend our framework to imperfect CSI, recasting robust SINR constraints as linear matrix inequality (LMI) constraints and formulating a robust MINLP problem.

The quiet neighborhood, an undisclosed location meant to keep the Captain's whereabouts a secret, was speculated to be somewhere in upstate New York, perhaps not far from his birthplace.  While many suggested Steve move further afield, even to another country, for a life truly off the grid, his response was characteristically straightforward: "I'm not going to live my life in hiding or fear. I plan on enjoying my retirement."  And he did just that.  He'd purchased a fixer-upper, an older home needing plenty of work—a perfect project to keep him busy. It was an average neighborhood: suburban life with a watch, carpools, holiday barbecues, and a community garden.

The first few nights were spent on a military-issue cot, but the rough conditions were nothing new to Steve, and he slept soundly.  His days started early: measuring, making lists of materials, trips to the lumber yard. People were either politely oblivious to the fact that Captain America was buying lumber and renting equipment, or they genuinely didn't recognize him.  Either way, he appreciated the anonymity.  The work was easy. Decades spent honing his superhuman body for battle translated surprisingly well to demolition and rebuilding.  He found himself reflecting on years past, a flicker of longing for Tony already surfacing.

A knock broke his reverie.  He opened the door, jeans and shirt smeared with grime, wiping his hands on a rag. "Hello there, we're your neighbors. I'm Liz Lee, and this is my son Nathan." Liz, in her late twenties or early thirties, smiled.  Nathan, about seven, held up a bowl, his words tumbling out in an excited rush. "We brought you fruit, bread, and some snacks!"  Steve, cleaning his hand, shook Liz's hand and bent down to Nathan. "Well, that was mighty nice of you and your mother to bring me some food, Nathan."

Before Steve could say more, Nathan blurted, "ARE YOU CAPTAIN AMERICA?"  Steve laughed, while Liz admonished, "Nathan Lee, what did I say about that!"  Steve reassured her, "No, that's okay, Mrs. Lee—Liz.” He corrected himself, meeting Nathan’s awestruck gaze. "To answer your question, Nathan, no. Sorry, buddy. I'm not Captain America." Nathan's face fell, but then Steve winked. "I *used* to be Captain America. I'm retired now." The boy's face lit up again.  Turning back to Liz, Steve continued, "But please, I'm done with that. I'm just here to fix up this place and be part of the community. Just call me Steve."

“Welcome to the neighborhood, Steve. Let us know if you need anything,” Liz offered warmly.  "Thank you, Liz, I will. And thank you again, Nathan, for the food." Nathan, speechless, was nudged by his mother.  "Oh, you're welcome."  "Nice to meet you, Steve," Liz said, taking Nathan's hand.

The distribution shift between training and testing data, known as domain shift, poses a significant challenge in real-world applications. Domain generalization attempts to mitigate this by learning a universal model from available source datasets without access to the target data (Ghifary et al., 2016; Motiian et al., 2017).  Existing methods predominantly focus on learning domain-invariant representations across source domains (Muandet et al., 2013; Ghifary et al., 2015; Motiian et al., 2017; Li et al., 2018a; b). However, these approaches can falter in complex scenarios.

Consider the data model Y → X defined on X × Y.  Given a class label Y, feature X is generated by conditional distributions D<sub>y</sub>(X) = P<sub>D</sub>(X|Y = y), where D represents either a source domain (S<sub>m</sub>, m = 1, . . . , M) or the target domain T.  Most domain generalization methods assume that for a fixed y ∈ Y, the target domain's class-conditional distribution T(X|Y = y) is closer to at least one source class-conditional S<sub>m</sub>(X|Y = y) than to any distribution of a different class (Figure 1 Left). In such ideal cases, even simple k-NN methods can perform well.  However, performance degrades when the variation among class-conditionals of the same class is substantial, meaning the closest conditional distribution to T(X|Y = y) is S(X|Y = y') where y' ≠ y (Figure 1 Right) (Krueger et al., 2020).

This work proposes a class-conditioned domain generalization method inspired by distributional robust optimization (Kuhn et al., 2019).  This approach optimizes the worst-case performance over a set of distributions—the uncertainty set—centered around observed reference distributions. We assume that class-conditionals of different domains form class-specific uncertainty sets, aiming to learn a universally robust classifier that remains discriminative even under the worst-case distributions within these sets.

A key challenge lies in defining a robust and computable uncertainty set.  Gao et al. (2018) addressed this for a single source domain using the Wasserstein distance, formulating the robust optimization problem as a solvable convex optimization problem.  However, the choice of parameters in Gao et al. (2018) significantly impacts generalization performance.  Our method leverages the Wasserstein barycenter as the reference distribution and employs an iterative algorithm to automatically learn the optimal radius.
